pli-tv-kd1:7.14.1.eng: “It’s a great gain for Yasa that his mind has been freed from the corruptions through letting go!

pli-tv-kd1:7.14.2.pli: Adhivāsetu me, bhante, bhagavā ajjatanāya bhattaṃ yasena kulaputtena pacchāsamaṇenā”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:7.14.2.eng: Sir, please accept today’s meal from me with Yasa as your attendant.”

pli-tv-kd1:7.14.3.eng: The Buddha consented by remaining silent.

pli-tv-kd1:7.14.4.pli: Atha kho seṭṭhi gahapati bhagavato adhivāsanaṃ viditvā uṭṭhāyāsanā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṃ katvā pakkāmi.
pli-tv-kd1:7.14.4.eng: Knowing that the Buddha had consented, the merchant got up from his seat, bowed down, circumambulated the Buddha with his right side toward him, and left.

pli-tv-kd1:7.15.1.pli: Atha kho yaso kulaputto acirapakkante seṭṭhimhi gahapatimhi bhagavantaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd1:7.15.1.eng: Soon after the merchant had left, Yasa said to the Buddha,

pli-tv-kd1:7.15.2.pli: “labheyyāhaṃ, bhante, bhagavato santike pabbajjaṃ, labheyyaṃ upasampadan”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:7.15.2.eng: “Sir, I wish to receive the going forth in your presence. I wish to receive the full ordination.”

pli-tv-kd1:7.15.4.pli: “svākkhāto dhammo, cara brahmacariyaṃ sammā dukkhassa antakiriyāyā”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:7.15.4.eng: The Teaching is well-proclaimed. Practice the spiritual life to make a complete end of suffering.”

pli-tv-kd1:7.15.5.eng: That was the full ordination of that venerable.

pli-tv-kd1:7.15.6.pli: Tena kho pana samayena satta loke arahanto honti.
pli-tv-kd1:7.15.6.eng: Then there were seven perfected ones in the world.

pli-tv-kd1:7.15.7.eng: The going forth of Yasa is finished.

pli-tv-kd1:8.1.1.pli: Atha kho bhagavā pubbaṇhasamayaṃ nivāsetvā pattacīvaramādāya āyasmatā yasena pacchāsamaṇena yena seṭṭhissa gahapatissa nivesanaṃ tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā paññatte āsane nisīdi.
pli-tv-kd1:8.1.1.eng: The following morning the Buddha robed up, took his bowl and robe, and, with Venerable Yasa as his attendant, went to the house of that merchant where he sat down on the prepared seat.

pli-tv-kd1:8.1.2.pli: Atha kho āyasmato yasassa mātā ca purāṇadutiyikā ca yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkamiṃsu, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdiṃsu.
pli-tv-kd1:8.1.2.eng: Yasa’s mother and ex-wife approached the Buddha, bowed, and sat down.

pli-tv-kd1:8.2.1.pli: Tāsaṃ bhagavā anupubbiṃ kathaṃ kathesi, seyyathidaṃ—
pli-tv-kd1:8.2.1.eng: The Buddha gave them a progressive talk—

pli-tv-kd1:8.2.2.pli: dānakathaṃ sīlakathaṃ saggakathaṃ, kāmānaṃ ādīnavaṃ okāraṃ saṅkilesaṃ, nekkhamme ānisaṃsaṃ pakāsesi.
pli-tv-kd1:8.2.2.eng: on generosity, morality, and heaven; on the downside, degradation, and defilement of worldly pleasures; and he revealed the benefits of renunciation.

pli-tv-kd1:8.2.3.pli: Yadā tā bhagavā aññāsi kallacittā, muducittā, vinīvaraṇacittā, udaggacittā, pasannacittā, atha yā buddhānaṃ sāmukkaṃsikā dhammadesanā taṃ pakāsesi—
pli-tv-kd1:8.2.3.eng: When the Buddha knew that their minds were ready, supple, without hindrances, joyful, and confident, he revealed the teaching unique to the Buddhas:

pli-tv-kd1:8.2.4.eng: suffering, its origin, its end, and the path.

pli-tv-kd1:8.2.5.pli: Seyyathāpi nāma suddhaṃ vatthaṃ apagatakāḷakaṃ sammadeva rajanaṃ paṭiggaṇheyya;
pli-tv-kd1:8.2.5.eng: And just as a clean and stainless cloth absorbs dye properly,

pli-tv-kd1:8.2.6.pli: evameva tāsaṃ tasmiṃyeva āsane virajaṃ vītamalaṃ dhammacakkhuṃ udapādi—
pli-tv-kd1:8.2.6.eng: so too, while they were sitting right there, they experienced the stainless vision of the Truth:

pli-tv-kd1:8.2.7.eng: “Anything that has a beginning has an end.”

pli-tv-kd1:8.3.1.pli: Tā diṭṭhadhammā pattadhammā viditadhammā pariyogāḷhadhammā tiṇṇavicikicchā vigatakathaṅkathā vesārajjappattā aparappaccayā satthusāsane bhagavantaṃ etadavocuṃ—
pli-tv-kd1:8.3.1.eng: They had seen the Truth, had reached, understood, and penetrated it. They had gone beyond doubt and uncertainty, had attained to confidence, and had become independent of others in the Teacher’s instruction. And they said to the Buddha,

pli-tv-kd1:8.3.3.pli: etā mayaṃ, bhante, bhagavantaṃ saraṇaṃ gacchāma, dhammañca, bhikkhusaṅghañca.
pli-tv-kd1:8.3.3.eng: We go for refuge to the Buddha, the Teaching, and the Sangha of monks.

pli-tv-kd1:8.3.4.pli: Upāsikāyo no bhagavā dhāretu ajjatagge pāṇupetā saraṇaṃ gatā”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:8.3.4.eng: Please accept us as lay followers who have gone for refuge for life.”

pli-tv-kd1:8.3.5.pli: Tā ca loke paṭhamaṃ upāsikā ahesuṃ tevācikā.
pli-tv-kd1:8.3.5.eng: And they were the first women in the world to become lay followers by means of the triple refuge.

pli-tv-kd1:8.4.1.pli: Atha kho āyasmato yasassa mātā ca pitā ca purāṇadutiyikā ca bhagavantañca āyasmantañca yasaṃ paṇītena khādanīyena bhojanīyena sahatthā santappetvā sampavāretvā, bhagavantaṃ bhuttāviṃ onītapattapāṇiṃ, ekamantaṃ nisīdiṃsu.
pli-tv-kd1:8.4.1.eng: Yasa’s mother, father, and ex-wife personally served various kinds of fine foods to the Buddha and Yasa. When the Buddha had finished his meal, they sat down.

pli-tv-kd1:8.4.2.pli: Atha kho bhagavā āyasmato yasassa mātarañca pitarañca purāṇadutiyikañca dhammiyā kathāya sandassetvā samādapetvā samuttejetvā sampahaṃsetvā uṭṭhāyāsanā pakkāmi.
pli-tv-kd1:8.4.2.eng: The Buddha then instructed, inspired, and gladdened them with a teaching, before getting up from his seat and leaving.

pli-tv-kd1:9.1.1.pli: Assosuṃ kho āyasmato yasassa cattāro gihisahāyakā bārāṇasiyaṃ seṭṭhānuseṭṭhīnaṃ kulānaṃ puttā—

pli-tv-kd1:9.1.3.pli: yaso kira kulaputto kesamassuṃ ohāretvā kāsāyāni vatthāni acchādetvā agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajitoti.
pli-tv-kd1:9.1.3.eng: who were from the wealthiest merchant families in Benares. When they heard that Yasa had shaved off his hair and beard, put on ocher robes, and gone forth into homelessness,

pli-tv-kd1:9.1.5.pli: “na hi nūna so orako dhammavinayo, na sā orakā pabbajjā, yattha yaso kulaputto kesamassuṃ ohāretvā kāsāyāni vatthāni acchādetvā agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajito”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:9.1.5.eng: “This must be an extraordinary spiritual path, an extraordinary going forth, for Yasa to have done this.”
pli-tv-kd1:9.1.5.comm: “Spiritual path” renders dhammavinaya. See Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-kd1:9.2.1.pli: Te yenāyasmā yaso tenupasaṅkamiṃsu, upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantaṃ yasaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ aṭṭhaṃsu.
pli-tv-kd1:9.2.1.eng: And they went to Yasa and bowed down to him.

pli-tv-kd1:9.2.2.pli: Atha kho āyasmā yaso te cattāro gihisahāyake ādāya yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi.
pli-tv-kd1:9.2.2.eng: Yasa then took his four friends to the Buddha. He bowed, sat down,

pli-tv-kd1:9.2.3.pli: Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho āyasmā yaso bhagavantaṃ etadavoca—

pli-tv-kd1:9.2.4.pli: “ime me, bhante, cattāro gihisahāyakā bārāṇasiyaṃ seṭṭhānuseṭṭhīnaṃ kulānaṃ puttā—

pli-tv-kd1:9.2.6.eng: are from the wealthiest merchant families in Benares. Please instruct them.”

pli-tv-kd1:9.3.1.pli: Tesaṃ bhagavā anupubbiṃ kathaṃ kathesi, seyyathidaṃ—
pli-tv-kd1:9.3.1.eng: The Buddha gave them a progressive talk:

pli-tv-kd1:9.3.2.pli: dānakathaṃ sīlakathaṃ saggakathaṃ kāmānaṃ ādīnavaṃ okāraṃ saṅkilesaṃ nekkhamme ānisaṃsaṃ pakāsesi.
pli-tv-kd1:9.3.2.eng: on generosity, morality, and heaven; on the downside, degradation, and defilement of worldly pleasures; and he revealed the benefits of renunciation.

pli-tv-kd1:9.3.3.pli: Yadā te bhagavā aññāsi kallacitte muducitte vinīvaraṇacitte udaggacitte pasannacitte, atha yā buddhānaṃ sāmukkaṃsikā dhammadesanā, taṃ pakāsesi dukkhaṃ samudayaṃ nirodhaṃ maggaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:9.3.3.eng: When the Buddha knew that their minds were ready, supple, without hindrances, joyful, and confident, he revealed the teaching unique to the Buddhas: suffering, its origin, its end, and the path.

pli-tv-kd1:9.3.4.pli: Seyyathāpi nāma suddhaṃ vatthaṃ apagatakāḷakaṃ sammadeva rajanaṃ paṭiggaṇheyya;
pli-tv-kd1:9.3.4.eng: And just as a clean and stainless cloth absorbs dye properly,

pli-tv-kd1:9.3.5.pli: evameva tesaṃ tasmiṃyeva āsane virajaṃ vītamalaṃ dhammacakkhuṃ udapādi—
pli-tv-kd1:9.3.5.eng: so too, while they were sitting right there, they experienced the stainless vision of the Truth:

pli-tv-kd1:9.3.6.eng: “Anything that has a beginning has an end.”

pli-tv-kd1:9.4.1.pli: Te diṭṭhadhammā pattadhammā viditadhammā pariyogāḷhadhammā tiṇṇavicikicchā vigatakathaṅkathā vesārajjappattā aparappaccayā satthusāsane bhagavantaṃ etadavocuṃ—
pli-tv-kd1:9.4.1.eng: They had seen the Truth, had reached, understood, and penetrated it. They had gone beyond doubt and uncertainty, had attained to confidence, and had become independent of others in the Teacher’s instruction. And they said to the Buddha,

pli-tv-kd1:9.4.2.pli: “labheyyāma mayaṃ, bhante, bhagavato santike pabbajjaṃ, labheyyāma upasampadan”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:9.4.2.eng: “Sir, we wish to receive the going forth in your presence. We wish to receive the full ordination.”

pli-tv-kd1:9.4.4.pli: “svākkhāto dhammo, caratha brahmacariyaṃ sammā dukkhassa antakiriyāyā”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:9.4.4.eng: The Teaching is well-proclaimed. Practice the spiritual life to make a complete end of suffering.”

pli-tv-kd1:9.4.5.eng: That was the full ordination of those venerables.

pli-tv-kd1:9.4.6.pli: Atha kho bhagavā te bhikkhū dhammiyā kathāya ovadi anusāsi.
pli-tv-kd1:9.4.6.eng: Then, as the Buddha instructed those monks in the Teaching,

pli-tv-kd1:9.4.7.pli: Tesaṃ bhagavatā dhammiyā kathāya ovadiyamānānaṃ anusāsiyamānānaṃ anupādāya āsavehi cittāni vimucciṃsu.
pli-tv-kd1:9.4.7.eng: their minds were freed from the corruptions through letting go.

pli-tv-kd1:9.4.8.pli: Tena kho pana samayena ekādasa loke arahanto honti.
pli-tv-kd1:9.4.8.eng: And there were eleven perfected ones in the world.

pli-tv-kd1:9.4.9.eng: The going forth of the four friends is finished.

pli-tv-kd1:10.1.1.pli: Assosuṃ kho āyasmato yasassa paññāsamattā gihisahāyakā jānapadā pubbānupubbakānaṃ kulānaṃ puttā—
pli-tv-kd1:10.1.1.eng: Fifty of Yasa’s friends from leading families in the countryside also heard

pli-tv-kd1:10.1.2.pli: yaso kira kulaputto kesamassuṃ ohāretvā kāsāyāni vatthāni acchādetvā agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajitoti.
pli-tv-kd1:10.1.2.eng: that Yasa had shaved off his hair and beard, put on ocher robes, and gone forth into homelessness.

pli-tv-kd1:10.1.3.eng: They too said to one another,

pli-tv-kd1:10.1.4.pli: “na hi nūna so orako dhammavinayo, na sā orakā pabbajjā, yattha yaso kulaputto kesamassuṃ ohāretvā kāsāyāni vatthāni acchādetvā agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajito”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:10.1.4.eng: “This must be an extraordinary spiritual path, an extraordinary going forth, for Yasa to have done this.”

pli-tv-kd1:10.2.1.pli: Te yenāyasmā yaso tenupasaṅkamiṃsu, upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantaṃ yasaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ aṭṭhaṃsu.
pli-tv-kd1:10.2.1.eng: And they went to Yasa and bowed down to him.

pli-tv-kd1:10.2.2.pli: Atha kho āyasmā yaso te paññāsamatte gihisahāyake ādāya yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi.
pli-tv-kd1:10.2.2.eng: Yasa then took his fifty friends to the Buddha. He bowed, sat down,

pli-tv-kd1:10.2.3.pli: Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho āyasmā yaso bhagavantaṃ etadavoca—

pli-tv-kd1:10.2.4.pli: “ime me, bhante, paññāsamattā gihisahāyakā jānapadā pubbānupubbakānaṃ kulānaṃ puttā.
pli-tv-kd1:10.2.4.eng: “Sir, these fifty friends of mine are from leading families in the countryside.

pli-tv-kd1:10.3.1.pli: Tesaṃ bhagavā anupubbiṃ kathaṃ kathesi, seyyathidaṃ—
pli-tv-kd1:10.3.1.eng: The Buddha then gave them a progressive talk—

pli-tv-kd1:10.3.2.pli: dānakathaṃ sīlakathaṃ saggakathaṃ kāmānaṃ ādīnavaṃ okāraṃ saṅkilesaṃ nekkhamme ānisaṃsaṃ pakāsesi.
pli-tv-kd1:10.3.2.eng: on generosity, morality, and heaven; on the downside, degradation, and defilement of worldly pleasures; and he revealed the benefits of renunciation.

pli-tv-kd1:10.3.3.pli: Yadā te bhagavā aññāsi kallacitte muducitte vinīvaraṇacitte udaggacitte pasannacitte, atha yā buddhānaṃ sāmukkaṃsikā dhammadesanā, taṃ pakāsesi dukkhaṃ samudayaṃ nirodhaṃ maggaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:10.3.3.eng: When the Buddha knew that their minds were ready, supple, without hindrances, joyful, and confident, he revealed the teaching unique to the Buddhas: suffering, its origin, its end, and the path.

pli-tv-kd1:10.3.4.pli: Seyyathāpi nāma suddhaṃ vatthaṃ apagatakāḷakaṃ sammadeva rajanaṃ paṭiggaṇheyya;
pli-tv-kd1:10.3.4.eng: And just as a clean and stainless cloth absorbs dye properly,

pli-tv-kd1:10.3.5.pli: evameva tesaṃ tasmiṃyeva āsane virajaṃ vītamalaṃ dhammacakkhuṃ udapādi—
pli-tv-kd1:10.3.5.eng: so too, while they were sitting right there, they experienced the stainless vision of the Truth:

pli-tv-kd1:10.3.6.eng: “Anything that has a beginning has an end.”

pli-tv-kd1:10.4.1.eng: They had seen the Truth, had reached, understood, and penetrated it. They had gone beyond doubt and uncertainty, had attained to confidence, and had become independent of others in the Teacher’s instruction. And they said to the Buddha,

pli-tv-kd1:10.4.2.pli: “labheyyāma mayaṃ, bhante, bhagavato santike pabbajjaṃ, labheyyāma upasampadan”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:10.4.2.eng: “Sir, we wish to receive the going forth in your presence. We wish to receive the full ordination.”

pli-tv-kd1:10.4.4.pli: “svākkhāto dhammo, caratha brahmacariyaṃ sammā dukkhassa antakiriyāyā”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:10.4.4.eng: The Teaching is well-proclaimed. Practice the spiritual life to make a complete end of suffering.”

pli-tv-kd1:10.4.5.eng: That was the full ordination of those venerables.

pli-tv-kd1:10.4.6.pli: Atha kho bhagavā te bhikkhū dhammiyā kathāya ovadi anusāsi.
pli-tv-kd1:10.4.6.eng: Then, as the Buddha instructed those monks in the Teaching,

pli-tv-kd1:10.4.7.pli: Tesaṃ bhagavatā dhammiyā kathāya ovadiyamānānaṃ anusāsiyamānānaṃ anupādāya āsavehi cittāni vimucciṃsu.
pli-tv-kd1:10.4.7.eng: their minds were freed from the corruptions through letting go.

pli-tv-kd1:10.4.8.pli: Tena kho pana samayena ekasaṭṭhi loke arahanto honti.
pli-tv-kd1:10.4.8.eng: And there were sixty-one perfected ones in the world.

pli-tv-kd1:10.4.9.eng: The going forth of the fifty friends is finished.

pli-tv-kd1:11.1.0.eng: 8. The account of the Lord of Death

pli-tv-kd1:11.1.1.pli: Atha kho bhagavā te bhikkhū āmantesi—
pli-tv-kd1:11.1.1.eng: Then the Buddha addressed those monks:

pli-tv-kd1:11.1.2.pli: “muttāhaṃ, bhikkhave, sabbapāsehi, ye dibbā ye ca mānusā.
pli-tv-kd1:11.1.2.eng: “I’m free from all snares, both human and divine.

pli-tv-kd1:11.1.3.pli: Tumhepi, bhikkhave, muttā sabbapāsehi, ye dibbā ye ca mānusā.
pli-tv-kd1:11.1.3.eng: You, too, are free from all snares, both human and divine.

pli-tv-kd1:11.1.4.pli: Caratha, bhikkhave, cārikaṃ bahujanahitāya bahujanasukhāya lokānukampāya atthāya hitāya sukhāya devamanussānaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:11.1.4.eng: Go wandering, monks, for the benefit and happiness of humanity, out of compassion for the world, for the good, benefit, and happiness of gods and humans.

pli-tv-kd1:11.1.5.eng: You should each go a different way.

pli-tv-kd1:11.1.6.pli: Desetha, bhikkhave, dhammaṃ ādikalyāṇaṃ majjhekalyāṇaṃ pariyosānakalyāṇaṃ sātthaṃ sabyañjanaṃ kevalaparipuṇṇaṃ parisuddhaṃ brahmacariyaṃ pakāsetha.
pli-tv-kd1:11.1.6.eng: Proclaim the Teaching that is good in the beginning, good in the middle, and good in the end, that has a true goal and is well articulated. Set out the perfectly complete and pure spiritual life.

pli-tv-kd1:11.1.7.pli: Santi sattā apparajakkhajātikā, assavanatā dhammassa parihāyanti, bhavissanti dhammassa aññātāro.
pli-tv-kd1:11.1.7.eng: There are beings with little dust in their eyes who are ruined because of not hearing the Teaching. There will be those who understand.

pli-tv-kd1:11.1.8.pli: Ahampi, bhikkhave, yena uruvelā senānigamo tenupasaṅkamissāmi dhammadesanāyā”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:11.1.8.eng: I too will go to Uruvelā, to Senānigama, to proclaim the Teaching.”

pli-tv-kd1:11.2.1.pli: Atha kho māro pāpimā yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ gāthāya ajjhabhāsi—
pli-tv-kd1:11.2.1.eng: Then the Lord of Death, the Evil One, went up to the Buddha and spoke to him in verse:

pli-tv-kd1:11.2.4.eng: You’re bound by the great bond:

pli-tv-kd1:11.2.5.eng: You’re not free from me, monastic.”

pli-tv-kd1:11.2.8.eng: I’m free from the great bond:

pli-tv-kd1:11.2.11.eng: And it comes from the mind.

pli-tv-kd1:11.2.13.eng: You’re not free from me, monastic.”

pli-tv-kd1:11.2.16.eng: For these I have no desire:

pli-tv-kd1:11.2.18.eng: Then the Lord of Death, the Evil One, thought,

pli-tv-kd1:11.2.19.pli: “jānāti maṃ bhagavā, jānāti maṃ sugato”ti dukkhī dummano tatthevantaradhāyīti.
pli-tv-kd1:11.2.19.eng: “The Buddha knows me, the Happy One knows me,” and, sad and miserable, he disappeared right there.

pli-tv-kd1:11.2.20.eng: The account of the Lord of Death is finished.

pli-tv-kd1:12.1.0.eng: 9. Discussion of the going forth and the full ordination

pli-tv-kd1:12.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhū nānādisā nānājanapadā pabbajjāpekkhe ca upasampadāpekkhe ca ānenti—
pli-tv-kd1:12.1.1.eng: Soon afterwards, the monks were bringing back, from various regions and countries, people desiring the going forth and the full ordination, thinking,

pli-tv-kd1:12.1.3.pli: Tattha bhikkhū ceva kilamanti pabbajjāpekkhā ca upasampadāpekkhā ca.
pli-tv-kd1:12.1.3.eng: The monks became tired, as did those seeking ordination.

pli-tv-kd1:12.1.4.pli: Atha kho bhagavato rahogatassa paṭisallīnassa evaṃ cetaso parivitakko udapādi—
pli-tv-kd1:12.1.4.eng: Then, while reflecting in private, the Buddha thought,

pli-tv-kd1:12.1.5.pli: “etarahi kho bhikkhū nānādisā nānājanapadā pabbajjāpekkhe ca upasampadāpekkhe ca ānenti—

pli-tv-kd1:12.1.7.pli: Tattha bhikkhū ceva kilamanti pabbajjāpekkhā ca upasampadāpekkhā ca.

pli-tv-kd1:12.1.9.pli: tumheva dāni, bhikkhave, tāsu tāsu disāsu tesu tesu janapadesu pabbājetha upasampādethā”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:12.1.9.eng: to give the going forth and the full ordination right there in those various regions and countries?”

pli-tv-kd1:12.2.1.pli: Atha kho bhagavā sāyanhasamayaṃ paṭisallānā vuṭṭhito etasmiṃ nidāne etasmiṃ pakaraṇe dhammiṃ kathaṃ katvā bhikkhū āmantesi—
pli-tv-kd1:12.2.1.eng: In the evening, the Buddha came out from seclusion, gave a teaching, and told the monks what he had thought, adding:

pli-tv-kd1:12.2.2.pli: “idha mayhaṃ, bhikkhave, rahogatassa paṭisallīnassa evaṃ cetaso parivitakko udapādi—

pli-tv-kd1:12.2.3.pli: etarahi kho bhikkhū nānādisā nānājanapadā pabbajjāpekkhe ca upasampadāpekkhe ca ānenti—

pli-tv-kd1:12.2.4.pli: ‘bhagavā ne pabbājessati upasampādessatī’ti, Tattha bhikkhū ceva kilamanti pabbajjāpekkhā ca upasampadāpekkhā ca.

pli-tv-kd1:12.3.1.pli: Yannūnāhaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ anujāneyyaṃ tumheva dāni, bhikkhave, tāsu tāsu disāsu tesu tesu janapadesu pabbājetha upasampādethāti, Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, tumheva dāni tāsu tāsu disāsu tesu tesu janapadesu pabbājetha upasampādetha.
pli-tv-kd1:12.3.1.eng: “I allow you to give the going forth and the full ordination in those various regions and countries.

pli-tv-kd1:12.3.2.eng: And, monks, it should be done like this.

pli-tv-kd1:12.3.3.pli: Paṭhamaṃ kesamassuṃ ohārāpetvā, kāsāyāni vatthāni acchādāpetvā, ekaṃsaṃ uttarāsaṅgaṃ kārāpetvā, bhikkhūnaṃ pāde vandāpetvā, ukkuṭikaṃ nisīdāpetvā, añjaliṃ paggaṇhāpetvā ‘evaṃ vadehī’ti vattabbo—
pli-tv-kd1:12.3.3.eng: First the candidate should shave off his hair and beard and put on ocher robes. He should then arrange his upper robe over one shoulder, pay respect at the feet of the monks, squat on his heels, and raise his joined palms. He should then be told to say this:

pli-tv-kd1:12.4.1.eng: ‘I go for refuge to the Buddha,

pli-tv-kd1:12.4.2.eng: I go for refuge to the Teaching,

pli-tv-kd1:12.4.3.eng: I go for refuge to the Sangha.

pli-tv-kd1:12.4.4.eng: For the second time, I go for refuge to the Buddha,

pli-tv-kd1:12.4.5.eng: For the second time, I go for refuge to the Teaching,

pli-tv-kd1:12.4.6.eng: For the second time, I go for refuge to the Sangha.

pli-tv-kd1:12.4.7.eng: For the third time, I go for refuge to the Buddha,

pli-tv-kd1:12.4.8.eng: For the third time, I go for refuge to the Teaching,

pli-tv-kd1:12.4.9.eng: For the third time, I go for refuge to the Sangha.’

pli-tv-kd1:12.4.10.pli: Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, imehi tīhi saraṇagamanehi pabbajjaṃ upasampadan”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:12.4.10.eng: You should give the going forth and the full ordination through the taking of the three refuges.”
pli-tv-kd1:12.4.10.comm: “Should” renders anujānāmi. For a discussion of this word, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-kd1:12.4.11.eng: The discussion of the full ordination through the taking of the three refuges is finished.

pli-tv-kd1:13.1.0.eng: 10. The second account of the Lord of Death

pli-tv-kd1:13.1.1.pli: Atha kho bhagavā vassaṃvuṭṭho bhikkhū āmantesi—
pli-tv-kd1:13.1.1.eng: When the Buddha had completed the rainy-season residence, he said to the monks,

pli-tv-kd1:13.1.2.pli: “mayhaṃ kho, bhikkhave, yoniso manasikārā yoniso sammappadhānā anuttarā vimutti anuppattā, anuttarā vimutti sacchikatā.
pli-tv-kd1:13.1.2.eng: “Through wise attention and wise right effort, I have reached the supreme freedom, realized the supreme freedom.

pli-tv-kd1:13.1.3.pli: Tumhepi, bhikkhave, yoniso manasikārā yoniso sammappadhānā anuttaraṃ vimuttiṃ anupāpuṇātha, anuttaraṃ vimuttiṃ sacchikarothā”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:13.1.3.eng: And you, monks, have done the same.”

pli-tv-kd1:13.2.1.pli: Atha kho māro pāpimā yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ gāthāya ajjhabhāsi—
pli-tv-kd1:13.2.1.eng: Then the Lord of Death, the Evil One, went up to the Buddha and spoke to him in verse:

pli-tv-kd1:13.2.2.eng: “You’re bound by the snares of the Lord of Death,

pli-tv-kd1:13.2.4.eng: You’re bound by the great bond:

pli-tv-kd1:13.2.5.eng: You’re not free from me, monastic.”

pli-tv-kd1:13.2.6.eng: “I’m free from the snares of the Lord of Death,

pli-tv-kd1:13.2.8.eng: I’m free from the great bond:

pli-tv-kd1:13.2.10.eng: Then the Lord of Death, the Evil One, thought,

pli-tv-kd1:13.2.11.pli: “jānāti maṃ bhagavā, jānāti maṃ sugato”ti dukkhī dummano tatthevantaradhāyi.
pli-tv-kd1:13.2.11.eng: “The Buddha knows me, the Happy One knows me,” and sad and miserable he disappeared right there.

pli-tv-kd1:13.2.12.eng: The second account of the Lord of Death is finished.

pli-tv-kd1:14.1.0.eng: 11. The account of the fine group of people

pli-tv-kd1:14.1.1.pli: Atha kho bhagavā bārāṇasiyaṃ yathābhirantaṃ viharitvā yena uruvelā tena cārikaṃ pakkāmi.
pli-tv-kd1:14.1.1.eng: When the Buddha had stayed at Benares for as long as he liked, he set out wandering toward Uruvelā.

pli-tv-kd1:14.1.2.pli: Atha kho bhagavā maggā okkamma yena aññataro vanasaṇḍo tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā taṃ vanasaṇḍaṃ ajjhogāhetvā aññatarasmiṃ rukkhamūle nisīdi.
pli-tv-kd1:14.1.2.eng: At a certain point he left the road, entered a forest grove, and sat down at the foot of a tree.

pli-tv-kd1:14.1.3.pli: Tena kho pana samayena tiṃsamattā bhaddavaggiyā sahāyakā sapajāpatikā tasmiṃ vanasaṇḍe paricārenti.
pli-tv-kd1:14.1.3.eng: Just then a fine group of thirty friends and their wives were enjoying themselves in that forest grove.

pli-tv-kd1:14.1.4.eng: Because one of them did not have a wife,

pli-tv-kd1:14.1.5.eng: they had brought him a sex worker.

pli-tv-kd1:14.1.6.pli: Atha kho sā vesī tesu pamattesu paricārentesu bhaṇḍaṃ ādāya palāyittha.
pli-tv-kd1:14.1.6.eng: While they were all carelessly enjoying themselves, that sex worker took that man’s possessions and ran away.

pli-tv-kd1:14.2.1.pli: Atha kho te sahāyakā sahāyakassa veyyāvaccaṃ karontā, taṃ itthiṃ gavesantā, taṃ vanasaṇḍaṃ āhiṇḍantā addasaṃsu bhagavantaṃ aññatarasmiṃ rukkhamūle nisinnaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:14.2.1.eng: To help their friend, they all went searching for that woman. And as they walked about that forest grove, they saw the Buddha seated at the foot of a tree.

pli-tv-kd1:14.2.2.pli: Disvāna yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkamiṃsu, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ etadavocuṃ—

pli-tv-kd1:14.2.3.eng: “Sir, have you seen a woman by any chance?”

pli-tv-kd1:14.2.4.eng: “But, young men, why look for a woman?”
pli-tv-kd1:14.2.4.comm: This rendering is elliptical. The combination of kiṁ + itthiyā, an interrogative particle together with what is probably an instrumental case, normally means, “What use is a woman?” (See DOP, sv. ka.) The context, however, makes it clear that the problem is not women as such, but rather the pursuit of sensuality when one is better off looking for a higher spiritual happiness. Thus my indirect translation.

pli-tv-kd1:14.2.5.pli: “Idha mayaṃ, bhante, tiṃsamattā bhaddavaggiyā sahāyakā sapajāpatikā imasmiṃ vanasaṇḍe paricārimhā.
pli-tv-kd1:14.2.5.eng: They told him what had happened.

pli-tv-kd1:14.2.8.pli: Atha kho sā, bhante, vesī amhesu pamattesu paricārentesu bhaṇḍaṃ ādāya palāyittha.

pli-tv-kd1:14.2.9.pli: Te mayaṃ, bhante, sahāyakā sahāyakassa veyyāvaccaṃ karontā, taṃ itthiṃ gavesantā, imaṃ vanasaṇḍaṃ āhiṇḍāmā”ti.

pli-tv-kd1:14.3.1.pli: “Taṃ kiṃ maññatha vo, kumārā, katamaṃ nu kho tumhākaṃ varaṃ—
pli-tv-kd1:14.3.1.eng: “What do you think is better for you:

pli-tv-kd1:14.3.2.pli: yaṃ vā tumhe itthiṃ gaveseyyātha, yaṃ vā attānaṃ gaveseyyāthā”ti?
pli-tv-kd1:14.3.2.eng: that you search for a woman, or that you search for yourselves?”

pli-tv-kd1:14.3.3.pli: “Etadeva, bhante, amhākaṃ varaṃ yaṃ mayaṃ attānaṃ gaveseyyāmā”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:14.3.3.eng: “It’s better that we search for ourselves.”

pli-tv-kd1:14.3.4.pli: “Tena hi vo, kumārā, nisīdatha, dhammaṃ vo desessāmī”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:14.3.4.eng: “Well then, sit down, and I’ll give you a teaching.”

pli-tv-kd1:14.3.5.pli: “Evaṃ, bhante”ti kho te bhaddavaggiyā sahāyakā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdiṃsu.
pli-tv-kd1:14.3.5.eng: Saying, “Yes, sir,” they bowed to the Buddha and sat down.

pli-tv-kd1:14.4.1.pli: Tesaṃ bhagavā anupubbiṃ kathaṃ kathesi, seyyathidaṃ—
pli-tv-kd1:14.4.1.eng: The Buddha then gave them a progressive talk—

pli-tv-kd1:14.4.2.pli: dānakathaṃ sīlakathaṃ saggakathaṃ kāmānaṃ ādīnavaṃ okāraṃ saṅkilesaṃ nekkhamme ānisaṃsaṃ pakāsesi.
pli-tv-kd1:14.4.2.eng: on generosity, morality, and heaven; on the downside, degradation, and defilement of worldly pleasures; and he revealed the benefits of renunciation.

pli-tv-kd1:14.4.3.pli: Yadā te bhagavā aññāsi kallacitte muducitte vinīvaraṇacitte udaggacitte pasannacitte, atha yā buddhānaṃ sāmukkaṃsikā dhammadesanā, taṃ pakāsesi dukkhaṃ samudayaṃ nirodhaṃ maggaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:14.4.3.eng: When the Buddha knew that their minds were ready, supple, without hindrances, joyful, and confident, he revealed the teaching unique to the Buddhas: suffering, its origin, its end, and the path.

pli-tv-kd1:14.4.4.pli: Seyyathāpi nāma suddhaṃ vatthaṃ apagatakāḷakaṃ sammadeva rajanaṃ paṭiggaṇheyya;
pli-tv-kd1:14.4.4.eng: And just as a clean and stainless cloth absorbs dye properly,

pli-tv-kd1:14.4.5.pli: evameva tesaṃ tasmiṃyeva āsane virajaṃ vītamalaṃ dhammacakkhuṃ udapādi—
pli-tv-kd1:14.4.5.eng: so too, while they were sitting right there, they experienced the stainless vision of the Truth:

pli-tv-kd1:14.4.6.eng: “Anything that has a beginning has an end.”

pli-tv-kd1:14.5.1.pli: Te diṭṭhadhammā pattadhammā viditadhammā pariyogāḷhadhammā tiṇṇavicikicchā vigatakathaṅkathā vesārajjappattā aparappaccayā satthusāsane bhagavantaṃ etadavocuṃ—
pli-tv-kd1:14.5.1.eng: They had seen the Truth, had reached, understood, and penetrated it. They had gone beyond doubt and uncertainty, had attained to confidence, and had become independent of others in the Teacher’s instruction. And they said to the Buddha,

pli-tv-kd1:14.5.2.pli: “labheyyāma mayaṃ, bhante, bhagavato santike pabbajjaṃ, labheyyāma upasampadan”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:14.5.2.eng: “Sir, we wish to receive the going forth in your presence. We wish to receive the full ordination.”

pli-tv-kd1:14.5.4.pli: “svākkhāto dhammo, caratha brahmacariyaṃ sammā dukkhassa antakiriyāyā”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:14.5.4.eng: The Teaching is well-proclaimed. Practice the spiritual life to make a complete end of suffering.”

pli-tv-kd1:14.5.5.eng: That was the full ordination of those venerables.

pli-tv-kd1:14.5.6.eng: The account of the fine group of friends is finished.

pli-tv-kd1:14.5.7.eng: The second section for recitation is finished.

pli-tv-kd1:15.1.0.eng: 12. The account of the wonders at Uruvelā

pli-tv-kd1:15.1.1.pli: Atha kho bhagavā anupubbena cārikaṃ caramāno yena uruvelā tadavasari.
pli-tv-kd1:15.1.1.eng: The Buddha continued his wandering and eventually arrived at Uruvelā.

pli-tv-kd1:15.1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena uruvelāyaṃ tayo jaṭilā paṭivasanti—
pli-tv-kd1:15.1.2.eng: At that time there were three dreadlocked ascetics living there:

pli-tv-kd1:15.1.3.eng: Uruvelā Kassapa, Nadī Kassapa, and Gayā Kassapa.

pli-tv-kd1:15.1.4.pli: Tesu uruvelakassapo jaṭilo pañcannaṃ jaṭilasatānaṃ nāyako hoti, vināyako aggo pamukho pāmokkho.
pli-tv-kd1:15.1.4.eng: Uruvelā Kassapa was the leader and chief of five hundred dreadlocked ascetics,

pli-tv-kd1:15.1.5.pli: Nadīkassapo jaṭilo tiṇṇaṃ jaṭilasatānaṃ nāyako hoti, vināyako aggo pamukho pāmokkho.

pli-tv-kd1:15.1.6.pli: Gayākassapo jaṭilo dvinnaṃ jaṭilasatānaṃ nāyako hoti, vināyako aggo pamukho pāmokkho.
pli-tv-kd1:15.1.6.eng: and Gayā Kassapa of two hundred.

pli-tv-kd1:15.2.1.pli: Atha kho bhagavā yena uruvelakassapassa jaṭilassa assamo tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā uruvelakassapaṃ jaṭilaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd1:15.2.1.eng: The Buddha went to the hermitage of Uruvelā Kassapa and said to him,

pli-tv-kd1:15.2.2.pli: “sace te, kassapa, agaru, vaseyyāma ekarattaṃ agyāgāre”ti?
pli-tv-kd1:15.2.2.eng: “If it’s not inconvenient for you, Kassapa, may I stay for one night in your fire hut?”

pli-tv-kd1:15.2.3.pli: “Na kho me, mahāsamaṇa, garu, caṇḍettha nāgarājā iddhimā āsiviso ghoraviso, so taṃ mā viheṭhesī”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:15.2.3.eng: “It’s not inconvenient for me, Great Ascetic, but there’s a fierce and highly venomous dragon king with supernormal powers there. I don’t want it to harm you.”

pli-tv-kd1:15.2.4.pli: Dutiyampi kho bhagavā uruvelakassapaṃ jaṭilaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd1:15.2.4.eng: The Buddha asked a second and a third time, and on both occasions Uruvelā Kassapa replied as before.

pli-tv-kd1:15.2.5.pli: “sace te, kassapa, agaru, vaseyyāma ekarattaṃ agyāgāre”ti?

pli-tv-kd1:15.2.6.pli: “Na kho me, mahāsamaṇa, garu, caṇḍettha nāgarājā iddhimā āsiviso ghoraviso, so taṃ mā viheṭhesī”ti.

pli-tv-kd1:15.2.7.pli: Tatiyampi kho bhagavā uruvelakassapaṃ jaṭilaṃ etadavoca—

pli-tv-kd1:15.2.8.pli: “sace te, kassapa, agaru, vaseyyāma ekarattaṃ agyāgāre”ti?

pli-tv-kd1:15.2.9.pli: “Na kho me, mahāsamaṇa, garu, caṇḍettha nāgarājā iddhimā āsiviso ghoraviso, so taṃ mā viheṭhesī”ti.

pli-tv-kd1:15.2.10.pli: “Appeva maṃ na viheṭheyya, iṅgha tvaṃ, kassapa, anujānāhi agyāgāran”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:15.2.10.eng: The Buddha then said, “Perhaps it won’t harm me. Come on, Kassapa, let me to stay in the fire hut.”

pli-tv-kd1:15.3.1.pli: Atha kho bhagavā agyāgāraṃ pavisitvā tiṇasanthārakaṃ paññapetvā nisīdi pallaṅkaṃ ābhujitvā ujuṃ kāyaṃ paṇidhāya parimukhaṃ satiṃ upaṭṭhapetvā.
pli-tv-kd1:15.3.1.eng: The Buddha entered the fire hut and prepared a spread of grass. He sat down, crossed his legs, straightened his body, and established mindfulness in front of him.

pli-tv-kd1:15.3.2.pli: Addasā kho so nāgo bhagavantaṃ paviṭṭhaṃ, disvāna dummano padhūpāyi.
pli-tv-kd1:15.3.2.eng: When the dragon saw that the Buddha had entered, he was displeased and emitted smoke.

pli-tv-kd1:15.3.4.pli: “yannūnāhaṃ imassa nāgassa anupahacca chaviñca cammañca maṃsañca nhāruñca aṭṭhiñca aṭṭhimiñjañca tejasā tejaṃ pariyādiyeyyan”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:15.3.4.eng: “Let me overpower this dragon, using fire against fire, but without harming it in the slightest way.”

pli-tv-kd1:15.4.1.pli: Atha kho bhagavā tathārūpaṃ iddhābhisaṅkhāraṃ abhisaṅkharitvā padhūpāyi.
pli-tv-kd1:15.4.1.eng: The Buddha then used his supernormal powers so that he, too, emitted smoke.

pli-tv-kd1:15.4.2.pli: Atha kho so nāgo makkhaṃ asahamāno pajjali.
pli-tv-kd1:15.4.2.eng: The dragon, being unable to contain his rage, emitted flames.

pli-tv-kd1:15.4.3.eng: The Buddha entered the fire element and he, too, emitted flames.

pli-tv-kd1:15.4.4.pli: Ubhinnaṃ sajotibhūtānaṃ agyāgāraṃ ādittaṃ viya hoti sampajjalitaṃ sajotibhūtaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:15.4.4.eng: With both of them emitting flames, it was as if the fire hut was ablaze and burning.

pli-tv-kd1:15.4.5.pli: Atha kho te jaṭilā agyāgāraṃ parivāretvā evamāhaṃsu—
pli-tv-kd1:15.4.5.eng: Those dreadlocked ascetics gathered around the fire hut, saying,

pli-tv-kd1:15.4.6.eng: “The Great Ascetic is handsome, but the dragon is harming him.”

pli-tv-kd1:15.5.1.pli: Atha kho bhagavā tassā rattiyā accayena tassa nāgassa anupahacca chaviñca cammañca maṃsañca nhāruñca aṭṭhiñca aṭṭhimiñjañca tejasā tejaṃ pariyādiyitvā patte pakkhipitvā uruvelakassapassa jaṭilassa dassesi—
pli-tv-kd1:15.5.1.eng: The next morning the Buddha had overcome that dragon, using fire against fire, but without harming it in the slightest way. He put it in his almsbowl and showed it to Uruvelā Kassapa:

pli-tv-kd1:15.5.2.pli: “ayaṃ te, kassapa, nāgo pariyādinno assa tejasā tejo”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:15.5.2.eng: “Here is your dragon, Kassapa, his fire overpowered by fire.”

pli-tv-kd1:15.5.4.pli: “mahiddhiko kho mahāsamaṇo mahānubhāvo, yatra hi nāma caṇḍassa nāgarājassa iddhimato āsivisassa ghoravisassa tejasā tejaṃ pariyādiyissati, na tveva ca kho arahā yathā ahan”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:15.5.4.eng: “The Great Ascetic is powerful and mighty. Using fire against fire, he has overcome that fierce and highly venomous dragon king with its supernormal powers. But he’s not a perfected one like me.”

pli-tv-kd1:15.6.1.eng: At the Nerañjara the Buddha said

pli-tv-kd1:15.6.2.eng: To the dreadlocked ascetic Uruvelā Kassapa,

pli-tv-kd1:15.6.4.eng: May I stay for a night in your fire hut?”

pli-tv-kd1:15.6.6.eng: But for your own good, I bar you.

pli-tv-kd1:15.6.7.eng: A fierce dragon king is there,

pli-tv-kd1:15.6.9.eng: I don’t want it to harm you.”

pli-tv-kd1:15.6.10.eng: “Perhaps it won’t harm me. Come on, Kassapa,

pli-tv-kd1:15.6.11.eng: Let me stay in the fire hut.”

pli-tv-kd1:15.6.12.eng: When he knew the answer was “Yes,”

pli-tv-kd1:15.6.14.eng: Seeing the sage who had entered,

pli-tv-kd1:15.6.16.eng: With a mind of good will,

pli-tv-kd1:15.6.17.eng: The Great Man, too, emitted smoke.

pli-tv-kd1:15.6.21.eng: The Great Man, too, emitted fire.

pli-tv-kd1:15.6.22.eng: With both of them emitting flames,

pli-tv-kd1:15.6.23.eng: The fire hut was glowing and blazing.

pli-tv-kd1:15.6.24.eng: Looking on, the dreadlocked ascetics said,

pli-tv-kd1:15.6.26.eng: But the dragon is harming him.”

pli-tv-kd1:15.7.3.eng: While the One with supernormal powers

pli-tv-kd1:15.7.5.comm: “Red” renders lohitaka, whereas “magenta” is for mañjiṭṭhā. DN 16:3.31.2 says that lohitaka is the color of the bandhujīvakapuppha, which according to PED is the flower of Pentapetes phaenicea, which is red. Vv-a 689: Sinduvārakaṇavīramakulasadisavaṇṇañhi “mañjiṭṭhakan”ti vuccati, “For a color like the bud of the sinduvāra and the kaṇavīra is called mañjiṭṭhaka.” The sinduvāra (Vitex negundo) flower is a variety of shades from white to blue, including purple, whereas the kaṇavīra (Pentapetes phaenicea) flower is mostly pink. I have settled for “magenta” as an approximate description for this range of colors.

pli-tv-kd1:15.7.6.eng: Yellow, and the color of crystal:

pli-tv-kd1:15.7.9.eng: Putting the dragon in his bowl,

pli-tv-kd1:15.7.10.eng: He showed it to the brahmin:

pli-tv-kd1:15.7.13.pli: Atha kho uruvelakassapo jaṭilo bhagavato iminā iddhipāṭihāriyena abhippasanno bhagavantaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd1:15.7.13.eng: Because of this wonder of supernormal power, Uruvelā Kassapa gained confidence in the Buddha and said to him,

pli-tv-kd1:15.7.14.eng: “Great Ascetic, please stay right here. I’ll supply you with food.”

pli-tv-kd1:16.1.1.pli: Atha kho bhagavā uruvelakassapassa jaṭilassa assamassa avidūre aññatarasmiṃ vanasaṇḍe vihāsi.
pli-tv-kd1:16.1.1.eng: Soon afterwards the Buddha stayed in a forest grove not far from Uruvelā Kassapa’s hermitage.

pli-tv-kd1:16.1.2.pli: Atha kho cattāro mahārājāno abhikkantāya rattiyā abhikkantavaṇṇā kevalakappaṃ vanasaṇḍaṃ obhāsetvā yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkamiṃsu, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā catuddisā aṭṭhaṃsu seyyathāpi mahantā aggikkhandhā.
pli-tv-kd1:16.1.2.eng: Then, when the night was well advanced, the magnificent four great kings approached the Buddha, illuminating the whole forest grove. They bowed down to the Buddha and stood at the four cardinal points, appearing like great bonfires.

pli-tv-kd1:16.2.1.pli: Atha kho uruvelakassapo jaṭilo tassā rattiyā accayena yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd1:16.2.1.eng: The next morning Uruvelā Kassapa went to the Buddha and said,

pli-tv-kd1:16.2.2.eng: “It’s time, Great Ascetic, the meal is ready.

pli-tv-kd1:16.2.3.pli: Ke nu kho te, mahāsamaṇa, abhikkantāya rattiyā abhikkantavaṇṇā kevalakappaṃ vanasaṇḍaṃ obhāsetvā yena tvaṃ tenupasaṅkamiṃsu, upasaṅkamitvā taṃ abhivādetvā catuddisā aṭṭhaṃsu seyyathāpi mahantā aggikkhandhā”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:16.2.3.eng: And who was it that visited you last night?”

pli-tv-kd1:16.2.4.pli: “Ete kho, kassapa, cattāro mahārājāno yenāhaṃ tenupasaṅkamiṃsu dhammassavanāyā”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:16.2.4.eng: “That was the four great kings. They came to me to hear the Teaching.”

pli-tv-kd1:16.2.6.pli: “mahiddhiko kho mahāsamaṇo mahānubhāvo, yatra hi nāma cattāropi mahārājāno upasaṅkamissanti dhammassavanāya, na tveva ca kho arahā yathā ahan”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:16.2.6.eng: “The Great Ascetic is powerful and mighty, in that even the four great kings go to him to hear the Teaching. But he’s not a perfected one like me.”

pli-tv-kd1:16.2.7.pli: Atha kho bhagavā uruvelakassapassa jaṭilassa bhattaṃ bhuñjitvā tasmiṃyeva vanasaṇḍe vihāsi.
pli-tv-kd1:16.2.7.eng: The Buddha ate his meal and continued to stay in the same forest grove.

pli-tv-kd1:17.1.1.pli: Atha kho sakko devānamindo abhikkantāya rattiyā abhikkantavaṇṇo kevalakappaṃ vanasaṇḍaṃ obhāsetvā yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ aṭṭhāsi seyyathāpi mahāaggikkhandho, purimāhi vaṇṇanibhāhi abhikkantataro ca paṇītataro ca.
pli-tv-kd1:17.1.1.eng: Once again when the night was well advanced, Sakka, the magnificent ruler of the gods, approached the Buddha, illuminating the whole forest grove. He bowed down to the Buddha and stood up, appearing just like a great bonfire. But it was more splendid and sublime than the previous ones.

pli-tv-kd1:17.2.1.pli: Atha kho uruvelakassapo jaṭilo tassā rattiyā accayena yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd1:17.2.1.eng: The next morning Uruvelā Kassapa went to the Buddha and said,

pli-tv-kd1:17.2.2.eng: “It’s time, Great Ascetic, the meal is ready.

pli-tv-kd1:17.2.3.pli: Ko nu kho so, mahāsamaṇa, abhikkantāya rattiyā abhikkantavaṇṇo kevalakappaṃ vanasaṇḍaṃ obhāsetvā yena tvaṃ tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā taṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ aṭṭhāsi seyyathāpi mahāaggikkhandho, purimāhi vaṇṇanibhāhi abhikkantataro ca paṇītataro cā”ti?
pli-tv-kd1:17.2.3.eng: And who was it that visited you last night?”

pli-tv-kd1:17.2.4.pli: “Eso kho, kassapa, sakko devānamindo yenāhaṃ tenupasaṅkami dhammassavanāyā”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:17.2.4.eng: “That was Sakka, the ruler of the gods. He came to me to hear the Teaching.”

pli-tv-kd1:17.2.6.pli: “mahiddhiko kho mahāsamaṇo mahānubhāvo, yatra hi nāma sakkopi devānamindo upasaṅkamissati dhammassavanāya, na tveva ca kho arahā yathā ahan”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:17.2.6.eng: “The Great Ascetic is powerful and mighty, in that even Sakka, the ruler of gods, goes to him to hear the Teaching. But he’s not a perfected one like me.”

pli-tv-kd1:17.2.7.pli: Atha kho bhagavā uruvelakassapassa jaṭilassa bhattaṃ bhuñjitvā tasmiṃyeva vanasaṇḍe vihāsi.
pli-tv-kd1:17.2.7.eng: The Buddha ate his meal and continued to stay in the same forest grove.

pli-tv-kd1:18.1.1.pli: Atha kho brahmā sahampati abhikkantāya rattiyā abhikkantavaṇṇo kevalakappaṃ vanasaṇḍaṃ obhāsetvā yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ aṭṭhāsi seyyathāpi mahāaggikkhandho, purimāhi vaṇṇanibhāhi abhikkantataro ca paṇītataro ca.
pli-tv-kd1:18.1.1.eng: Once again when the night was well advanced, Sahampati, the magnificent supreme being, approached the Buddha, illuminating the whole forest grove. He bowed down to the Buddha and stood up, appearing just like a great bonfire. But it was even more splendid and sublime than the previous ones.

pli-tv-kd1:18.2.1.pli: Atha kho uruvelakassapo jaṭilo tassā rattiyā accayena yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd1:18.2.1.eng: The next morning Uruvelā Kassapa went to the Buddha and said,

pli-tv-kd1:18.2.2.eng: “It’s time, Great Ascetic, the meal is ready.

pli-tv-kd1:18.2.3.pli: Ko nu kho so, mahāsamaṇa, abhikkantāya rattiyā abhikkantavaṇṇo kevalakappaṃ vanasaṇḍaṃ obhāsetvā yena tvaṃ tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā taṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ aṭṭhāsi seyyathāpi mahāaggikkhandho, purimāhi vaṇṇanibhāhi abhikkantataro ca paṇītataro cā”ti?
pli-tv-kd1:18.2.3.eng: And who was it that visited you last night?”

pli-tv-kd1:18.2.4.pli: “Eso kho, kassapa, brahmā sahampati yenāhaṃ tenupasaṅkami dhammassavanāyā”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:18.2.4.eng: “That was Sahampati, the supreme being. He came to me to hear the Teaching.”

pli-tv-kd1:18.2.6.pli: “mahiddhiko kho mahāsamaṇo mahānubhāvo, yatra hi nāma brahmāpi sahampati upasaṅkamissati dhammassavanāya, na tveva ca kho arahā yathā ahan”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:18.2.6.eng: “The Great Ascetic is powerful and mighty, in that even Sahampati, the supreme being, goes to him to hear the Teaching. But he’s not a perfected one like me.”

pli-tv-kd1:18.2.7.pli: Atha kho bhagavā uruvelakassapassa jaṭilassa bhattaṃ bhuñjitvā tasmiṃyeva vanasaṇḍe vihāsi.
pli-tv-kd1:18.2.7.eng: The Buddha ate his meal and continued to stay in the same forest grove.

pli-tv-kd1:19.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena uruvelakassapassa jaṭilassa mahāyañño paccupaṭṭhito hoti, kevalakappā ca aṅgamagadhā pahūtaṃ khādanīyaṃ bhojanīyaṃ ādāya abhikkamitukāmā honti.
pli-tv-kd1:19.1.1.eng: At this time Uruvelā Kassapa was holding a great sacrifice, and the whole of Aṅga and Magadha wanted to attend with much food of various kinds.

pli-tv-kd1:19.1.3.pli: “etarahi kho me mahāyañño paccupaṭṭhito, kevalakappā ca aṅgamagadhā pahūtaṃ khādanīyaṃ bhojanīyaṃ ādāya abhikkamissanti.

pli-tv-kd1:19.1.4.pli: Sace mahāsamaṇo mahājanakāye iddhipāṭihāriyaṃ karissati, mahāsamaṇassa lābhasakkāro abhivaḍḍhissati, mama lābhasakkāro parihāyissati.
pli-tv-kd1:19.1.4.eng: and thought, “If the Great Ascetic performs a wonder of supernormal power for the great crowd, he’ll get more material support and honor, whereas I’ll get less.

pli-tv-kd1:19.1.5.eng: I hope he doesn’t come tomorrow.”

pli-tv-kd1:19.2.1.pli: Atha kho bhagavā uruvelakassapassa jaṭilassa cetasā cetoparivitakkamaññāya uttarakuruṃ gantvā tato piṇḍapātaṃ āharitvā anotattadahe paribhuñjitvā tattheva divāvihāraṃ akāsi.
pli-tv-kd1:19.2.1.eng: The Buddha read the mind of Uruvelā Kassapa. He then went to Uttarakuru, collected almsfood there, ate it at the Anotatta lake, and stayed there for the day’s meditation.

pli-tv-kd1:19.2.2.pli: Atha kho uruvelakassapo jaṭilo tassā rattiyā accayena yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd1:19.2.2.eng: The next morning Uruvelā Kassapa went to the Buddha and said,

pli-tv-kd1:19.2.3.eng: “It’s time, Great Ascetic, the meal is ready.

pli-tv-kd1:19.2.4.pli: Kiṃ nu kho, mahāsamaṇa, hiyyo nāgamāsi?
pli-tv-kd1:19.2.4.eng: And why didn’t you come yesterday?

pli-tv-kd1:19.2.7.pli: Khādanīyassa ca bhojanīyassa ca te paṭivīso ṭhapito”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:19.2.7.eng: and set aside a share of various kinds of food.”

pli-tv-kd1:19.3.2.pli: ‘etarahi kho me mahāyañño paccupaṭṭhito, kevalakappā ca aṅgamagadhā pahūtaṃ khādanīyaṃ bhojanīyaṃ ādāya abhikkamissanti, sace mahāsamaṇo mahājanakāye iddhipāṭihāriyaṃ karissati, mahāsamaṇassa lābhasakkāro abhivaḍḍhissati, mama lābhasakkāro parihāyissati, aho nūna mahāsamaṇo svātanāya nāgaccheyyā’ti.

pli-tv-kd1:19.4.1.pli: So kho ahaṃ, kassapa, tava cetasā cetoparivitakkamaññāya uttarakuruṃ gantvā tato piṇḍapātaṃ āharitvā anotattadahe paribhuñjitvā tattheva divāvihāraṃ akāsin”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:19.4.1.eng: Because I read your mind, I went to Uttarakuru, collected almsfood there, ate it at the Anotatta lake, and stayed there for the day’s meditation.”

pli-tv-kd1:19.4.3.pli: “mahiddhiko kho mahāsamaṇo mahānubhāvo, yatra hi nāma cetasāpi cittaṃ pajānissati, na tveva ca kho arahā yathā ahan”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:19.4.3.eng: “The Great Ascetic is powerful and mighty, in that he can read the minds of others. But he’s not a perfected one like me.”

pli-tv-kd1:19.4.4.pli: Atha kho bhagavā uruvelakassapassa jaṭilassa bhattaṃ bhuñjitvā tasmiṃyeva vanasaṇḍe vihāsi.
pli-tv-kd1:19.4.4.eng: The Buddha ate his meal and continued to stay in the same forest grove.

pli-tv-kd1:20.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhagavato paṃsukūlaṃ uppannaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-kd1:20.1.1.eng: Soon afterwards the Buddha got a rag

pli-tv-kd1:20.1.4.pli: Atha kho sakko devānamindo bhagavato cetasā cetoparivitakkamaññāya pāṇinā pokkharaṇiṃ khaṇitvā bhagavantaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd1:20.1.4.eng: Reading the Buddha’s mind, Sakka dug a pond with his hand. And he said to the Buddha,

pli-tv-kd1:20.1.8.pli: Atha kho sakko devānamindo bhagavato cetasā cetoparivitakkamaññāya mahatiṃ silaṃ upanikkhipi—
pli-tv-kd1:20.1.8.eng: Reading the Buddha’s mind once again, Sakka placed a boulder there. And he said to the Buddha,

pli-tv-kd1:20.2.2.eng: “What can I hold onto to get out of this pond?”

pli-tv-kd1:20.2.3.pli: Atha kho kakudhe adhivatthā devatā bhagavato cetasā cetoparivitakkamaññāya sākhaṃ onāmesi—
pli-tv-kd1:20.2.3.eng: A god living in an arjun tree read the Buddha’s mind. She then bent down a branch and said to the Buddha,

pli-tv-kd1:20.2.4.eng: “Sir, please come out by holding onto this.”

pli-tv-kd1:20.2.7.pli: Atha kho sakko devānamindo bhagavato cetasā cetoparivitakkamaññāya mahatiṃ silaṃ upanikkhipi—
pli-tv-kd1:20.2.7.eng: Reading the Buddha’s mind yet again, Sakka placed another boulder there. And he said to the Buddha,

pli-tv-kd1:20.3.1.pli: Atha kho uruvelakassapo jaṭilo tassā rattiyā accayena yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd1:20.3.1.eng: The next morning Uruvelā Kassapa went to the Buddha and said,

pli-tv-kd1:20.3.2.eng: “It’s time, Great Ascetic, the meal is ready.

pli-tv-kd1:20.3.3.pli: Kiṃ nu kho, mahāsamaṇa, nāyaṃ pubbe idha pokkharaṇī, sāyaṃ idha pokkharaṇī.
pli-tv-kd1:20.3.3.eng: But what’s going on? There was no pond here before, but now there is.

pli-tv-kd1:20.3.4.eng: These boulders were not here before.

pli-tv-kd1:20.3.6.pli: Nayimassa kakudhassa pubbe sākhā onatā, sāyaṃ sākhā onatā”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:20.3.6.eng: And this arjun tree didn’t have a bent branch, but now it does.”

pli-tv-kd1:20.4.4.pli: Atha kho, kassapa, sakko devānamindo mama cetasā cetoparivitakkamaññāya pāṇinā pokkharaṇiṃ khaṇitvā maṃ etadavoca—

pli-tv-kd1:20.4.6.pli: Sāyaṃ, kassapa, amanussena pāṇinā khaṇitā pokkharaṇī.

pli-tv-kd1:20.4.9.pli: Atha kho, kassapa, sakko devānamindo mama cetasā cetoparivitakkamaññāya mahatiṃ silaṃ upanikkhipi—

pli-tv-kd1:20.5.3.pli: Atha kho, kassapa, kakudhe adhivatthā devatā mama cetasā cetoparivitakkamaññāya sākhaṃ onāmesi—

pli-tv-kd1:20.5.8.pli: Atha kho, kassapa, sakko devānamindo mama cetasā cetoparivitakkamaññāya mahatiṃ silaṃ upanikkhipi—

pli-tv-kd1:20.6.1.eng: When the Buddha told him what had happened, Uruvelā Kassapa thought,

pli-tv-kd1:20.6.2.pli: “mahiddhiko kho mahāsamaṇo mahānubhāvo, yatra hi nāma sakkopi devānamindo veyyāvaccaṃ karissati, na tveva ca kho arahā yathā ahan”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:20.6.2.eng: “The Great Ascetic is powerful and mighty, in that even Sakka, the ruler of the gods, performs services for him. But he’s not a perfected one like me.”

pli-tv-kd1:20.6.3.pli: Atha kho bhagavā uruvelakassapassa jaṭilassa bhattaṃ bhuñjitvā tasmiṃyeva vanasaṇḍe vihāsi.
pli-tv-kd1:20.6.3.eng: The Buddha ate his meal and continued to stay in the same forest grove.

pli-tv-kd1:20.7.1.pli: Atha kho uruvelakassapo jaṭilo tassā rattiyā accayena yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavato kālaṃ ārocesi—
pli-tv-kd1:20.7.1.eng: The next morning Uruvelā Kassapa went to the Buddha and said,

pli-tv-kd1:20.7.2.eng: “It’s time, Great Ascetic, the meal is ready.”

pli-tv-kd1:20.7.3.pli: “Gaccha tvaṃ, kassapa, āyāmahan”ti uruvelakassapaṃ jaṭilaṃ uyyojetvā yāya jambuyā “jambudīpo” paññāyati, tato phalaṃ gahetvā paṭhamataraṃ āgantvā agyāgāre nisīdi.
pli-tv-kd1:20.7.3.eng: “You just go ahead, Kassapa, I’ll come.” After dismissing him, he took a fruit from a rose-apple tree—the tree after which the Rose-apple Land of India is named—and then arrived first in the fire hut where he sat down.

pli-tv-kd1:20.8.1.pli: Addasā kho uruvelakassapo jaṭilo bhagavantaṃ agyāgāre nisinnaṃ, disvāna bhagavantaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd1:20.8.1.eng: When Uruvelā Kassapa saw the Buddha sitting there, he said to him,

pli-tv-kd1:20.8.3.pli: Ahaṃ tayā paṭhamataraṃ pakkanto, so tvaṃ paṭhamataraṃ āgantvā agyāgāre nisinno”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:20.8.3.eng: I left first, but you’re already here.”

pli-tv-kd1:20.9.1.pli: “Idhāhaṃ, kassapa, taṃ uyyojetvā yāya jambuyā ‘jambudīpo’ paññāyati, tato phalaṃ gahetvā paṭhamataraṃ āgantvā agyāgāre nisinno.
pli-tv-kd1:20.9.1.eng: The Buddha told him what he had done and added,

pli-tv-kd1:20.9.2.pli: Idaṃ kho, kassapa, jambuphalaṃ vaṇṇasampannaṃ gandhasampannaṃ rasasampannaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:20.9.2.eng: “This rose apple has a good color, and it’s fragrant and delicious, too.

pli-tv-kd1:20.9.3.eng: You can have it, if you wish.”

pli-tv-kd1:20.9.4.pli: “Alaṃ, mahāsamaṇa, tvaṃyeva taṃ arahasi, tvaṃyeva taṃ paribhuñjāhī”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:20.9.4.eng: “There’s no need. You deserve it and you should have it.”

pli-tv-kd1:20.9.6.pli: “mahiddhiko kho mahāsamaṇo mahānubhāvo, yatra hi nāma maṃ paṭhamataraṃ uyyojetvā yāya jambuyā ‘jambudīpo’ paññāyati, tato phalaṃ gahetvā paṭhamataraṃ āgantvā agyāgāre nisīdissati, na tveva ca kho arahā yathā ahan”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:20.9.6.eng: “The Great Ascetic is powerful and mighty, in that he dismissed me, then took a fruit from a rose-apple tree, and still arrived first in the fire hut. But he’s not a perfected one like me.”

pli-tv-kd1:20.9.7.pli: Atha kho bhagavā uruvelakassapassa jaṭilassa bhattaṃ bhuñjitvā tasmiṃyeva vanasaṇḍe vihāsi.
pli-tv-kd1:20.9.7.eng: The Buddha ate his meal and continued to stay in the same forest grove.

pli-tv-kd1:20.10.1.pli: Atha kho uruvelakassapo jaṭilo tassā rattiyā accayena yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavato kālaṃ ārocesi—
pli-tv-kd1:20.10.1.eng: The next morning Uruvelā Kassapa went to the Buddha and said,

pli-tv-kd1:20.10.2.eng: “It’s time, Great Ascetic, the meal is ready.”

pli-tv-kd1:20.10.3.pli: “Gaccha tvaṃ, kassapa, āyāmahan”ti uruvelakassapaṃ jaṭilaṃ uyyojetvā yāya jambuyā “jambudīpo” paññāyati, tassā avidūre ambo …pe…
pli-tv-kd1:20.10.3.eng: “You just go ahead, Kassapa, I’ll come.” After dismissing him, he took a fruit from a mango tree not far from the rose-apple tree …

pli-tv-kd1:20.10.4.eng: he took a fruit from an emblic myrobalan tree not far from the mango tree …

pli-tv-kd1:20.10.5.eng: he took a fruit from a chebulic myrobalan tree not far from the emblic myrobalan tree …

pli-tv-kd1:20.10.6.pli: tāvatiṃsaṃ gantvā pāricchattakapupphaṃ gahetvā paṭhamataraṃ āgantvā agyāgāre nisīdi.
pli-tv-kd1:20.10.6.eng: he went to Tāvatiṁsa heaven, took a flower from an orchid tree, and then arrived first in the fire hut where he sat down.
pli-tv-kd1:20.10.6.comm: “Orchid tree” renders pāricchattaka. According to PED the pāricchattaka tree is equivalent to the kovilāra tree, which DOP identifies as the Bauhinia variegata, the orchid tree.

pli-tv-kd1:20.10.7.pli: Addasā kho uruvelakassapo jaṭilo bhagavantaṃ agyāgāre nisinnaṃ, disvāna bhagavantaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd1:20.10.7.eng: When Uruvelā Kassapa saw the Buddha sitting there, he said to him,

pli-tv-kd1:20.10.9.pli: Ahaṃ tayā paṭhamataraṃ pakkanto, so tvaṃ paṭhamataraṃ āgantvā agyāgāre nisinno”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:20.10.9.eng: I left first, but you’re already here.”

pli-tv-kd1:20.11.1.pli: “Idhāhaṃ, kassapa, taṃ uyyojetvā tāvatiṃsaṃ gantvā pāricchattakapupphaṃ gahetvā paṭhamataraṃ āgantvā agyāgāre nisinno.
pli-tv-kd1:20.11.1.eng: The Buddha told him what he had done, and added,

pli-tv-kd1:20.11.2.pli: Idaṃ kho, kassapa, pāricchattakapupphaṃ vaṇṇasampannaṃ gandhasampannaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:20.11.2.eng: “This orchid tree flower is colorful and fragrant.

pli-tv-kd1:20.11.3.eng: You can have it, if you wish.”

pli-tv-kd1:20.11.4.pli: “Alaṃ, mahāsamaṇa, tvaṃyeva taṃ arahasi, tvaṃyeva taṃ gaṇhā”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:20.11.4.eng: “There’s no need. You deserve it and you should have it.”

pli-tv-kd1:20.11.6.pli: “mahiddhiko kho mahāsamaṇo mahānubhāvo, yatra hi nāma maṃ paṭhamataraṃ uyyojetvā tāvatiṃsaṃ gantvā pāricchattakapupphaṃ gahetvā paṭhamataraṃ āgantvā agyāgāre nisīdissati, na tveva ca kho arahā yathā ahan”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:20.11.6.eng: “The Great Ascetic is powerful and mighty, in that he dismissed me, then went to Tāvatiṁsa heaven, took an orchid tree flower, and still arrived first in the fire hut. But he’s not a perfected one like me.”

pli-tv-kd1:20.12.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena te jaṭilā aggiṃ paricaritukāmā na sakkonti kaṭṭhāni phāletuṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:20.12.1.eng: Soon afterwards those dreadlocked ascetics wanted to tend the sacred fire, but were unable to split the logs.

pli-tv-kd1:20.12.3.pli: “nissaṃsayaṃ kho mahāsamaṇassa iddhānubhāvo, yathā mayaṃ na sakkoma kaṭṭhāni phāletun”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:20.12.3.eng: “This must be because of the supernormal powers of the Great Ascetic.”

pli-tv-kd1:20.12.4.pli: Atha kho bhagavā uruvelakassapaṃ jaṭilaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd1:20.12.4.eng: The Buddha said to Uruvelā Kassapa,

pli-tv-kd1:20.12.7.eng: And five hundred logs were split all at once.

pli-tv-kd1:20.12.9.pli: “mahiddhiko kho mahāsamaṇo mahānubhāvo, yatra hi nāma kaṭṭhānipi phāliyissanti, na tveva ca kho arahā yathā ahan”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:20.12.9.eng: “The Great Ascetic is powerful and mighty, in that he can split logs just like that. But he’s not a perfected one like me.”

pli-tv-kd1:20.13.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena te jaṭilā aggiṃ paricaritukāmā na sakkonti aggiṃ ujjaletuṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:20.13.1.eng: Those ascetics still wanted to tend the sacred fire, but were unable to light it.

pli-tv-kd1:20.13.3.pli: “nissaṃsayaṃ kho mahāsamaṇassa iddhānubhāvo, yathā mayaṃ na sakkoma aggiṃ ujjaletun”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:20.13.3.eng: “This must be because of the supernormal powers of the Great Ascetic.”

pli-tv-kd1:20.13.4.pli: Atha kho bhagavā uruvelakassapaṃ jaṭilaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd1:20.13.4.eng: The Buddha said to Uruvelā Kassapa,

pli-tv-kd1:20.13.7.eng: And five hundred fires were lit all at once.

pli-tv-kd1:20.13.9.pli: “mahiddhiko kho mahāsamaṇo mahānubhāvo, yatra hi nāma aggīpi ujjaliyissanti, na tveva ca kho arahā yathā ahan”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:20.13.9.eng: “The Great Ascetic is powerful and mighty, in that he can light fires just like that. But he’s not a perfected one like me.”

pli-tv-kd1:20.14.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena te jaṭilā aggiṃ paricaritvā na sakkonti aggiṃ vijjhāpetuṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:20.14.1.eng: When those ascetics had tended the sacred fires, they were unable to extinguish them.

pli-tv-kd1:20.14.3.pli: “nissaṃsayaṃ kho mahāsamaṇassa iddhānubhāvo, yathā mayaṃ na sakkoma aggiṃ vijjhāpetun”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:20.14.3.eng: “This must be because of the supernormal powers of the Great Ascetic.”

pli-tv-kd1:20.14.4.pli: Atha kho bhagavā uruvelakassapaṃ jaṭilaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd1:20.14.4.eng: The Buddha said to Uruvelā Kassapa,

pli-tv-kd1:20.14.7.eng: And the five hundred fires were extinguished all at once.

pli-tv-kd1:20.14.9.pli: “mahiddhiko kho mahāsamaṇo mahānubhāvo, yatra hi nāma aggīpi vijjhāyissanti, na tveva ca kho arahā yathā ahan”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:20.14.9.eng: “The Great Ascetic is powerful and mighty, in that he can extinguish fires just like that. But he’s not a perfected one like me.”

pli-tv-kd1:20.15.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena te jaṭilā sītāsu hemantikāsu rattīsu antaraṭṭhakāsu himapātasamaye najjā nerañjarāya ummujjantipi, nimujjantipi, ummujjananimujjanampi karonti.
pli-tv-kd1:20.15.1.eng: At that time it was midwinter, with cold days and snow. During this period those ascetics emerged from the Nerañjara river, immersed themselves in it, and repeatedly emerged and immersed themselves.

pli-tv-kd1:20.15.2.pli: Atha kho bhagavā pañcamattāni mandāmukhisatāni abhinimmini, yattha te jaṭilā uttaritvā visibbesuṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:20.15.2.eng: Then the Buddha manifested five hundred pans with hot coals, where those ascetics could warm themselves after coming out of the water.

pli-tv-kd1:20.15.4.pli: “nissaṃsayaṃ kho mahāsamaṇassa iddhānubhāvo, yathayimā mandāmukhiyo nimmitā”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:20.15.4.eng: “These were no doubt created by the supernormal powers of the Great Ascetic.”

pli-tv-kd1:20.15.6.pli: “mahiddhiko kho mahāsamaṇo mahānubhāvo, yatra hi nāma tāva bahū mandāmukhiyopi abhinimminissati, na tveva ca kho arahā yathā ahan”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:20.15.6.eng: “The Great Ascetic is powerful and mighty, in that he can manifest so many pans with hot coals. But he’s not a perfected one like me.”

pli-tv-kd1:20.16.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena mahā akālamegho pāvassi, mahā udakavāhako sañjāyi.
pli-tv-kd1:20.16.1.eng: Soon afterwards an unseasonal storm poured down, producing a great flood.

pli-tv-kd1:20.16.2.pli: Yasmiṃ padese bhagavā viharati, so padeso udakena na otthaṭo hoti.
pli-tv-kd1:20.16.2.eng: The spot where the Buddha was staying was inundated.
pli-tv-kd1:20.16.2.comm: Here I do not follow MS, which has na otthaṭo, but instead the reading anuotthaṭo or otthaṭo found in other editions.

pli-tv-kd1:20.16.4.pli: “yannūnāhaṃ samantā udakaṃ ussāretvā majjhe reṇuhatāya bhūmiyā caṅkameyyan”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:20.16.4.eng: “Why don’t I drive back the water on all sides and walk on the dry ground in the middle?”

pli-tv-kd1:20.16.5.pli: Atha kho bhagavā samantā udakaṃ ussāretvā majjhe reṇuhatāya bhūmiyā caṅkami.

pli-tv-kd1:20.16.7.pli: “mā heva kho mahāsamaṇo udakena vūḷho ahosī”ti nāvāya sambahulehi jaṭilehi saddhiṃ yasmiṃ padese bhagavā viharati taṃ padesaṃ agamāsi.
pli-tv-kd1:20.16.7.eng: “I hope the Great Ascetic hasn’t been swept away by the water.” Together with a number of ascetics he went by boat to where the Buddha was staying.

pli-tv-kd1:20.16.8.pli: Addasā kho uruvelakassapo jaṭilo bhagavantaṃ samantā udakaṃ ussāretvā majjhe reṇuhatāya bhūmiyā caṅkamantaṃ, disvāna bhagavantaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd1:20.16.8.eng: He saw that the Buddha had driven back the water on all sides and was walking on the dry ground in the middle. And he said to the Buddha,

pli-tv-kd1:20.16.11.eng: The Buddha rose up into the air and landed in the boat.
pli-tv-kd1:20.16.11.comm: “Landed” renders paccuṭṭhāsi. This verb usually means “to stand up” or “to get up”, as in getting up from one’s seat or getting up from bed. In the current context, however, the meaning must be slightly different. A fairly unambiguous context is found at DN 21:1.2.6, in the Sakkapañhā Sutta, where Sakka, the king of gods, is said to disappear in heaven and then paccuṭṭhāsi in Magadha. Here it would seem to be used synonymously with pātubhavati, “to reappear”. I take the meaning to be the same in the present context.

pli-tv-kd1:20.16.13.pli: “mahiddhiko kho mahāsamaṇo mahānubhāvo, yatra hi nāma udakampi na pavāhissati, na tveva ca kho arahā yathā ahan”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:20.16.13.eng: “The Great Ascetic is powerful and mighty, in that he can displace the water. But he’s not a perfected one like me.”

pli-tv-kd1:20.17.2.eng: “For a long time this foolish man has thought,

pli-tv-kd1:20.17.3.pli: ‘mahiddhiko kho mahāsamaṇo mahānubhāvo, na tveva ca kho arahā yathā ahan’ti;
pli-tv-kd1:20.17.3.eng: ‘The Great Ascetic is powerful and mighty, but he’s not a perfected one like me.’

pli-tv-kd1:20.17.5.pli: Atha kho bhagavā uruvelakassapaṃ jaṭilaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd1:20.17.5.eng: And he said to Uruvelā Kassapa,

pli-tv-kd1:20.17.6.pli: “neva ca kho tvaṃ, kassapa, arahā, nāpi arahattamaggasamāpanno.
pli-tv-kd1:20.17.6.eng: “Kassapa, you’re not a perfected one or on the path to perfection.

pli-tv-kd1:20.17.7.pli: Sāpi te paṭipadā natthi, yāya tvaṃ arahā vā assasi, arahattamaggaṃ vā samāpanno”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:20.17.7.eng: You don’t have the practice that might make you a perfected one or one on the path to perfection.”

pli-tv-kd1:20.17.8.pli: Atha kho uruvelakassapo jaṭilo bhagavato pādesu sirasā nipatitvā bhagavantaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd1:20.17.8.eng: At that Uruvelā Kassapa bowed down with his head at the Buddha’s feet and said,

pli-tv-kd1:20.17.9.pli: “labheyyāhaṃ, bhante, bhagavato santike pabbajjaṃ, labheyyaṃ upasampadan”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:20.17.9.eng: “Sir, I wish to receive the going forth in your presence. I wish to receive the full ordination.”

pli-tv-kd1:20.18.1.pli: “Tvaṃ khosi, kassapa, pañcannaṃ jaṭilasatānaṃ nāyako vināyako aggo pamukho pāmokkho.
pli-tv-kd1:20.18.1.eng: “Kassapa, you’re the leader and chief of five hundred dreadlocked ascetics.

pli-tv-kd1:20.18.2.pli: Tepi tāva apalokehi, yathā te maññissanti tathā te karissantī”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:20.18.2.eng: Tell them first, so that they may take appropriate action.”

pli-tv-kd1:20.18.3.pli: Atha kho uruvelakassapo jaṭilo yena te jaṭilā tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā te jaṭile etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd1:20.18.3.eng: Uruvelā Kassapa then went to those ascetics and said,

pli-tv-kd1:20.18.4.pli: “icchāmahaṃ, bho, mahāsamaṇe brahmacariyaṃ carituṃ, yathā bhavanto maññanti tathā karontū”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:20.18.4.eng: “I wish to practice the spiritual life under the Great Ascetic. Please do whatever you think is appropriate.”

pli-tv-kd1:20.18.5.pli: “Cirapaṭikā mayaṃ, bho, mahāsamaṇe abhippasannā, sace bhavaṃ, mahāsamaṇe brahmacariyaṃ carissati, sabbeva mayaṃ mahāsamaṇe brahmacariyaṃ carissāmā”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:20.18.5.eng: “Sir, we’ve had confidence in the Great Ascetic for a long time. If you are to practice the spiritual life under him, so will all of us.”

pli-tv-kd1:20.19.1.pli: Atha kho te jaṭilā kesamissaṃ jaṭāmissaṃ khārikājamissaṃ aggihutamissaṃ udake pavāhetvā yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkamiṃsu, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavato pādesu sirasā nipatitvā bhagavantaṃ etadavocuṃ—
pli-tv-kd1:20.19.1.eng: Then, after letting their hair and dreadlocks, their carrying poles and bundles, and their fire-worship implements be carried away by the water, they went to the Buddha. They bowed down with their heads at his feet and said,
pli-tv-kd1:20.19.1.comm: Following the commentary I render kesamissaṁ jaṭāmissaṁ khārikājamissaṁ aggihutamissaṁ as if missaṁ were not there. Sp 3.52: Kesamissantiādīsu kesā eva kesamissaṁ. Esa nayo sabbattha, “In regard to kesamissa etc., kesamissa is just kesa. This method applies to all (four).” Of aggihut(t)a CPD says: “an instrument for the fire-worship.”

pli-tv-kd1:20.19.2.pli: “labheyyāma mayaṃ, bhante, bhagavato santike pabbajjaṃ, labheyyāma upasampadan”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:20.19.2.eng: “Sir, we wish to receive the going forth in your presence. We wish to receive the full ordination.”

pli-tv-kd1:20.19.4.pli: “svākkhāto dhammo, caratha brahmacariyaṃ sammā dukkhassa antakiriyāyā”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:20.19.4.eng: The Teaching is well-proclaimed. Practice the spiritual life to make a complete end of suffering.”

pli-tv-kd1:20.19.5.eng: And that was the full ordination of those venerables.

pli-tv-kd1:20.20.1.pli: Addasā kho nadīkassapo jaṭilo kesamissaṃ jaṭāmissaṃ khārikājamissaṃ aggihutamissaṃ udake vuyhamāne, disvānassa etadahosi—
pli-tv-kd1:20.20.1.eng: Nadī Kassapa saw those things being carried away by the water, and he thought,

pli-tv-kd1:20.20.5.pli: Sāmañca tīhi jaṭilasatehi saddhiṃ yenāyasmā uruvelakassapo tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantaṃ uruvelakassapaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd1:20.20.5.eng: Together with the three hundred ascetics he then went to Uruvelā Kassapa and said,

pli-tv-kd1:20.21.1.pli: Atha kho te jaṭilā kesamissaṃ jaṭāmissaṃ khārikājamissaṃ aggihutamissaṃ udake pavāhetvā yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkamiṃsu, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavato pādesu sirasā nipatitvā bhagavantaṃ etadavocuṃ—
pli-tv-kd1:20.21.1.eng: Then, after letting their hair and dreadlocks, their carrying poles and bundles, and their fire-worship implements be carried away by the water, they went to the Buddha. They bowed down with their heads at his feet and said,

pli-tv-kd1:20.21.2.pli: “labheyyāma mayaṃ, bhante, bhagavato santike pabbajjaṃ, labheyyāma upasampadan”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:20.21.2.eng: “Sir, we wish to receive the going forth in your presence. We wish to receive the full ordination.”

pli-tv-kd1:20.21.4.pli: “svākkhāto dhammo, caratha brahmacariyaṃ sammā dukkhassa antakiriyāyā”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:20.21.4.eng: The Teaching is well-proclaimed. Practice the spiritual life to make a complete end of suffering.”

pli-tv-kd1:20.21.5.eng: And that was the full ordination of those venerables.

pli-tv-kd1:20.22.1.pli: Addasā kho gayākassapo jaṭilo kesamissaṃ jaṭāmissaṃ khārikājamissaṃ aggihutamissaṃ udake vuyhamāne, disvānassa etadahosi—
pli-tv-kd1:20.22.1.eng: Gayā Kassapa saw those things being carried away by the water, and he thought,

pli-tv-kd1:20.22.5.pli: Sāmañca dvīhi jaṭilasatehi saddhiṃ yenāyasmā uruvelakassapo tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantaṃ uruvelakassapaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd1:20.22.5.eng: Together with the two hundred ascetics he then went to Uruvelā Kassapa and said,

pli-tv-kd1:20.23.1.pli: Atha kho te jaṭilā kesamissaṃ jaṭāmissaṃ khārikājamissaṃ aggihutamissaṃ udake pavāhetvā yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkamiṃsu, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavato pādesu sirasā nipatitvā bhagavantaṃ etadavocuṃ—
pli-tv-kd1:20.23.1.eng: Then, after letting their hair and dreadlocks, their carrying poles and bundles, and their fire-worship implements be carried away by the water, they went to the Buddha. They bowed down with their heads at his feet and said,

pli-tv-kd1:20.23.2.pli: “labheyyāma mayaṃ, bhante, bhagavato santike pabbajjaṃ, labheyyāma upasampadan”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:20.23.2.eng: “Sir, we wish to receive the going forth in your presence. We wish to receive the full ordination.”

pli-tv-kd1:20.23.4.pli: “svākkhāto dhammo, caratha brahmacariyaṃ sammā dukkhassa antakiriyāyā”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:20.23.4.eng: The Teaching is well-proclaimed. Practice the spiritual life to make a complete end of suffering.”

pli-tv-kd1:20.23.5.eng: And that was the full ordination of those venerables.

pli-tv-kd1:20.24.1.pli: Bhagavato adhiṭṭhānena pañca kaṭṭhasatāni na phāliyiṃsu, phāliyiṃsu;
pli-tv-kd1:20.24.1.eng: By an act of supernormal determination the Buddha stopped five hundred logs from being split before splitting them;

pli-tv-kd1:20.24.2.eng: he stopped fires from being lit before lighting them;

pli-tv-kd1:20.24.3.eng: he stopped them from being extinguished before extinguishing them;

pli-tv-kd1:20.24.4.eng: and he manifested five hundred pans with hot coals.

pli-tv-kd1:20.24.5.eng: In this way, there were three and a half thousand wonders.

pli-tv-kd1:21.1.1.pli: Atha kho bhagavā uruvelāyaṃ yathābhirantaṃ viharitvā yena gayāsīsaṃ tena pakkāmi mahatā bhikkhusaṅghena saddhiṃ bhikkhusahassena sabbeheva purāṇajaṭilehi.
pli-tv-kd1:21.1.1.eng: After staying at Uruvelā for as long as he liked, the Buddha went to Gayāsīsa together with that large sangha of one thousand monks, all of them previously dreadlocked ascetics,

pli-tv-kd1:21.1.2.pli: Tatra sudaṃ bhagavā gayāyaṃ viharati gayāsīse saddhiṃ bhikkhusahassena.

pli-tv-kd1:21.2.1.eng: Then the Buddha addressed the monks:

pli-tv-kd1:21.2.3.eng: What is that everything that is burning?

pli-tv-kd1:21.2.4.pli: Cakkhu ādittaṃ, rūpā ādittā, cakkhuviññāṇaṃ ādittaṃ, cakkhusamphasso āditto, yamidaṃ cakkhusamphassapaccayā uppajjati vedayitaṃ sukhaṃ vā dukkhaṃ vā adukkhamasukhaṃ vā tampi ādittaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:21.2.4.eng: The eye is burning. Sights are burning. Eye consciousness is burning. Eye contact is burning. Whatever feeling arises because of eye contact—whether pleasant, painful, or neither-pleasant-nor-painful—that too is burning.

pli-tv-kd1:21.2.6.pli: Rāgagginā dosagginā mohagginā ādittaṃ, jātiyā jarāya maraṇena sokehi paridevehi dukkhehi domanassehi upāyāsehi ādittanti vadāmi.
pli-tv-kd1:21.2.6.eng: Burning with the fire of sensual desire, the fire of ill will, and the fire of confusion; burning with birth, old age, and death; burning with grief, sorrow, pain, aversion, and distress, I say.

pli-tv-kd1:21.3.1.pli: Sotaṃ ādittaṃ, saddā ādittā, sotaviññāṇaṃ ādittaṃ, sotasamphasso āditto, yamidaṃ sotasamphassapaccayā uppajjati vedayitaṃ sukhaṃ vā dukkhaṃ vā adukkhamasukhaṃ vā tampi ādittaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:21.3.1.eng: The ear is burning. Sounds are burning. Ear consciousness is burning. Ear contact is burning. Whatever feeling arises because of ear contact—whether pleasant, painful, or neither-pleasant-nor-painful—that too is burning.

pli-tv-kd1:21.3.3.pli: Rāgagginā dosagginā mohagginā ādittaṃ, jātiyā jarāya maraṇena sokehi paridevehi dukkhehi domanassehi upāyāsehi ādittanti vadāmi.
pli-tv-kd1:21.3.3.eng: Burning with the fire of sensual desire, the fire of ill will, and the fire of confusion; burning with birth, old age, and death; burning with grief, sorrow, pain, aversion, and distress, I say.

pli-tv-kd1:21.3.4.pli: Ghānaṃ ādittaṃ, gandhā ādittā, ghānaviññāṇaṃ ādittaṃ, ghānasamphasso āditto, yamidaṃ ghānasamphassapaccayā uppajjati vedayitaṃ sukhaṃ vā dukkhaṃ vā adukkhamasukhaṃ vā tampi ādittaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:21.3.4.eng: The nose is burning. Smells are burning. Nose consciousness is burning. Nose contact is burning. Whatever feeling arises because of nose contact—whether pleasant, painful, or neither-pleasant-nor-painful—that too is burning.

pli-tv-kd1:21.3.6.pli: Rāgagginā dosagginā mohagginā ādittaṃ, jātiyā jarāya maraṇena sokehi paridevehi dukkhehi domanassehi upāyāsehi ādittanti vadāmi.
pli-tv-kd1:21.3.6.eng: Burning with the fire of sensual desire, the fire of ill will, and the fire of confusion; burning with birth, old age, and death; burning with grief, sorrow, pain, aversion, and distress, I say.

pli-tv-kd1:21.3.7.pli: Jivhā ādittā, rasā ādittā, jivhāviññāṇaṃ ādittaṃ jivhāsamphasso āditto, yamidaṃ jivhāsamphassapaccayā uppajjati vedayitaṃ sukhaṃ vā dukkhaṃ vā adukkhamasukhaṃ vā tampi ādittaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:21.3.7.eng: The tongue is burning. Tastes are burning. Tongue consciousness is burning. Tongue contact is burning. Whatever feeling arises because of tongue contact—whether pleasant, painful, or neither-pleasant-nor-painful—that too is burning.

pli-tv-kd1:21.3.9.pli: Rāgagginā dosagginā mohagginā ādittaṃ, jātiyā jarāya maraṇena sokehi paridevehi dukkhehi domanassehi upāyāsehi ādittanti vadāmi.
pli-tv-kd1:21.3.9.eng: Burning with the fire of sensual desire, the fire of ill will, and the fire of confusion; burning with birth, old age, and death; burning with grief, sorrow, pain, aversion, and distress, I say.

pli-tv-kd1:21.3.10.pli: Kāyo āditto, phoṭṭhabbā ādittā, kāyaviññāṇaṃ ādittaṃ kāyasamphasso āditto, yamidaṃ kāyasamphassapaccayā uppajjati vedayitaṃ sukhaṃ vā dukkhaṃ vā adukkhamasukhaṃ vā tampi ādittaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:21.3.10.eng: The body is burning. Touches are burning. Body consciousness is burning. Body contact is burning. Whatever feeling arises because of body contact—whether pleasant, painful, or neither-pleasant-nor-painful—that too is burning.

pli-tv-kd1:21.3.12.pli: Rāgagginā dosagginā mohagginā ādittaṃ, jātiyā jarāya maraṇena sokehi paridevehi dukkhehi domanassehi upāyāsehi ādittanti vadāmi.
pli-tv-kd1:21.3.12.eng: Burning with the fire of sensual desire, the fire of ill will, and the fire of confusion; burning with birth, old age, and death; burning with grief, sorrow, pain, aversion, and distress, I say.

pli-tv-kd1:21.3.13.pli: Mano āditto, dhammā ādittā, manoviññāṇaṃ ādittaṃ manosamphasso āditto, yamidaṃ manosamphassapaccayā uppajjati vedayitaṃ sukhaṃ vā dukkhaṃ vā adukkhamasukhaṃ vā tampi ādittaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:21.3.13.eng: The mind is burning. Mental phenomena are burning. Mind consciousness is burning. Mind contact is burning. Whatever feeling arises because of mind contact—whether pleasant, painful, or neither-pleasant-nor-painful—that too is burning.

pli-tv-kd1:21.3.15.pli: Rāgagginā dosagginā mohagginā ādittaṃ, jātiyā jarāya maraṇena sokehi paridevehi dukkhehi domanassehi upāyāsehi ādittanti vadāmi.
pli-tv-kd1:21.3.15.eng: Burning with the fire of sensual desire, the fire of ill will, and the fire of confusion; burning with birth, old age, and death; burning with grief, sorrow, pain, aversion, and distress, I say.

pli-tv-kd1:21.4.1.pli: Evaṃ passaṃ, bhikkhave, sutavā ariyasāvako cakkhusmimpi nibbindati, rūpesupi nibbindati, cakkhuviññāṇepi nibbindati, cakkhusamphassepi nibbindati, yamidaṃ cakkhusamphassapaccayā uppajjati vedayitaṃ sukhaṃ vā dukkhaṃ vā adukkhamasukhaṃ vā, tasmimpi nibbindati.
pli-tv-kd1:21.4.1.eng: When they see this, the learned noble disciple is repelled by the eye, repelled by sights, repelled by eye consciousness, repelled by eye contact, and repelled by whatever pleasant, painful, or neither-pleasant-nor-painful feeling that arises because of eye contact.

pli-tv-kd1:21.4.2.eng: They are repelled by the ear, repelled by sounds, repelled by ear consciousness, repelled by ear contact, and repelled by whatever pleasant, painful, or neither-pleasant-nor-painful feeling that arises because of ear contact.

pli-tv-kd1:21.4.3.eng: They are repelled by the nose, repelled by smells, repelled by nose consciousness, repelled by nose contact, and repelled by whatever pleasant, painful, or neither-pleasant-nor-painful feeling that arises because of nose contact.

pli-tv-kd1:21.4.4.eng: They are repelled by the tongue, repelled by tastes, repelled by tongue consciousness, repelled by tongue contact, and repelled by whatever pleasant, painful, or neither-pleasant-nor-painful feeling that arises because of tongue contact.

pli-tv-kd1:21.4.5.eng: They are repelled by the body, repelled by touches, repelled by body consciousness, repelled by body contact, and repelled by whatever pleasant, painful, or neither-pleasant-nor-painful feeling that arises because of body contact.

pli-tv-kd1:21.4.6.pli: manasmimpi nibbindati, dhammesupi nibbindati, manoviññāṇepi nibbindati, manosamphassepi nibbindati, yamidaṃ manosamphassapaccayā uppajjati vedayitaṃ sukhaṃ vā dukkhaṃ vā adukkhamasukhaṃ vā tasmimpi nibbindati,
pli-tv-kd1:21.4.6.eng: They are repelled by the mind, repelled by mental phenomena, repelled by mind consciousness, repelled by mind contact, and repelled by whatever pleasant, painful, or neither-pleasant-nor-painful feeling that arises because of mind contact.

pli-tv-kd1:21.4.7.pli: nibbindaṃ virajjati, virāgā vimuccati, vimuttasmiṃ vimuttamiti ñāṇaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-kd1:21.4.7.eng: Being repelled, they become desireless. Because they are desireless, they are freed. When they are freed, they know they are freed.

pli-tv-kd1:21.4.8.pli: Khīṇā jāti, vusitaṃ brahmacariyaṃ, kataṃ karaṇīyaṃ, nāparaṃ itthattāyāti pajānātī”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:21.4.8.eng: They understand that birth has come to an end, that the spiritual life has been fulfilled, that the job has been done, that there is no further state of existence.”

pli-tv-kd1:21.4.9.pli: Imasmiñca pana veyyākaraṇasmiṃ bhaññamāne tassa bhikkhusahassassa anupādāya āsavehi cittāni vimucciṃsu.
pli-tv-kd1:21.4.9.eng: And while this exposition was being spoken, the minds of those one thousand monks were freed from the corruptions through letting go.

pli-tv-kd1:21.4.10.eng: The discourse on burning is finished.

pli-tv-kd1:21.4.11.eng: The third section for recitation on the wonders at Uruvelā is finished.

pli-tv-kd1:22.1.0.eng: 13. The account of the meeting with Bimbisāra

pli-tv-kd1:22.1.1.pli: Atha kho bhagavā gayāsīse yathābhirantaṃ viharitvā yena rājagahaṃ tena cārikaṃ pakkāmi, mahatā bhikkhusaṅghena saddhiṃ bhikkhusahassena sabbeheva purāṇajaṭilehi.
pli-tv-kd1:22.1.1.eng: After staying at Gayāsīsa for as long as he liked, the Buddha set out wandering toward Rājagaha with that large sangha of one thousand monks, all of them previously dreadlocked ascetics.

pli-tv-kd1:22.1.2.pli: Atha kho bhagavā anupubbena cārikaṃ caramāno yena rājagahaṃ tadavasari.

pli-tv-kd1:22.1.3.pli: Tatra sudaṃ bhagavā rājagahe viharati laṭṭhivane suppatiṭṭhe cetiye.
pli-tv-kd1:22.1.3.eng: he stayed in Cane Grove at the Suppatiṭṭha Shrine.

pli-tv-kd1:22.2.1.pli: Assosi kho rājā māgadho seniyo bimbisāro—
pli-tv-kd1:22.2.1.eng: King Seniya Bimbisāra of Magadha was told:

pli-tv-kd1:22.2.2.pli: “samaṇo khalu bho gotamo sakyaputto sakyakulā pabbajito rājagahaṃ anuppatto rājagahe viharati laṭṭhivane suppatiṭṭhe cetiye.
pli-tv-kd1:22.2.2.eng: “Sir, the ascetic Gotama, the Sakyan, who has gone forth from the Sakyan clan, has arrived at Rājagaha and is staying in the Cane Grove at the Suppatiṭṭha Shrine.

pli-tv-kd1:22.2.3.pli: Taṃ kho pana bhagavantaṃ gotamaṃ evaṃ kalyāṇo kittisaddo abbhuggato—
pli-tv-kd1:22.2.3.eng: That good Gotama has a fine reputation:

pli-tv-kd1:22.2.4.pli: itipi so bhagavā arahaṃ sammāsambuddho vijjācaraṇasampanno sugato lokavidū anuttaro purisadammasārathi satthā devamanussānaṃ buddho bhagavā.
pli-tv-kd1:22.2.4.eng: ‘He is a Buddha, perfected and fully awakened, complete in insight and conduct, happy, knower of the world, supreme leader of trainable people, teacher of gods and humans, awakened, a Buddha.

pli-tv-kd1:22.2.5.pli: So imaṃ lokaṃ sadevakaṃ samārakaṃ sabrahmakaṃ sassamaṇabrāhmaṇiṃ pajaṃ sadevamanussaṃ sayaṃ abhiññā sacchikatvā pavedeti.
pli-tv-kd1:22.2.5.eng: With his own insight he has seen this world with its gods, its lords of death, and its supreme beings, this society with its monastics and brahmins, its gods and humans, and he makes it known to others.

pli-tv-kd1:22.2.6.pli: So dhammaṃ deseti ādikalyāṇaṃ majjhekalyāṇaṃ pariyosānakalyāṇaṃ sātthaṃ sabyañjanaṃ kevalaparipuṇṇaṃ parisuddhaṃ brahmacariyaṃ pakāseti.
pli-tv-kd1:22.2.6.eng: He has a Teaching that’s good in the beginning, good in the middle, and good in the end. It has a true goal and is well articulated. He sets out a perfectly complete and pure spiritual life.’

pli-tv-kd1:22.2.7.pli: Sādhu kho pana tathārūpānaṃ arahataṃ dassanaṃ hotī”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:22.2.7.eng: It’s good to see such perfected ones.”

pli-tv-kd1:22.3.1.pli: Atha kho rājā māgadho seniyo bimbisāro dvādasanahutehi māgadhikehi brāhmaṇagahapatikehi parivuto yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi.
pli-tv-kd1:22.3.1.eng: Then, accompanied by one hundred and twenty thousand brahmin householders from Magadha, King Bimbisāra went to the Buddha, bowed, and sat down.

pli-tv-kd1:22.3.2.pli: Tepi kho dvādasanahutā māgadhikā brāhmaṇagahapatikā appekacce bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdiṃsu, appekacce bhagavatā saddhiṃ sammodiṃsu, sammodanīyaṃ kathaṃ sāraṇīyaṃ vītisāretvā ekamantaṃ nisīdiṃsu, appekacce yena bhagavā tenañjaliṃ paṇāmetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdiṃsu, appekacce bhagavato santike nāmagottaṃ sāvetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdiṃsu, appekacce tuṇhībhūtā ekamantaṃ nisīdiṃsu.
pli-tv-kd1:22.3.2.eng: Among those brahmins, some bowed to the Buddha and then sat down, some exchanged pleasantries with him and then sat down, some raised their joined palms and then sat down, some announced their name and family and then sat down, and some sat down in silence.

pli-tv-kd1:22.4.1.pli: Atha kho tesaṃ dvādasanahutānaṃ māgadhikānaṃ brāhmaṇagahapatikānaṃ etadahosi—

pli-tv-kd1:22.4.2.pli: “kiṃ nu kho mahāsamaṇo uruvelakassape brahmacariyaṃ carati, udāhu uruvelakassapo mahāsamaṇe brahmacariyaṃ caratī”ti?
pli-tv-kd1:22.4.2.eng: “Is the Great Ascetic practicing the spiritual life under Uruvelā Kassapa, or is Uruvelā Kassapa practicing the spiritual life under the Great Ascetic?”
