pli-tv-kd1:22.4.3.pli: Atha kho bhagavā tesaṃ dvādasanahutānaṃ māgadhikānaṃ brāhmaṇagahapatikānaṃ cetasā cetoparivitakkamaññāya āyasmantaṃ uruvelakassapaṃ gāthāya ajjhabhāsi—
pli-tv-kd1:22.4.3.eng: Reading their minds, the Buddha spoke to Venerable Uruvelā Kassapa in verse:

pli-tv-kd1:22.4.4.eng: “The resident of Uruvelā, known as The Emaciated One—

pli-tv-kd1:22.4.5.eng: What did he see that he abandoned the fire?

pli-tv-kd1:22.4.7.eng: Why did you abandon the fire worship?”

pli-tv-kd1:22.4.8.pli: “Rūpe ca sadde ca atho rase ca,
pli-tv-kd1:22.4.8.eng: “As a reward for the sacrifice, they promise worldly pleasures:

pli-tv-kd1:22.4.9.eng: Sights, sounds, and tastes, and women, too.
pli-tv-kd1:22.4.9.comm: Sp 3.55: Dutiyagāthāya ayamattho – ete rūpādike kāme itthiyo ca yaññā abhivadanti, “This is the meaning of the second verse: they promise that the sacrifice will give these worldly pleasures, starting with forms, and also women.” Sp-ṭ 3.55 adds: Yaññā abhivadantīti yāgahetu ijjhantīti vadanti, “Yaññā abhivadanti means: they say, ‘They get good results because of the sacrifice.’”

pli-tv-kd1:22.4.10.eng: But knowing the stain of ownership,

pli-tv-kd1:22.4.11.pli: Tasmā na yiṭṭhe na hute arañjin”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:22.4.11.eng: I found no delight in worship and sacrifice.”

pli-tv-kd1:22.5.4.eng: What then, in the world of gods and humans,

pli-tv-kd1:22.5.5.eng: Does your mind delight in? Tell me this, Kassapa.”

pli-tv-kd1:22.5.6.eng: “I saw the state of peace that is detached from sensual existence,

pli-tv-kd1:22.5.7.eng: Where there is nothing and no ownership;

pli-tv-kd1:22.5.8.eng: It doesn’t change, and can’t be found through another.
pli-tv-kd1:22.5.8.comm: Sp 3.55: Jātijarāmaraṇānaṁ abhāvena anaññathābhāviṁ. Attanā bhāvitena maggeneva adhigantabbaṁ, na aññena kenaci adhigametabbanti anaññaneyyaṁ. “It is anaññathābhāvi by not being born, becoming old, or dying. Anaññaneyyaṁ: it is to be obtained by a path developed by oneself; it is not to be obtained by anyone else.”

pli-tv-kd1:22.5.9.pli: Tasmā na yiṭṭhe na hute arañjin”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:22.5.9.eng: That’s why I found no delight in worship and sacrifice.”

pli-tv-kd1:22.6.1.pli: Atha kho āyasmā uruvelakassapo uṭṭhāyāsanā ekaṃsaṃ uttarāsaṅgaṃ karitvā bhagavato pādesu sirasā nipatitvā bhagavantaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd1:22.6.1.eng: Uruvelā Kassapa got up from his seat, arranged his upper robe over one shoulder, bowed down with his head at the Buddha’s feet, and said,

pli-tv-kd1:22.6.2.eng: “Sir, you’re my teacher, I’m your disciple;

pli-tv-kd1:22.6.3.eng: you’re my teacher, I’m your disciple.”

pli-tv-kd1:22.6.4.pli: Atha kho tesaṃ dvādasanahutānaṃ māgadhikānaṃ brāhmaṇagahapatikānaṃ etadahosi—
pli-tv-kd1:22.6.4.eng: The one hundred and twenty thousand brahmin householders from Magadha thought,

pli-tv-kd1:22.6.5.eng: “So Uruvelā Kassapa is practicing the spiritual life under the Great Ascetic.”

pli-tv-kd1:22.7.1.pli: Atha kho bhagavā tesaṃ dvādasanahutānaṃ māgadhikānaṃ brāhmaṇagahapatikānaṃ cetasā cetoparivitakkamaññāya anupubbiṃ kathaṃ kathesi, seyyathidaṃ—
pli-tv-kd1:22.7.1.eng: Reading their minds, the Buddha gave them a progressive talk—

pli-tv-kd1:22.7.2.pli: dānakathaṃ sīlakathaṃ saggakathaṃ kāmānaṃ ādīnavaṃ okāraṃ saṅkilesaṃ nekkhamme ānisaṃsaṃ pakāsesi.
pli-tv-kd1:22.7.2.eng: on generosity, morality, and heaven; on the downside, degradation, and defilement of worldly pleasures; and he revealed the benefits of renunciation.

pli-tv-kd1:22.7.3.pli: Yadā te bhagavā aññāsi kallacitte muducitte vinīvaraṇacitte udaggacitte pasannacitte, atha yā buddhānaṃ sāmukkaṃsikā dhammadesanā, taṃ pakāsesi—
pli-tv-kd1:22.7.3.eng: When the Buddha knew that their minds were ready, supple, without hindrances, joyful, and confident, he revealed the teaching unique to the Buddhas:

pli-tv-kd1:22.7.4.eng: suffering, its origin, its end, and the path.

pli-tv-kd1:22.8.1.pli: Seyyathāpi nāma suddhaṃ vatthaṃ apagatakāḷakaṃ sammadeva rajanaṃ paṭiggaṇheyya;
pli-tv-kd1:22.8.1.eng: And just as a clean and stainless cloth absorbs dye properly,

pli-tv-kd1:22.8.2.pli: evameva ekādasanahutānaṃ māgadhikānaṃ brāhmaṇagahapatikānaṃ bimbisārappamukhānaṃ tasmiṃyeva āsane virajaṃ vītamalaṃ dhammacakkhuṃ udapādi—
pli-tv-kd1:22.8.2.eng: so too, while they were sitting right there, one hundred and ten thousand of those brahmin householders headed by Bimbisāra experienced the stainless vision of the Truth:

pli-tv-kd1:22.8.3.eng: “Anything that has a beginning has an end.”

pli-tv-kd1:22.8.4.eng: The remaining ten thousand declared themselves as lay followers.

pli-tv-kd1:22.9.1.pli: Atha kho rājā māgadho seniyo bimbisāro diṭṭhadhammo pattadhammo viditadhammo pariyogāḷhadhammo tiṇṇavicikiccho vigatakathaṅkatho vesārajjappatto aparappaccayo satthusāsane bhagavantaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd1:22.9.1.eng: King Bimbisāra had seen the Truth, had reached, understood, and penetrated it. He had gone beyond doubt and uncertainty, had attained to confidence, and had become independent of others in the Teacher’s instruction. He then said to the Buddha,

pli-tv-kd1:22.9.2.pli: “pubbe me, bhante, kumārassa sato pañca assāsakā ahesuṃ, te me etarahi samiddhā.
pli-tv-kd1:22.9.2.eng: “Sir, when I was a prince, I had five wishes, and they have now been fulfilled.

pli-tv-kd1:22.9.3.pli: Pubbe me, bhante, kumārassa sato etadahosi—
pli-tv-kd1:22.9.3.eng: When I was a prince, I thought,

pli-tv-kd1:22.9.4.pli: ‘aho vata maṃ rajje abhisiñceyyun’ti, ayaṃ kho me, bhante, paṭhamo assāsako ahosi, so me etarahi samiddho.
pli-tv-kd1:22.9.4.eng: ‘Oh, I wish they would anoint me as the king!’ That was my first wish, which has now been fulfilled.

pli-tv-kd1:22.9.5.pli: ‘Tassa ca me vijitaṃ arahaṃ sammāsambuddho okkameyyā’ti, ayaṃ kho me, bhante, dutiyo assāsako ahosi, so me etarahi samiddho.
pli-tv-kd1:22.9.5.eng: ‘May one who is perfected and fully awakened come to my kingdom!’ That was my second wish, which has now been fulfilled.

pli-tv-kd1:22.10.1.pli: ‘Tañcāhaṃ bhagavantaṃ payirupāseyyan’ti, ayaṃ kho me, bhante, tatiyo assāsako ahosi, so me etarahi samiddho.
pli-tv-kd1:22.10.1.eng: ‘May I get to visit that Buddha!’ That was my third wish, which has now been fulfilled.

pli-tv-kd1:22.10.2.pli: ‘So ca me bhagavā dhammaṃ deseyyā’ti, ayaṃ kho me, bhante, catuttho assāsako ahosi, so me etarahi samiddho.
pli-tv-kd1:22.10.2.eng: ‘May that Buddha give me a teaching!’ That was my fourth wish, which has now been fulfilled.

pli-tv-kd1:22.10.3.pli: ‘Tassa cāhaṃ bhagavato dhammaṃ ājāneyyan’ti, ayaṃ kho me, bhante, pañcamo assāsako ahosi, so me etarahi samiddho.
pli-tv-kd1:22.10.3.eng: ‘May I understand the Teaching of that Buddha!’ That was my fifth wish, which has now been fulfilled.

pli-tv-kd1:22.10.4.pli: Pubbe me, bhante, kumārassa sato ime pañca assāsakā ahesuṃ, te me etarahi samiddhā.

pli-tv-kd1:22.11.2.pli: Seyyathāpi, bhante, nikkujjitaṃ vā ukkujjeyya, paṭicchannaṃ vā vivareyya, mūḷhassa vā maggaṃ ācikkheyya, andhakāre vā telapajjotaṃ dhāreyya—‘cakkhumanto rūpāni dakkhantī’ti;
pli-tv-kd1:22.11.2.eng: Just as one might set upright what’s overturned, or reveal what’s hidden, or show the way to one who’s lost, or bring a lamp into the darkness so that one with eyes might see what’s there—

pli-tv-kd1:22.11.3.eng: just so has the Buddha made the Teaching clear in many ways.

pli-tv-kd1:22.11.4.pli: Esāhaṃ, bhante, bhagavantaṃ saraṇaṃ gacchāmi, dhammañca, bhikkhusaṅghañca.
pli-tv-kd1:22.11.4.eng: I go for refuge to the Buddha, the Teaching, and the Sangha of monks.

pli-tv-kd1:22.11.5.pli: Upāsakaṃ maṃ, bhagavā dhāretu ajjatagge pāṇupetaṃ saraṇaṃ gataṃ, adhivāsetu ca me, bhante, bhagavā, svātanāya bhattaṃ saddhiṃ bhikkhusaṅghenā”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:22.11.5.eng: Please accept me as a lay follower who’s gone for refuge for life. And please accept tomorrow’s meal from me together with the Sangha of monks.”

pli-tv-kd1:22.11.6.eng: The Buddha consented by remaining silent.

pli-tv-kd1:22.12.1.pli: Atha kho rājā māgadho seniyo bimbisāro bhagavato adhivāsanaṃ viditvā uṭṭhāyāsanā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṃ katvā pakkāmi.
pli-tv-kd1:22.12.1.eng: Knowing that the Buddha had consented, the king got up from his seat, bowed down, circumambulated the Buddha with his right side toward him, and left.

pli-tv-kd1:22.12.2.pli: Atha kho rājā māgadho seniyo bimbisāro tassā rattiyā accayena paṇītaṃ khādanīyaṃ bhojanīyaṃ paṭiyādāpetvā bhagavato kālaṃ ārocāpesi—
pli-tv-kd1:22.12.2.eng: The following morning King Bimbisāra had various kinds of fine foods prepared. He then had the Buddha informed

pli-tv-kd1:22.12.4.pli: Atha kho bhagavā pubbaṇhasamayaṃ nivāsetvā pattacīvaramādāya rājagahaṃ pāvisi mahatā bhikkhusaṅghena saddhiṃ bhikkhusahassena sabbeheva purāṇajaṭilehi.
pli-tv-kd1:22.12.4.eng: The Buddha robed up, took his bowl and robe, and together with a large sangha of a thousand monks, all previously dreadlocked ascetics, he entered Rājagaha.

pli-tv-kd1:22.13.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena sakko devānamindo māṇavakavaṇṇaṃ abhinimminitvā buddhappamukhassa bhikkhusaṅghassa purato purato gacchati imā gāthāyo gāyamāno—
pli-tv-kd1:22.13.1.eng: Just then Sakka, the ruler of the gods, had transformed himself into a young brahmin. He walked in front of the Sangha of monks headed by the Buddha, chanting these verses:

pli-tv-kd1:22.13.2.eng: “The Tamed One with the tamed ones, previously dreadlocked;

pli-tv-kd1:22.13.3.eng: The Liberated One with the liberated ones:

pli-tv-kd1:22.13.6.eng: The Freed One with the freed ones, previously dreadlocked;

pli-tv-kd1:22.13.7.eng: The Liberated One with the liberated ones:

pli-tv-kd1:22.13.10.eng: The One Crossed Over with the ones crossed over, previously dreadlocked;

pli-tv-kd1:22.13.11.eng: The Liberated One with the liberated ones:

pli-tv-kd1:22.13.14.eng: The Peaceful One with the peaceful ones, previously dreadlocked;

pli-tv-kd1:22.13.15.eng: The Liberated One with the liberated ones:

pli-tv-kd1:22.13.18.eng: He has ten abidings and ten powers;

pli-tv-kd1:22.13.19.eng: He knows ten truths and has ten qualities—

pli-tv-kd1:22.13.20.eng: With a following of ten times one hundred,

pli-tv-kd1:22.14.1.eng: People saw Sakka, and they said,

pli-tv-kd1:22.14.2.pli: “abhirūpo vatāyaṃ māṇavako, dassanīyo vatāyaṃ māṇavako, pāsādiko vatāyaṃ māṇavako.
pli-tv-kd1:22.14.2.eng: “This young brahmin is handsome and graceful.

pli-tv-kd1:22.14.4.pli: Evaṃ vutte, sakko devānamindo te manusse gāthāya ajjhabhāsi—
pli-tv-kd1:22.14.4.eng: Sakka replied to them in verse:

pli-tv-kd1:22.14.7.eng: The one in the world who is happy—

pli-tv-kd1:22.15.1.pli: Atha kho bhagavā yena rañño māgadhassa seniyassa bimbisārassa nivesanaṃ tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā paññatte āsane nisīdi saddhiṃ bhikkhusaṅghena.
pli-tv-kd1:22.15.1.eng: The Buddha then went to King Bimbisāra’s house where he sat down on the prepared seat, together with the Sangha of monks.

pli-tv-kd1:22.15.2.pli: Atha kho rājā māgadho seniyo bimbisāro buddhappamukhaṃ bhikkhusaṅghaṃ paṇītena khādanīyena bhojanīyena sahatthā santappetvā sampavāretvā bhagavantaṃ bhuttāviṃ onītapattapāṇiṃ ekamantaṃ nisīdi.
pli-tv-kd1:22.15.2.eng: The king personally served various kinds of fine foods to the Sangha of monks headed by the Buddha. When the Buddha had finished his meal, the king sat down to one side.

pli-tv-kd1:22.16.1.pli: Ekamantaṃ nisinnassa kho rañño māgadhassa seniyassa bimbisārassa etadahosi—

pli-tv-kd1:22.16.3.pli: Yaṃ assa gāmato neva atidūre na accāsanne, gamanāgamanasampannaṃ, atthikānaṃ atthikānaṃ manussānaṃ abhikkamanīyaṃ, divā appākiṇṇaṃ, rattiṃ appasaddaṃ appanigghosaṃ vijanavātaṃ, manussarāhasseyyakaṃ, paṭisallānasāruppan”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:22.16.3.eng: that’s neither too far from habitation nor too close, that has good access roads and is easily accessible for people who seek him, that has few people during the day and is quiet at night, that’s free from chatter and offers solitude, a private resting place suitable for seclusion?”

pli-tv-kd1:22.17.1.pli: Atha kho rañño māgadhassa seniyassa bimbisārassa etadahosi—

pli-tv-kd1:22.17.2.pli: “idaṃ kho amhākaṃ veḷuvanaṃ uyyānaṃ gāmato neva atidūre na accāsanne gamanāgamanasampannaṃ atthikānaṃ atthikānaṃ manussānaṃ abhikkamanīyaṃ divā appākiṇṇaṃ rattiṃ appasaddaṃ appanigghosaṃ vijanavātaṃ manussarāhasseyyakaṃ paṭisallānasāruppaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:22.17.2.eng: “My Bamboo Grove park has all these qualities.

pli-tv-kd1:22.17.3.pli: Yannūnāhaṃ veḷuvanaṃ uyyānaṃ buddhappamukhassa bhikkhusaṅghassa dadeyyan”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:22.17.3.eng: Why don’t I give it to the Sangha of monks headed by the Buddha?”

pli-tv-kd1:22.18.1.pli: Atha kho rājā māgadho seniyo bimbisāro sovaṇṇamayaṃ bhiṅkāraṃ gahetvā bhagavato oṇojesi—
pli-tv-kd1:22.18.1.eng: The king then took hold of a golden ceremonial vessel and dedicated the park to the Buddha, saying,

pli-tv-kd1:22.18.2.pli: “etāhaṃ, bhante, veḷuvanaṃ uyyānaṃ buddhappamukhassa bhikkhusaṅghassa dammī”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:22.18.2.eng: “I give this park, the Bamboo Grove, to the Sangha of monks headed by the Buddha.”

pli-tv-kd1:22.18.4.pli: Atha kho bhagavā rājānaṃ māgadhaṃ seniyaṃ bimbisāraṃ dhammiyā kathāya sandassetvā samādapetvā samuttejetvā sampahaṃsetvā uṭṭhāyāsanā pakkāmi.
pli-tv-kd1:22.18.4.eng: After instructing, inspiring, and gladdening the king with a teaching, he got up from his seat and left.

pli-tv-kd1:22.18.5.pli: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṃ nidāne etasmiṃ pakaraṇe dhammiṃ kathaṃ katvā bhikkhū āmantesi—
pli-tv-kd1:22.18.5.eng: Soon afterwards the Buddha gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-kd1:22.18.6.comm: “Monastery” renders ārāma. Ārāma could be rendered as “park”, which is the more fundamental meaning of the word. However, since such parks were sometimes given to the Sangha to serve as monasteries, the monasteries, too, became known by the same name. It is the latter meaning which predominates in the Vinaya Piṭaka.

pli-tv-kd1:22.18.7.eng: The account of the meeting with Bimbisāra is finished.

pli-tv-kd1:23.1.0.eng: 14. The account of the going forth of Sāriputta and Moggallāna

pli-tv-kd1:23.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena sañcayo paribbājako rājagahe paṭivasati mahatiyā paribbājakaparisāya saddhiṃ aḍḍhateyyehi paribbājakasatehi.
pli-tv-kd1:23.1.1.eng: At that time the wanderer Sañcaya was staying at Rājagaha with a large group of two hundred and fifty wanderers,

pli-tv-kd1:23.1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena sāriputtamoggallānā sañcaye paribbājake brahmacariyaṃ caranti.

pli-tv-kd1:23.1.3.eng: The two of them had made an agreement

pli-tv-kd1:23.1.4.pli: “yo paṭhamaṃ amataṃ adhigacchati, so itarassa ārocetū”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:23.1.4.eng: that whoever reached freedom from death first would inform the other.

pli-tv-kd1:23.2.1.pli: Atha kho āyasmā assaji pubbaṇhasamayaṃ nivāsetvā pattacīvaramādāya rājagahaṃ piṇḍāya pāvisi pāsādikena abhikkantena paṭikkantena ālokitena vilokitena samiñjitena pasāritena, okkhittacakkhu iriyāpathasampanno.
pli-tv-kd1:23.2.1.eng: Just then, Venerable Assaji robed up in the morning, took his bowl and robe, and entered Rājagaha for almsfood. He was pleasing in his conduct: in going out and coming back, in looking ahead and looking aside, in bending and stretching his arms. His eyes were lowered, and he was perfect in deportment.

pli-tv-kd1:23.2.2.pli: Addasā kho sāriputto paribbājako āyasmantaṃ assajiṃ rājagahe piṇḍāya carantaṃ pāsādikena abhikkantena paṭikkantena ālokitena vilokitena samiñjitena pasāritena okkhittacakkhuṃ iriyāpathasampannaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:23.2.2.eng: The wanderer Sāriputta observed all this

pli-tv-kd1:23.2.4.pli: “ye vata loke arahanto vā arahattamaggaṃ vā samāpannā, ayaṃ tesaṃ bhikkhu aññataro.
pli-tv-kd1:23.2.4.eng: “This monk is one of those in the world who are perfected or on the path to perfection.

pli-tv-kd1:23.2.5.eng: Why don’t I go up to him and ask

pli-tv-kd1:23.2.6.pli: ‘kaṃsi tvaṃ, āvuso, uddissa pabbajito, ko vā te satthā, kassa vā tvaṃ dhammaṃ rocesī’”ti?
pli-tv-kd1:23.2.6.eng: in whose name he has gone forth, and who his teacher is or whose teachings he follows?”

pli-tv-kd1:23.3.2.pli: “akālo kho imaṃ bhikkhuṃ pucchituṃ, antaragharaṃ paviṭṭho piṇḍāya carati.
pli-tv-kd1:23.3.2.eng: “It’s the wrong time to ask him while he’s walking for almsfood among the houses.

pli-tv-kd1:23.3.3.pli: Yannūnāhaṃ imaṃ bhikkhuṃ piṭṭhito piṭṭhito anubandheyyaṃ, atthikehi upaññātaṃ maggan”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:23.3.3.eng: Let me follow behind him, for one who seeks the path will find it.”

pli-tv-kd1:23.3.4.pli: Atha kho āyasmā assaji rājagahe piṇḍāya caritvā piṇḍapātaṃ ādāya paṭikkami.
pli-tv-kd1:23.3.4.eng: After walking for alms in Rājagaha, Assaji turned back with his almsfood.

pli-tv-kd1:23.3.5.pli: Atha kho sāriputtopi paribbājako yenāyasmā assaji tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā āyasmatā assajinā saddhiṃ sammodi, sammodanīyaṃ kathaṃ sāraṇīyaṃ vītisāretvā ekamantaṃ aṭṭhāsi.
pli-tv-kd1:23.3.5.eng: Sāriputta then went up to him and exchanged pleasantries with him.

pli-tv-kd1:23.3.6.pli: Ekamantaṃ ṭhito kho sāriputto paribbājako āyasmantaṃ assajiṃ etadavoca—

pli-tv-kd1:23.3.7.pli: “vippasannāni kho te, āvuso, indriyāni, parisuddho chavivaṇṇo pariyodāto.
pli-tv-kd1:23.3.7.eng: “Venerable, your senses are clear and your skin is pure and bright.

pli-tv-kd1:23.3.8.pli: Kaṃsi tvaṃ, āvuso, uddissa pabbajito, ko vā te satthā, kassa vā tvaṃ dhammaṃ rocesī”ti?
pli-tv-kd1:23.3.8.eng: In whose name have you gone forth? Who is your teacher or whose teaching do you follow?”

pli-tv-kd1:23.4.1.pli: “Atthāvuso, mahāsamaṇo sakyaputto sakyakulā pabbajito, tāhaṃ bhagavantaṃ uddissa pabbajito, so ca me bhagavā satthā, tassa cāhaṃ bhagavato dhammaṃ rocemī”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:23.4.1.eng: “There’s a great ascetic, a Sakyan who has gone forth from the Sakyan clan. I’ve gone forth in his name, he’s my teacher, and I follow his teaching.”

pli-tv-kd1:23.4.3.pli: “Ahaṃ kho, āvuso, navo acirapabbajito, adhunāgato imaṃ dhammavinayaṃ, na tāhaṃ sakkomi vitthārena dhammaṃ desetuṃ, api ca te saṅkhittena atthaṃ vakkhāmī”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:23.4.3.eng: “I’ve only recently gone forth; I’m new to this spiritual path. I’m not able to give you the Teaching in full, but I can tell you the meaning in brief.”

pli-tv-kd1:23.4.4.pli: Atha kho sāriputto paribbājako āyasmantaṃ assajiṃ etadavoca—

pli-tv-kd1:23.4.7.eng: But do tell me the meaning.

pli-tv-kd1:23.4.9.eng: For what’s the point of a detailed exposition?”

pli-tv-kd1:23.5.1.pli: Atha kho āyasmā assaji sāriputtassa paribbājakassa imaṃ dhammapariyāyaṃ abhāsi—
pli-tv-kd1:23.5.1.eng: And Assaji gave this teaching to the wanderer Sāriputta:

pli-tv-kd1:23.5.3.eng: The Buddha has declared their cause,

pli-tv-kd1:23.5.5.eng: This is the teaching of the Great Ascetic.”

pli-tv-kd1:23.5.6.pli: Atha kho sāriputtassa paribbājakassa imaṃ dhammapariyāyaṃ sutvā virajaṃ vītamalaṃ dhammacakkhuṃ udapādi—
pli-tv-kd1:23.5.6.eng: When he had heard this teaching, Sāriputta experienced the stainless vision of the Truth:

pli-tv-kd1:23.5.7.eng: “Anything that has a beginning has an end.”

pli-tv-kd1:23.5.8.eng: “Now this is the truth, even just this much—

pli-tv-kd1:23.5.9.eng: The sorrowless state that you have penetrated,
pli-tv-kd1:23.5.9.comm: Sp 3.59 explains paccabyattha as paṭividdhāttha tumhe, “You have penetrated.”

pli-tv-kd1:23.6.1.pli: Atha kho sāriputto paribbājako yena moggallāno paribbājako tenupasaṅkami.
pli-tv-kd1:23.6.1.eng: Then the wanderer Sāriputta went to the wanderer Moggallāna.

pli-tv-kd1:23.6.2.pli: Addasā kho moggallāno paribbājako sāriputtaṃ paribbājakaṃ dūratova āgacchantaṃ, disvāna sāriputtaṃ paribbājakaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd1:23.6.2.eng: When Moggallāna saw him coming, he said to Sāriputta,

pli-tv-kd1:23.6.3.pli: “vippasannāni kho te, āvuso, indriyāni, parisuddho chavivaṇṇo pariyodāto.
pli-tv-kd1:23.6.3.eng: “Your senses are clear and your skin is pure and bright.

pli-tv-kd1:23.6.4.pli: Kacci no tvaṃ, āvuso, amataṃ adhigato”ti?
pli-tv-kd1:23.6.4.eng: You haven’t attained freedom from death, have you?”

pli-tv-kd1:23.7.1.pli: “Idhāhaṃ, āvuso, addasaṃ assajiṃ bhikkhuṃ rājagahe piṇḍāya carantaṃ pāsādikena abhikkantena paṭikkantena ālokitena vilokitena samiñjitena pasāritena okkhittacakkhuṃ iriyāpathasampannaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:23.7.1.eng: Sāriputta told him everything up to and including the teaching given by Assaji. When he had heard this teaching, Moggallāna experienced the stainless vision of the Truth:

pli-tv-kd1:23.7.3.pli: ‘ye vata loke arahanto vā arahattamaggaṃ vā samāpannā, ayaṃ tesaṃ bhikkhu aññataro.

pli-tv-kd1:23.7.5.pli: kaṃsi tvaṃ, āvuso, uddissa pabbajito, ko vā te satthā, kassa vā tvaṃ dhammaṃ rocesī’ti.

pli-tv-kd1:23.8.2.pli: ‘akālo kho imaṃ bhikkhuṃ pucchituṃ antaragharaṃ paviṭṭho piṇḍāya carati, yannūnāhaṃ imaṃ bhikkhuṃ piṭṭhito piṭṭhito anubandheyyaṃ atthikehi upaññātaṃ maggan’ti.

pli-tv-kd1:23.8.3.pli: Atha kho, āvuso, assaji bhikkhu rājagahe piṇḍāya caritvā piṇḍapātaṃ ādāya paṭikkami.

pli-tv-kd1:23.8.4.pli: Atha khvāhaṃ, āvuso, yena assaji bhikkhu tenupasaṅkamiṃ, upasaṅkamitvā assajinā bhikkhunā saddhiṃ sammodiṃ, sammodanīyaṃ kathaṃ sāraṇīyaṃ vītisāretvā ekamantaṃ aṭṭhāsiṃ.

pli-tv-kd1:23.8.5.pli: Ekamantaṃ ṭhito kho ahaṃ, āvuso, assajiṃ bhikkhuṃ etadavocaṃ—

pli-tv-kd1:23.8.6.pli: ‘vippasannāni kho te, āvuso, indriyāni, parisuddho chavivaṇṇo pariyodāto.

pli-tv-kd1:23.9.1.pli: Kaṃsi tvaṃ, āvuso, uddissa pabbajito, ko vā te satthā, kassa vā tvaṃ dhammaṃ rocesī’ti?

pli-tv-kd1:23.9.2.pli: ‘Atthāvuso, mahāsamaṇo sakyaputto sakyakulā pabbajito, tāhaṃ bhagavantaṃ uddissa pabbajito, so ca me bhagavā satthā, tassa cāhaṃ bhagavato dhammaṃ rocemī’ti.

pli-tv-kd1:23.9.4.pli: ‘Ahaṃ kho, āvuso, navo acirapabbajito adhunāgato imaṃ dhammavinayaṃ, na tāhaṃ sakkomi vitthārena dhammaṃ desetuṃ, api ca te saṅkhittena atthaṃ vakkhāmī’ti.

pli-tv-kd1:23.9.5.pli: Atha khvāhaṃ, āvuso, assajiṃ bhikkhuṃ etadavocaṃ—

pli-tv-kd1:23.10.1.pli: Atha kho, āvuso, assaji bhikkhu imaṃ dhammapariyāyaṃ abhāsi—

pli-tv-kd1:23.10.6.pli: Atha kho moggallānassa paribbājakassa imaṃ dhammapariyāyaṃ sutvā virajaṃ vītamalaṃ dhammacakkhuṃ udapādi—

pli-tv-kd1:23.10.7.eng: “Anything that has a beginning has an end.”

pli-tv-kd1:23.10.8.eng: “Now this is the truth, even just this much—

pli-tv-kd1:23.10.9.eng: The sorrowless state that you have penetrated,

pli-tv-kd1:24.1.1.pli: Atha kho moggallāno paribbājako sāriputtaṃ paribbājakaṃ etadavoca—

pli-tv-kd1:24.1.2.pli: “gacchāma mayaṃ, āvuso, bhagavato santike, so no bhagavā satthā”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:24.1.2.eng: “Let’s go to the Buddha. He’s our teacher.”

pli-tv-kd1:24.1.3.pli: “Imāni kho, āvuso, aḍḍhateyyāni paribbājakasatāni amhe nissāya amhe sampassantā idha viharanti, tepi tāva apalokema.
pli-tv-kd1:24.1.3.eng: “But these two hundred and fifty wanderers look to us for support. We must tell them first,

pli-tv-kd1:24.1.4.pli: Yathā te maññissanti, tathā te karissantī”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:24.1.4.eng: so that they may take appropriate action.”

pli-tv-kd1:24.1.5.pli: Atha kho sāriputtamoggallānā yena te paribbājakā tenupasaṅkamiṃsu, upasaṅkamitvā te paribbājake etadavocuṃ—
pli-tv-kd1:24.1.5.eng: And they went to those wanderers and said,

pli-tv-kd1:24.1.6.pli: “gacchāma mayaṃ, āvuso, bhagavato santike, so no bhagavā satthā”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:24.1.6.eng: “We’re going over to the Buddha. He’s our teacher.”

pli-tv-kd1:24.1.7.pli: “Mayaṃ āyasmante nissāya āyasmante sampassantā idha viharāma, sace āyasmantā mahāsamaṇe brahmacariyaṃ carissanti, sabbeva mayaṃ mahāsamaṇe brahmacariyaṃ carissāmā”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:24.1.7.eng: “But we look to you for support. If you are to practice the spiritual life under the Great Ascetic, so will all of us.”

pli-tv-kd1:24.2.1.pli: Atha kho sāriputtamoggallānā yena sañcayo paribbājako tenupasaṅkamiṃsu, upasaṅkamitvā sañcayaṃ paribbājakaṃ etadavocuṃ—
pli-tv-kd1:24.2.1.eng: Then Sāriputta and Moggallāna went to Sañcaya and said,

pli-tv-kd1:24.2.2.pli: “gacchāma mayaṃ, āvuso, bhagavato santike, so no bhagavā satthā”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:24.2.2.eng: “We’re going over to the Buddha. He’s our teacher.”

pli-tv-kd1:24.2.3.pli: “Alaṃ, āvuso, mā agamittha, sabbeva tayo imaṃ gaṇaṃ pariharissāmā”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:24.2.3.eng: “Don’t go! The three of us can look after this community together.”

pli-tv-kd1:24.2.4.eng: Sāriputta and Moggallāna said the same thing a second time

pli-tv-kd1:24.2.5.pli: tatiyampi kho sāriputtamoggallānā sañcayaṃ paribbājakaṃ etadavocuṃ—

pli-tv-kd1:24.2.6.pli: “gacchāma mayaṃ, āvuso, bhagavato santike, so no bhagavā satthā”ti.

pli-tv-kd1:24.2.7.pli: “Alaṃ, āvuso, mā agamittha, sabbeva tayo imaṃ gaṇaṃ pariharissāmā”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:24.2.7.eng: and they got the same reply.

pli-tv-kd1:24.3.1.pli: Atha kho sāriputtamoggallānā tāni aḍḍhateyyāni paribbājakasatāni ādāya yena veḷuvanaṃ tenupasaṅkamiṃsu.
pli-tv-kd1:24.3.1.eng: They then took those two hundred and fifty wanderers and went to the Bamboo Grove.

pli-tv-kd1:24.3.2.pli: Sañcayassa pana paribbājakassa tattheva uṇhaṃ lohitaṃ mukhato uggañchi.
pli-tv-kd1:24.3.2.eng: But the wanderer Sañcaya vomited hot blood right there.

pli-tv-kd1:24.3.3.pli: Addasā kho bhagavā sāriputtamoggallāne dūratova āgacchante, disvāna bhikkhū āmantesi—
pli-tv-kd1:24.3.3.eng: When the Buddha saw Sāriputta and Moggallāna coming, he said to the monks,

pli-tv-kd1:24.3.4.pli: “ete, bhikkhave, dve sahāyakā āgacchanti, kolito upatisso ca.
pli-tv-kd1:24.3.4.eng: “The two friends Kolita and Upatissa are coming.

pli-tv-kd1:24.3.5.pli: Etaṃ me sāvakayugaṃ bhavissati aggaṃ bhaddayugan”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:24.3.5.eng: They will become my most eminent disciples, an excellent pair.”

pli-tv-kd1:24.3.6.eng: They had not even reached the Bamboo Grove,

pli-tv-kd1:24.3.7.eng: Yet had a profound range of knowledge,

pli-tv-kd1:24.3.8.eng: About the supreme end of ownership, about freedom.

pli-tv-kd1:24.3.9.eng: And the Teacher said of them:

pli-tv-kd1:24.3.12.eng: They will be an excellent pair,

pli-tv-kd1:24.4.1.pli: Atha kho sāriputtamoggallānā yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkamiṃsu, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavato pādesu sirasā nipatitvā bhagavantaṃ etadavocuṃ—
pli-tv-kd1:24.4.1.eng: Sāriputta and Moggallāna approached the Buddha, bowed down with their heads at his feet, and said,

pli-tv-kd1:24.4.2.pli: “labheyyāma mayaṃ, bhante, bhagavato santike pabbajjaṃ, labheyyāma upasampadan”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:24.4.2.eng: “Sir, we wish to receive the going forth in your presence. We wish to receive the full ordination.”

pli-tv-kd1:24.4.4.pli: “svākkhāto dhammo, caratha brahmacariyaṃ sammā dukkhassa antakiriyāyā”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:24.4.4.eng: The Teaching is well-proclaimed. Practice the spiritual life to make a complete end of suffering.”

pli-tv-kd1:24.4.5.eng: That was the full ordination of those venerables.

pli-tv-kd1:24.5.0.eng: The going forth of the well-known

pli-tv-kd1:24.5.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena abhiññātā abhiññātā māgadhikā kulaputtā bhagavati brahmacariyaṃ caranti.
pli-tv-kd1:24.5.1.eng: At that time many well-known gentlemen from Magadha were practicing the spiritual life under the Buddha.

pli-tv-kd1:24.5.3.pli: “aputtakatāya paṭipanno samaṇo gotamo, vedhabyāya paṭipanno samaṇo gotamo, kulupacchedāya paṭipanno samaṇo gotamo, idāni anena jaṭilasahassaṃ pabbājitaṃ, imāni ca aḍḍhateyyāni paribbājakasatāni sañcayāni pabbājitāni.
pli-tv-kd1:24.5.3.eng: “The ascetic Gotama is making us childless; he’s making us widows. He’s breaking up good families! A thousand dreadlocked ascetics have now gone forth because of him, and also these two hundred and fifty wanderers who were disciples of Sañcaya.

pli-tv-kd1:24.5.4.pli: Ime ca abhiññātā abhiññātā māgadhikā kulaputtā samaṇe gotame brahmacariyaṃ carantī”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:24.5.4.eng: All these well-known gentlemen from Magadha are practicing the spiritual life under the ascetic Gotama.”

pli-tv-kd1:24.5.5.pli: Apissu bhikkhū disvā imāya gāthāya codenti—
pli-tv-kd1:24.5.5.eng: And when they saw monks, they confronted them with this verse:
pli-tv-kd1:24.5.5.comm: “Confronted” renders codenti. See Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-kd1:24.5.8.eng: After leading away all of Sañcaya’s disciples,

pli-tv-kd1:24.5.9.eng: Who will he lead away next?”

pli-tv-kd1:24.6.1.pli: Assosuṃ kho bhikkhū tesaṃ manussānaṃ ujjhāyantānaṃ khiyyantānaṃ vipācentānaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:24.6.1.eng: The monks heard the complaints of those people

pli-tv-kd1:24.6.2.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ …pe…

pli-tv-kd1:24.6.3.pli: “na, bhikkhave, so saddo ciraṃ bhavissati, sattāhameva bhavissati, sattāhassa accayena antaradhāyissati.
pli-tv-kd1:24.6.3.eng: “The complaining will soon stop. It will only go on for seven days.

pli-tv-kd1:24.6.4.pli: Tena hi, bhikkhave, ye tumhe imāya gāthāya codenti—
pli-tv-kd1:24.6.4.eng: Still, when people confront you like this, you can confront them in return with this verse:

pli-tv-kd1:24.6.11.eng: Lead by means of a good teaching.

pli-tv-kd1:24.6.12.eng: When you understand this, what indignation can there be

pli-tv-kd1:24.7.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena manussā bhikkhū disvā imāya gāthāya codenti—
pli-tv-kd1:24.7.1.eng: Soon, when they saw monks, people confronted them with the same verse:

pli-tv-kd1:24.7.4.eng: After leading away all of Sañcaya’s disciples,

pli-tv-kd1:24.7.5.eng: Who will he lead away next?”

pli-tv-kd1:24.7.6.pli: Bhikkhū te manusse imāya gāthāya paṭicodenti—
pli-tv-kd1:24.7.6.eng: And the monks confronted them in return with this verse:

pli-tv-kd1:24.7.8.eng: Lead by means of a good teaching.

pli-tv-kd1:24.7.9.eng: When you understand this, what indignation can there be

pli-tv-kd1:24.7.11.pli: Manussā dhammena kira samaṇā sakyaputtiyā nenti no adhammenāti sattāhameva so saddo ahosi, sattāhassa accayena antaradhāyi.
pli-tv-kd1:24.7.11.eng: People thought, “So it seems the Sakyan monastics lead legitimately, not illegitimately.” The complaining went on for seven days and then stopped.

pli-tv-kd1:24.7.12.eng: The account of the going forth of Sāriputta and Moggallāna is finished.

pli-tv-kd1:24.7.13.eng: The fourth section for recitation is finished.

pli-tv-kd1:25.1.0.eng: 15. Discussion of the proper conduct toward the preceptor

pli-tv-kd1:25.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhū anupajjhāyakā anācariyakā anovadiyamānā ananusāsiyamānā dunnivatthā duppārutā anākappasampannā piṇḍāya caranti;
pli-tv-kd1:25.1.1.eng: At that time the monks did not have preceptors or teachers, and as a result they were not being instructed. When walking for almsfood, they were shabbily dressed and improper in appearance.

pli-tv-kd1:25.1.2.pli: manussānaṃ bhuñjamānānaṃ uparibhojanepi uttiṭṭhapattaṃ upanāmenti, uparikhādanīyepi uttiṭṭhapattaṃ upanāmenti, uparisāyanīyepi uttiṭṭhapattaṃ upanāmenti, uparipānīyepi uttiṭṭhapattaṃ upanāmenti;
pli-tv-kd1:25.1.2.eng: While people were eating, they held out their almsbowls to receive leftovers, even right over their food, whether it was cooked or fresh food, delicacies or drinks.

pli-tv-kd1:25.1.3.eng: They ate bean curry and rice that they themselves had asked for,

pli-tv-kd1:25.1.4.eng: and they were noisy in the dining hall.
pli-tv-kd1:25.1.4.comm: Bhattagga is literally “a meal house”. The name suggests that the bhattagga was a separate building for eating. They were found both in private houses and in monasteries (Kd 10:4.5.7). Since they were part of houses or a compound of private buildings, “refectory” is not a satisfactory rendering. The fact that kitchens are not mentioned separately may mean that they were part of the bhattagga, except in monasteries. This is supported by a passage Bu Pj 3:5.3.1 that mentions a cooking implement, a pestle, being stored in a village bhattagga.

pli-tv-kd1:25.2.2.pli: “kathañhi nāma samaṇā sakyaputtiyā dunnivatthā duppārutā anākappasampannā piṇḍāya carissanti;
pli-tv-kd1:25.2.2.eng: “How can the Sakyan monastics act like this?

pli-tv-kd1:25.2.3.pli: manussānaṃ bhuñjamānānaṃ, uparibhojanepi uttiṭṭhapattaṃ upanāmessanti, uparikhādanīyepi uttiṭṭhapattaṃ upanāmessanti, uparisāyanīyepi uttiṭṭhapattaṃ upanāmessanti, uparipānīyepi uttiṭṭhapattaṃ upanāmessanti;

pli-tv-kd1:25.2.5.pli: bhattaggepi uccāsaddā mahāsaddā viharissanti seyyathāpi brāhmaṇā brāhmaṇabhojane”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:25.2.5.eng: They are just like brahmins at a brahminical meal!”

pli-tv-kd1:25.3.1.pli: Assosuṃ kho bhikkhū tesaṃ manussānaṃ ujjhāyantānaṃ khiyyantānaṃ vipācentānaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:25.3.1.eng: The monks heard the complaints of those people.

pli-tv-kd1:25.3.2.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā santuṭṭhā lajjino kukkuccakā sikkhākāmā, te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-kd1:25.3.2.eng: The monks of few desires, who had a sense of conscience, and who were contented, afraid of wrongdoing, and fond of the training, complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-kd1:25.3.3.pli: “kathañhi nāma bhikkhū dunnivatthā duppārutā anākappasampannā piṇḍāya carissanti;
pli-tv-kd1:25.3.3.eng: “How can monks act like this?” They then told the Buddha. …

pli-tv-kd1:25.3.4.pli: manussānaṃ bhuñjamānānaṃ, uparibhojanepi uttiṭṭhapattaṃ upanāmessanti, uparikhādanīyepi uttiṭṭhapattaṃ upanāmessanti, uparisāyanīyepi uttiṭṭhapattaṃ upanāmessanti, uparipānīyepi uttiṭṭhapattaṃ upanāmessanti;

pli-tv-kd1:25.4.3.pli: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṃ nidāne etasmiṃ pakaraṇe bhikkhusaṅghaṃ sannipātāpetvā bhikkhū paṭipucchi—
pli-tv-kd1:25.4.3.eng: Soon afterwards the Buddha had the Sangha gathered and questioned the monks:

pli-tv-kd1:25.4.4.pli: “saccaṃ kira, bhikkhave, bhikkhū dunnivatthā duppārutā anākappasampannā piṇḍāya caranti, manussānaṃ bhuñjamānānaṃ uparibhojanepi uttiṭṭhapattaṃ upanāmenti, uparikhādanīyepi uttiṭṭhapattaṃ upanāmenti, uparisāyanīyepi uttiṭṭhapattaṃ upanāmenti, uparipānīyepi uttiṭṭhapattaṃ upanāmenti, sāmaṃ sūpampi odanampi viññāpetvā bhuñjanti, bhattaggepi uccāsaddā mahāsaddā viharantī”ti?
pli-tv-kd1:25.4.4.eng: “Is it true, monks, that monks act like this?”

pli-tv-kd1:25.5.2.pli: “ananucchavikaṃ, bhikkhave, tesaṃ moghapurisānaṃ ananulomikaṃ appatirūpaṃ assāmaṇakaṃ akappiyaṃ akaraṇīyaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:25.5.2.eng: “It’s not suitable for those foolish men, it’s not proper, it’s not worthy of a monastic, it’s not allowable, it’s not to be done.

pli-tv-kd1:25.5.3.pli: Kathañhi nāma te, bhikkhave, moghapurisā dunnivatthā duppārutā anākappasampannā piṇḍāya carissanti, manussānaṃ bhuñjamānānaṃ uparibhojanepi uttiṭṭhapattaṃ upanāmessanti, uparikhādanīyepi uttiṭṭhapattaṃ upanāmessanti, uparisāyanīyepi uttiṭṭhapattaṃ upanāmessanti, uparipānīyepi uttiṭṭhapattaṃ upanāmessanti, sāmaṃ sūpampi odanampi viññāpetvā bhuñjissanti, bhattaggepi uccāsaddā mahāsaddā viharissanti.
pli-tv-kd1:25.5.3.eng: How can they act like this?

pli-tv-kd1:25.5.4.pli: Netaṃ, bhikkhave, appasannānaṃ vā pasādāya, pasannānaṃ vā bhiyyobhāvāya.

pli-tv-kd1:25.5.5.pli: Atha khvetaṃ, bhikkhave, appasannānañceva appasādāya, pasannānañca ekaccānaṃ aññathattāyā”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:25.5.5.eng: and cause some to lose it.”

pli-tv-kd1:25.6.1.pli: Atha kho bhagavā te bhikkhū anekapariyāyena vigarahitvā dubbharatāya dupposatāya mahicchatāya asantuṭṭhitāya saṅgaṇikāya kosajjassa avaṇṇaṃ bhāsitvā anekapariyāyena subharatāya suposatāya appicchassa santuṭṭhassa sallekhassa dhutassa pāsādikassa apacayassa vīriyārambhassa vaṇṇaṃ bhāsitvā bhikkhūnaṃ tadanucchavikaṃ tadanulomikaṃ dhammiṃ kathaṃ katvā bhikkhū āmantesi—
pli-tv-kd1:25.6.1.eng: Then the Buddha spoke in many ways in dispraise of being difficult to support and maintain, in dispraise of great desires, discontent, socializing, and laziness; but he spoke in many ways in praise of being easy to support and maintain, of fewness of wishes, contentment, self-effacement, ascetic practices, serenity, reduction in things, and being energetic. After giving a teaching on what is right and proper, he addressed the monks:

pli-tv-kd1:25.6.3.pli: Upajjhāyo, bhikkhave, saddhivihārikamhi puttacittaṃ upaṭṭhapessati, saddhivihāriko upajjhāyamhi pitucittaṃ upaṭṭhapessati.
pli-tv-kd1:25.6.3.eng: The preceptor should think of his student as a son and the student his preceptor as a father.

pli-tv-kd1:25.6.4.pli: Evaṃ te aññamaññaṃ sagāravā sappatissā sabhāgavuttino viharantā imasmiṃ dhammavinaye vuḍḍhiṃ viruḷhiṃ vepullaṃ āpajjissanti.
pli-tv-kd1:25.6.4.eng: In this way they will respect, esteem, and be considerate toward each other, and they will grow and reach greatness on this spiritual path.

pli-tv-kd1:25.7.1.eng: A preceptor should be chosen like this.

pli-tv-kd1:25.7.2.pli: ekaṃsaṃ uttarāsaṅgaṃ karitvā pāde vanditvā ukkuṭikaṃ nisīditvā añjaliṃ paggahetvā evamassa vacanīyo—
pli-tv-kd1:25.7.2.eng: After arranging his upper robe over one shoulder, a student should pay respect at the feet of the potential preceptor. He should then squat on his heels, raise his joined palms, and say,

pli-tv-kd1:25.7.4.eng: And he should repeat this a second

pli-tv-kd1:25.7.6.pli: Sāhūti vā lahūti vā opāyikanti vā patirūpanti vā pāsādikena sampādehīti vā kāyena viññāpeti, vācāya viññāpeti, kāyena vācāya viññāpeti, gahito hoti upajjhāyo;
pli-tv-kd1:25.7.6.eng: If the other conveys the following by body, by speech, or by body and speech: ‘Yes;’ ‘No problem;’ ‘It’s suitable;’ ‘It’s appropriate;’ or, ‘Carry on with inspiration’—then a preceptor has been chosen.

pli-tv-kd1:25.7.7.pli: na kāyena viññāpeti, na vācāya viññāpeti, na kāyena vācāya viññāpeti, na gahito hoti upajjhāyo.
pli-tv-kd1:25.7.7.eng: If the other doesn’t convey this by body, by speech, or by body and speech, then a preceptor hasn’t been chosen.

pli-tv-kd1:25.8.1.eng: “A student should conduct himself properly toward his preceptor.

pli-tv-kd1:25.8.3.1.pli: Kālasseva vuṭṭhāya upāhanā omuñcitvā ekaṃsaṃ uttarāsaṅgaṃ karitvā dantakaṭṭhaṃ dātabbaṃ, mukhodakaṃ dātabbaṃ, āsanaṃ paññapetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:25.8.3.1.eng: Having gotten up at the appropriate time, the student should remove his sandals and arrange his upper robe over one shoulder. He should then give his preceptor a tooth cleaner and water for rinsing the mouth, and he should prepare a seat for him.

pli-tv-kd1:25.8.4.pli: Sace yāgu hoti, bhājanaṃ dhovitvā yāgu upanāmetabbā.
pli-tv-kd1:25.8.4.eng: If there is congee, he should rinse a vessel and bring the congee to his preceptor.

pli-tv-kd1:25.8.5.pli: Yāguṃ pītassa udakaṃ datvā bhājanaṃ paṭiggahetvā nīcaṃ katvā sādhukaṃ appaṭighaṃsantena dhovitvā paṭisāmetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:25.8.5.eng: When he has drunk the congee, the student should give him water and receive the vessel. Holding it low, he should wash it carefully without scratching it and then put it away.

pli-tv-kd1:25.8.6.eng: When the preceptor has gotten up, the student should put away the seat.

pli-tv-kd1:25.8.7.pli: Sace so deso uklāpo hoti, so deso sammajjitabbo.
pli-tv-kd1:25.8.7.eng: If the place is dirty, he should sweep it.

pli-tv-kd1:25.9.1.pli: Sace upajjhāyo gāmaṃ pavisitukāmo hoti, nivāsanaṃ dātabbaṃ, paṭinivāsanaṃ paṭiggahetabbaṃ, kāyabandhanaṃ dātabbaṃ, saguṇaṃ katvā saṅghāṭiyo dātabbā, dhovitvā patto sodako dātabbo.
pli-tv-kd1:25.9.1.eng: If the preceptor wants to enter the village, the student should give him a sarong and receive the one he’s wearing in return. He should give him a belt. He should put the upper robes together, overlapping each other edge-to-edge, and then give them to him. He should rinse his preceptor’s bowl and give it to him while wet.
pli-tv-kd1:25.9.1.comm: “He should put the upper robes together, overlapping each other edge-to-edge” renders saguṇaṁ katvā saṅghāṭiyo. Sp 3.66: Saguṇaṁ katvāti dve cīvarāni ekato katvā, tā ekato katā dvepi saṅghāṭiyo dātabbā. Sabbañhi cīvaraṁ saṅghaṭitattā “saṅghāṭī”ti vuccati, “Saguṇaṁ katvā: having made two robes into one, even those two upper robes made into one are to be given. All robes are called saṅghāṭi because of being pieced together.” See Appendix of Technical Terms for this rendering of saṅghāṭi.

pli-tv-kd1:25.9.2.pli: Sace upajjhāyo pacchāsamaṇaṃ ākaṅkhati, timaṇḍalaṃ paṭicchādentena parimaṇḍalaṃ nivāsetvā kāyabandhanaṃ bandhitvā saguṇaṃ katvā saṅghāṭiyo pārupitvā gaṇṭhikaṃ paṭimuñcitvā dhovitvā pattaṃ gahetvā upajjhāyassa pacchāsamaṇena hotabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:25.9.2.eng: If the preceptor wants an attendant, the student should put on his sarong evenly all around, covering the navel and the knees. He should put on a belt. Putting the upper robes together, overlapping each other edge-to-edge, he should put them on and fasten the toggle. He should rinse his bowl, bring it along, and be his preceptor’s attendant.

pli-tv-kd1:25.10.1.pli: Nātidūre gantabbaṃ, nāccāsanne gantabbaṃ, pattapariyāpannaṃ paṭiggahetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:25.10.1.eng: He shouldn’t walk too far behind his preceptor or too close to him. He should receive the contents of his bowl.

pli-tv-kd1:25.10.2.pli: Na upajjhāyassa bhaṇamānassa antarantarā kathā opātetabbā.
pli-tv-kd1:25.10.2.eng: He shouldn’t interrupt his preceptor when he’s speaking.

pli-tv-kd1:25.10.3.eng: But if the preceptor’s speech is bordering on an offense, he should stop him.

pli-tv-kd1:25.10.4.pli: Nivattantena paṭhamataraṃ āgantvā āsanaṃ paññapetabbaṃ, pādodakaṃ pādapīṭhaṃ pādakathalikaṃ upanikkhipitabbaṃ, paccuggantvā pattacīvaraṃ paṭiggahetabbaṃ, paṭinivāsanaṃ dātabbaṃ, nivāsanaṃ paṭiggahetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:25.10.4.eng: When returning, the student should go first to prepare a seat and to set out a foot stool, a foot scraper, and water for washing the feet. He should go out to meet the preceptor and receive his bowl and robe. He should give him a sarong and receive the one he’s wearing in return.

pli-tv-kd1:25.10.5.pli: Sace cīvaraṃ sinnaṃ hoti, muhuttaṃ uṇhe otāpetabbaṃ, na ca uṇhe cīvaraṃ nidahitabbaṃ;
pli-tv-kd1:25.10.5.eng: If the robe is damp, he should sun it for a short while, but shouldn’t leave it in the heat.

pli-tv-kd1:25.10.6.pli: cīvaraṃ saṅgharitabbaṃ, cīvaraṃ saṅgharantena caturaṅgulaṃ kaṇṇaṃ ussāretvā cīvaraṃ saṅgharitabbaṃ—
pli-tv-kd1:25.10.6.eng: He should fold the robe, offsetting the edges by seven centimeters,
pli-tv-kd1:25.10.6.comm: That is, four fingerbreadths. For a discussion of the aṅgula, see sugata in Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-kd1:25.10.7.eng: so that the fold doesn’t become worn.

pli-tv-kd1:25.10.8.eng: He should place the belt in the fold.

pli-tv-kd1:25.10.9.pli: Sace piṇḍapāto hoti, upajjhāyo ca bhuñjitukāmo hoti, udakaṃ datvā piṇḍapāto upanāmetabbo.
pli-tv-kd1:25.10.9.eng: If there is almsfood and his preceptor wants to eat, the student should give him water and then the almsfood.

pli-tv-kd1:25.11.1.eng: He should ask his preceptor if he wants water to drink.

pli-tv-kd1:25.11.2.pli: Bhuttāvissa udakaṃ datvā pattaṃ paṭiggahetvā nīcaṃ katvā sādhukaṃ appaṭighaṃsantena dhovitvā vodakaṃ katvā muhuttaṃ uṇhe otāpetabbo, na ca uṇhe patto nidahitabbo.
pli-tv-kd1:25.11.2.eng: When the preceptor has eaten, the student should give him water and receive his bowl. Holding it low, he should wash it carefully without scratching it. He should then dry it and sun it for a short while, but shouldn’t leave it in the heat.

pli-tv-kd1:25.11.3.eng: The student should put away the robe and bowl.

pli-tv-kd1:25.11.4.pli: Pattaṃ nikkhipantena ekena hatthena pattaṃ gahetvā ekena hatthena heṭṭhāmañcaṃ vā heṭṭhāpīṭhaṃ vā parāmasitvā patto nikkhipitabbo.
pli-tv-kd1:25.11.4.eng: When putting away the bowl, he should hold the bowl in one hand, feel under the bed or the bench with the other, and then put it away.

pli-tv-kd1:25.11.5.pli: Na ca anantarahitāya bhūmiyā patto nikkhipitabbo.
pli-tv-kd1:25.11.5.eng: He shouldn’t put the bowl away on the bare floor.

pli-tv-kd1:25.11.6.pli: Cīvaraṃ nikkhipantena ekena hatthena cīvaraṃ gahetvā ekena hatthena cīvaravaṃsaṃ vā cīvararajjuṃ vā pamajjitvā pārato antaṃ orato bhogaṃ katvā cīvaraṃ nikkhipitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:25.11.6.eng: When putting away the robe, he should hold the robe in one hand, wipe the bamboo robe rack or the clothesline with the other, and then put it away by folding the robe over it, making the ends face the wall and the fold face out.

pli-tv-kd1:25.11.7.pli: Upajjhāyamhi vuṭṭhite āsanaṃ uddharitabbaṃ, pādodakaṃ pādapīṭhaṃ pādakathalikaṃ paṭisāmetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:25.11.7.eng: When the preceptor has gotten up, the student should put away the seat and also the foot stool, the foot scraper, and the water for washing the feet.

pli-tv-kd1:25.11.8.pli: Sace so deso uklāpo hoti, so deso sammajjitabbo.
pli-tv-kd1:25.11.8.eng: If the place is dirty, he should sweep it.

pli-tv-kd1:25.12.1.pli: Sace upajjhāyo nahāyitukāmo hoti, nahānaṃ paṭiyādetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:25.12.1.eng: If the preceptor wants to bathe, the student should prepare a bath.

pli-tv-kd1:25.12.2.pli: Sace sītena attho hoti, sītaṃ paṭiyādetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:25.12.2.eng: If he wants a cold bath, he should prepare that;

pli-tv-kd1:25.12.3.pli: Sace uṇhena attho hoti, uṇhaṃ paṭiyādetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:25.12.3.eng: if he wants a hot bath, he should prepare that.

pli-tv-kd1:25.12.4.pli: Sace upajjhāyo jantāgharaṃ pavisitukāmo hoti, cuṇṇaṃ sannetabbaṃ, mattikā temetabbā, jantāgharapīṭhaṃ ādāya upajjhāyassa piṭṭhito piṭṭhito gantvā jantāgharapīṭhaṃ datvā cīvaraṃ paṭiggahetvā ekamantaṃ nikkhipitabbaṃ, cuṇṇaṃ dātabbaṃ, mattikā dātabbā.
pli-tv-kd1:25.12.4.eng: If the preceptor wants to take a sauna, the student should knead bath powder, moisten the clay, take a sauna bench, and follow behind his preceptor. After giving the preceptor the sauna bench, receiving his robe, and putting it aside, he should give him the bath powder and the clay.

pli-tv-kd1:25.12.5.eng: If he’s able, he should enter the sauna.

pli-tv-kd1:25.12.6.pli: Jantāgharaṃ pavisantena mattikāya mukhaṃ makkhetvā purato ca pacchato ca paṭicchādetvā jantāgharaṃ pavisitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:25.12.6.eng: When entering the sauna, he should smear his face with clay, cover himself front and back, and then enter.

pli-tv-kd1:25.13.1.eng: He shouldn’t sit encroaching on the senior monks,

pli-tv-kd1:25.13.2.eng: and he shouldn’t block the junior monks from getting a seat.

pli-tv-kd1:25.13.3.eng: While in the sauna, he should provide assistance to his preceptor.

pli-tv-kd1:25.13.4.pli: Jantāgharā nikkhamantena jantāgharapīṭhaṃ ādāya purato ca pacchato ca paṭicchādetvā jantāgharā nikkhamitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:25.13.4.eng: When leaving the sauna, he should take the sauna bench, cover himself front and back, and then leave.

pli-tv-kd1:25.13.5.eng: He should also provide assistance to his preceptor in the water.

pli-tv-kd1:25.13.6.pli: Nahātena paṭhamataraṃ uttaritvā attano gattaṃ vodakaṃ katvā nivāsetvā upajjhāyassa gattato udakaṃ pamajjitabbaṃ, nivāsanaṃ dātabbaṃ, saṅghāṭi dātabbā, jantāgharapīṭhaṃ ādāya paṭhamataraṃ āgantvā āsanaṃ paññapetabbaṃ, pādodakaṃ pādapīṭhaṃ pādakathalikaṃ upanikkhipitabbaṃ, upajjhāyo pānīyena pucchitabbo.
pli-tv-kd1:25.13.6.eng: When he has bathed, he should be the first to come out. He should dry himself and put on his sarong. He should then wipe the water off his preceptor’s body, and he should give him his sarong and then his upper robe. Taking the sauna bench, he should be the first to return. He should prepare a seat, and also set out a foot stool, a foot scraper, and water for washing the feet. He should ask his preceptor if he wants water to drink.

pli-tv-kd1:25.14.1.eng: If the preceptor wants him to recite, he should do so.

pli-tv-kd1:25.14.2.eng: If the preceptor wants to question him, he should be questioned.

pli-tv-kd1:25.14.3.1.pli: Yasmiṃ vihāre upajjhāyo viharati, sace so vihāro uklāpo hoti, sace ussahati, sodhetabbo.
pli-tv-kd1:25.14.3.1.eng: If the dwelling where the preceptor is staying is dirty, the student should clean it if he’s able.

pli-tv-kd1:25.14.4.pli: Vihāraṃ sodhentena paṭhamaṃ pattacīvaraṃ nīharitvā ekamantaṃ nikkhipitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:25.14.4.eng: When he’s cleaning the dwelling, he should first take out the bowl and robe and put them aside.

pli-tv-kd1:25.14.5.eng: He should take out the sitting mat and the sheet and put them aside.
pli-tv-kd1:25.14.5.comm: “Sitting mat” renders nisīdana. See Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-kd1:25.14.6.eng: He should take out the mattress and the pillow and put them aside.

pli-tv-kd1:25.15.1.pli: Mañco nīcaṃ katvā sādhukaṃ appaṭighaṃsantena, asaṅghaṭṭentena kavāṭapiṭṭhaṃ, nīharitvā ekamantaṃ nikkhipitabbo.
pli-tv-kd1:25.15.1.eng: Holding the bed low, he should carefully take it out without scratching it or knocking it against the door or the door frame, and he should put it aside.

pli-tv-kd1:25.15.2.pli: Pīṭhaṃ nīcaṃ katvā sādhukaṃ appaṭighaṃsantena, asaṅghaṭṭentena kavāṭapiṭṭhaṃ, nīharitvā ekamantaṃ nikkhipitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:25.15.2.eng: Holding the bench low, he should carefully take it out without scratching it or knocking it against the door or the door frame, and he should put it aside.

pli-tv-kd1:25.15.3.eng: He should take out the bed supports and put them aside.

pli-tv-kd1:25.15.4.eng: He should take out the spittoon and put it aside.

pli-tv-kd1:25.15.5.eng: He should take out the leaning board and put it aside.

pli-tv-kd1:25.15.6.pli: Bhūmattharaṇaṃ yathāpaññattaṃ sallakkhetvā nīharitvā ekamantaṃ nikkhipitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:25.15.6.eng: After taking note of its position, he should take out the floor cover and put it aside.

pli-tv-kd1:25.15.7.pli: Sace vihāre santānakaṃ hoti, ullokā paṭhamaṃ ohāretabbaṃ, ālokasandhikaṇṇabhāgā pamajjitabbā.
pli-tv-kd1:25.15.7.eng: If the dwelling has cobwebs, he should first remove them from the ceiling cloth, and he should then wipe the windows and the corners of the room.
pli-tv-kd1:25.15.7.comm: “The windows and the corners of the room” renders ālokasandhikaṇṇabhāga. Sp 3.66: Ālokasandhikaṇṇabhāgāti ālokasandhibhāgā ca kaṇṇabhāgā ca antarabāhiravātapānakavāṭakāni ca gabbhassa ca cattāro koṇā pamajjitabbāti attho, “Ālokasandhikaṇṇabhāga means the windows and the corners. The meaning is that he should sweep inside and outside the windows and the door and the four corners of the room.”

pli-tv-kd1:25.15.8.pli: Sace gerukaparikammakatā bhitti kaṇṇakitā hoti, coḷakaṃ temetvā pīḷetvā pamajjitabbā.
pli-tv-kd1:25.15.8.eng: If the walls have been treated with red ocher and they’re moldy, he should moisten a cloth, wring it out, and wipe the walls.

pli-tv-kd1:25.15.9.pli: Sace kāḷavaṇṇakatā bhūmi kaṇṇakitā hoti, coḷakaṃ temetvā pīḷetvā pamajjitabbā.
pli-tv-kd1:25.15.9.eng: If the floor has been treated with a black finish and it’s moldy, he should moisten a cloth, wring it out, and wipe the floor.

pli-tv-kd1:25.15.10.pli: Sace akatā hoti bhūmi, udakena paripphositvā sammajjitabbā—
pli-tv-kd1:25.15.10.eng: If the floor is untreated, he should sprinkle it with water and then sweep it,

pli-tv-kd1:25.15.11.eng: trying to avoid stirring up dust.

pli-tv-kd1:25.15.12.eng: He should look out for any trash and discard it.

pli-tv-kd1:25.16.1.pli: Bhūmattharaṇaṃ otāpetvā sodhetvā papphoṭetvā atiharitvā yathāpaññattaṃ paññapetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:25.16.1.eng: He should sun the floor cover, clean it, beat it, bring it back inside, and put it back as before.

pli-tv-kd1:25.16.2.pli: Mañcapaṭipādakā otāpetvā pamajjitvā atiharitvā yathāṭhāne ṭhapetabbā.
pli-tv-kd1:25.16.2.eng: He should sun the bed supports, wipe them, bring them back inside, and put them back where they were.

pli-tv-kd1:25.16.3.pli: Mañco otāpetvā sodhetvā papphoṭetvā nīcaṃ katvā sādhukaṃ appaṭighaṃsantena, asaṅghaṭṭentena kavāṭapiṭṭhaṃ, atiharitvā yathāpaññattaṃ paññapetabbo.
pli-tv-kd1:25.16.3.eng: He should sun the bed, clean it, and beat it. Holding it low, he should carefully bring it back inside without scratching it or knocking it against the door or the door frame, and he should put it back as before.

pli-tv-kd1:25.16.4.pli: Pīṭhaṃ otāpetvā sodhetvā papphoṭetvā nīcaṃ katvā sādhukaṃ appaṭighaṃsantena, asaṅghaṭṭentena kavāṭapiṭṭhaṃ, atiharitvā yathāpaññattaṃ paññapetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:25.16.4.eng: He should sun the bench, clean it, and beat it. Holding it low, he should carefully bring it back inside without scratching it or knocking it against the door or the door frame, and he should put it back as before.

pli-tv-kd1:25.16.5.pli: Bhisibibbohanaṃ otāpetvā sodhetvā papphoṭetvā atiharitvā yathāpaññattaṃ paññapetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:25.16.5.eng: He should sun the mattress and the pillow, clean them, beat them, bring them back inside, and put them back as before.

pli-tv-kd1:25.16.6.pli: Nisīdanapaccattharaṇaṃ otāpetvā sodhetvā papphoṭetvā atiharitvā yathāpaññattaṃ paññapetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:25.16.6.eng: He should sun the sitting mat and the sheet, clean them, beat them, bring them back inside, and put them back as before.

pli-tv-kd1:25.16.7.pli: Kheḷamallako otāpetvā pamajjitvā atiharitvā yathāṭhāne ṭhapetabbo.
pli-tv-kd1:25.16.7.eng: He should sun the spittoon, wipe it, bring it back inside, and put it back where it was.

pli-tv-kd1:25.16.8.pli: Apassenaphalakaṃ otāpetvā pamajjitvā atiharitvā yathāṭhāne ṭhapetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:25.16.8.eng: He should sun the leaning board, wipe it, bring it back inside, and put it back where it was.

pli-tv-kd1:25.17.1.eng: He should put away the bowl and robe.

pli-tv-kd1:25.17.2.pli: Pattaṃ nikkhipantena ekena hatthena pattaṃ gahetvā ekena hatthena heṭṭhāmañcaṃ vā heṭṭhāpīṭhaṃ vā parāmasitvā patto nikkhipitabbo.
pli-tv-kd1:25.17.2.eng: When putting away the bowl, he should hold the bowl in one hand, feel under the bed or the bench with the other, and then put it away.

pli-tv-kd1:25.17.3.pli: Na ca anantarahitāya bhūmiyā patto nikkhipitabbo.
pli-tv-kd1:25.17.3.eng: He shouldn’t put the bowl away on the bare floor.

pli-tv-kd1:25.17.4.pli: Cīvaraṃ nikkhipantena ekena hatthena cīvaraṃ gahetvā ekena hatthena cīvaravaṃsaṃ vā cīvararajjuṃ vā pamajjitvā pārato antaṃ orato bhogaṃ katvā cīvaraṃ nikkhipitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:25.17.4.eng: When putting away the robe, he should hold the robe in one hand, wipe the bamboo robe rack or the clothesline with the other, and then put it away by folding the robe over it, making the ends face the wall and the fold face out.

pli-tv-kd1:25.18.1.pli: Sace puratthimā sarajā vātā vāyanti, puratthimā vātapānā thaketabbā.
pli-tv-kd1:25.18.1.eng: If dusty winds are blowing from the east, he should close the windows on the eastern side.

pli-tv-kd1:25.18.2.pli: Sace pacchimā sarajā vātā vāyanti, pacchimā vātapānā thaketabbā.
pli-tv-kd1:25.18.2.eng: If dusty winds are blowing from the west, he should close the windows on the western side.

pli-tv-kd1:25.18.3.pli: Sace uttarā sarajā vātā vāyanti, uttarā vātapānā thaketabbā.
pli-tv-kd1:25.18.3.eng: If dusty winds are blowing from the north, he should close the windows on the northern side.

pli-tv-kd1:25.18.4.pli: Sace dakkhiṇā sarajā vātā vāyanti, dakkhiṇā vātapānā thaketabbā.
pli-tv-kd1:25.18.4.eng: If dusty winds are blowing from the south, he should close the windows on the southern side.

pli-tv-kd1:25.18.5.pli: Sace sītakālo hoti, divā vātapānā vivaritabbā, rattiṃ thaketabbā.
pli-tv-kd1:25.18.5.eng: If the weather is cold, he should open the windows during the day and close them at night.

pli-tv-kd1:25.18.6.pli: Sace uṇhakālo hoti, divā vātapānā thaketabbā, rattiṃ vivaritabbā.
pli-tv-kd1:25.18.6.eng: If the weather is hot, he should close the windows during the day and open them at night.

pli-tv-kd1:25.19.1.pli: Sace pariveṇaṃ uklāpaṃ hoti, pariveṇaṃ sammajjitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:25.19.1.eng: If the yard is dirty, he should sweep it.
pli-tv-kd1:25.19.1.comm: “Yard” renders pariveṇa. See Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-kd1:25.19.2.pli: Sace koṭṭhako uklāpo hoti, koṭṭhako sammajjitabbo.
pli-tv-kd1:25.19.2.eng: If the gatehouse is dirty, he should sweep it.
pli-tv-kd1:25.19.2.comm: “Gatehouse” renders koṭṭhaka. See Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-kd1:25.19.3.pli: Sace upaṭṭhānasālā uklāpā hoti, upaṭṭhānasālā sammajjitabbā.
pli-tv-kd1:25.19.3.eng: If the assembly hall is dirty, he should sweep it.

pli-tv-kd1:25.19.4.pli: Sace aggisālā uklāpā hoti, aggisālā sammajjitabbā.
pli-tv-kd1:25.19.4.eng: If the water-boiling shed is dirty, he should sweep it.

pli-tv-kd1:25.19.5.pli: Sace vaccakuṭi uklāpā hoti, vaccakuṭi sammajjitabbā.
pli-tv-kd1:25.19.5.eng: If the restroom is dirty, he should sweep it.

pli-tv-kd1:25.19.6.pli: Sace pānīyaṃ na hoti, pānīyaṃ upaṭṭhāpetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:25.19.6.eng: If there is no water for drinking, he should get some.

pli-tv-kd1:25.19.7.pli: Sace paribhojanīyaṃ na hoti, paribhojanīyaṃ upaṭṭhāpetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:25.19.7.eng: If there is no water for washing, he should get some.

pli-tv-kd1:25.19.8.pli: Sace ācamanakumbhiyā udakaṃ na hoti, ācamanakumbhiyā udakaṃ āsiñcitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:25.19.8.eng: If there is no water in the restroom ablutions pot, he should fill it.

pli-tv-kd1:25.20.1.pli: Sace upajjhāyassa anabhirati uppannā hoti, saddhivihārikena vūpakāsetabbo, vūpakāsāpetabbo, dhammakathā vāssa kātabbā.
pli-tv-kd1:25.20.1.eng: If the preceptor becomes discontent with the spiritual life, the student should send him away or have him sent away, or he should give him a teaching.

pli-tv-kd1:25.20.2.pli: Sace upajjhāyassa kukkuccaṃ uppannaṃ hoti, saddhivihārikena vinodetabbaṃ, vinodāpetabbaṃ, dhammakathā vāssa kātabbā.
pli-tv-kd1:25.20.2.eng: If the preceptor becomes anxious, the student should dispel it or have it dispelled, or he should give him a teaching.

pli-tv-kd1:25.20.3.pli: Sace upajjhāyassa diṭṭhigataṃ uppannaṃ hoti, saddhivihārikena vivecetabbaṃ, vivecāpetabbaṃ, dhammakathā vāssa kātabbā.
pli-tv-kd1:25.20.3.eng: If the preceptor has wrong view, the student should make him give it up or have someone else do it, or he should give him a teaching.

pli-tv-kd1:25.21.1.pli: Sace upajjhāyo garudhammaṃ ajjhāpanno hoti parivāsāraho, saddhivihārikena ussukkaṃ kātabbaṃ—
pli-tv-kd1:25.21.1.eng: If the preceptor has committed a heavy offense and deserves probation,

pli-tv-kd1:25.21.2.pli: kinti nu kho saṅgho upajjhāyassa parivāsaṃ dadeyyāti.
pli-tv-kd1:25.21.2.eng: the student should try to get the Sangha to give it to him.

pli-tv-kd1:25.21.3.pli: Sace upajjhāyo mūlāyapaṭikassanāraho hoti, saddhivihārikena ussukkaṃ kātabbaṃ—
pli-tv-kd1:25.21.3.eng: If the preceptor has committed a heavy offense and deserves to be sent back to the beginning,

pli-tv-kd1:25.21.4.pli: kinti nu kho saṅgho upajjhāyaṃ mūlāya paṭikasseyyāti.
pli-tv-kd1:25.21.4.eng: the student should try to get the Sangha to do it.

pli-tv-kd1:25.21.5.pli: Sace upajjhāyo mānattāraho hoti, saddhivihārikena ussukkaṃ kātabbaṃ—
pli-tv-kd1:25.21.5.eng: If the preceptor has committed a heavy offense and deserves the trial period,

pli-tv-kd1:25.21.6.pli: kinti nu kho saṅgho upajjhāyassa mānattaṃ dadeyyāti.
pli-tv-kd1:25.21.6.eng: the student should try to get the Sangha to give it to him.

pli-tv-kd1:25.21.7.pli: Sace upajjhāyo abbhānāraho hoti, saddhivihārikena ussukkaṃ kātabbaṃ—
pli-tv-kd1:25.21.7.eng: If the preceptor has committed a heavy offense and deserves rehabilitation,

pli-tv-kd1:25.21.8.pli: kinti nu kho saṅgho upajjhāyaṃ abbheyyāti.
pli-tv-kd1:25.21.8.eng: the student should try to get the Sangha to give it to him.

pli-tv-kd1:25.22.1.pli: Sace saṅgho upajjhāyassa kammaṃ kattukāmo hoti tajjanīyaṃ vā niyassaṃ vā pabbājanīyaṃ vā paṭisāraṇīyaṃ vā ukkhepanīyaṃ vā, saddhivihārikena ussukkaṃ kātabbaṃ—
pli-tv-kd1:25.22.1.eng: If the Sangha wants to do a legal procedure against his preceptor—whether a procedure of condemnation, demotion, banishment, reconciliation, or ejection—
pli-tv-kd1:25.22.1.comm: “Demotion” renders niyassa. See Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-kd1:25.22.2.pli: kinti nu kho saṅgho upajjhāyassa kammaṃ na kareyya lahukāya vā pariṇāmeyyāti.
pli-tv-kd1:25.22.2.eng: the student should make an effort to stop it or to reduce the penalty.

pli-tv-kd1:25.22.3.pli: Kataṃ vā panassa hoti saṅghena kammaṃ tajjanīyaṃ vā niyassaṃ vā pabbājanīyaṃ vā paṭisāraṇīyaṃ vā ukkhepanīyaṃ vā, saddhivihārikena ussukkaṃ kātabbaṃ—
pli-tv-kd1:25.22.3.eng: But if the Sangha has already done a legal procedure against his preceptor—whether a procedure of condemnation, demotion, banishment, reconciliation, or ejection—

pli-tv-kd1:25.22.4.pli: kinti nu kho upajjhāyo sammā vatteyya, lomaṃ pāteyya, netthāraṃ vatteyya, saṅgho taṃ kammaṃ paṭippassambheyyāti.
pli-tv-kd1:25.22.4.eng: the student should help the preceptor conduct himself properly and suitably so as to deserve to be released, and try to get the Sangha to lift that procedure.
pli-tv-kd1:25.22.4.comm: The meaning of the first of these phrases, sammā vattati, is straightforward, but the last two, lomaṁ pāteti and netthāraṁ vattati, are more difficult. Commenting on Bu Ss 13, Sp 1.435 says: Na lomaṁ pātentīti anulomapaṭipadaṁ appaṭipajjanatāya na pannalomā honti. Na netthāraṁ vattantīti attano nittharaṇamaggaṁ na paṭipajjanti, “Na lomaṁ pātenti: because of their non-practicing in conformity with the path, their bodily hairs are not flat. Na netthāraṁ vattanti: they are not practicing the path for their own getting out (of the offense).” My rendering attempts to capture the meaning in a non-literal way.

pli-tv-kd1:25.23.1.pli: Sace upajjhāyassa cīvaraṃ dhovitabbaṃ hoti, saddhivihārikena dhovitabbaṃ, ussukkaṃ vā kātabbaṃ—
pli-tv-kd1:25.23.1.eng: If the preceptor’s robe needs washing, the student should do it himself,

pli-tv-kd1:25.23.2.pli: kinti nu kho upajjhāyassa cīvaraṃ dhoviyethāti.
pli-tv-kd1:25.23.2.eng: or he should make an effort to get it done.

pli-tv-kd1:25.23.3.pli: Sace upajjhāyassa cīvaraṃ kātabbaṃ hoti, saddhivihārikena kātabbaṃ, ussukkaṃ vā kātabbaṃ—
pli-tv-kd1:25.23.3.eng: If the preceptor needs a robe, the student should make one himself,

pli-tv-kd1:25.23.4.pli: kinti nu kho upajjhāyassa cīvaraṃ kariyethāti.
pli-tv-kd1:25.23.4.eng: or he should make an effort to get one made.

pli-tv-kd1:25.23.5.pli: Sace upajjhāyassa rajanaṃ pacitabbaṃ hoti, saddhivihārikena pacitabbaṃ, ussukkaṃ vā kātabbaṃ—
pli-tv-kd1:25.23.5.eng: If the preceptor needs dye, the student should make it himself,

pli-tv-kd1:25.23.6.pli: kinti nu kho upajjhāyassa rajanaṃ paciyethāti.
pli-tv-kd1:25.23.6.eng: or he should make an effort to get it made.

pli-tv-kd1:25.23.7.pli: Sace upajjhāyassa cīvaraṃ rajitabbaṃ hoti, saddhivihārikena rajitabbaṃ, ussukkaṃ vā kātabbaṃ—
pli-tv-kd1:25.23.7.eng: If the preceptor’s robe needs dyeing, the student should do it himself,

pli-tv-kd1:25.23.8.pli: kinti nu kho upajjhāyassa cīvaraṃ rajiyethāti.
pli-tv-kd1:25.23.8.eng: or he should make an effort to get it done.

pli-tv-kd1:25.23.9.pli: Cīvaraṃ rajantena sādhukaṃ samparivattakaṃ samparivattakaṃ rajitabbaṃ, na ca acchinne theve pakkamitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:25.23.9.eng: When he’s dyeing the robe, he should carefully and repeatedly turn it over, and shouldn’t go away while it’s still dripping.

pli-tv-kd1:25.24.1.pli: Na upajjhāyaṃ anāpucchā ekaccassa patto dātabbo, na ekaccassa patto paṭiggahetabbo;
pli-tv-kd1:25.24.1.eng: Without asking his preceptor for permission, he shouldn’t do any of the following: give away or receive a bowl;

pli-tv-kd1:25.24.2.pli: na ekaccassa cīvaraṃ dātabbaṃ, na ekaccassa cīvaraṃ paṭiggahetabbaṃ;
pli-tv-kd1:25.24.2.eng: give away or receive a robe;

pli-tv-kd1:25.24.3.pli: na ekaccassa parikkhāro dātabbo, na ekaccassa parikkhāro paṭiggahetabbo;
pli-tv-kd1:25.24.3.eng: give away or receive a requisite;

pli-tv-kd1:25.24.4.pli: na ekaccassa kesā chedetabbā, na ekaccena kesā chedāpetabbā;
pli-tv-kd1:25.24.4.eng: cut anyone’s hair or have it cut;

pli-tv-kd1:25.24.5.pli: na ekaccassa parikammaṃ kātabbaṃ, na ekaccena parikammaṃ kārāpetabbaṃ;
pli-tv-kd1:25.24.5.eng: provide assistance to anyone or have assistance provided by anyone;

pli-tv-kd1:25.24.6.pli: na ekaccassa veyyāvacco kātabbo, na ekaccena veyyāvacco kārāpetabbo;
pli-tv-kd1:25.24.6.eng: do a service for anyone or get a service done by anyone;

pli-tv-kd1:25.24.7.pli: na ekaccassa pacchāsamaṇena hotabbaṃ, na ekacco pacchāsamaṇo ādātabbo;
pli-tv-kd1:25.24.7.eng: be the attendant monk for anyone or take anyone as his attendant monk;

pli-tv-kd1:25.24.8.pli: na ekaccassa piṇḍapāto nīharitabbo, na ekaccena piṇḍapāto nīharāpetabbo;
pli-tv-kd1:25.24.8.eng: bring back almsfood for anyone or get almsfood brought back by anyone;

pli-tv-kd1:25.24.12.pli: Sace upajjhāyo gilāno hoti, yāvajīvaṃ upaṭṭhātabbo;
pli-tv-kd1:25.24.12.eng: If his preceptor is sick, he should nurse him for as long as he lives,

pli-tv-kd1:25.24.13.eng: or he should wait until he’s recovered.”

pli-tv-kd1:25.24.14.eng: The proper conduct toward the preceptor is finished.

pli-tv-kd1:26.1.0.eng: 16. Discussion of the proper conduct toward a student

pli-tv-kd1:26.1.1.eng: “And a preceptor should conduct himself properly toward his student.

pli-tv-kd1:26.1.3.pli: Upajjhāyena, bhikkhave, saddhivihāriko saṅgahetabbo anuggahetabbo uddesena paripucchāya ovādena anusāsaniyā.
pli-tv-kd1:26.1.3.eng: A preceptor should help and take care of his student through recitation, questioning, and instruction.

pli-tv-kd1:26.1.4.pli: Sace upajjhāyassa patto hoti, saddhivihārikassa patto na hoti, upajjhāyena saddhivihārikassa patto dātabbo, ussukkaṃ vā kātabbaṃ—
pli-tv-kd1:26.1.4.eng: If the preceptor has a bowl, but not the student, the preceptor should give it to him,
pli-tv-kd1:26.1.4.comm: Sp 3.67: Sace upajjhāyassa patto hotīti sace atirekapatto hoti. Esa nayo sabbattha, “‘If the preceptor has a bowl’ means if the preceptor has an extra bowl. This method applies to everything (below).”

pli-tv-kd1:26.1.5.pli: kinti nu kho saddhivihārikassa patto uppajjiyethāti.
pli-tv-kd1:26.1.5.eng: or he should make an effort to get him one.

pli-tv-kd1:26.1.6.pli: Sace upajjhāyassa cīvaraṃ hoti, saddhivihārikassa cīvaraṃ na hoti, upajjhāyena saddhivihārikassa cīvaraṃ dātabbaṃ, ussukkaṃ vā kātabbaṃ—
pli-tv-kd1:26.1.6.eng: If the preceptor has a robe, but not the student, the preceptor should give it to him,

pli-tv-kd1:26.1.7.pli: kinti nu kho saddhivihārikassa cīvaraṃ uppajjiyethāti.
pli-tv-kd1:26.1.7.eng: or he should make an effort to get him one.

pli-tv-kd1:26.1.8.pli: Sace upajjhāyassa parikkhāro hoti, saddhivihārikassa parikkhāro na hoti, upajjhāyena saddhivihārikassa parikkhāro dātabbo, ussukkaṃ vā kātabbaṃ—
pli-tv-kd1:26.1.8.eng: If the preceptor has a requisite, but not the student, the preceptor should give it to him,

pli-tv-kd1:26.1.9.pli: kinti nu kho saddhivihārikassa parikkhāro uppajjiyethāti.
pli-tv-kd1:26.1.9.eng: or he should make an effort to get him one.

pli-tv-kd1:26.2.1.pli: Sace saddhivihāriko gilāno hoti, kālasseva uṭṭhāya dantakaṭṭhaṃ dātabbaṃ, mukhodakaṃ dātabbaṃ, āsanaṃ paññapetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:26.2.1.eng: If the student is sick, the preceptor should get up at the appropriate time and give his student a tooth cleaner and water for rinsing the mouth, and he should prepare a seat for him.

pli-tv-kd1:26.2.2.pli: Sace yāgu hoti, bhājanaṃ dhovitvā yāgu upanāmetabbā.
pli-tv-kd1:26.2.2.eng: If there is congee, he should rinse a vessel and bring the congee to his student.

pli-tv-kd1:26.2.3.pli: Yāguṃ pītassa udakaṃ datvā bhājanaṃ paṭiggahetvā nīcaṃ katvā sādhukaṃ appaṭighaṃsantena dhovitvā paṭisāmetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:26.2.3.eng: When he has drunk the congee, the preceptor should give him water and receive the vessel. Holding it low, he should wash it carefully without scratching it and then put it away.

pli-tv-kd1:26.2.4.eng: When the student has gotten up, the preceptor should put away the seat.

pli-tv-kd1:26.2.5.pli: Sace so deso uklāpo hoti, so deso sammajjitabbo.
pli-tv-kd1:26.2.5.eng: If the place is dirty, he should sweep it.

pli-tv-kd1:26.3.1.pli: Sace saddhivihāriko gāmaṃ pavisitukāmo hoti, nivāsanaṃ dātabbaṃ, paṭinivāsanaṃ paṭiggahetabbaṃ, kāyabandhanaṃ dātabbaṃ, saguṇaṃ katvā saṅghāṭiyo dātabbā, dhovitvā patto sodako dātabbo.
pli-tv-kd1:26.3.1.eng: If the student wants to enter the village, the preceptor should give him a sarong and receive the one he’s wearing in return. He should give him a belt. He should put the upper robes together, overlapping each other edge-to-edge, and then give them to him. He should rinse his student’s bowl and give it to him while wet.

pli-tv-kd1:26.3.2.pli: Ettāvatā nivattissatīti āsanaṃ paññapetabbaṃ, pādodakaṃ pādapīṭhaṃ pādakathalikaṃ upanikkhipitabbaṃ, paccuggantvā pattacīvaraṃ paṭiggahetabbaṃ, paṭinivāsanaṃ dātabbaṃ, nivāsanaṃ paṭiggahetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:26.3.2.eng: Before he’s due back, the preceptor should prepare a seat and set out a foot stool, a foot scraper, and water for washing the feet. He should go out to meet the student and receive his bowl and robe. He should give him a sarong and receive the one he’s wearing in return.

pli-tv-kd1:26.3.3.pli: Sace cīvaraṃ sinnaṃ hoti, muhuttaṃ uṇhe otāpetabbaṃ, na ca uṇhe cīvaraṃ nidahitabbaṃ;
pli-tv-kd1:26.3.3.eng: If the robe is damp, he should sun it for a short while, but shouldn’t leave it in the heat.

pli-tv-kd1:26.3.4.pli: cīvaraṃ saṅgharitabbaṃ, cīvaraṃ saṅgharantena caturaṅgulaṃ kaṇṇaṃ ussāretvā cīvaraṃ saṅgharitabbaṃ—
pli-tv-kd1:26.3.4.eng: He should fold the robe, offsetting the edges by seven centimeters,

pli-tv-kd1:26.3.5.eng: so that the fold doesn’t become worn.

pli-tv-kd1:26.3.6.eng: He should place the belt in the fold.

pli-tv-kd1:26.3.7.pli: Sace piṇḍapāto hoti, saddhivihāriko ca bhuñjitukāmo hoti, udakaṃ datvā piṇḍapāto upanāmetabbo.
pli-tv-kd1:26.3.7.eng: If there is almsfood and his student wants to eat, the preceptor should give him water and then the almsfood.

pli-tv-kd1:26.4.1.eng: He should ask his student if he wants water to drink.

pli-tv-kd1:26.4.2.pli: Bhuttāvissa udakaṃ datvā pattaṃ paṭiggahetvā nīcaṃ katvā sādhukaṃ appaṭighaṃsantena dhovitvā vodakaṃ katvā muhuttaṃ uṇhe otāpetabbo, na ca uṇhe patto nidahitabbo.
pli-tv-kd1:26.4.2.eng: When the student has eaten, the preceptor should give him water and receive his bowl. Holding it low, he should wash it carefully without scratching it. He should then dry it and sun it for a short while, but shouldn’t leave it in the heat.

pli-tv-kd1:26.4.3.eng: The preceptor should put away the robe and bowl.

pli-tv-kd1:26.4.4.pli: Pattaṃ nikkhipantena ekena hatthena pattaṃ gahetvā ekena hatthena heṭṭhāmañcaṃ vā heṭṭhāpīṭhaṃ vā parāmasitvā patto nikkhipitabbo.
pli-tv-kd1:26.4.4.eng: When putting away the bowl, he should hold the bowl in one hand, feel under the bed or the bench with the other, and then put it away.

pli-tv-kd1:26.4.5.pli: Na ca anantarahitāya bhūmiyā patto nikkhipitabbo.
pli-tv-kd1:26.4.5.eng: He shouldn’t put the bowl away on the bare floor.

pli-tv-kd1:26.4.6.pli: Cīvaraṃ nikkhipantena ekena hatthena cīvaraṃ gahetvā ekena hatthena cīvaravaṃsaṃ vā cīvararajjuṃ vā pamajjitvā pārato antaṃ orato bhogaṃ katvā cīvaraṃ nikkhipitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:26.4.6.eng: When putting away the robe, he should hold the robe in one hand, wipe the bamboo robe rack or the clothesline with the other, and then put it away by folding the robe over it, making the ends face the wall and the fold face out.

pli-tv-kd1:26.4.7.pli: Saddhivihārikamhi vuṭṭhite āsanaṃ uddharitabbaṃ, pādodakaṃ pādapīṭhaṃ pādakathalikaṃ paṭisāmetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:26.4.7.eng: When the student has gotten up, the preceptor should put away the seat and also the foot stool, the foot scraper, and the water for washing the feet.

pli-tv-kd1:26.4.8.pli: Sace so deso uklāpo hoti, so deso sammajjitabbo.
pli-tv-kd1:26.4.8.eng: If the place is dirty, he should sweep it.

pli-tv-kd1:26.5.1.pli: Sace saddhivihāriko nahāyitukāmo hoti, nahānaṃ paṭiyādetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:26.5.1.eng: If the student wants to bathe, the preceptor should prepare a bath.

pli-tv-kd1:26.5.2.pli: Sace sītena attho hoti, sītaṃ paṭiyādetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:26.5.2.eng: If he wants a cold bath, he should prepare that;

pli-tv-kd1:26.5.3.pli: Sace uṇhena attho hoti, uṇhaṃ paṭiyādetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:26.5.3.eng: if he wants a hot bath, he should prepare that.

pli-tv-kd1:26.5.4.pli: Sace saddhivihāriko jantāgharaṃ pavisitukāmo hoti, cuṇṇaṃ sannetabbaṃ, mattikā temetabbā, jantāgharapīṭhaṃ ādāya gantvā jantāgharapīṭhaṃ datvā cīvaraṃ paṭiggahetvā ekamantaṃ nikkhipitabbaṃ, cuṇṇaṃ dātabbaṃ, mattikā dātabbā.
pli-tv-kd1:26.5.4.eng: If the student wants to take a sauna, the preceptor should knead bath powder, moisten the clay, take a sauna bench, and go to the sauna. After giving the student the sauna bench, receiving his robe, and putting it aside, he should give him the bath powder and the clay.

pli-tv-kd1:26.5.5.eng: If he’s able, he should enter the sauna.

pli-tv-kd1:26.5.6.pli: Jantāgharaṃ pavisantena mattikāya mukhaṃ makkhetvā purato ca pacchato ca paṭicchādetvā jantāgharaṃ pavisitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:26.5.6.eng: When entering the sauna, he should smear his face with clay, cover himself front and back, and then enter.

pli-tv-kd1:26.6.1.eng: He shouldn’t sit encroaching on the senior monks,

pli-tv-kd1:26.6.2.eng: and he shouldn’t block the junior monks from getting a seat.

pli-tv-kd1:26.6.3.eng: While in the sauna, he should provide assistance to his student.

pli-tv-kd1:26.6.4.pli: Jantāgharā nikkhamantena jantāgharapīṭhaṃ ādāya purato ca pacchato ca paṭicchādetvā jantāgharā nikkhamitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:26.6.4.eng: When leaving the sauna, he should take the sauna bench, cover himself front and back, and then leave.

pli-tv-kd1:26.6.5.eng: The preceptor should also provide assistance to his student in the water.

pli-tv-kd1:26.6.6.pli: Nahātena paṭhamataraṃ uttaritvā attano gattaṃ vodakaṃ katvā nivāsetvā saddhivihārikassa gattato udakaṃ pamajjitabbaṃ, nivāsanaṃ dātabbaṃ, saṅghāṭi dātabbā.
pli-tv-kd1:26.6.6.eng: When the preceptor has bathed, he should be the first to come out. He should dry himself and put on his sarong. He should then wipe the water off his student’s body, and he should give him his sarong and then his upper robe.

pli-tv-kd1:26.6.7.pli: Jantāgharapīṭhaṃ ādāya paṭhamataraṃ āgantvā āsanaṃ paññapetabbaṃ, pādodakaṃ pādapīṭhaṃ pādakathalikaṃ upanikkhipitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:26.6.7.eng: Taking the sauna bench, he should be the first to return. He should prepare a seat, and also set out a foot stool, a foot scraper, and water for washing the feet.

pli-tv-kd1:26.6.8.eng: He should ask his student if he wants water to drink.

pli-tv-kd1:26.7.1.pli: Yasmiṃ vihāre saddhivihāriko viharati, sace so vihāro uklāpo hoti, sace ussahati, sodhetabbo.
pli-tv-kd1:26.7.1.eng: If the dwelling where the student is staying is dirty, the preceptor should clean it if he’s able.

pli-tv-kd1:26.7.2.pli: Vihāraṃ sodhentena paṭhamaṃ pattacīvaraṃ nīharitvā ekamantaṃ nikkhipitabbaṃ;
pli-tv-kd1:26.7.2.eng: When he’s cleaning the dwelling, he should first take out the bowl and robe and put them aside.

pli-tv-kd1:26.7.3.eng: He should take out the sitting mat and the sheet and put them aside.

pli-tv-kd1:26.7.4.eng: He should take out the mattress and the pillow and put them aside.

pli-tv-kd1:26.7.5.pli: mañco nīcaṃ katvā sādhukaṃ appaṭighaṃsantena, asaṅghaṭṭentena kavāṭapiṭṭhaṃ, nīharitvā ekamantaṃ nikkhipitabbo;
pli-tv-kd1:26.7.5.eng: Holding the bed low, he should carefully take it out without scratching it or knocking it against the door or the door frame, and he should put it aside.

pli-tv-kd1:26.7.6.pli: pīṭhaṃ nīcaṃ katvā sādhukaṃ appaṭighaṃsantena asaṅghaṭṭentena kavāṭapiṭṭhaṃ nīharitvā ekamantaṃ nikkhipitabbaṃ;
pli-tv-kd1:26.7.6.eng: Holding the bench low, he should carefully take it out without scratching it or knocking it against the door or the door frame, and he should put it aside.

pli-tv-kd1:26.7.7.eng: He should take out the bed supports and put them aside.

pli-tv-kd1:26.7.8.eng: He should take out the spittoon and put it aside.

pli-tv-kd1:26.7.9.eng: He should take out the leaning board and put it aside.

pli-tv-kd1:26.7.10.pli: bhūmattharaṇaṃ yathāpaññattaṃ sallakkhetvā nīharitvā ekamantaṃ nikkhipitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:26.7.10.eng: After taking note of its position, he should take out the floor cover and put it aside.

pli-tv-kd1:26.7.11.pli: Sace vihāre santānakaṃ hoti, ullokā paṭhamaṃ ohāretabbaṃ, ālokasandhikaṇṇabhāgā pamajjitabbā.
pli-tv-kd1:26.7.11.eng: If the dwelling has cobwebs, he should first remove them from the ceiling cloth, and he should then wipe the windows and the corners of the room.

pli-tv-kd1:26.7.12.pli: Sace gerukaparikammakatā bhitti kaṇṇakitā hoti, coḷakaṃ temetvā pīḷetvā pamajjitabbā.
pli-tv-kd1:26.7.12.eng: If the walls have been treated with red ocher and they’re moldy, he should moisten a cloth, wring it out, and wipe the walls.

pli-tv-kd1:26.7.13.pli: Sace kāḷavaṇṇakatā bhūmi kaṇṇakitā hoti, coḷakaṃ temetvā pīḷetvā pamajjitabbā.
pli-tv-kd1:26.7.13.eng: If the floor has been treated with a black finish and it’s moldy, he should moisten a cloth, wring it out, and wipe the floor.

pli-tv-kd1:26.7.14.pli: Sace akatā hoti bhūmi, udakena paripphositvā sammajjitabbā—
pli-tv-kd1:26.7.14.eng: If the floor is untreated, he should sprinkle it with water and then sweep it,

pli-tv-kd1:26.7.15.eng: trying to avoid stirring up dust.

pli-tv-kd1:26.7.16.eng: He should look out for any trash and discard it.

pli-tv-kd1:26.7.17.pli: Bhūmattharaṇaṃ otāpetvā sodhetvā papphoṭetvā atiharitvā yathāpaññattaṃ paññapetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:26.7.17.eng: He should sun the floor cover, clean it, beat it, bring it back inside, and put it back as before.

pli-tv-kd1:26.7.18.pli: Mañcapaṭipādakā otāpetvā pamajjitvā atiharitvā yathāṭhāne ṭhapetabbā.
pli-tv-kd1:26.7.18.eng: He should sun the bed supports, wipe them, bring them back inside, and put them back where they were.

pli-tv-kd1:26.7.19.pli: Mañco otāpetvā sodhetvā papphoṭetvā nīcaṃ katvā sādhukaṃ appaṭighaṃsantena, asaṅghaṭṭentena kavāṭapiṭṭhaṃ, atiharitvā yathāpaññattaṃ paññapetabbo.
pli-tv-kd1:26.7.19.eng: He should sun the bed, clean it, and beat it. Holding it low, he should carefully bring it back inside without scratching it or knocking it against the door or the door frame, and he should put it back as before.

pli-tv-kd1:26.7.20.pli: Pīṭhaṃ otāpetvā sodhetvā papphoṭetvā nīcaṃ katvā sādhukaṃ appaṭighaṃsantena, asaṅghaṭṭentena kavāṭapiṭṭhaṃ, atiharitvā yathāpaññattaṃ paññapetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:26.7.20.eng: He should sun the bench, clean it, and beat it. Holding it low, he should carefully bring it back inside without scratching it or knocking it against the door or the door frame, and he should put it back as before.

pli-tv-kd1:26.7.21.pli: Bhisibibbohanaṃ otāpetvā sodhetvā papphoṭetvā atiharitvā yathāpaññattaṃ paññapetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:26.7.21.eng: He should sun the mattress and the pillow, clean them, beat them, bring them back inside, and put them back as before.

pli-tv-kd1:26.7.22.pli: Nisīdanapaccattharaṇaṃ otāpetvā sodhetvā papphoṭetvā atiharitvā yathāpaññattaṃ paññapetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:26.7.22.eng: He should sun the sitting mat and the sheet, clean them, beat them, bring them back inside, and put them back as before.

pli-tv-kd1:26.7.23.pli: Kheḷamallako otāpetvā pamajjitvā atiharitvā yathāṭhāne ṭhapetabbo.
pli-tv-kd1:26.7.23.eng: He should sun the spittoon, wipe it, bring it back inside, and put it back where it was.

pli-tv-kd1:26.7.24.pli: Apassenaphalakaṃ otāpetvā pamajjitvā atiharitvā yathāṭhāne ṭhapetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:26.7.24.eng: He should sun the leaning board, wipe it, bring it back inside, and put it back where it was.

pli-tv-kd1:26.7.25.eng: He should put away the bowl and robe.

pli-tv-kd1:26.7.26.pli: Pattaṃ nikkhipantena ekena hatthena pattaṃ gahetvā ekena hatthena heṭṭhāmañcaṃ vā heṭṭhāpīṭhaṃ vā parāmasitvā patto nikkhipitabbo.
pli-tv-kd1:26.7.26.eng: When putting away the bowl, he should hold the bowl in one hand, feel under the bed or the bench with the other, and then put it away.

pli-tv-kd1:26.7.27.pli: Na ca anantarahitāya bhūmiyā patto nikkhipitabbo.
pli-tv-kd1:26.7.27.eng: He shouldn’t put the bowl away on the bare floor.

pli-tv-kd1:26.7.28.pli: Cīvaraṃ nikkhipantena ekena hatthena cīvaraṃ gahetvā ekena hatthena cīvaravaṃsaṃ vā cīvararajjuṃ vā pamajjitvā pārato antaṃ orato bhogaṃ katvā cīvaraṃ nikkhipitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:26.7.28.eng: When putting away the robe, he should hold the robe in one hand, wipe the bamboo robe rack or the clothesline with the other, and then put it away by folding the robe over it, making the ends face the wall and the fold face out.

pli-tv-kd1:26.7.29.pli: Sace puratthimā sarajā vātā vāyanti, puratthimā vātapānā thaketabbā.
pli-tv-kd1:26.7.29.eng: If dusty winds are blowing from the east, he should close the windows on the eastern side.
