pli-tv-kd1:26.7.30.pli: Sace pacchimā sarajā vātā vāyanti, pacchimā vātapānā thaketabbā.
pli-tv-kd1:26.7.30.eng: If dusty winds are blowing from the west, he should close the windows on the western side.

pli-tv-kd1:26.7.31.pli: Sace uttarā sarajā vātā vāyanti, uttarā vātapānā thaketabbā.
pli-tv-kd1:26.7.31.eng: If dusty winds are blowing from the north, he should close the windows on the northern side.

pli-tv-kd1:26.7.32.pli: Sace dakkhiṇā sarajā vātā vāyanti, dakkhiṇā vātapānā thaketabbā.
pli-tv-kd1:26.7.32.eng: If dusty winds are blowing from the south, he should close the windows on the southern side.

pli-tv-kd1:26.7.33.pli: Sace sītakālo hoti, divā vātapānā vivaritabbā, rattiṃ thaketabbā.
pli-tv-kd1:26.7.33.eng: If the weather is cold, he should open the windows during the day and close them at night.

pli-tv-kd1:26.7.34.pli: Sace uṇhakālo hoti, divā vātapānā thaketabbā, rattiṃ vivaritabbā.
pli-tv-kd1:26.7.34.eng: If the weather is hot, he should close the windows during the day and open them at night.

pli-tv-kd1:26.7.35.pli: Sace pariveṇaṃ uklāpaṃ hoti, pariveṇaṃ sammajjitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:26.7.35.eng: If the yard is dirty, he should sweep it.

pli-tv-kd1:26.7.36.pli: Sace koṭṭhako uklāpo hoti, koṭṭhako sammajjitabbo.
pli-tv-kd1:26.7.36.eng: If the gatehouse is dirty, he should sweep it.

pli-tv-kd1:26.7.37.pli: Sace upaṭṭhānasālā uklāpā hoti, upaṭṭhānasālā sammajjitabbā.
pli-tv-kd1:26.7.37.eng: If the assembly hall is dirty, he should sweep it.

pli-tv-kd1:26.7.38.pli: Sace aggisālā uklāpā hoti, aggisālā sammajjitabbā.
pli-tv-kd1:26.7.38.eng: If the water-boiling shed is dirty, he should sweep it.

pli-tv-kd1:26.7.39.pli: Sace vaccakuṭi uklāpā hoti, vaccakuṭi sammajjitabbā.
pli-tv-kd1:26.7.39.eng: If the restroom is dirty, he should sweep it.

pli-tv-kd1:26.7.40.pli: Sace pānīyaṃ na hoti, pānīyaṃ upaṭṭhāpetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:26.7.40.eng: If there is no water for drinking, he should get some.

pli-tv-kd1:26.7.41.pli: Sace paribhojanīyaṃ na hoti, paribhojanīyaṃ upaṭṭhāpetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:26.7.41.eng: If there is no water for washing, he should get some.

pli-tv-kd1:26.7.42.pli: Sace ācamanakumbhiyā udakaṃ na hoti, ācamanakumbhiyā udakaṃ āsiñcitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:26.7.42.eng: If there is no water in the restroom ablutions pot, he should fill it.

pli-tv-kd1:26.8.1.pli: Sace saddhivihārikassa anabhirati uppannā hoti, upajjhāyena vūpakāsetabbo, vūpakāsāpetabbo, dhammakathā vāssa kātabbā.
pli-tv-kd1:26.8.1.eng: If the student becomes discontent with the spiritual life, the preceptor should send him away or have him sent away, or he should give him a teaching.

pli-tv-kd1:26.8.2.pli: Sace saddhivihārikassa kukkuccaṃ uppannaṃ hoti, upajjhāyena vinodetabbaṃ, vinodāpetabbaṃ, dhammakathā vāssa kātabbā.
pli-tv-kd1:26.8.2.eng: If the student becomes anxious, the preceptor should dispel it or have it dispelled, or he should give him a teaching.

pli-tv-kd1:26.8.3.pli: Sace saddhivihārikassa diṭṭhigataṃ uppannaṃ hoti, upajjhāyena vivecetabbaṃ, vivecāpetabbaṃ, dhammakathā vāssa kātabbā.
pli-tv-kd1:26.8.3.eng: If the student has wrong view, the preceptor should make him give it up or have someone else do it, or he should give him a teaching.

pli-tv-kd1:26.9.1.pli: Sace saddhivihāriko garudhammaṃ ajjhāpanno hoti parivāsāraho, upajjhāyena ussukkaṃ kātabbaṃ—
pli-tv-kd1:26.9.1.eng: If the student has committed a heavy offense and deserves probation,

pli-tv-kd1:26.9.2.pli: kinti nu kho saṅgho saddhivihārikassa parivāsaṃ dadeyyāti.
pli-tv-kd1:26.9.2.eng: the preceptor should try to get the Sangha to give it to him.

pli-tv-kd1:26.9.3.pli: Sace saddhivihāriko mūlāyapaṭikassanāraho hoti, upajjhāyena ussukkaṃ kātabbaṃ—
pli-tv-kd1:26.9.3.eng: If the student has committed a heavy offense and deserves to be sent back to the beginning,

pli-tv-kd1:26.9.4.pli: kinti nu kho saṅgho saddhivihārikaṃ mūlāya paṭikasseyyāti.
pli-tv-kd1:26.9.4.eng: the preceptor should try to get the Sangha to do it.

pli-tv-kd1:26.9.5.pli: Sace saddhivihāriko mānattāraho hoti, upajjhāyena ussukkaṃ kātabbaṃ—
pli-tv-kd1:26.9.5.eng: If the student has committed a heavy offense and deserves the trial period,

pli-tv-kd1:26.9.6.pli: kinti nu kho saṅgho saddhivihārikassa mānattaṃ dadeyyāti.
pli-tv-kd1:26.9.6.eng: the preceptor should try to get the Sangha to give it to him.

pli-tv-kd1:26.9.7.pli: Sace saddhivihāriko abbhānāraho hoti, upajjhāyena ussukkaṃ kātabbaṃ—
pli-tv-kd1:26.9.7.eng: If the student has committed a heavy offense and deserves rehabilitation,

pli-tv-kd1:26.9.8.pli: kinti nu kho saṅgho saddhivihārikaṃ abbheyyāti.
pli-tv-kd1:26.9.8.eng: the preceptor should try to get the Sangha to give it to him.

pli-tv-kd1:26.10.1.pli: Sace saṅgho saddhivihārikassa kammaṃ kattukāmo hoti, tajjanīyaṃ vā niyassaṃ vā pabbājanīyaṃ vā paṭisāraṇīyaṃ vā ukkhepanīyaṃ vā, upajjhāyena ussukkaṃ kātabbaṃ—
pli-tv-kd1:26.10.1.eng: If the Sangha wants to do a legal procedure against his student—whether a procedure of condemnation, demotion, banishment, reconciliation, or ejection—

pli-tv-kd1:26.10.2.pli: kinti nu kho saṅgho saddhivihārikassa kammaṃ na kareyya, lahukāya vā pariṇāmeyyāti.
pli-tv-kd1:26.10.2.eng: the preceptor should make an effort to stop it or to reduce the penalty.

pli-tv-kd1:26.10.3.pli: Kataṃ vā panassa hoti saṅghena kammaṃ, tajjanīyaṃ vā niyassaṃ vā pabbājanīyaṃ vā paṭisāraṇīyaṃ vā ukkhepanīyaṃ vā, upajjhāyena ussukkaṃ kātabbaṃ—
pli-tv-kd1:26.10.3.eng: But if the Sangha has already done a legal procedure against his student—whether a procedure of condemnation, demotion, banishment, reconciliation, or ejection—

pli-tv-kd1:26.10.4.pli: kinti nu kho saddhivihāriko sammā vatteyya, lomaṃ pāteyya, netthāraṃ vatteyya, saṅgho taṃ kammaṃ paṭippassambheyyāti.
pli-tv-kd1:26.10.4.eng: the preceptor should help the student conduct himself properly and suitably so as to deserve to be released, and try to get the Sangha to lift that procedure.

pli-tv-kd1:26.11.1.pli: Sace saddhivihārikassa cīvaraṃ dhovitabbaṃ hoti, upajjhāyena ācikkhitabbaṃ evaṃ dhoveyyāsīti, ussukkaṃ vā kātabbaṃ—
pli-tv-kd1:26.11.1.eng: If the student’s robe needs washing, the preceptor should show him how to do it,

pli-tv-kd1:26.11.2.pli: kinti nu kho saddhivihārikassa cīvaraṃ dhoviyethāti.
pli-tv-kd1:26.11.2.eng: or he should make an effort to get it done.

pli-tv-kd1:26.11.3.pli: Sace saddhivihārikassa cīvaraṃ kātabbaṃ hoti, upajjhāyena ācikkhitabbaṃ evaṃ kareyyāsīti, ussukkaṃ vā kātabbaṃ—
pli-tv-kd1:26.11.3.eng: If the student needs a robe, the preceptor should show him how to make one,

pli-tv-kd1:26.11.4.pli: kinti nu kho saddhivihārikassa cīvaraṃ kariyethāti.
pli-tv-kd1:26.11.4.eng: or he should make an effort to get one made.

pli-tv-kd1:26.11.5.pli: Sace saddhivihārikassa rajanaṃ pacitabbaṃ hoti, upajjhāyena ācikkhitabbaṃ evaṃ paceyyāsīti, ussukkaṃ vā kātabbaṃ—
pli-tv-kd1:26.11.5.eng: If the student needs dye, the preceptor should show him how to make it,

pli-tv-kd1:26.11.6.pli: kinti nu kho saddhivihārikassa rajanaṃ paciyethāti.
pli-tv-kd1:26.11.6.eng: or he should make an effort to get it made.

pli-tv-kd1:26.11.7.pli: Sace saddhivihārikassa cīvaraṃ rajitabbaṃ hoti, upajjhāyena ācikkhitabbaṃ, evaṃ rajeyyāsīti, ussukkaṃ vā kātabbaṃ—
pli-tv-kd1:26.11.7.eng: If the student’s robe needs dyeing, the preceptor should show him how to do it,

pli-tv-kd1:26.11.8.pli: kinti nu kho saddhivihārikassa cīvaraṃ rajiyethāti.
pli-tv-kd1:26.11.8.eng: or he should make an effort to get it done.

pli-tv-kd1:26.11.9.pli: Cīvaraṃ rajantena sādhukaṃ samparivattakaṃ samparivattakaṃ rajitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:26.11.9.eng: When he’s dyeing the robe, he should carefully and repeatedly turn it over,

pli-tv-kd1:26.11.10.eng: and shouldn’t go away while it’s still dripping.

pli-tv-kd1:26.11.11.pli: Sace saddhivihāriko gilāno hoti, yāvajīvaṃ upaṭṭhātabbo, vuṭṭhānamassa āgametabban”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:26.11.11.eng: If his student is sick, he should nurse him for as long as he lives, or he should wait until he’s recovered.”

pli-tv-kd1:26.11.12.eng: The proper conduct toward a student is finished.

pli-tv-kd1:27.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena saddhivihārikā upajjhāyesu na sammā vattanti.
pli-tv-kd1:27.1.1.eng: On a later occasion the students did not conduct themselves properly toward their preceptors.

pli-tv-kd1:27.1.2.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-kd1:27.1.2.eng: The monks of few desires complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-kd1:27.1.3.pli: “kathañhi nāma saddhivihārikā upajjhāyesu na sammā vattissantī”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:27.1.3.eng: “How can students not conduct themselves properly toward their preceptors?”

pli-tv-kd1:27.1.4.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ …pe…

pli-tv-kd1:27.1.5.pli: “saccaṃ kira, bhikkhave, saddhivihārikā upajjhāyesu na sammā vattantī”ti?
pli-tv-kd1:27.1.5.eng: “Is it true, monks, that students are acting like this?”

pli-tv-kd1:27.1.8.pli: kathañhi nāma, bhikkhave, saddhivihārikā upajjhāyesu na sammā vattissantīti …pe…
pli-tv-kd1:27.1.8.eng: “How can students not conduct themselves properly toward their preceptors?” …

pli-tv-kd1:27.1.10.eng: he gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-kd1:27.1.11.pli: “na, bhikkhave, saddhivihārikena upajjhāyamhi na sammā vattitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:27.1.11.eng: “A student should conduct himself properly toward his preceptor.

pli-tv-kd1:27.1.12.pli: Yo na sammā vatteyya, āpatti dukkaṭassā”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:27.1.12.eng: If he doesn’t, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-kd1:27.2.1.eng: They still did not conduct themselves properly.

pli-tv-kd1:27.2.3.eng: “You should dismiss one who doesn’t conduct himself properly.

pli-tv-kd1:27.2.4.eng: And this is how he should be dismissed.

pli-tv-kd1:27.2.5.pli: ‘paṇāmemi tan’ti vā, ‘māyidha paṭikkamī’ti vā, ‘nīhara te pattacīvaran’ti vā, ‘nāhaṃ tayā upaṭṭhātabbo’ti vā, kāyena viññāpeti, vācāya viññāpeti, kāyena vācāya viññāpeti, paṇāmito hoti saddhivihāriko;
pli-tv-kd1:27.2.5.eng: If the preceptor conveys the following by body, by speech, or by body and speech: ‘I dismiss you;’ ‘Don’t come back here;’ ‘Remove your bowl and robe;’ or, ‘You shouldn’t attend on me’—then the student has been dismissed.

pli-tv-kd1:27.2.6.pli: na kāyena viññāpeti, na vācāya viññāpeti, na kāyena vācāya viññāpeti, na paṇāmito hoti saddhivihāriko”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:27.2.6.eng: If he doesn’t convey this by body, by speech, or by body and speech, then the student hasn’t been dismissed.”

pli-tv-kd1:27.3.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena saddhivihārikā paṇāmitā na khamāpenti.
pli-tv-kd1:27.3.1.eng: Students who had been dismissed did not ask for forgiveness.

pli-tv-kd1:27.3.4.eng: They still did not ask for forgiveness.

pli-tv-kd1:27.3.6.eng: “One who has been dismissed should ask for forgiveness.

pli-tv-kd1:27.3.7.eng: If he doesn’t, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-kd1:27.4.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena upajjhāyā khamāpiyamānā na khamanti.
pli-tv-kd1:27.4.1.eng: Preceptors who were asked for forgiveness did not forgive.

pli-tv-kd1:27.4.5.eng: The students left, disrobed, and joined the monastics of other religions.
pli-tv-kd1:27.4.5.comm: “Disrobed” renders vibbhamanti. See Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-kd1:27.4.7.eng: “When asked for forgiveness, you should forgive.

pli-tv-kd1:27.4.8.eng: If you don’t, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-kd1:27.5.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena upajjhāyā sammāvattantaṃ paṇāmenti, asammāvattantaṃ na paṇāmenti.
pli-tv-kd1:27.5.1.eng: Preceptors dismissed students who were conducting themselves properly and did not dismiss those who were not.

pli-tv-kd1:27.5.3.eng: “You shouldn’t dismiss someone who is conducting himself properly.

pli-tv-kd1:27.5.4.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-kd1:27.5.5.pli: Na ca, bhikkhave, asammāvattanto na paṇāmetabbo.
pli-tv-kd1:27.5.5.eng: And you should dismiss someone who isn’t conducting himself properly.

pli-tv-kd1:27.5.6.eng: If you don’t, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-kd1:27.6.1.pli: Pañcahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgato saddhivihāriko paṇāmetabbo.
pli-tv-kd1:27.6.1.eng: If a student has five qualities, he should be dismissed:

pli-tv-kd1:27.6.2.pli: Upajjhāyamhi nādhimattaṃ pemaṃ hoti, nādhimatto pasādo hoti, nādhimattā hirī hoti, nādhimatto gāravo hoti, nādhimattā bhāvanā hoti—
pli-tv-kd1:27.6.2.eng: he doesn’t have much affection for his preceptor; he doesn’t have much confidence in his preceptor; he doesn’t have much conscience in regard to his preceptor; he doesn’t have much respect for his preceptor; he hasn’t developed his mind much under his preceptor.

pli-tv-kd1:27.6.3.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgato saddhivihāriko paṇāmetabbo.

pli-tv-kd1:27.6.4.pli: Pañcahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgato saddhivihāriko na paṇāmetabbo.
pli-tv-kd1:27.6.4.eng: If a student has five qualities, he shouldn’t be dismissed:

pli-tv-kd1:27.6.5.pli: Upajjhāyamhi adhimattaṃ pemaṃ hoti, adhimatto pasādo hoti, adhimattā hirī hoti, adhimatto gāravo hoti, adhimattā bhāvanā hoti—
pli-tv-kd1:27.6.5.eng: he has much affection for his preceptor; he has much confidence in his preceptor; he has much conscience in regard to his preceptor; he has much respect for his preceptor; he has developed his mind much under his preceptor.

pli-tv-kd1:27.6.6.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgato saddhivihāriko na paṇāmetabbo.

pli-tv-kd1:27.7.1.pli: Pañcahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgato saddhivihāriko alaṃ paṇāmetuṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:27.7.1.eng: If a student has five qualities, he deserves to be dismissed:

pli-tv-kd1:27.7.2.pli: Upajjhāyamhi nādhimattaṃ pemaṃ hoti, nādhimatto pasādo hoti, nādhimattā hirī hoti, nādhimatto gāravo hoti, nādhimattā bhāvanā hoti—
pli-tv-kd1:27.7.2.eng: he doesn’t have much affection for his preceptor; he doesn’t have much confidence in his preceptor; he doesn’t have much conscience in regard to his preceptor; he doesn’t have much respect for his preceptor; he hasn’t developed his mind much under his preceptor.

pli-tv-kd1:27.7.3.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgato saddhivihāriko alaṃ paṇāmetuṃ.

pli-tv-kd1:27.7.4.pli: Pañcahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgato saddhivihāriko nālaṃ paṇāmetuṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:27.7.4.eng: If a student has five qualities, he doesn’t deserve to be dismissed:

pli-tv-kd1:27.7.5.pli: Upajjhāyamhi adhimattaṃ pemaṃ hoti, adhimatto pasādo hoti, adhimattā hirī hoti, adhimatto gāravo hoti, adhimattā bhāvanā hoti—
pli-tv-kd1:27.7.5.eng: he has much affection for his preceptor; he has much confidence in his preceptor; he has much conscience in regard to his preceptor; he has much respect for his preceptor; he has developed his mind much under his preceptor.

pli-tv-kd1:27.7.6.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgato saddhivihāriko nālaṃ paṇāmetuṃ.

pli-tv-kd1:27.8.1.pli: Pañcahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgataṃ saddhivihārikaṃ appaṇāmento upajjhāyo sātisāro hoti, paṇāmento anatisāro hoti.
pli-tv-kd1:27.8.1.eng: If a student has five qualities, the preceptor is at fault if he doesn’t dismiss him, but not if he does:

pli-tv-kd1:27.8.2.pli: Upajjhāyamhi nādhimattaṃ pemaṃ hoti, nādhimatto pasādo hoti, nādhimattā hirī hoti, nādhimatto gāravo hoti, nādhimattā bhāvanā hoti—
pli-tv-kd1:27.8.2.eng: the student doesn’t have much affection for his preceptor; he doesn’t have much confidence in his preceptor; he doesn’t have much conscience in regard to his preceptor; he doesn’t have much respect for his preceptor; he hasn’t developed his mind much under his preceptor.

pli-tv-kd1:27.8.3.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgataṃ saddhivihārikaṃ appaṇāmento upajjhāyo sātisāro hoti, paṇāmento anatisāro hoti.

pli-tv-kd1:27.8.4.pli: Pañcahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgataṃ saddhivihārikaṃ paṇāmento upajjhāyo sātisāro hoti, appaṇāmento anatisāro hoti.
pli-tv-kd1:27.8.4.eng: If a student has five qualities, the preceptor is at fault if he dismisses him, but not if he doesn’t:

pli-tv-kd1:27.8.5.pli: Upajjhāyamhi adhimattaṃ pemaṃ hoti, adhimatto pasādo hoti, adhimattā hirī hoti, adhimatto gāravo hoti, adhimattā bhāvanā hoti—
pli-tv-kd1:27.8.5.eng: the student has much affection for his preceptor; he has much confidence in his preceptor; he has much conscience in regard to his preceptor; he has much respect for his preceptor; he has developed his mind much under his preceptor.”

pli-tv-kd1:27.8.6.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgataṃ saddhivihārikaṃ paṇāmento upajjhāyo sātisāro hoti, appaṇāmento anatisāro hotī”ti.

pli-tv-kd1:28.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro brāhmaṇo bhikkhū upasaṅkamitvā pabbajjaṃ yāci.
pli-tv-kd1:28.1.1.eng: On one occasion a brahmin went to the monks and asked for the going forth,

pli-tv-kd1:28.1.3.pli: So bhikkhūsu pabbajjaṃ alabhamāno kiso ahosi lūkho dubbaṇṇo uppaṇḍuppaṇḍukajāto dhamanisanthatagatto.
pli-tv-kd1:28.1.3.eng: As a result, he became thin, haggard, and pale, with veins protruding all over his body.

pli-tv-kd1:28.1.4.pli: Addasā kho bhagavā taṃ brāhmaṇaṃ kisaṃ lūkhaṃ dubbaṇṇaṃ uppaṇḍuppaṇḍukajātaṃ dhamanisanthatagattaṃ, disvāna bhikkhū āmantesi—
pli-tv-kd1:28.1.4.eng: The Buddha saw him, and he asked the monks,

pli-tv-kd1:28.1.5.pli: “kiṃ nu kho so, bhikkhave, brāhmaṇo kiso lūkho dubbaṇṇo uppaṇḍuppaṇḍukajāto dhamanisanthatagatto”ti?
pli-tv-kd1:28.1.5.eng: “Why is that brahmin looking so sickly?”

pli-tv-kd1:28.1.6.pli: “Eso, bhante, brāhmaṇo bhikkhū upasaṅkamitvā pabbajjaṃ yāci.
pli-tv-kd1:28.1.6.eng: They told him what had happened.

pli-tv-kd1:28.1.8.pli: So bhikkhūsu pabbajjaṃ alabhamāno kiso lūkho dubbaṇṇo uppaṇḍuppaṇḍukajāto dhamanisanthatagatto”ti.

pli-tv-kd1:28.2.2.pli: “ko nu kho, bhikkhave, tassa brāhmaṇassa adhikāraṃ sarasī”ti?
pli-tv-kd1:28.2.2.eng: “Does anyone remember any act of service from that brahmin?”

pli-tv-kd1:28.2.3.pli: Evaṃ vutte, āyasmā sāriputto bhagavantaṃ etadavoca—

pli-tv-kd1:28.2.4.pli: “ahaṃ kho, bhante, tassa brāhmaṇassa adhikāraṃ sarāmī”ti.

pli-tv-kd1:28.2.5.pli: “Kiṃ pana tvaṃ, sāriputta, tassa brāhmaṇassa adhikāraṃ sarasī”ti?

pli-tv-kd1:28.2.6.pli: “Idha me, bhante, so brāhmaṇo rājagahe piṇḍāya carantassa kaṭacchubhikkhaṃ dāpesi.
pli-tv-kd1:28.2.6.eng: “When I was walking for almsfood here in Rājagaha, that brahmin gave a ladleful of food.”

pli-tv-kd1:28.2.7.pli: Imaṃ kho ahaṃ, bhante, tassa brāhmaṇassa adhikāraṃ sarāmī”ti.

pli-tv-kd1:28.3.1.pli: “Sādhu sādhu, sāriputta, kataññuno hi, sāriputta, sappurisā katavedino.
pli-tv-kd1:28.3.1.eng: “Good, good, Sāriputta, superior people have gratitude.

pli-tv-kd1:28.3.2.pli: Tena hi tvaṃ, sāriputta, taṃ brāhmaṇaṃ pabbājehi upasampādehī”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:28.3.2.eng: Well then, Sāriputta, give that brahmin the going forth and the full ordination.”

pli-tv-kd1:28.3.4.pli: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṃ nidāne etasmiṃ pakaraṇe dhammiṃ kathaṃ katvā bhikkhū āmantesi—
pli-tv-kd1:28.3.4.eng: The Buddha then gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-kd1:28.3.5.pli: “yā sā, bhikkhave, mayā tīhi saraṇagamanehi upasampadā anuññātā, taṃ ajjatagge paṭikkhipāmi.
pli-tv-kd1:28.3.5.eng: “From today I rescind the full ordination through the taking of the three refuges.

pli-tv-kd1:28.4.1.eng: Instead you should give the full ordination through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements.

pli-tv-kd1:28.4.2.eng: And the ordination should be done like this.

pli-tv-kd1:28.4.3.eng: A competent and capable monk should inform the Sangha:

pli-tv-kd1:28.4.4.eng: ‘Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd1:28.4.5.eng: So-and-so wants the full ordination with venerable so-and-so.
pli-tv-kd1:28.4.5.comm: The Pali reads: Ayaṁ itthannāmo itthannāmassa āyasmato upasampadāpekkho. Taking the genitive case here to be the agent genitive, which seems to be the most obvious reading, this would mean, “So-and-so who is seeking to be fully ordained by venerable so-and-so.” But it is the Sangha that ordains, not individuals, and so this translation does not seem quite right. According to Vmv 3.126 this phrase should be understood by means of this example: Ayaṁ buddharakkhito āyasmato dhammarakkhitassa saddhivihārikabhūto upasampadāpekkho, “This Buddharakkhita, who is seeking the full ordination, is the student of Venerable Dhammarakkhita.” I have followed this interpretation, and thus my translation “with venerable so-and-so”.

pli-tv-kd1:28.4.6.pli: Yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṃ, saṅgho itthannāmaṃ upasampādeyya itthannāmena upajjhāyena.
pli-tv-kd1:28.4.6.eng: If the Sangha is ready, it should give the full ordination to so-and-so with so-and-so as his preceptor.

pli-tv-kd1:28.5.1.eng: Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd1:28.5.2.eng: So-and-so wants the full ordination with venerable so-and-so.

pli-tv-kd1:28.5.3.eng: The Sangha gives the full ordination to so-and-so with so-and-so as his preceptor.

pli-tv-kd1:28.5.4.pli: Yassāyasmato khamati itthannāmassa upasampadā itthannāmena upajjhāyena, so tuṇhassa;
pli-tv-kd1:28.5.4.eng: Any monk who approves of giving the full ordination to so-and-so with so-and-so as his preceptor should remain silent.

pli-tv-kd1:28.5.5.eng: Any monk who doesn’t approve should speak up.

pli-tv-kd1:28.5.6.eng: For the second time, I speak on this matter.

pli-tv-kd1:28.5.7.eng: Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd1:28.5.8.eng: So-and-so wants the full ordination with venerable so-and-so.

pli-tv-kd1:28.5.9.eng: The Sangha gives the full ordination to so-and-so with so-and-so as his preceptor.

pli-tv-kd1:28.5.10.pli: Yassāyasmato khamati itthannāmassa upasampadā itthannāmena upajjhāyena, so tuṇhassa;
pli-tv-kd1:28.5.10.eng: Any monk who approves of giving the full ordination to so-and-so with so-and-so as his preceptor should remain silent.

pli-tv-kd1:28.5.11.eng: Any monk who doesn’t approve should speak up.

pli-tv-kd1:28.6.1.eng: For the third time, I speak on this matter.

pli-tv-kd1:28.6.2.eng: Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd1:28.6.3.eng: So-and-so wants the full ordination with venerable so-and-so.

pli-tv-kd1:28.6.4.eng: The Sangha gives the full ordination to so-and-so with so-and-so as his preceptor.

pli-tv-kd1:28.6.5.pli: Yassāyasmato khamati itthannāmassa upasampadā itthannāmena upajjhāyena, so tuṇhassa;
pli-tv-kd1:28.6.5.eng: Any monk who approves of giving the full ordination to so-and-so with so-and-so as his preceptor should remain silent.

pli-tv-kd1:28.6.6.eng: Any monk who doesn’t approve should speak up.

pli-tv-kd1:28.6.7.eng: The Sangha has given the full ordination to so-and-so with so-and-so as his preceptor.

pli-tv-kd1:28.6.8.pli: Khamati saṅghassa, tasmā tuṇhī, evametaṃ dhārayāmī’”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:28.6.8.eng: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent. I’ll remember it thus.’”

pli-tv-kd1:29.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro bhikkhu upasampannasamanantarā anācāraṃ ācarati.
pli-tv-kd1:29.1.1.eng: On a later occasion, a monk misbehaved immediately after his full ordination.

pli-tv-kd1:29.1.5.eng: “But I didn’t ask you to ordain me.

pli-tv-kd1:29.1.6.eng: Why did you ordain me without being asked?”

pli-tv-kd1:29.1.8.eng: “You shouldn’t give the full ordination to someone who hasn’t asked.

pli-tv-kd1:29.1.9.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-kd1:29.1.10.eng: I allow you to give the full ordination to someone who has asked.

pli-tv-kd1:29.2.1.eng: And this is how they should ask.

pli-tv-kd1:29.2.2.pli: Tena upasampadāpekkhena saṅghaṃ upasaṅkamitvā ekaṃsaṃ uttarāsaṅgaṃ karitvā bhikkhūnaṃ pāde vanditvā ukkuṭikaṃ nisīditvā añjaliṃ paggahetvā evamassa vacanīyo—
pli-tv-kd1:29.2.2.eng: After approaching the Sangha, the one who wants the full ordination should arrange his upper robe over one shoulder and pay respect at the feet of the monks. He should then squat on his heels, raise his joined palms, and say:

pli-tv-kd1:29.2.3.pli: ‘saṅghaṃ, bhante, upasampadaṃ yācāmi, ullumpatu maṃ, bhante, saṅgho anukampaṃ upādāyā’ti.
pli-tv-kd1:29.2.3.eng: ‘Venerables, I ask the Sangha for the full ordination. Please lift me up out of compassion.’

pli-tv-kd1:29.2.4.eng: And he should ask a second

pli-tv-kd1:29.3.1.eng: A competent and capable monk should then inform the Sangha:

pli-tv-kd1:29.3.2.eng: ‘Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd1:29.3.3.eng: So-and-so wants the full ordination with venerable so-and-so.

pli-tv-kd1:29.3.4.pli: Itthannāmo saṅghaṃ upasampadaṃ yācati itthannāmena upajjhāyena.
pli-tv-kd1:29.3.4.eng: So-and-so is asking the Sangha for the full ordination with so-and-so as his preceptor.

pli-tv-kd1:29.3.5.pli: Yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṃ, saṅgho itthannāmaṃ upasampādeyya itthannāmena upajjhāyena.
pli-tv-kd1:29.3.5.eng: If the Sangha is ready, it should give the full ordination to so-and-so with so-and-so as his preceptor.

pli-tv-kd1:29.4.1.eng: Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd1:29.4.2.eng: So-and-so wants the full ordination with venerable so-and-so.

pli-tv-kd1:29.4.3.pli: Itthannāmo saṅghaṃ upasampadaṃ yācati itthannāmena upajjhāyena.
pli-tv-kd1:29.4.3.eng: So-and-so is asking the Sangha for the full ordination with so-and-so as his preceptor.

pli-tv-kd1:29.4.4.eng: The Sangha gives the full ordination to so-and-so with so-and-so as his preceptor.

pli-tv-kd1:29.4.5.pli: Yassāyasmato khamati itthannāmassa upasampadā itthannāmena upajjhāyena, so tuṇhassa;
pli-tv-kd1:29.4.5.eng: Any monk who approves of giving the full ordination to so-and-so with so-and-so as his preceptor should remain silent.

pli-tv-kd1:29.4.6.eng: Any monk who doesn’t approve should speak up.

pli-tv-kd1:29.4.7.eng: For the second time, I speak on this matter. …

pli-tv-kd1:29.4.8.eng: For the third time, I speak on this matter. …

pli-tv-kd1:29.4.9.eng: The Sangha has given the full ordination to so-and-so with so-and-so as his preceptor.

pli-tv-kd1:29.4.10.pli: Khamati saṅghassa, tasmā tuṇhī, evametaṃ dhārayāmī’”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:29.4.10.eng: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent. I’ll remember it thus.’”

pli-tv-kd1:30.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena rājagahe paṇītānaṃ bhattānaṃ bhattapaṭipāṭi aṭṭhitā hoti.
pli-tv-kd1:30.1.1.eng: At that time in Rājagaha, there was a succession of fine meals.

pli-tv-kd1:30.1.3.pli: “ime kho samaṇā sakyaputtiyā sukhasīlā sukhasamācārā, subhojanāni bhuñjitvā nivātesu sayanesu sayanti.
pli-tv-kd1:30.1.3.eng: “These Sakyan monastics have pleasant habits and a happy life. They eat nice food and sleep in beds sheltered from the wind.

pli-tv-kd1:30.1.4.eng: Why don’t I go forth with the Sakyan monastics?”

pli-tv-kd1:30.1.5.pli: Atha kho so brāhmaṇo bhikkhū upasaṅkamitvā pabbajjaṃ yāci.
pli-tv-kd1:30.1.5.eng: Then that brahmin went to the monks and asked for the going forth.

pli-tv-kd1:30.1.6.eng: The monks gave him the going forth and the full ordination.

pli-tv-kd1:30.2.1.eng: When he had gone forth, that succession of meals came to a stop.

pli-tv-kd1:30.2.5.eng: “I didn’t go forth to walk for alms.

pli-tv-kd1:30.2.6.pli: Sace me dassatha bhuñjissāmi, no ce me dassatha vibbhamissāmī”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:30.2.6.eng: If you give me some, I’ll eat it. If not, I’ll disrobe.”

pli-tv-kd1:30.2.7.pli: “Kiṃ pana tvaṃ, āvuso, udarassa kāraṇā pabbajito”ti?
pli-tv-kd1:30.2.7.eng: “But did you go forth for the sake of your stomach?”

pli-tv-kd1:30.3.1.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-kd1:30.3.1.eng: The monks of few desires complained and criticized him,

pli-tv-kd1:30.3.2.pli: “kathañhi nāma bhikkhu evaṃ svākkhāte dhammavinaye udarassa kāraṇā pabbajissatī”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:30.3.2.eng: “How could a monk go forth on this well-proclaimed spiritual path for the sake of his stomach?”

pli-tv-kd1:30.3.4.pli: “saccaṃ kira tvaṃ, bhikkhu, udarassa kāraṇā pabbajito”ti?
pli-tv-kd1:30.3.4.eng: “Is it true, monk, that you did this?”

pli-tv-kd1:30.3.7.pli: kathañhi nāma tvaṃ, moghapurisa, evaṃ svākkhāte dhammavinaye udarassa kāraṇā pabbajissasi.
pli-tv-kd1:30.3.7.eng: “Foolish man, how could you go forth on this well-proclaimed spiritual path for the sake of your stomach?

pli-tv-kd1:30.3.8.pli: Netaṃ, moghapurisa, appasannānaṃ vā pasādāya pasannānaṃ vā bhiyyobhāvāya …pe…

pli-tv-kd1:30.3.10.eng: he gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-kd1:30.4.1.eng: “When you are giving the full ordination, you should point out the four supports:

pli-tv-kd1:30.4.2.pli: piṇḍiyālopabhojanaṃ nissāya pabbajjā, tattha te yāvajīvaṃ ussāho karaṇīyo;
pli-tv-kd1:30.4.2.eng: One gone forth is supported by almsfood. You should persevere with this for life.

pli-tv-kd1:30.4.4.pli: saṅghabhattaṃ, uddesabhattaṃ, nimantanaṃ, salākabhattaṃ, pakkhikaṃ, uposathikaṃ, pāṭipadikaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:30.4.4.eng: a meal for the Sangha, a meal for designated monks, an invitational meal, a meal for which lots are drawn, a half-monthly meal, a meal on the observance day, and a meal on the day after the observance day.

pli-tv-kd1:30.4.5.pli: Paṃsukūlacīvaraṃ nissāya pabbajjā, tattha te yāvajīvaṃ ussāho karaṇīyo;
pli-tv-kd1:30.4.5.eng: One gone forth is supported by rag-robes. You should persevere with this for life.

pli-tv-kd1:30.4.7.pli: khomaṃ, kappāsikaṃ, koseyyaṃ, kambalaṃ, sāṇaṃ, bhaṅgaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:30.4.7.eng: linen, cotton, silk, wool, sunn hemp, and hemp.

pli-tv-kd1:30.4.8.pli: Rukkhamūlasenāsanaṃ nissāya pabbajjā, tattha te yāvajīvaṃ ussāho karaṇīyo;
pli-tv-kd1:30.4.8.eng: One gone forth is supported by the foot of a tree as a resting place. You should persevere with this for life.
pli-tv-kd1:30.4.8.comm: “Resting place” renders senāsana. See Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-kd1:30.4.10.eng: a dwelling, a stilt house, and a cave.
pli-tv-kd1:30.4.10.comm: Apart from the vihāra, “a dwelling”, and the guhā, “a cave”, the Pali mentions three kinds of buildings, the aḍḍhayoga, the pāsāda, and the hammiya, all of which, according to the commentaries, are different kinds of pāsāda, “stilt houses”. Rather than try to differentiate between these buildings, which is unlikely to be useful from a practical perspective, I have instead grouped them together as “stilt house”. Here is what the commentaries have to say. Sp 4.294: Aḍḍhayogoti supaṇṇavaṅkagehaṁ, “An aḍḍhayoga is a house bent like a supaṇṇa.” Sp-ṭ 4.294 clarifies: Supaṇṇavaṅkagehanti garuḷapakkhasaṇṭhānena katagehaṁ, “Supaṇṇavaṅkageha: a house made in the shape of the wings of a garuḷa.” A garuḷa, better known in its Sanskrit form garuḍa, is a mythological bird. Sp 4.294 continues: Pāsādoti dīghapāsādo. Hammiyanti upariākāsatale patiṭṭhitakūṭāgāro pāsādoyeva, “A pāsāda is a long stilt house. A hammiya is just a pāsāda that has an upper room on top of its flat roof.” At Sp-ṭ 3.74, however, we find slightly different explanations. It seems clear, however, that all three are stilt houses and that they are distinguished according to their shape and the kind of roof they possess.

pli-tv-kd1:30.4.11.pli: Pūtimuttabhesajjaṃ nissāya pabbajjā, tattha te yāvajīvaṃ ussāho karaṇīyo;
pli-tv-kd1:30.4.11.eng: One gone forth is supported by medicine of fermented urine. You should persevere with this for life.

pli-tv-kd1:30.4.13.eng: ghee, butter, oil, honey, and syrup.”
pli-tv-kd1:30.4.13.comm: I. B. Horner translates phāṇita as “molasses”, which doesn’t quite hit the mark. SED defines phāṇita as “the inspissated juice of the sugarcane or other plants”, in other words, “cane syrup”. According to the commentary at Sp 1.623 it can be either cooked or uncooked, the difference presumably being whether the juice is raw or concentrated. “Syrup” seems closer to the mark than “molasses”.

pli-tv-kd1:30.4.14.eng: The fifth section for recitation on the proper conduct toward the preceptor is finished.

pli-tv-kd1:31.1.0.eng: 18. Discussion of the proper conduct toward a teacher

pli-tv-kd1:31.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro māṇavako bhikkhū upasaṅkamitvā pabbajjaṃ yāci.
pli-tv-kd1:31.1.1.eng: Soon afterwards a young brahmin went to the monks and asked for the going forth.

pli-tv-kd1:31.1.2.eng: The monks told him about the four supports.

pli-tv-kd1:31.1.4.pli: “sace me, bhante, pabbajite nissaye ācikkheyyātha, abhirameyyāmahaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:31.1.4.eng: “Venerables, if you had told me about this after my going forth, I would have been fine.

pli-tv-kd1:31.1.5.eng: But now I won’t go forth,

pli-tv-kd1:31.1.6.eng: for these supports are disgusting and repulsive to me.”

pli-tv-kd1:31.1.8.eng: “You shouldn’t point out the supports beforehand.

pli-tv-kd1:31.1.9.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-kd1:31.1.10.eng: You should point out the supports immediately after the full ordination.”

pli-tv-kd1:31.2.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhū duvaggenapi tivaggenapi gaṇena upasampādenti.
pli-tv-kd1:31.2.1.eng: At that time, monks in groups of two and three gave the full ordination.

pli-tv-kd1:31.2.3.eng: “You shouldn’t give the full ordination in groups of less than ten.

pli-tv-kd1:31.2.4.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-kd1:31.2.5.pli: Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, dasavaggena vā atirekadasavaggena vā gaṇena upasampādetun”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:31.2.5.eng: You should give the full ordination in groups of ten or more than ten.”

pli-tv-kd1:31.3.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhū ekavassāpi duvassāpi saddhivihārikaṃ upasampādenti.
pli-tv-kd1:31.3.1.eng: At that time monks who only had one or two years of seniority gave the full ordination,

pli-tv-kd1:31.3.2.pli: Āyasmāpi upaseno vaṅgantaputto ekavasso saddhivihārikaṃ upasampādesi.
pli-tv-kd1:31.3.2.eng: among them Venerable Upasena of Vaṅganta.

pli-tv-kd1:31.3.3.pli: So vassaṃvuṭṭho duvasso ekavassaṃ saddhivihārikaṃ ādāya yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi.
pli-tv-kd1:31.3.3.eng: After completing the rainy-season residence, he had two years of seniority and his student had one. The two of them went to the Buddha, bowed, and sat down.

pli-tv-kd1:31.3.4.pli: Āciṇṇaṃ kho panetaṃ buddhānaṃ bhagavantānaṃ āgantukehi bhikkhūhi saddhiṃ paṭisammodituṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:31.3.4.eng: Since it is the custom for Buddhas to greet newly-arrived monks,

pli-tv-kd1:31.4.1.pli: Atha kho bhagavā āyasmantaṃ upasenaṃ vaṅgantaputtaṃ etadavoca—

pli-tv-kd1:31.4.2.eng: “I hope you’re keeping well, monk, I hope you’re getting by?

pli-tv-kd1:31.4.3.eng: I hope you’re not tired from traveling?”

pli-tv-kd1:31.4.4.eng: “I’m keeping well, sir, I’m getting by.

pli-tv-kd1:31.4.6.pli: Jānantāpi tathāgatā pucchanti, jānantāpi na pucchanti, kālaṃ viditvā pucchanti, kālaṃ viditvā na pucchanti;
pli-tv-kd1:31.4.6.eng: When Buddhas know what is going on, sometimes they ask and sometimes not. They know the right time to ask and when not to ask.

pli-tv-kd1:31.4.7.eng: Buddhas ask when it is beneficial, otherwise not,

pli-tv-kd1:31.4.8.eng: for Buddhas are incapable of doing what is unbeneficial.
pli-tv-kd1:31.4.8.comm: “Incapable of doing” renders setughāta, literally, “destroyed the bridge”. Sp 1.16: Setu vuccati maggo, maggeneva tādisassa vacanassa ghāto, samucchedoti vuttaṁ hoti, “The path is called the bridge. What is said is that there is the destruction and cutting off of such speech by the path.” The commentary seems to take setu, “bridge”, as a reference to the eightfold path. I prefer to understand “bridge” as a metaphor for access, that is, the Buddhas no longer have the possibility of doing what is unbeneficial.

pli-tv-kd1:31.4.9.pli: Dvīhi ākārehi buddhā bhagavanto bhikkhū paṭipucchanti— dhammaṃ vā desessāma, sāvakānaṃ vā sikkhāpadaṃ paññapessāmāti.
pli-tv-kd1:31.4.9.eng: Buddhas question the monks for two reasons: to give a teaching or to lay down a training rule.

pli-tv-kd1:31.5.1.pli: Atha kho bhagavā āyasmantaṃ upasenaṃ vaṅgantaputtaṃ etadavoca— “kativassosi tvaṃ, bhikkhū”ti?
pli-tv-kd1:31.5.1.eng: The Buddha said to Upasena, “How long have you been a monk?”

pli-tv-kd1:31.5.8.pli: “ananucchavikaṃ, moghapurisa, ananulomikaṃ appatirūpaṃ assāmaṇakaṃ akappiyaṃ akaraṇīyaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:31.5.8.eng: “It’s not suitable, foolish man, it’s not proper, it’s not worthy of a monastic, it’s not allowable, it’s not to be done.

pli-tv-kd1:31.5.9.pli: Kathañhi nāma tvaṃ, moghapurisa, aññehi ovadiyo anusāsiyo aññaṃ ovadituṃ anusāsituṃ maññissasi.
pli-tv-kd1:31.5.9.eng: You ought to be taught and instructed by others. What, then, makes you think that you should teach and instruct another person?

pli-tv-kd1:31.5.10.pli: Atilahuṃ kho tvaṃ, moghapurisa, bāhullāya āvatto, yadidaṃ gaṇabandhikaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:31.5.10.eng: You have turned to indulgence too readily, that is, by forming a group.

pli-tv-kd1:31.5.11.pli: Netaṃ, moghapurisa, appasannānaṃ vā pasādāya pasannānaṃ vā bhiyyobhāvāya …pe…

pli-tv-kd1:31.5.13.eng: he gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-kd1:31.5.14.eng: “You shouldn’t give the full ordination if you have less than ten years of seniority.

pli-tv-kd1:31.5.15.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-kd1:31.5.16.pli: Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, dasavassena vā atirekadasavassena vā upasampādetun”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:31.5.16.eng: I allow you to give the full ordination if you have ten or more years of seniority.”

pli-tv-kd1:31.6.2.eng: once they had ten years of seniority,

pli-tv-kd1:31.6.3.eng: ignorant and incompetent monks gave the full ordination.

pli-tv-kd1:31.6.4.eng: As a result there were ignorant preceptors with knowledgeable students,

pli-tv-kd1:31.6.7.eng: and foolish preceptors with wise students.

pli-tv-kd1:31.6.8.pli: Aññataropi aññatitthiyapubbo upajjhāyena sahadhammikaṃ vuccamāno upajjhāyassa vādaṃ āropetvā taṃyeva titthāyatanaṃ saṅkami.
pli-tv-kd1:31.6.8.eng: A monk who had been a monastic in another religion even refuted his preceptor, despite being legitimately corrected by him. He then returned to that religious community.
pli-tv-kd1:31.6.8.comm: “Correct” renders vuccamāno. See vadati in Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-kd1:31.7.1.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-kd1:31.7.1.eng: The monks of few desires complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-kd1:31.7.2.eng: “How can ignorant and incompetent monks give the full ordination just because they have ten years of seniority?

pli-tv-kd1:31.7.3.pli: Dissanti upajjhāyā bālā saddhivihārikā paṇḍitā, dissanti upajjhāyā abyattā saddhivihārikā byattā, dissanti upajjhāyā appassutā saddhivihārikā bahussutā, dissanti upajjhāyā duppaññā, saddhivihārikā paññavanto”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:31.7.3.eng: There are ignorant preceptors with knowledgeable students, incompetent preceptors with competent students, uneducated preceptors with learned students, and foolish preceptors with wise students.”

pli-tv-kd1:31.7.4.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ.

pli-tv-kd1:31.7.5.eng: He said, “Is it true, monks, that this is happening?”

pli-tv-kd1:31.7.8.pli: Dissanti upajjhāyā bālā, saddhivihārikā paṇḍitā, dissanti upajjhāyā abyattā saddhivihārikā byattā, dissanti upajjhāyā appassutā, saddhivihārikā bahussutā, dissanti upajjhāyā duppaññā, saddhivihārikā paññavanto”ti?

pli-tv-kd1:31.8.2.pli: “kathañhi nāma te, bhikkhave, moghapurisā—dasavassamhā dasavassamhāti—bālā abyattā upasampādessanti.
pli-tv-kd1:31.8.2.eng: “How can those foolish men give the full ordination just because they have ten years of seniority?

pli-tv-kd1:31.8.3.pli: Dissanti upajjhāyā bālā, saddhivihārikā paṇḍitā, dissanti upajjhāyā abyattā saddhivihārikā byattā, dissanti upajjhāyā appassutā, saddhivihārikā bahussutā, dissanti upajjhāyā duppaññā, saddhivihārikā paññavanto.

pli-tv-kd1:31.8.6.eng: he gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-kd1:31.8.7.eng: “An ignorant and incompetent monk shouldn’t give the full ordination.

pli-tv-kd1:31.8.8.eng: If he does, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-kd1:31.8.9.pli: Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, byattena bhikkhunā paṭibalena dasavassena vā atirekadasavassena vā upasampādetun”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:31.8.9.eng: I allow a competent and capable monk who has ten or more years of seniority to give the full ordination.”

pli-tv-kd1:32.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhū upajjhāyesu pakkantesupi vibbhantesupi kālaṅkatesupi pakkhasaṅkantesupi anācariyakā anovadiyamānā ananusāsiyamānā
pli-tv-kd1:32.1.1.eng: At that time there were preceptors who went away, disrobed, died, or joined another religion or sect, and as a result their students were not being instructed.
pli-tv-kd1:32.1.1.comm: Sp 3.77: Pakkhasaṅkantesūti titthiyapakkhasaṅkantesu, “Pakkhasaṅkantesu means those who have joined a group of monastics of another religion.” Yet the idea of pakkha also refers to groups or factions within the Sangha, for instance, when the Sangha is split into different communities (nānāsaṁvāsa) that no longer perform legal procedures together. As such, it is a term for a separate sect of Buddhism.

pli-tv-kd1:32.1.2.eng: When walking for almsfood, they were shabbily dressed and improper in appearance.

pli-tv-kd1:32.1.3.pli: manussānaṃ bhuñjamānānaṃ uparibhojanepi uttiṭṭhapattaṃ upanāmenti, uparikhādanīyepi uparisāyanīyepi uparipānīyepi uttiṭṭhapattaṃ upanāmenti;
pli-tv-kd1:32.1.3.eng: While people were eating, they held out their almsbowls to receive leftovers, even right over their food, whether it was cooked or fresh food, delicacies or drinks.

pli-tv-kd1:32.1.4.eng: They ate bean curry and rice that they themselves had asked for,

pli-tv-kd1:32.1.5.eng: and they were noisy in the dining hall.

pli-tv-kd1:32.1.7.pli: “kathañhi nāma samaṇā sakyaputtiyā dunnivatthā duppārutā anākappasampannā piṇḍāya carissanti;
pli-tv-kd1:32.1.7.eng: “How can the Sakyan monastics act like this?

pli-tv-kd1:32.1.8.pli: manussānaṃ bhuñjamānānaṃ uparibhojanepi uttiṭṭhapattaṃ upanāmessanti, uparikhādanīyepi uparisāyanīyepi uparipānīyepi uttiṭṭhapattaṃ upanāmessanti;

pli-tv-kd1:32.1.10.pli: bhattaggepi uccāsaddā mahāsaddā viharissanti, seyyathāpi brāhmaṇā brāhmaṇabhojane”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:32.1.10.eng: They are just like brahmins at a brahminical meal.”

pli-tv-kd1:32.1.11.pli: Assosuṃ kho bhikkhū tesaṃ manussānaṃ ujjhāyantānaṃ khiyyantānaṃ vipācentānaṃ …pe…
pli-tv-kd1:32.1.11.eng: The monks heard the complaints of those people. …

pli-tv-kd1:32.1.12.pli: atha kho te bhikkhū bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ.

pli-tv-kd1:32.1.15.pli: vigarahitvā dhammiṃ kathaṃ katvā bhikkhū āmantesi—
pli-tv-kd1:32.1.15.eng: After rebuking them, the Buddha gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-kd1:32.1.17.pli: Ācariyo, bhikkhave, antevāsikamhi puttacittaṃ upaṭṭhāpessati, antevāsiko ācariyamhi pitucittaṃ upaṭṭhāpessati.
pli-tv-kd1:32.1.17.eng: The teacher should think of his pupil as a son and the pupil his teacher as a father.

pli-tv-kd1:32.1.18.pli: Evaṃ te aññamaññaṃ sagāravā sappatissā sabhāgavuttino viharantā imasmiṃ dhammavinaye vuddhiṃ viruḷhiṃ vepullaṃ āpajjissanti.
pli-tv-kd1:32.1.18.eng: In this way they will respect, esteem, and be considerate toward each other, and they will grow and reach greatness on this spiritual path.

pli-tv-kd1:32.1.19.pli: Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, dasavassaṃ nissāya vatthuṃ, dasavassena nissayaṃ dātuṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:32.1.19.eng: You should live with formal support for ten years. And I allow a monk of ten years’ seniority to give such support.
pli-tv-kd1:32.1.19.comm: “Formal support” renders nissāya. See Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-kd1:32.2.1.eng: A teacher should be chosen like this.

pli-tv-kd1:32.2.2.pli: Ekaṃsaṃ uttarāsaṅgaṃ karitvā pāde vanditvā ukkuṭikaṃ nisīditvā añjaliṃ paggahetvā evamassa vacanīyo—
pli-tv-kd1:32.2.2.eng: After arranging his upper robe over one shoulder, a pupil should pay respect at the feet of a potential teacher. He should then squat on his heels, raise his joined palms, and say,

pli-tv-kd1:32.2.3.pli: ‘ācariyo me, bhante, hohi, āyasmato nissāya vacchāmi;
pli-tv-kd1:32.2.3.eng: ‘Venerable, please be my teacher. I wish to live with formal support from you.’

pli-tv-kd1:32.2.4.pli: ācariyo me, bhante, hohi, āyasmato nissāya vacchāmi;
pli-tv-kd1:32.2.4.eng: And he should repeat this a second

pli-tv-kd1:32.2.5.pli: ācariyo me, bhante, hohi, āyasmato nissāya vacchāmī’ti.

pli-tv-kd1:32.2.6.pli: ‘Sāhū’ti vā ‘lahū’ti vā ‘opāyikan’ti vā ‘patirūpan’ti vā ‘pāsādikena sampādehī’ti vā kāyena viññāpeti, vācāya viññāpeti, kāyena vācāya viññāpeti, gahito hoti ācariyo;
pli-tv-kd1:32.2.6.eng: If the other conveys the following by body, by speech, or by body and speech: ‘Yes;’ ‘No problem;’ ‘It’s suitable;’ ‘It’s appropriate;’ or, ‘Carry on with inspiration’—then a teacher has been chosen.

pli-tv-kd1:32.2.7.pli: na kāyena viññāpeti, na vācāya viññāpeti, na kāyena vācāya viññāpeti, na gahito hoti ācariyo.
pli-tv-kd1:32.2.7.eng: If the other doesn’t convey this by body, by speech, or by body and speech, then a teacher hasn’t been chosen.

pli-tv-kd1:32.3.1.eng: “A pupil should conduct himself properly toward his teacher.

pli-tv-kd1:32.3.3.1.pli: Kālasseva uṭṭhāya upāhanaṃ omuñcitvā ekaṃsaṃ uttarāsaṅgaṃ karitvā dantakaṭṭhaṃ dātabbaṃ, mukhodakaṃ dātabbaṃ, āsanaṃ paññapetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:32.3.3.1.eng: Having gotten up at the appropriate time, the pupil should remove his sandals, and arrange his upper robe over one shoulder. He should then give his teacher a tooth cleaner and water for rinsing the mouth, and he should prepare a seat for him.

pli-tv-kd1:32.3.4.pli: Sace yāgu hoti, bhājanaṃ dhovitvā yāgu upanāmetabbā.
pli-tv-kd1:32.3.4.eng: If there is congee, he should rinse a vessel and bring the congee to his teacher.

pli-tv-kd1:32.3.5.pli: Yāguṃ pītassa udakaṃ datvā bhājanaṃ paṭiggahetvā nīcaṃ katvā sādhukaṃ appaṭighaṃsantena dhovitvā paṭisāmetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:32.3.5.eng: When he has drunk the congee, the pupil should give him water and receive the vessel. Holding it low, he should wash it carefully without scratching it and then put it away.

pli-tv-kd1:32.3.6.eng: When the teacher has gotten up, the pupil should put away the seat.

pli-tv-kd1:32.3.7.pli: Sace so deso uklāpo hoti, so deso sammajjitabbo.
pli-tv-kd1:32.3.7.eng: If the place is dirty, he should sweep it.

pli-tv-kd1:32.3.8.pli: Sace ācariyo gāmaṃ pavisitukāmo hoti, nivāsanaṃ dātabbaṃ, paṭinivāsanaṃ paṭiggahetabbaṃ, kāyabandhanaṃ dātabbaṃ, saguṇaṃ katvā saṅghāṭiyo dātabbā, dhovitvā patto sodako dātabbo.
pli-tv-kd1:32.3.8.eng: If the teacher wants to enter the village, the pupil should give him a sarong and receive the one he’s wearing in return. He should give him a belt. He should put the upper robes together, overlapping each other edge-to-edge, and then give them to him. He should rinse his teacher’s bowl and give it to him while wet.

pli-tv-kd1:32.3.9.pli: Sace ācariyo pacchāsamaṇaṃ ākaṅkhati, timaṇḍalaṃ paṭicchādentena parimaṇḍalaṃ nivāsetvā kāyabandhanaṃ bandhitvā saguṇaṃ katvā saṅghāṭiyo pārupitvā gaṇṭhikaṃ paṭimuñcitvā dhovitvā pattaṃ gahetvā ācariyassa pacchāsamaṇena hotabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:32.3.9.eng: If the teacher wants an attendant, the pupil should put on his sarong evenly all around, covering the navel and the knees. He should put on a belt. Putting the upper robes together, overlapping each other edge-to-edge, he should put them on and fasten the toggle. He should rinse his bowl, bring it along, and be his teacher’s attendant.

pli-tv-kd1:32.3.10.pli: Nātidūre gantabbaṃ, nāccāsanne gantabbaṃ, pattapariyāpannaṃ paṭiggahetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:32.3.10.eng: He shouldn’t walk too far behind his teacher or too close to him. He should receive the contents of his bowl.

pli-tv-kd1:32.3.11.pli: Na ācariyassa bhaṇamānassa antarantarā kathā opātetabbā.
pli-tv-kd1:32.3.11.eng: He shouldn’t interrupt his teacher when he’s speaking.

pli-tv-kd1:32.3.12.eng: But if the teacher’s speech is bordering on an offense, he should stop him.

pli-tv-kd1:32.3.13.pli: Nivattantena paṭhamataraṃ āgantvā āsanaṃ paññapetabbaṃ, pādodakaṃ pādapīṭhaṃ pādakathalikaṃ upanikkhipitabbaṃ, paccuggantvā pattacīvaraṃ paṭiggahetabbaṃ, paṭinivāsanaṃ dātabbaṃ, nivāsanaṃ paṭiggahetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:32.3.13.eng: When returning, the pupil should go first to prepare a seat and to set out a foot stool, a foot scraper, and water for washing the feet. He should go out to meet the teacher and receive his bowl and robe. He should give him a sarong and receive the one he’s wearing in return.

pli-tv-kd1:32.3.14.pli: Sace cīvaraṃ sinnaṃ hoti, muhuttaṃ uṇhe otāpetabbaṃ, na ca uṇhe cīvaraṃ nidahitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:32.3.14.eng: If the robe is damp, he should sun it for a short while, but shouldn’t leave it in the heat.

pli-tv-kd1:32.3.16.pli: Cīvaraṃ saṅgharantena caturaṅgulaṃ kaṇṇaṃ ussāretvā cīvaraṃ saṅgharitabbaṃ—
pli-tv-kd1:32.3.16.eng: offsetting the edges by seven centimeters,

pli-tv-kd1:32.3.17.eng: so that the fold doesn’t become worn.

pli-tv-kd1:32.3.18.eng: He should place the belt in the fold.

pli-tv-kd1:32.3.19.pli: Sace piṇḍapāto hoti, ācariyo ca bhuñjitukāmo hoti, udakaṃ datvā piṇḍapāto upanāmetabbo.
pli-tv-kd1:32.3.19.eng: If there is almsfood and his teacher wants to eat, the pupil should give him water and then the almsfood.

pli-tv-kd1:32.3.20.eng: He should ask his teacher if he wants water to drink.

pli-tv-kd1:32.3.21.pli: Bhuttāvissa udakaṃ datvā pattaṃ paṭiggahetvā nīcaṃ katvā sādhukaṃ appaṭighaṃsantena dhovitvā vodakaṃ katvā muhuttaṃ uṇhe otāpetabbo, na ca uṇhe patto nidahitabbo.
pli-tv-kd1:32.3.21.eng: When the teacher has eaten, the pupil should give him water and receive his bowl. Holding it low, he should wash it carefully without scratching it. He should then dry it and sun it for a short while, but shouldn’t leave it in the heat.

pli-tv-kd1:32.3.22.eng: The pupil should put away the robe and bowl.

pli-tv-kd1:32.3.23.pli: Pattaṃ nikkhipantena ekena hatthena pattaṃ gahetvā ekena hatthena heṭṭhāmañcaṃ vā heṭṭhāpīṭhaṃ vā parāmasitvā patto nikkhipitabbo.
pli-tv-kd1:32.3.23.eng: When putting away the bowl, he should hold the bowl in one hand, feel under the bed or the bench with the other, and then put it away.

pli-tv-kd1:32.3.24.pli: Na ca anantarahitāya bhūmiyā patto nikkhipitabbo.
pli-tv-kd1:32.3.24.eng: He shouldn’t put the bowl away on the bare floor.

pli-tv-kd1:32.3.25.pli: Cīvaraṃ nikkhipantena ekena hatthena cīvaraṃ gahetvā ekena hatthena cīvaravaṃsaṃ vā cīvararajjuṃ vā pamajjitvā pārato antaṃ orato bhogaṃ katvā cīvaraṃ nikkhipitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:32.3.25.eng: When putting away the robe, he should hold the robe in one hand, wipe the bamboo robe rack or the clothesline with the other, and then put it away by folding the robe over it, making the ends face the wall and the fold face out.

pli-tv-kd1:32.3.26.pli: Ācariyamhi vuṭṭhite āsanaṃ uddharitabbaṃ, pādodakaṃ pādapīṭhaṃ pādakathalikaṃ paṭisāmetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:32.3.26.eng: When the teacher has gotten up, the pupil should put away the seat and also the foot stool, the foot scraper, and the water for washing the feet.

pli-tv-kd1:32.3.27.pli: Sace so deso uklāpo hoti, so deso sammajjitabbo.
pli-tv-kd1:32.3.27.eng: If the place is dirty, he should sweep it.

pli-tv-kd1:32.3.28.1.pli: Sace ācariyo nahāyitukāmo hoti, nahānaṃ paṭiyādetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:32.3.28.1.eng: If the teacher wants to bathe, the pupil should prepare a bath.

pli-tv-kd1:32.3.29.pli: Sace sītena attho hoti, sītaṃ paṭiyādetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:32.3.29.eng: If he wants a cold bath, he should prepare that;

pli-tv-kd1:32.3.30.pli: Sace uṇhena attho hoti, uṇhaṃ paṭiyādetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:32.3.30.eng: if he wants a hot bath, he should prepare that.

pli-tv-kd1:32.3.31.pli: Sace ācariyo jantāgharaṃ pavisitukāmo hoti, cuṇṇaṃ sannetabbaṃ, mattikā temetabbā, jantāgharapīṭhaṃ ādāya ācariyassa piṭṭhito piṭṭhito gantvā jantāgharapīṭhaṃ datvā cīvaraṃ paṭiggahetvā ekamantaṃ nikkhipitabbaṃ, cuṇṇaṃ dātabbaṃ, mattikā dātabbā.
pli-tv-kd1:32.3.31.eng: If the teacher wants to take a sauna, the pupil should knead bath powder, moisten the clay, take a sauna bench, and follow behind his teacher. After giving the teacher the sauna bench, receiving his robe, and putting it aside, he should give him the bath powder and the clay.

pli-tv-kd1:32.3.32.eng: If he’s able, he should enter the sauna.

pli-tv-kd1:32.3.33.pli: Jantāgharaṃ pavisantena mattikāya mukhaṃ makkhetvā purato ca pacchato ca paṭicchādetvā jantāgharaṃ pavisitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:32.3.33.eng: When entering the sauna, he should smear his face with clay, cover himself front and back, and then enter.

pli-tv-kd1:32.3.34.eng: He shouldn’t sit encroaching on the senior monks,

pli-tv-kd1:32.3.35.eng: and he shouldn’t block the junior monks from getting a seat.

pli-tv-kd1:32.3.36.eng: While in the sauna, he should provide assistance to his teacher.

pli-tv-kd1:32.3.37.pli: Jantāgharā nikkhamantena jantāgharapīṭhaṃ ādāya purato ca pacchato ca paṭicchādetvā jantāgharā nikkhamitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:32.3.37.eng: When leaving the sauna, he should take the sauna bench, cover himself front and back, and then leave.

pli-tv-kd1:32.3.38.eng: He should also provide assistance to his teacher in the water.

pli-tv-kd1:32.3.39.pli: Nahātena paṭhamataraṃ uttaritvā attano gattaṃ vodakaṃ katvā nivāsetvā ācariyassa gattato udakaṃ pamajjitabbaṃ, nivāsanaṃ dātabbaṃ, saṅghāṭi dātabbā, jantāgharapīṭhaṃ ādāya paṭhamataraṃ āgantvā āsanaṃ paññapetabbaṃ, pādodakaṃ pādapīṭhaṃ pādakathalikaṃ upanikkhipitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:32.3.39.eng: When he has bathed, he should be the first to come out. He should dry himself and put on his sarong. He should then wipe the water off his teacher’s body, and he should give him his sarong and then his upper robe. Taking the sauna bench, he should be first to return. He should prepare a seat, and also set out a foot stool, a foot scraper, and water for washing the feet.

pli-tv-kd1:32.3.40.eng: He should ask his teacher if he wants water to drink.

pli-tv-kd1:32.3.41.eng: If the teacher wants him to recite, he should do so.

pli-tv-kd1:32.3.42.eng: If the teacher wants to question him, he should be questioned.

pli-tv-kd1:32.3.43.1.pli: Yasmiṃ vihāre ācariyo viharati, sace so vihāro uklāpo hoti, sace ussahati, sodhetabbo.
pli-tv-kd1:32.3.43.1.eng: If the dwelling where the teacher is staying is dirty, the pupil should clean it if he’s able.

pli-tv-kd1:32.3.44.pli: Vihāraṃ sodhentena paṭhamaṃ pattacīvaraṃ nīharitvā ekamantaṃ nikkhipitabbaṃ;
pli-tv-kd1:32.3.44.eng: When he’s cleaning the dwelling, he should first take out the bowl and robe and put them aside.

pli-tv-kd1:32.3.45.eng: He should take out the sitting mat and the sheet and put them aside.

pli-tv-kd1:32.3.46.eng: He should take out the mattress and the pillow and put them aside.

pli-tv-kd1:32.3.47.pli: mañco nīcaṃ katvā sādhukaṃ appaṭighaṃsantena, asaṅghaṭṭentena kavāṭapiṭṭhaṃ, nīharitvā ekamantaṃ nikkhipitabbo;
pli-tv-kd1:32.3.47.eng: Holding the bed low, he should carefully take it out without scratching it or knocking it against the door or the door frame, and he should put it aside.

pli-tv-kd1:32.3.48.pli: pīṭhaṃ nīcaṃ katvā sādhukaṃ appaṭighaṃsantena, asaṅghaṭṭentena kavāṭapiṭṭhaṃ, nīharitvā ekamantaṃ nikkhipitabbaṃ;
pli-tv-kd1:32.3.48.eng: Holding the bench low, he should carefully take it out without scratching it or knocking it against the door or the door frame, and he should put it aside.

pli-tv-kd1:32.3.49.eng: He should take out the bed supports and put them aside.

pli-tv-kd1:32.3.50.eng: He should take out the spittoon and put it aside.

pli-tv-kd1:32.3.51.eng: He should take out the leaning board and put it aside.

pli-tv-kd1:32.3.52.pli: bhūmattharaṇaṃ yathāpaññattaṃ sallakkhetvā nīharitvā ekamantaṃ nikkhipitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:32.3.52.eng: After taking note of its position, he should take out the floor cover and put it aside.

pli-tv-kd1:32.3.53.pli: Sace vihāre santānakaṃ hoti, ullokā paṭhamaṃ ohāretabbaṃ, ālokasandhikaṇṇabhāgā pamajjitabbā.
pli-tv-kd1:32.3.53.eng: If the dwelling has cobwebs, he should first remove them from the ceiling cloth, and he should then wipe the windows and the corners of the room.

pli-tv-kd1:32.3.54.pli: Sace gerukaparikammakatā bhitti kaṇṇakitā hoti, coḷakaṃ temetvā pīḷetvā pamajjitabbā.
pli-tv-kd1:32.3.54.eng: If the walls have been treated with red ocher and they’re moldy, he should moisten a cloth, wring it out, and wipe the walls.

pli-tv-kd1:32.3.55.pli: Sace kāḷavaṇṇakatā bhūmi kaṇṇakitā hoti, coḷakaṃ temetvā pīḷetvā pamajjitabbā.
pli-tv-kd1:32.3.55.eng: If the floor has been treated with a black finish and it’s moldy, he should moisten a cloth, wring it out, and wipe the floor.

pli-tv-kd1:32.3.56.pli: Sace akatā hoti bhūmi, udakena paripphositvā sammajjitabbā—
pli-tv-kd1:32.3.56.eng: If the floor is untreated, he should sprinkle it with water and then sweep it,

pli-tv-kd1:32.3.57.eng: trying to avoid stirring up dust.

pli-tv-kd1:32.3.58.eng: He should look out for any trash and discard it.

pli-tv-kd1:32.3.59.pli: Bhūmattharaṇaṃ otāpetvā sodhetvā papphoṭetvā atiharitvā yathāpaññattaṃ paññapetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:32.3.59.eng: He should sun the floor cover, clean it, beat it, bring it back inside, and put it back as before.

pli-tv-kd1:32.3.60.pli: Mañcapaṭipādakā otāpetvā pamajjitvā atiharitvā yathāṭhāne ṭhapetabbā.
pli-tv-kd1:32.3.60.eng: He should sun the bed supports, wipe them, bring them back inside, and put them back where they were.

pli-tv-kd1:32.3.61.pli: Mañco otāpetvā sodhetvā papphoṭetvā nīcaṃ katvā sādhukaṃ appaṭighaṃsantena, asaṅghaṭṭentena kavāṭapiṭṭhaṃ, atiharitvā yathāpaññattaṃ paññapetabbo.
pli-tv-kd1:32.3.61.eng: He should sun the bed, clean it, and beat it. Holding it low, he should carefully bring it back inside without scratching it or knocking it against the door or the door frame, and he should put it back as before.

pli-tv-kd1:32.3.62.pli: Pīṭhaṃ otāpetvā sodhetvā papphoṭetvā nīcaṃ katvā sādhukaṃ appaṭighaṃsantena, asaṅghaṭṭentena kavāṭapiṭṭhaṃ, atiharitvā yathāpaññattaṃ paññapetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:32.3.62.eng: He should sun the bench, clean it, and beat it. Holding it low, he should carefully bring it back inside without scratching it or knocking it against the door or the door frame, and he should put it back as before.

pli-tv-kd1:32.3.63.pli: Bhisibibbohanaṃ otāpetvā sodhetvā papphoṭetvā atiharitvā yathāpaññattaṃ paññapetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:32.3.63.eng: He should sun the mattress and the pillow, clean them, beat them, bring them back inside, and put them back as before.

pli-tv-kd1:32.3.64.pli: Nisīdanapaccattharaṇaṃ otāpetvā sodhetvā papphoṭetvā atiharitvā yathāpaññattaṃ paññapetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:32.3.64.eng: He should sun the sitting mat and the sheet, clean them, beat them, bring them back inside, and put them back as before.

pli-tv-kd1:32.3.65.pli: Kheḷamallako otāpetvā pamajjitvā atiharitvā yathāṭhāne ṭhapetabbo.
pli-tv-kd1:32.3.65.eng: He should sun the spittoon, wipe it, bring it back inside, and put it back where it was.

pli-tv-kd1:32.3.66.pli: Apassenaphalakaṃ otāpetvā pamajjitvā atiharitvā yathāṭhāne ṭhapetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:32.3.66.eng: He should sun the leaning board, wipe it, bring it back inside, and put it back where it was.

pli-tv-kd1:32.3.67.eng: He should put away the bowl and robe.

pli-tv-kd1:32.3.68.pli: Pattaṃ nikkhipantena ekena hatthena pattaṃ gahetvā ekena hatthena heṭṭhāmañcaṃ vā heṭṭhāpīṭhaṃ vā parāmasitvā patto nikkhipitabbo.
pli-tv-kd1:32.3.68.eng: When putting away the bowl, he should hold the bowl in one hand, feel under the bed or the bench with the other, and then put it away.

pli-tv-kd1:32.3.69.pli: Na ca anantarahitāya bhūmiyā patto nikkhipitabbo.
pli-tv-kd1:32.3.69.eng: He shouldn’t put the bowl away on the bare floor.

pli-tv-kd1:32.3.70.pli: Cīvaraṃ nikkhipantena ekena hatthena cīvaraṃ gahetvā ekena hatthena cīvaravaṃsaṃ vā cīvararajjuṃ vā pamajjitvā pārato antaṃ orato bhogaṃ katvā cīvaraṃ nikkhipitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:32.3.70.eng: When putting away the robe, he should hold the robe in one hand, wipe the bamboo robe rack or the clothesline with the other, and then put it away by folding the robe over it, making the ends face the wall and the fold face out.

pli-tv-kd1:32.3.71.pli: Sace puratthimā sarajā vātā vāyanti, puratthimā vātapānā thaketabbā.
pli-tv-kd1:32.3.71.eng: If dusty winds are blowing from the east, he should close the windows on the eastern side.

pli-tv-kd1:32.3.72.pli: Sace pacchimā sarajā vātā vāyanti, pacchimā vātapānā thaketabbā.
pli-tv-kd1:32.3.72.eng: If dusty winds are blowing from the west, he should close the windows on the western side.

pli-tv-kd1:32.3.73.pli: Sace uttarā sarajā vātā vāyanti, uttarā vātapānā thaketabbā.
pli-tv-kd1:32.3.73.eng: If dusty winds are blowing from the north, he should close the windows on the northern side.

pli-tv-kd1:32.3.74.pli: Sace dakkhiṇā sarajā vātā vāyanti, dakkhiṇā vātapānā thaketabbā.
pli-tv-kd1:32.3.74.eng: If dusty winds are blowing from the south, he should close the windows on the southern side.

pli-tv-kd1:32.3.75.pli: Sace sītakālo hoti, divā vātapānā vivaritabbā, rattiṃ thaketabbā.
pli-tv-kd1:32.3.75.eng: If the weather is cold, he should open the windows during the day and close them at night.

pli-tv-kd1:32.3.76.pli: Sace uṇhakālo hoti, divā vātapānā thaketabbā, rattiṃ vivaritabbā.
pli-tv-kd1:32.3.76.eng: If the weather is hot, he should close the windows during the day and open them at night.

pli-tv-kd1:32.3.77.pli: Sace pariveṇaṃ uklāpaṃ hoti, pariveṇaṃ sammajjitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:32.3.77.eng: If the yard is dirty, he should sweep it.

pli-tv-kd1:32.3.78.pli: Sace koṭṭhako uklāpo hoti, koṭṭhako sammajjitabbo.
pli-tv-kd1:32.3.78.eng: If the gatehouse is dirty, he should sweep it.

pli-tv-kd1:32.3.79.pli: Sace upaṭṭhānasālā uklāpā hoti, upaṭṭhānasālā sammajjitabbā.
pli-tv-kd1:32.3.79.eng: If the assembly hall is dirty, he should sweep it.

pli-tv-kd1:32.3.80.pli: Sace aggisālā uklāpā hoti, aggisālā sammajjitabbā.
pli-tv-kd1:32.3.80.eng: If the water-boiling shed is dirty, he should sweep it.

pli-tv-kd1:32.3.81.pli: Sace vaccakuṭi uklāpā hoti, vaccakuṭi sammajjitabbā.
pli-tv-kd1:32.3.81.eng: If the restroom is dirty, he should sweep it.

pli-tv-kd1:32.3.82.pli: Sace pānīyaṃ na hoti, pānīyaṃ upaṭṭhāpetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:32.3.82.eng: If there is no water for drinking, he should get some.

pli-tv-kd1:32.3.83.pli: Sace paribhojanīyaṃ na hoti, paribhojanīyaṃ upaṭṭhāpetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:32.3.83.eng: If there is no water for washing, he should get some.

pli-tv-kd1:32.3.84.pli: Sace ācamanakumbhiyaṃ udakaṃ na hoti, ācamanakumbhiyā udakaṃ āsiñcitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:32.3.84.eng: If there is no water in the restroom ablutions pot, he should fill it.

pli-tv-kd1:32.3.85.1.pli: Sace ācariyassa anabhirati uppannā hoti, antevāsikena vūpakāsetabbo, vūpakāsāpetabbo, dhammakathā vāssa kātabbā.
pli-tv-kd1:32.3.85.1.eng: If the teacher becomes discontent with the spiritual life, the pupil should send him away or have him sent away, or he should give him a teaching.

pli-tv-kd1:32.3.86.pli: Sace ācariyassa kukkuccaṃ uppannaṃ hoti, antevāsikena vinodetabbaṃ, vinodāpetabbaṃ, dhammakathā vāssa kātabbā.
pli-tv-kd1:32.3.86.eng: If the teacher becomes anxious, the pupil should dispel it or have it dispelled, or he should give him a teaching.

pli-tv-kd1:32.3.87.pli: Sace ācariyassa diṭṭhigataṃ uppannaṃ hoti, antevāsikena vivecetabbaṃ, vivecāpetabbaṃ, dhammakathā vāssa kātabbā.
pli-tv-kd1:32.3.87.eng: If the teacher has wrong view, the pupil should make him give it up or have someone else do it, or he should give him a teaching.

pli-tv-kd1:32.3.88.pli: Sace ācariyo garudhammaṃ ajjhāpanno hoti parivāsāraho, antevāsikena ussukkaṃ kātabbaṃ—
pli-tv-kd1:32.3.88.eng: If the teacher has committed a heavy offense and deserves probation,

pli-tv-kd1:32.3.89.pli: kinti nu kho saṅgho ācariyassa parivāsaṃ dadeyyāti.
pli-tv-kd1:32.3.89.eng: the pupil should try to get the Sangha to give it to him.

pli-tv-kd1:32.3.90.pli: Sace ācariyo mūlāyapaṭikassanāraho hoti, antevāsikena ussukkaṃ kātabbaṃ—
pli-tv-kd1:32.3.90.eng: If the teacher has committed a heavy offense and deserves to be sent back to the beginning,

pli-tv-kd1:32.3.91.pli: kinti nu kho saṅgho ācariyaṃ mūlāya paṭikasseyyāti.
pli-tv-kd1:32.3.91.eng: the pupil should try to get the Sangha to do it.

pli-tv-kd1:32.3.92.pli: Sace ācariyo mānattāraho hoti, antevāsikena ussukkaṃ kātabbaṃ—
pli-tv-kd1:32.3.92.eng: If the teacher has committed a heavy offense and deserves the trial period,

pli-tv-kd1:32.3.93.pli: kinti nu kho saṅgho ācariyassa mānattaṃ dadeyyāti.
pli-tv-kd1:32.3.93.eng: the pupil should try to get the Sangha to give it to him.

pli-tv-kd1:32.3.94.pli: Sace ācariyo abbhānāraho hoti, antevāsikena ussukkaṃ kātabbaṃ—
pli-tv-kd1:32.3.94.eng: If the teacher has committed a heavy offense and deserves rehabilitation,

pli-tv-kd1:32.3.95.pli: kinti nu kho saṅgho ācariyaṃ abbheyyāti.
pli-tv-kd1:32.3.95.eng: the pupil should try to get the Sangha to give it to him.

pli-tv-kd1:32.3.96.pli: Sace saṅgho ācariyassa kammaṃ kattukāmo hoti, tajjanīyaṃ vā niyassaṃ vā pabbājanīyaṃ vā paṭisāraṇīyaṃ vā ukkhepanīyaṃ vā, antevāsikena ussukkaṃ kātabbaṃ—
pli-tv-kd1:32.3.96.eng: If the Sangha wants to do a legal procedure against his teacher—whether a procedure of condemnation, demotion, banishment, reconciliation, or ejection—

pli-tv-kd1:32.3.97.pli: kinti nu kho saṅgho ācariyassa kammaṃ na kareyya, lahukāya vā pariṇāmeyyāti.
pli-tv-kd1:32.3.97.eng: the pupil should make an effort to stop it or to reduce the penalty.

pli-tv-kd1:32.3.98.pli: Kataṃ vā panassa hoti saṅghena kammaṃ, tajjanīyaṃ vā niyassaṃ vā pabbājanīyaṃ vā paṭisāraṇīyaṃ vā ukkhepanīyaṃ vā, antevāsikena ussukkaṃ kātabbaṃ—
pli-tv-kd1:32.3.98.eng: But if the Sangha has already done a legal procedure against his teacher—whether a procedure of condemnation, demotion, banishment, reconciliation, or ejection—

pli-tv-kd1:32.3.99.pli: kinti nu kho ācariyo sammā vatteyya, lomaṃ pāteyya, netthāraṃ vatteyya, saṅgho taṃ kammaṃ paṭippassambheyyāti.
pli-tv-kd1:32.3.99.eng: the pupil should help the teacher conduct himself properly and suitably so as to deserve to be released, and try to get the Sangha to lift that procedure.

pli-tv-kd1:32.3.100.pli: Sace ācariyassa cīvaraṃ dhovitabbaṃ hoti, antevāsikena dhovitabbaṃ, ussukkaṃ vā kātabbaṃ—
pli-tv-kd1:32.3.100.eng: If the teacher’s robe needs washing, the pupil should do it himself,

pli-tv-kd1:32.3.101.pli: kinti nu kho ācariyassa cīvaraṃ dhoviyethāti.
pli-tv-kd1:32.3.101.eng: or he should make an effort to get it done.

pli-tv-kd1:32.3.102.pli: Sace ācariyassa cīvaraṃ kātabbaṃ hoti, antevāsikena kātabbaṃ, ussukkaṃ vā kātabbaṃ—
pli-tv-kd1:32.3.102.eng: If the teacher needs a robe, the pupil should make one himself,

pli-tv-kd1:32.3.103.pli: kinti nu kho ācariyassa cīvaraṃ kariyethāti.
pli-tv-kd1:32.3.103.eng: or he should make an effort to get one made.

pli-tv-kd1:32.3.104.pli: Sace ācariyassa rajanaṃ pacitabbaṃ hoti, antevāsikena pacitabbaṃ, ussukkaṃ vā kātabbaṃ—
pli-tv-kd1:32.3.104.eng: If the teacher needs dye, the pupil should make it himself,

pli-tv-kd1:32.3.105.pli: kinti nu kho ācariyassa rajanaṃ paciyethāti.
pli-tv-kd1:32.3.105.eng: or he should make an effort to get it made.

pli-tv-kd1:32.3.106.pli: Sace ācariyassa cīvaraṃ rajitabbaṃ hoti, antevāsikena rajitabbaṃ, ussukkaṃ vā kātabbaṃ—
pli-tv-kd1:32.3.106.eng: If the teacher’s robe needs dyeing, the pupil should do it himself,

pli-tv-kd1:32.3.107.pli: kinti nu kho ācariyassa cīvaraṃ rajiyethāti.
pli-tv-kd1:32.3.107.eng: or he should make an effort to get it done.

pli-tv-kd1:32.3.108.pli: Cīvaraṃ rajantena sādhukaṃ samparivattakaṃ samparivattakaṃ rajitabbaṃ, na ca acchinne theve pakkamitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:32.3.108.eng: When he’s dyeing the robe, he should carefully and repeatedly turn it over, and shouldn’t go away while it’s still dripping.

pli-tv-kd1:32.3.109.pli: Na ācariyaṃ anāpucchā ekaccassa patto dātabbo, na ekaccassa patto paṭiggahetabbo;
pli-tv-kd1:32.3.109.eng: Without asking his teacher for permission, he shouldn’t do any of the following: give away or receive a bowl;

pli-tv-kd1:32.3.117.eng: or have assistance provided by anyone;

pli-tv-kd1:32.3.119.eng: or get a service done by anyone;

pli-tv-kd1:32.3.120.eng: be the attendant monk for anyone

pli-tv-kd1:32.3.121.eng: or take anyone as his attendant monk;

pli-tv-kd1:32.3.123.eng: or get almsfood brought back by anyone;

pli-tv-kd1:32.3.124.pli: Na ācariyaṃ anāpucchā gāmo pavisitabbo, na susānaṃ gantabbaṃ, na disā pakkamitabbā.
pli-tv-kd1:32.3.124.eng: enter the village, go to the charnel ground, or leave for another region.

pli-tv-kd1:32.3.125.pli: Sace ācariyo gilāno hoti, yāvajīvaṃ upaṭṭhātabbo, vuṭṭhānamassa āgametabban”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:32.3.125.eng: If his teacher is sick, he should nurse him for as long as he lives, or he should wait until he’s recovered.”

pli-tv-kd1:32.3.126.eng: The proper conduct toward a teacher is finished.

pli-tv-kd1:33.1.0.eng: 19. Discussion of the proper conduct toward a pupil

pli-tv-kd1:33.1.1.eng: “And a teacher should conduct himself properly toward his pupil.

pli-tv-kd1:33.1.3.pli: Ācariyena, bhikkhave, antevāsiko saṅgahetabbo anuggahetabbo uddesena paripucchāya ovādena anusāsaniyā.
pli-tv-kd1:33.1.3.eng: A teacher should help and take care of his pupil through recitation, questioning, and instruction.

pli-tv-kd1:33.1.4.pli: Sace ācariyassa patto hoti, antevāsikassa patto na hoti, ācariyena antevāsikassa patto dātabbo, ussukkaṃ vā kātabbaṃ—
pli-tv-kd1:33.1.4.eng: If the teacher has a bowl, but not the pupil, the teacher should give it to him,
pli-tv-kd1:33.1.4.comm: According to the commentary, Sp 3.77, this should be understood in the same way as with the preceptor, for which see comment at Kd 1:26.1.4.

pli-tv-kd1:33.1.5.pli: kinti nu kho antevāsikassa patto uppajjiyethāti.
pli-tv-kd1:33.1.5.eng: or he should make an effort to get him one.

pli-tv-kd1:33.1.6.pli: Sace ācariyassa cīvaraṃ hoti, antevāsikassa cīvaraṃ na hoti, ācariyena antevāsikassa cīvaraṃ dātabbaṃ, ussukkaṃ vā kātabbaṃ—
pli-tv-kd1:33.1.6.eng: If the teacher has a robe, but not the pupil, the teacher should give it to him,

pli-tv-kd1:33.1.7.pli: kinti nu kho antevāsikassa cīvaraṃ uppajjiyethāti.
pli-tv-kd1:33.1.7.eng: or he should make an effort to get him one.

pli-tv-kd1:33.1.8.pli: Sace ācariyassa parikkhāro hoti, antevāsikassa parikkhāro na hoti, ācariyena antevāsikassa parikkhāro dātabbo, ussukkaṃ vā kātabbaṃ—
pli-tv-kd1:33.1.8.eng: If the teacher has a requisite, but not the pupil, the teacher should give it to him,

pli-tv-kd1:33.1.9.pli: kinti nu kho antevāsikassa parikkhāro uppajjiyethāti.
pli-tv-kd1:33.1.9.eng: or he should make an effort to get him one.

pli-tv-kd1:33.1.10.1.pli: Sace antevāsiko gilāno hoti, kālasseva uṭṭhāya dantakaṭṭhaṃ dātabbaṃ, mukhodakaṃ dātabbaṃ, āsanaṃ paññapetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:33.1.10.1.eng: If the pupil is sick, the teacher should get up at the appropriate time and give his pupil a tooth cleaner and water for rinsing the mouth, and he should prepare a seat for him.

pli-tv-kd1:33.1.11.pli: Sace yāgu hoti, bhājanaṃ dhovitvā yāgu upanāmetabbā.
pli-tv-kd1:33.1.11.eng: If there is congee, he should rinse a vessel and bring the congee to his pupil.

pli-tv-kd1:33.1.12.pli: Yāguṃ pītassa udakaṃ datvā bhājanaṃ paṭiggahetvā nīcaṃ katvā sādhukaṃ appaṭighaṃsantena dhovitvā paṭisāmetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:33.1.12.eng: When he has drunk the congee, the teacher should give him water and receive the vessel. Holding it low, he should wash it carefully without scratching it and then put it away.

pli-tv-kd1:33.1.13.eng: When the pupil has gotten up, the teacher should put away the seat.

pli-tv-kd1:33.1.14.pli: Sace so deso uklāpo hoti, so deso sammajjitabbo.
pli-tv-kd1:33.1.14.eng: If the place is dirty, he should sweep it.

pli-tv-kd1:33.1.15.pli: Sace antevāsiko gāmaṃ pavisitukāmo hoti, nivāsanaṃ dātabbaṃ, paṭinivāsanaṃ paṭiggahetabbaṃ, kāyabandhanaṃ dātabbaṃ, saguṇaṃ katvā saṅghāṭiyo dātabbā, dhovitvā patto sodako dātabbo.
pli-tv-kd1:33.1.15.eng: If the pupil wants to enter the village, the teacher should give him a sarong and receive the one he’s wearing in return. He should give him a belt. He should put the upper robes together, overlapping each other edge-to-edge, and then give them to him. He should rinse his pupil’s bowl and give it to him while wet.

pli-tv-kd1:33.1.16.pli: Ettāvatā nivattissatīti āsanaṃ paññapetabbaṃ, pādodakaṃ pādapīṭhaṃ pādakathalikaṃ upanikkhipitabbaṃ, paccuggantvā pattacīvaraṃ paṭiggahetabbaṃ, paṭinivāsanaṃ dātabbaṃ, nivāsanaṃ paṭiggahetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:33.1.16.eng: Before he’s due back, the teacher should prepare a seat and set out a foot stool, a foot scraper, and water for washing the feet. He should go out to meet the pupil and receive his bowl and robe. He should give him a sarong and receive the one he’s wearing in return.

pli-tv-kd1:33.1.17.pli: Sace cīvaraṃ sinnaṃ hoti, muhuttaṃ uṇhe otāpetabbaṃ, na ca uṇhe cīvaraṃ nidahitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:33.1.17.eng: If the robe is damp, he should sun it for a short while, but shouldn’t leave it in the heat.

pli-tv-kd1:33.1.19.pli: Cīvaraṃ saṅgharantena caturaṅgulaṃ kaṇṇaṃ ussāretvā cīvaraṃ saṅgharitabbaṃ—
pli-tv-kd1:33.1.19.eng: offsetting the edges by seven centimeters,

pli-tv-kd1:33.1.20.eng: so that the fold doesn’t become worn.

pli-tv-kd1:33.1.21.eng: He should place the belt in the fold.

pli-tv-kd1:33.1.22.pli: Sace piṇḍapāto hoti, antevāsiko ca bhuñjitukāmo hoti, udakaṃ datvā piṇḍapāto upanāmetabbo.
pli-tv-kd1:33.1.22.eng: If there is almsfood and his pupil wants to eat, the teacher should give him water and then the almsfood.

pli-tv-kd1:33.1.23.eng: He should ask his pupil if he wants water to drink.

pli-tv-kd1:33.1.24.pli: Bhuttāvissa udakaṃ datvā pattaṃ paṭiggahetvā nīcaṃ katvā sādhukaṃ appaṭighaṃsantena dhovitvā vodakaṃ katvā muhuttaṃ uṇhe otāpetabbo, na ca uṇhe patto nidahitabbo.
pli-tv-kd1:33.1.24.eng: When the pupil has eaten, the teacher should give him water and receive his bowl. Holding it low, he should wash it carefully without scratching it. He should then dry it and sun it for a short while, but shouldn’t leave it in the heat.

pli-tv-kd1:33.1.25.eng: The teacher should put away the robe and bowl.

pli-tv-kd1:33.1.26.pli: Pattaṃ nikkhipantena ekena hatthena pattaṃ gahetvā ekena hatthena heṭṭhāmañcaṃ vā heṭṭhāpīṭhaṃ vā parāmasitvā patto nikkhipitabbo.
pli-tv-kd1:33.1.26.eng: When putting away the bowl, he should hold the bowl in one hand, feel under the bed or the bench with the other, and then put it away.

pli-tv-kd1:33.1.27.pli: Na ca anantarahitāya bhūmiyā patto nikkhipitabbo.
pli-tv-kd1:33.1.27.eng: He shouldn’t put the bowl away on the bare floor.

pli-tv-kd1:33.1.28.pli: Cīvaraṃ nikkhipantena ekena hatthena cīvaraṃ gahetvā ekena hatthena cīvaravaṃsaṃ vā cīvararajjuṃ vā pamajjitvā pārato antaṃ orato bhogaṃ katvā cīvaraṃ nikkhipitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:33.1.28.eng: When putting away the robe, he should hold the robe in one hand, wipe the bamboo robe rack or the clothesline with the other, and then put it away by folding the robe over it, making the ends face the wall and the fold face out.

pli-tv-kd1:33.1.29.pli: Antevāsikamhi vuṭṭhite āsanaṃ uddharitabbaṃ, pādodakaṃ pādapīṭhaṃ pādakathalikaṃ paṭisāmetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:33.1.29.eng: When the pupil has gotten up, the teacher should put away the seat and also the foot stool, the foot scraper, and the water for washing the feet.

pli-tv-kd1:33.1.30.pli: Sace so deso uklāpo hoti, so deso sammajjitabbo.
pli-tv-kd1:33.1.30.eng: If the place is dirty, he should sweep it.

pli-tv-kd1:33.1.31.1.pli: Sace antevāsiko nahāyitukāmo hoti, nahānaṃ paṭiyādetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:33.1.31.1.eng: If the pupil wants to bathe, the teacher should prepare a bath.

pli-tv-kd1:33.1.32.pli: Sace sītena attho hoti, sītaṃ paṭiyādetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:33.1.32.eng: If he wants a cold bath, he should prepare that;

pli-tv-kd1:33.1.33.pli: Sace uṇhena attho hoti, uṇhaṃ paṭiyādetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:33.1.33.eng: if he wants a hot bath, he should prepare that.

pli-tv-kd1:33.1.34.pli: Sace antevāsiko jantāgharaṃ pavisitukāmo hoti, cuṇṇaṃ sannetabbaṃ, mattikā temetabbā, jantāgharapīṭhaṃ ādāya gantvā jantāgharapīṭhaṃ datvā cīvaraṃ paṭiggahetvā ekamantaṃ nikkhipitabbaṃ, cuṇṇaṃ dātabbaṃ, mattikā dātabbā.
pli-tv-kd1:33.1.34.eng: If the pupil wants to take a sauna, the teacher should knead bath powder, moisten the clay, take a sauna bench, and go to the sauna. After giving the pupil the sauna bench, receiving his robe, and putting it aside, he should give him the bath powder and the clay.

pli-tv-kd1:33.1.35.eng: If he’s able, he should enter the sauna.

pli-tv-kd1:33.1.36.pli: Jantāgharaṃ pavisantena mattikāya mukhaṃ makkhetvā purato ca pacchato ca paṭicchādetvā jantāgharaṃ pavisitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:33.1.36.eng: When entering the sauna, he should smear his face with clay, cover himself front and back, and then enter.

pli-tv-kd1:33.1.37.pli: Na ca there bhikkhū anupakhajja nisīditabbaṃ, na navā bhikkhū āsanena paṭibāhitabbā.
pli-tv-kd1:33.1.37.eng: He shouldn’t sit encroaching on the senior monks, and he shouldn’t block the junior monks from getting a seat.

pli-tv-kd1:33.1.38.eng: While in the sauna, he should provide assistance to his pupil.

pli-tv-kd1:33.1.39.pli: Jantāgharā nikkhamantena jantāgharapīṭhaṃ ādāya purato ca pacchato ca paṭicchādetvā jantāgharā nikkhamitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:33.1.39.eng: When leaving the sauna, he should take the sauna bench, cover himself front and back, and then leave.

pli-tv-kd1:33.1.40.eng: The teacher should also provide assistance to his pupil in the water.

pli-tv-kd1:33.1.41.pli: Nahātena paṭhamataraṃ uttaritvā attano gattaṃ vodakaṃ katvā nivāsetvā antevāsikassa gattato udakaṃ pamajjitabbaṃ, nivāsanaṃ dātabbaṃ, saṅghāṭi dātabbā, jantāgharapīṭhaṃ ādāya paṭhamataraṃ āgantvā āsanaṃ paññapetabbaṃ, pādodakaṃ pādapīṭhaṃ pādakathalikaṃ upanikkhipitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:33.1.41.eng: When the teacher has bathed, he should be the first to come out. He should dry himself and put on his sarong. He should then wipe the water off his pupil’s body, and he should give him his sarong and then his upper robe. Taking the sauna bench, he should be first to return. He should prepare a seat, and also set out a foot stool, a foot scraper, and water for washing the feet.

pli-tv-kd1:33.1.42.eng: He should ask his pupil if he wants water to drink.

pli-tv-kd1:33.1.43.1.pli: Yasmiṃ vihāre antevāsiko viharati, sace so vihāro uklāpo hoti, sace ussahati, sodhetabbo.
pli-tv-kd1:33.1.43.1.eng: If the dwelling where the pupil is staying is dirty, the teacher should clean it if he’s able.

pli-tv-kd1:33.1.44.pli: Vihāraṃ sodhentena paṭhamaṃ pattacīvaraṃ nīharitvā ekamantaṃ nikkhipitabbaṃ;
pli-tv-kd1:33.1.44.eng: When he’s cleaning the dwelling, he should first take out the bowl and robe and put them aside.

pli-tv-kd1:33.1.45.eng: He should take out the sitting mat and the sheet and put them aside.

pli-tv-kd1:33.1.46.eng: He should take out the mattress and the pillow and put them aside.

pli-tv-kd1:33.1.47.pli: mañco nīcaṃ katvā sādhukaṃ appaṭighaṃsantena, asaṅghaṭṭentena kavāṭapiṭṭhaṃ, nīharitvā ekamantaṃ nikkhipitabbo;
pli-tv-kd1:33.1.47.eng: Holding the bed low, he should carefully take it out without scratching it or knocking it against the door or the door frame, and he should put it aside.

pli-tv-kd1:33.1.48.pli: pīṭhaṃ nīcaṃ katvā sādhukaṃ appaṭighaṃsantena, asaṅghaṭṭentena kavāṭapiṭṭhaṃ, nīharitvā ekamantaṃ nikkhipitabbaṃ;
pli-tv-kd1:33.1.48.eng: Holding the bench low, he should carefully take it out without scratching it or knocking it against the door or the door frame, and he should put it aside.

pli-tv-kd1:33.1.49.eng: He should take out the bed supports and put them aside.

pli-tv-kd1:33.1.50.eng: He should take out the spittoon and put it aside.

pli-tv-kd1:33.1.51.eng: He should take out the leaning board and put it aside.

pli-tv-kd1:33.1.52.pli: bhūmattharaṇaṃ yathāpaññattaṃ sallakkhetvā nīharitvā ekamantaṃ nikkhipitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:33.1.52.eng: After taking note of its position, he should take out the floor cover and put it aside.

pli-tv-kd1:33.1.53.pli: Sace vihāre santānakaṃ hoti, ullokā paṭhamaṃ otāretabbaṃ, ālokasandhikaṇṇabhāgā pamajjitabbā.
pli-tv-kd1:33.1.53.eng: If the dwelling has cobwebs, he should first remove them from the ceiling cloth, and he should then wipe the windows and the corners of the room.
