pli-tv-kd1:33.1.54.pli: Sace gerukaparikammakatā bhitti kaṇṇakitā hoti, coḷakaṃ temetvā pīḷetvā pamajjitabbā.
pli-tv-kd1:33.1.54.eng: If the walls have been treated with red ocher and they’re moldy, he should moisten a cloth, wring it out, and wipe the walls.

pli-tv-kd1:33.1.55.pli: Sace kāḷavaṇṇakatā bhūmi kaṇṇakitā hoti, coḷakaṃ temetvā pīḷetvā pamajjitabbā.
pli-tv-kd1:33.1.55.eng: If the floor has been treated with a black finish and it’s moldy, he should moisten a cloth, wring it out, and wipe the floor.

pli-tv-kd1:33.1.56.pli: Sace akatā hoti bhūmi, udakena paripphositvā sammajjitabbā—
pli-tv-kd1:33.1.56.eng: If the floor is untreated, he should sprinkle it with water and then sweep it,

pli-tv-kd1:33.1.57.eng: trying to avoid stirring up dust.

pli-tv-kd1:33.1.58.eng: He should look out for any trash and discard it.

pli-tv-kd1:33.1.59.pli: Bhūmattharaṇaṃ otāpetvā sodhetvā papphoṭetvā atiharitvā yathāpaññattaṃ paññapetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:33.1.59.eng: He should sun the floor cover, clean it, beat it, bring it back inside, and put it back as before.

pli-tv-kd1:33.1.60.pli: Mañcapaṭipādakā otāpetvā pamajjitvā atiharitvā yathāṭhāne ṭhapetabbā.
pli-tv-kd1:33.1.60.eng: He should sun the bed supports, wipe them, bring them back inside, and put them back where they were.

pli-tv-kd1:33.1.61.pli: Mañco otāpetvā sodhetvā papphoṭetvā nīcaṃ katvā sādhukaṃ appaṭighaṃsantena, asaṅghaṭṭentena kavāṭapiṭṭhaṃ, atiharitvā yathāpaññattaṃ paññapetabbo.
pli-tv-kd1:33.1.61.eng: He should sun the bed, clean it, and beat it. Holding it low, he should carefully bring it back inside without scratching it or knocking it against the door or the door frame, and he should put it back as before.

pli-tv-kd1:33.1.62.pli: Pīṭhaṃ otāpetvā sodhetvā papphoṭetvā nīcaṃ katvā sādhukaṃ appaṭighaṃsantena, asaṅghaṭṭentena kavāṭapiṭṭhaṃ, atiharitvā yathāpaññattaṃ paññapetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:33.1.62.eng: He should sun the bench, clean it, and beat it. Holding it low, he should carefully bring it back inside without scratching it or knocking it against the door or the door frame, and he should put it back as before.

pli-tv-kd1:33.1.63.pli: Bhisibibbohanaṃ otāpetvā sodhetvā papphoṭetvā atiharitvā yathāpaññattaṃ paññapetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:33.1.63.eng: He should sun the mattress and the pillow, clean them, beat them, bring them back inside, and put them back as before.

pli-tv-kd1:33.1.64.pli: Nisīdanapaccattharaṇaṃ otāpetvā sodhetvā papphoṭetvā atiharitvā yathāpaññattaṃ paññapetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:33.1.64.eng: He should sun the sitting mat and the sheet, clean them, beat them, bring them back inside, and put them back as before.

pli-tv-kd1:33.1.65.pli: Kheḷamallako otāpetvā pamajjitvā atiharitvā yathāṭhāne ṭhapetabbo.
pli-tv-kd1:33.1.65.eng: He should sun the spittoon, wipe it, bring it back inside, and put it back where it was.

pli-tv-kd1:33.1.66.pli: Apassenaphalakaṃ otāpetvā pamajjitvā atiharitvā yathāṭhāne ṭhapetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:33.1.66.eng: He should sun the leaning board, wipe it, bring it back inside, and put it back where it was.

pli-tv-kd1:33.1.67.eng: He should put away the bowl and robe.

pli-tv-kd1:33.1.68.pli: Pattaṃ nikkhipantena ekena hatthena pattaṃ gahetvā ekena hatthena heṭṭhāmañcaṃ vā heṭṭhāpīṭhaṃ vā parāmasitvā patto nikkhipitabbo.
pli-tv-kd1:33.1.68.eng: When putting away the bowl, he should hold the bowl in one hand, feel under the bed or the bench with the other, and then put it away.

pli-tv-kd1:33.1.69.pli: Na ca anantarahitāya bhūmiyā patto nikkhipitabbo.
pli-tv-kd1:33.1.69.eng: He shouldn’t put the bowl away on the bare floor.

pli-tv-kd1:33.1.70.pli: Cīvaraṃ nikkhipantena ekena hatthena cīvaraṃ gahetvā ekena hatthena cīvaravaṃsaṃ vā cīvararajjuṃ vā pamajjitvā pārato antaṃ orato bhogaṃ katvā cīvaraṃ nikkhipitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:33.1.70.eng: When putting away the robe, he should hold the robe in one hand, wipe the bamboo robe rack or the clothesline with the other, and then put it away by folding the robe over it, making the ends face the wall and the fold face out.

pli-tv-kd1:33.1.71.pli: Sace puratthimā sarajā vātā vāyanti, puratthimā vātapānā thaketabbā.
pli-tv-kd1:33.1.71.eng: If dusty winds are blowing from the east, he should close the windows on the eastern side.

pli-tv-kd1:33.1.72.pli: Sace pacchimā sarajā vātā vāyanti, pacchimā vātapānā thaketabbā.
pli-tv-kd1:33.1.72.eng: If dusty winds are blowing from the west, he should close the windows on the western side.

pli-tv-kd1:33.1.73.pli: Sace uttarā sarajā vātā vāyanti, uttarā vātapānā thaketabbā.
pli-tv-kd1:33.1.73.eng: If dusty winds are blowing from the north, he should close the windows on the northern side.

pli-tv-kd1:33.1.74.pli: Sace dakkhiṇā sarajā vātā vāyanti, dakkhiṇā vātapānā thaketabbā.
pli-tv-kd1:33.1.74.eng: If dusty winds are blowing from the south, he should close the windows on the southern side.

pli-tv-kd1:33.1.75.pli: Sace sītakālo hoti, divā vātapānā vivaritabbā, rattiṃ thaketabbā.
pli-tv-kd1:33.1.75.eng: If the weather is cold, he should open the windows during the day and close them at night.

pli-tv-kd1:33.1.76.pli: Sace uṇhakālo hoti, divā vātapānā thaketabbā, rattiṃ vivaritabbā.
pli-tv-kd1:33.1.76.eng: If the weather is hot, he should close the windows during the day and open them at night.

pli-tv-kd1:33.1.77.pli: Sace pariveṇaṃ uklāpaṃ hoti, pariveṇaṃ sammajjitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:33.1.77.eng: If the yard is dirty, he should sweep it.

pli-tv-kd1:33.1.78.pli: Sace koṭṭhako uklāpo hoti, koṭṭhako sammajjitabbo.
pli-tv-kd1:33.1.78.eng: If the gatehouse is dirty, he should sweep it.

pli-tv-kd1:33.1.79.pli: Sace upaṭṭhānasālā uklāpā hoti, upaṭṭhānasālā sammajjitabbā.
pli-tv-kd1:33.1.79.eng: If the assembly hall is dirty, he should sweep it.

pli-tv-kd1:33.1.80.pli: Sace aggisālā uklāpā hoti, aggisālā sammajjitabbā.
pli-tv-kd1:33.1.80.eng: If the water-boiling shed is dirty, he should sweep it.

pli-tv-kd1:33.1.81.pli: Sace vaccakuṭi uklāpā hoti, vaccakuṭi sammajjitabbā.
pli-tv-kd1:33.1.81.eng: If the restroom is dirty, he should sweep it.

pli-tv-kd1:33.1.82.pli: Sace pānīyaṃ na hoti, pānīyaṃ upaṭṭhāpetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:33.1.82.eng: If there is no water for drinking, he should get some.

pli-tv-kd1:33.1.83.pli: Sace paribhojanīyaṃ na hoti, paribhojanīyaṃ upaṭṭhāpetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:33.1.83.eng: If there is no water for washing, he should get some.

pli-tv-kd1:33.1.84.pli: Sace ācamanakumbhiyā udakaṃ na hoti, ācamanakumbhiyā udakaṃ āsiñcitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:33.1.84.eng: If there is no water in the restroom ablutions pot, he should fill it.

pli-tv-kd1:33.1.85.1.pli: Sace antevāsikassa anabhirati uppannā hoti, ācariyena vūpakāsetabbo, vūpakāsāpetabbo, dhammakathā vāssa kātabbā.
pli-tv-kd1:33.1.85.1.eng: If the pupil becomes discontent with the spiritual life, the teacher should send him away or have him sent away, or he should give him a teaching.

pli-tv-kd1:33.1.86.pli: Sace antevāsikassa kukkuccaṃ uppannaṃ hoti, ācariyena vinodetabbaṃ, vinodāpetabbaṃ, dhammakathā vāssa kātabbā.
pli-tv-kd1:33.1.86.eng: If the pupil becomes anxious, the teacher should dispel it or have it dispelled, or he should give him a teaching.

pli-tv-kd1:33.1.87.pli: Sace antevāsikassa diṭṭhigataṃ uppannaṃ hoti, ācariyena vivecetabbaṃ, vivecāpetabbaṃ, dhammakathā vāssa kātabbā.
pli-tv-kd1:33.1.87.eng: If the pupil has wrong view, the teacher should make him give it up or have someone else do it, or he should give him a teaching.

pli-tv-kd1:33.1.88.pli: Sace antevāsiko garudhammaṃ ajjhāpanno hoti parivāsāraho, ācariyena ussukkaṃ kātabbaṃ—
pli-tv-kd1:33.1.88.eng: If the pupil has committed a heavy offense and deserves probation,

pli-tv-kd1:33.1.89.pli: kinti nu kho saṅgho, antevāsikassa parivāsaṃ dadeyyāti.
pli-tv-kd1:33.1.89.eng: the teacher should try to get the Sangha to give it to him.

pli-tv-kd1:33.1.90.pli: Sace antevāsiko mūlāyapaṭikassanāraho hoti, ācariyena ussukkaṃ kātabbaṃ—
pli-tv-kd1:33.1.90.eng: If the pupil has committed a heavy offense and deserves to be sent back to the beginning,

pli-tv-kd1:33.1.91.pli: kinti nu kho saṅgho antevāsikaṃ mūlāya paṭikasseyyāti.
pli-tv-kd1:33.1.91.eng: the teacher should try to get the Sangha to do it.

pli-tv-kd1:33.1.92.pli: Sace antevāsiko mānattāraho hoti, ācariyena ussukkaṃ kātabbaṃ—
pli-tv-kd1:33.1.92.eng: If the pupil has committed a heavy offense and deserves the trial period,

pli-tv-kd1:33.1.93.pli: kinti nu kho saṅgho antevāsikassa mānattaṃ dadeyyāti.
pli-tv-kd1:33.1.93.eng: the teacher should try to get the Sangha to give it to him.

pli-tv-kd1:33.1.94.pli: Sace antevāsiko abbhānāraho hoti, ācariyena ussukkaṃ kātabbaṃ—
pli-tv-kd1:33.1.94.eng: If the pupil has committed a heavy offense and deserves rehabilitation,

pli-tv-kd1:33.1.95.pli: kinti nu kho saṅgho antevāsikaṃ abbheyyāti.
pli-tv-kd1:33.1.95.eng: the teacher should try to get the Sangha to give it to him.

pli-tv-kd1:33.1.96.pli: Sace saṅgho antevāsikassa kammaṃ kattukāmo hoti, tajjanīyaṃ vā niyassaṃ vā pabbājanīyaṃ vā paṭisāraṇīyaṃ vā ukkhepanīyaṃ vā, ācariyena ussukkaṃ kātabbaṃ—
pli-tv-kd1:33.1.96.eng: If the Sangha wants to do a legal procedure against his pupil—whether a procedure of condemnation, demotion, banishment, reconciliation, or ejection—

pli-tv-kd1:33.1.97.pli: kinti nu kho saṅgho antevāsikassa kammaṃ na kareyya, lahukāya vā pariṇāmeyyāti.
pli-tv-kd1:33.1.97.eng: the teacher should make an effort to stop it or to reduce the penalty.

pli-tv-kd1:33.1.98.pli: Kataṃ vā panassa hoti saṅghena kammaṃ, tajjanīyaṃ vā niyassaṃ vā pabbājanīyaṃ vā paṭisāraṇīyaṃ vā ukkhepanīyaṃ vā, ācariyena ussukkaṃ kātabbaṃ—
pli-tv-kd1:33.1.98.eng: But if the Sangha has already done a legal procedure against his pupil—whether a procedure of condemnation, demotion, banishment, reconciliation, or ejection—

pli-tv-kd1:33.1.99.pli: kinti nu kho antevāsiko sammā vatteyya, lomaṃ pāteyya, netthāraṃ vatteyya, saṅgho taṃ kammaṃ paṭippassambheyyāti.
pli-tv-kd1:33.1.99.eng: the teacher should help the pupil conduct himself properly and suitably so as to deserve to be released, and try to get the Sangha to lift that procedure.

pli-tv-kd1:33.1.100.pli: Sace antevāsikassa cīvaraṃ dhovitabbaṃ hoti, ācariyena ācikkhitabbaṃ—‘evaṃ dhoveyyāsī’ti,
pli-tv-kd1:33.1.100.eng: If the pupil’s robe needs washing, the teacher should show him how to do it,

pli-tv-kd1:33.1.101.pli: ussukkaṃ vā kātabbaṃ—kinti nu kho antevāsikassa cīvaraṃ dhoviyethāti.
pli-tv-kd1:33.1.101.eng: or he should make an effort to get it done.

pli-tv-kd1:33.1.102.pli: Sace antevāsikassa cīvaraṃ kātabbaṃ hoti, ācariyena ācikkhitabbaṃ—‘evaṃ kareyyāsī’ti,
pli-tv-kd1:33.1.102.eng: If the pupil needs a robe, the teacher should show him how to make one,

pli-tv-kd1:33.1.103.pli: ussukkaṃ vā kātabbaṃ—kinti nu kho antevāsikassa cīvaraṃ kariyethāti.
pli-tv-kd1:33.1.103.eng: or he should make an effort to get one made.

pli-tv-kd1:33.1.104.pli: Sace antevāsikassa rajanaṃ pacitabbaṃ hoti, ācariyena ācikkhitabbaṃ—‘evaṃ paceyyāsī’ti,
pli-tv-kd1:33.1.104.eng: If the pupil needs dye, the teacher should show him how to make it,

pli-tv-kd1:33.1.105.pli: ussukkaṃ vā kātabbaṃ—kinti nu kho antevāsikassa rajanaṃ paciyethāti.
pli-tv-kd1:33.1.105.eng: or he should make an effort to get it made.

pli-tv-kd1:33.1.106.pli: Sace antevāsikassa cīvaraṃ rajitabbaṃ hoti, ācariyena ācikkhitabbaṃ—‘evaṃ rajeyyāsī’ti,
pli-tv-kd1:33.1.106.eng: If the pupil’s robe needs dyeing, the teacher should show him how to do it,

pli-tv-kd1:33.1.107.pli: ussukkaṃ vā kātabbaṃ—kinti nu kho antevāsikassa cīvaraṃ rajiyethāti.
pli-tv-kd1:33.1.107.eng: or he should make an effort to get it done.

pli-tv-kd1:33.1.108.pli: Cīvaraṃ rajantena sādhukaṃ samparivattakaṃ samparivattakaṃ rajitabbaṃ, na ca acchinne theve pakkamitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:33.1.108.eng: When he’s dyeing the robe, he should carefully and repeatedly turn it over, and shouldn’t go away while it’s still dripping.

pli-tv-kd1:33.1.109.pli: Sace antevāsiko gilāno hoti, yāvajīvaṃ upaṭṭhātabbo, vuṭṭhānamassa āgametabban”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:33.1.109.eng: If his pupil is sick, he should nurse him for as long as he lives, or he should wait until he’s recovered.”

pli-tv-kd1:33.1.110.eng: The proper conduct toward a pupil is finished.

pli-tv-kd1:33.1.111.eng: The sixth section for recitation is finished.

pli-tv-kd1:34.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena antevāsikā ācariyesu na sammā vattanti …pe…
pli-tv-kd1:34.1.1.eng: On a later occasion the pupils did not conduct themselves properly toward their teachers. …

pli-tv-kd1:34.1.3.pli: “na, bhikkhave, antevāsikena ācariyamhi na sammā vattitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:34.1.3.eng: “A pupil should conduct himself properly toward his teacher.

pli-tv-kd1:34.1.4.pli: Yo na sammā vatteyya, āpatti dukkaṭassā”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:34.1.4.eng: If he doesn’t, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-kd1:34.1.5.eng: They still did not conduct themselves properly.

pli-tv-kd1:34.1.7.eng: “You should dismiss one who doesn’t conduct himself properly.

pli-tv-kd1:34.1.8.eng: And this is how he should be dismissed.

pli-tv-kd1:34.1.9.pli: paṇāmemi tanti vā, māyidha paṭikkamīti vā, nīhara te pattacīvaranti vā, nāhaṃ tayā upaṭṭhātabboti vā.
pli-tv-kd1:34.1.9.eng: If the teacher conveys the following by body, by speech, or by body and speech: ‘I dismiss you;’ ‘Don’t come back here;’ ‘Remove your bowl and robe;’ or, ‘You shouldn’t attend on me’—

pli-tv-kd1:34.1.10.pli: Kāyena viññāpeti, vācāya viññāpeti, kāyena vācāya viññāpeti, paṇāmito hoti antevāsiko;
pli-tv-kd1:34.1.10.eng: then the pupil has been dismissed.

pli-tv-kd1:34.1.11.pli: na kāyena viññāpeti, na vācāya viññāpeti, na kāyena vācāya viññāpeti, na paṇāmito hoti antevāsiko”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:34.1.11.eng: If he doesn’t convey this by body, by speech, or by body and speech, then the pupil hasn’t been dismissed.”

pli-tv-kd1:34.1.12.pli: Tena kho pana samayena antevāsikā paṇāmitā na khamāpenti.
pli-tv-kd1:34.1.12.eng: Pupils who had been dismissed did not ask for forgiveness.

pli-tv-kd1:34.1.15.eng: They still did not ask for forgiveness.

pli-tv-kd1:34.1.17.eng: “One who has been dismissed should ask for forgiveness.

pli-tv-kd1:34.1.18.eng: If he doesn’t, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-kd1:34.1.19.pli: Tena kho pana samayena ācariyā khamāpiyamānā na khamanti.
pli-tv-kd1:34.1.19.eng: Teachers who were asked for forgiveness did not forgive.

pli-tv-kd1:34.1.23.eng: The pupils left, disrobed, and joined the monastics of other religions.

pli-tv-kd1:34.1.25.eng: “When asked for forgiveness, you should forgive.

pli-tv-kd1:34.1.26.eng: If you don’t, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-kd1:34.1.27.pli: Tena kho pana samayena ācariyā sammāvattantaṃ paṇāmenti, asammāvattantaṃ na paṇāmenti.
pli-tv-kd1:34.1.27.eng: Teachers dismissed pupils who were conducting themselves properly and did not dismiss those who were not.

pli-tv-kd1:34.1.29.eng: “You shouldn’t dismiss someone who is conducting himself properly.

pli-tv-kd1:34.1.30.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-kd1:34.1.31.pli: Na ca, bhikkhave, asammāvattanto na paṇāmetabbo.
pli-tv-kd1:34.1.31.eng: And you should dismiss someone who isn’t conducting himself properly.

pli-tv-kd1:34.1.32.eng: If you don’t, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-kd1:34.1.33.pli: Pañcahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgato antevāsiko paṇāmetabbo.
pli-tv-kd1:34.1.33.eng: If a pupil has five qualities, he should be dismissed:

pli-tv-kd1:34.1.34.pli: Ācariyamhi nādhimattaṃ pemaṃ hoti, nādhimatto pasādo hoti, nādhimattā hirī hoti, nādhimatto gāravo hoti, nādhimattā bhāvanā hoti—
pli-tv-kd1:34.1.34.eng: he doesn’t have much affection for his teacher; he doesn’t have much confidence in his teacher; he doesn’t have much conscience in regard to his teacher; he doesn’t have much respect for his teacher; he hasn’t developed his mind much under his teacher.

pli-tv-kd1:34.1.35.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgato antevāsiko paṇāmetabbo.

pli-tv-kd1:34.1.36.pli: Pañcahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgato antevāsiko na paṇāmetabbo.
pli-tv-kd1:34.1.36.eng: If a pupil has five qualities, he shouldn’t be dismissed:

pli-tv-kd1:34.1.37.pli: Ācariyamhi adhimattaṃ pemaṃ hoti, adhimatto pasādo hoti, adhimattā hirī hoti, adhimatto gāravo hoti, adhimattā bhāvanā hoti—
pli-tv-kd1:34.1.37.eng: he has much affection for his teacher; he has much confidence in his teacher; he has much conscience in regard to his teacher; he has much respect for his teacher; he has developed his mind much under his teacher.

pli-tv-kd1:34.1.38.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgato antevāsiko na paṇāmetabbo.

pli-tv-kd1:34.1.39.pli: Pañcahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgato antevāsiko alaṃ paṇāmetuṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:34.1.39.eng: If a pupil has five qualities, he deserves to be dismissed:

pli-tv-kd1:34.1.40.pli: Ācariyamhi nādhimattaṃ pemaṃ hoti, nādhimatto pasādo hoti, nādhimattā hirī hoti, nādhimatto gāravo hoti, nādhimattā bhāvanā hoti—
pli-tv-kd1:34.1.40.eng: he doesn’t have much affection for his teacher; he doesn’t have much confidence in his teacher; he doesn’t have much conscience in regard to his teacher; he doesn’t have much respect for his teacher; he hasn’t developed his mind much under his teacher.

pli-tv-kd1:34.1.41.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgato antevāsiko alaṃ paṇāmetuṃ.

pli-tv-kd1:34.1.42.pli: Pañcahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgato antevāsiko nālaṃ paṇāmetuṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:34.1.42.eng: If a pupil has five qualities, he doesn’t deserve to be dismissed:

pli-tv-kd1:34.1.43.pli: Ācariyamhi adhimattaṃ pemaṃ hoti, adhimatto pasādo hoti, adhimattā hirī hoti, adhimatto gāravo hoti, adhimattā bhāvanā hoti—
pli-tv-kd1:34.1.43.eng: he has much affection for his teacher; he has much confidence in his teacher; he has much conscience in regard to his teacher; he has much respect for his teacher; he has developed his mind much under his teacher.

pli-tv-kd1:34.1.44.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgato antevāsiko nālaṃ paṇāmetuṃ.

pli-tv-kd1:34.1.45.pli: Pañcahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgataṃ antevāsikaṃ appaṇāmento ācariyo sātisāro hoti, paṇāmento anatisāro hoti.
pli-tv-kd1:34.1.45.eng: If a pupil has five qualities, the teacher is at fault if he doesn’t dismiss him, but not if he does:

pli-tv-kd1:34.1.46.pli: Ācariyamhi nādhimattaṃ pemaṃ hoti, nādhimatto pasādo hoti, nādhimattā hirī hoti, nādhimatto gāravo hoti, nādhimattā bhāvanā hoti—
pli-tv-kd1:34.1.46.eng: the pupil doesn’t have much affection for his teacher; he doesn’t have much confidence in his teacher; he doesn’t have much conscience in regard to his teacher; he doesn’t have much respect for his teacher; he hasn’t developed his mind much under his teacher.

pli-tv-kd1:34.1.47.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgataṃ antevāsikaṃ appaṇāmento ācariyo sātisāro hoti, paṇāmento anatisāro hoti.

pli-tv-kd1:34.1.48.pli: Pañcahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgataṃ antevāsikaṃ paṇāmento ācariyo sātisāro hoti, appaṇāmento anatisāro hoti.
pli-tv-kd1:34.1.48.eng: If a pupil has five qualities, the teacher is at fault if he dismisses him, but not if he doesn’t:

pli-tv-kd1:34.1.49.pli: Ācariyamhi adhimattaṃ pemaṃ hoti, adhimatto pasādo hoti, adhimattā hirī hoti, adhimatto gāravo hoti, adhimattā bhāvanā hoti—
pli-tv-kd1:34.1.49.eng: the pupil has much affection for his teacher; he has much confidence in his teacher; he has much conscience in regard to his teacher; he has much respect for his teacher; he has developed his mind much under his teacher.”

pli-tv-kd1:34.1.50.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgataṃ antevāsikaṃ paṇāmento ācariyo sātisāro hoti, appaṇāmento anatisāro hotī”ti.

pli-tv-kd1:34.1.51.eng: Asking for forgiveness when dismissed is finished.

pli-tv-kd1:35.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhū, dasavassamhā dasavassamhāti, bālā abyattā nissayaṃ denti.
pli-tv-kd1:35.1.1.eng: Then, once they had ten years of seniority, ignorant and incompetent monks gave formal support.

pli-tv-kd1:35.1.2.eng: As a result there were ignorant teachers with knowledgeable pupils,

pli-tv-kd1:35.1.5.eng: and foolish teachers with wise pupils.

pli-tv-kd1:35.1.6.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-kd1:35.1.6.eng: The monks of few desires complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-kd1:35.1.7.pli: “kathañhi nāma bhikkhū—dasavassamhā dasavassamhāti—bālā abyattā nissayaṃ dassanti.
pli-tv-kd1:35.1.7.eng: “How can ignorant and incompetent monks give formal support, just because they have ten years of seniority?

pli-tv-kd1:35.1.8.pli: Dissanti ācariyā bālā antevāsikā paṇḍitā, dissanti ācariyā abyattā antevāsikā byattā, dissanti ācariyā appassutā antevāsikā bahussutā, dissanti ācariyā duppaññā antevāsikā paññavanto”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:35.1.8.eng: There are ignorant teachers with knowledgeable pupils, incompetent teachers with competent pupils, uneducated teachers with learned pupils, and foolish teachers with wise pupils.”

pli-tv-kd1:35.2.1.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ …pe…

pli-tv-kd1:35.2.2.eng: “Is it true, monks, that this is happening?”

pli-tv-kd1:35.2.8.eng: He then gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-kd1:35.2.9.eng: “An ignorant and incompetent monk shouldn’t give formal support.

pli-tv-kd1:35.2.10.eng: If he does, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-kd1:35.2.11.pli: Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, byattena bhikkhunā paṭibalena dasavassena vā atirekadasavassena vā nissayaṃ dātun”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:35.2.11.eng: I allow a competent and capable monk who has ten or more years of seniority to give formal support.”

pli-tv-kd1:35.2.12.eng: The section on the ignorant and incompetent is finished.

pli-tv-kd1:36.1.0.eng: 22. Discussion of the ending of formal support

pli-tv-kd1:36.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhū ācariyupajjhāyesu pakkantesupi vibbhantesupi kālaṅkatesupi pakkhasaṅkantesupi nissayapaṭippassaddhiyo na jānanti.
pli-tv-kd1:36.1.1.eng: At that time there were preceptors and teachers who went away, disrobed, died, or joined another religion or sect, but their pupils did not know about the ending of support.

pli-tv-kd1:36.1.3.eng: “There are these five reasons why the formal support from a preceptor comes to an end:

pli-tv-kd1:36.1.4.pli: upajjhāyo pakkanto vā hoti, vibbhanto vā, kālaṅkato vā, pakkhasaṅkanto vā, āṇattiyeva pañcamī.
pli-tv-kd1:36.1.4.eng: the preceptor goes away; the preceptor disrobes; the preceptor dies; the preceptor joins another religion or sect; or the preceptor orders it.

pli-tv-kd1:36.1.5.pli: Imā kho, bhikkhave, pañca nissayapaṭippassaddhiyo upajjhāyamhā.

pli-tv-kd1:36.1.6.eng: There are these six reasons why the formal support from a teacher comes to an end:

pli-tv-kd1:36.1.7.pli: ācariyo pakkanto vā hoti, vibbhanto vā, kālaṅkato vā, pakkhasaṅkanto vā, āṇattiyeva pañcamī, upajjhāyena vā samodhānagato hoti.
pli-tv-kd1:36.1.7.eng: the teacher goes away; the teacher disrobes; the teacher dies; the teacher joins another religion or sect; the teacher orders it; or one is reunited with one’s preceptor.”

pli-tv-kd1:36.1.8.pli: Imā kho, bhikkhave, cha nissayapaṭippassaddhiyo ācariyamhā.

pli-tv-kd1:36.1.9.eng: The discussion of the ending of formal support is finished.

pli-tv-kd1:36.2.0.eng: 23. The five requirements for giving the full ordination

pli-tv-kd1:36.2.1.pli: Pañcahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā na upasampādetabbaṃ, na nissayo dātabbo, na sāmaṇero upaṭṭhāpetabbo.
pli-tv-kd1:36.2.1.eng: “A monk who has five qualities shouldn’t give the full ordination, give formal support, or have a novice monk attend on him.

pli-tv-kd1:36.2.2.pli: Na asekkhena sīlakkhandhena samannāgato hoti, na asekkhena samādhikkhandhena samannāgato hoti, na asekkhena paññākkhandhena samannāgato hoti, na asekkhena vimuttikkhandhena samannāgato hoti, na asekkhena vimuttiñāṇadassanakkhandhena samannāgato hoti—
pli-tv-kd1:36.2.2.eng: He doesn’t have the virtue, stillness, wisdom, freedom, or knowledge and vision of freedom of one who is fully trained.

pli-tv-kd1:36.2.3.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā na upasampādetabbaṃ, na nissayo dātabbo, na sāmaṇero upaṭṭhāpetabbo.

pli-tv-kd1:36.3.1.pli: Pañcahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā upasampādetabbaṃ, nissayo dātabbo, sāmaṇero upaṭṭhāpetabbo.
pli-tv-kd1:36.3.1.eng: But a monk who has five qualities may give the full ordination, give formal support, and have a novice monk attend on him.

pli-tv-kd1:36.3.2.pli: Asekkhena sīlakkhandhena samannāgato hoti, asekkhena samādhikkhandhena samannāgato hoti, asekkhena paññākkhandhena samannāgato hoti, asekkhena vimuttikkhandhena samannāgato hoti, asekkhena vimuttiñāṇadassanakkhandhena samannāgato hoti—
pli-tv-kd1:36.3.2.eng: He has the virtue, stillness, wisdom, freedom, and knowledge and vision of freedom of one who is fully trained.

pli-tv-kd1:36.3.3.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā upasampādetabbaṃ, nissayo dātabbo, sāmaṇero upaṭṭhāpetabbo.

pli-tv-kd1:36.4.1.pli: Aparehipi, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā na upasampādetabbaṃ, na nissayo dātabbo, na sāmaṇero upaṭṭhāpetabbo.
pli-tv-kd1:36.4.1.eng: “A monk who has another five qualities shouldn’t give the full ordination, give formal support, or have a novice monk attend on him.

pli-tv-kd1:36.4.2.pli: Attanā na asekkhena sīlakkhandhena samannāgato hoti, na paraṃ asekkhe sīlakkhandhe samādapetā;
pli-tv-kd1:36.4.2.eng: He neither has it himself nor encourages others in the virtue,

pli-tv-kd1:36.4.3.pli: attanā na asekkhena samādhikkhandhena samannāgato hoti, na paraṃ asekkhe samādhikkhandhe samādapetā;

pli-tv-kd1:36.4.4.pli: attanā na asekkhena paññākkhandhena samannāgato hoti, na paraṃ asekkhe paññākkhandhe samādapetā;

pli-tv-kd1:36.4.5.pli: attanā na asekkhena vimuttikkhandhena samannāgato hoti, na paraṃ asekkhe vimuttikkhandhe samādapetā;

pli-tv-kd1:36.4.6.pli: attanā na asekkhena vimuttiñāṇadassanakkhandhena samannāgato hoti, na paraṃ asekkhe vimuttiñāṇadassanakkhandhe samādapetā—
pli-tv-kd1:36.4.6.eng: or knowledge and vision of freedom of one who is fully trained.

pli-tv-kd1:36.4.7.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā na upasampādetabbaṃ, na nissayo dātabbo, na sāmaṇero upaṭṭhāpetabbo.

pli-tv-kd1:36.5.1.pli: Pañcahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā upasampādetabbaṃ, nissayo dātabbo, sāmaṇero upaṭṭhāpetabbo.
pli-tv-kd1:36.5.1.eng: But a monk who has five qualities may give the full ordination, give formal support, and have a novice monk attend on him.

pli-tv-kd1:36.5.2.pli: Attanā asekkhena sīlakkhandhena samannāgato hoti, paraṃ asekkhe sīlakkhandhe samādapetā;
pli-tv-kd1:36.5.2.eng: He both has it himself and encourages others in the virtue,

pli-tv-kd1:36.5.3.pli: attanā asekkhena samādhikkhandhena samannāgato hoti, paraṃ asekkhe samādhikkhandhe samādapetā;

pli-tv-kd1:36.5.4.pli: attanā asekkhena paññākkhandhena samannāgato hoti, paraṃ asekkhe paññākkhandhe samādapetā;

pli-tv-kd1:36.5.5.pli: attanā asekkhena vimuttikkhandhena samannāgato hoti, paraṃ asekkhe vimuttikkhandhe samādapetā;

pli-tv-kd1:36.5.6.pli: attanā asekkhena vimuttiñāṇadassanakkhandhena samannāgato hoti, paraṃ asekkhe vimuttiñāṇadassanakkhandhe samādapetā—
pli-tv-kd1:36.5.6.eng: and knowledge and vision of freedom of one who is fully trained.

pli-tv-kd1:36.5.7.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā upasampādetabbaṃ, nissayo dātabbo, sāmaṇero upaṭṭhāpetabbo.

pli-tv-kd1:36.6.1.pli: Aparehipi, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā na upasampādetabbaṃ, na nissayo dātabbo, na sāmaṇero upaṭṭhāpetabbo.
pli-tv-kd1:36.6.1.eng: “A monk who has another five qualities shouldn’t give the full ordination, give formal support, or have a novice monk attend on him.

pli-tv-kd1:36.6.2.pli: Assaddho hoti, ahiriko hoti, anottappī hoti, kusīto hoti, muṭṭhassati hoti—
pli-tv-kd1:36.6.2.eng: He has no faith, conscience, or moral prudence; and he is lazy and absentminded.

pli-tv-kd1:36.6.3.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā na upasampādetabbaṃ, na nissayo dātabbo, na sāmaṇero upaṭṭhāpetabbo.

pli-tv-kd1:36.7.1.pli: Pañcahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā upasampādetabbaṃ, nissayo dātabbo, sāmaṇero upaṭṭhāpetabbo.
pli-tv-kd1:36.7.1.eng: But a monk who has five qualities may give the full ordination, give formal support, and have a novice monk attend on him.

pli-tv-kd1:36.7.2.pli: Saddho hoti, hirimā hoti, ottappī hoti, āraddhavīriyo hoti, upaṭṭhitassati hoti—
pli-tv-kd1:36.7.2.eng: He has faith, conscience, moral prudence, energy, and mindfulness.

pli-tv-kd1:36.7.3.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā upasampādetabbaṃ, nissayo dātabbo, sāmaṇero upaṭṭhāpetabbo.

pli-tv-kd1:36.8.1.pli: Aparehipi, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā na upasampādetabbaṃ, na nissayo dātabbo, na sāmaṇero upaṭṭhāpetabbo.
pli-tv-kd1:36.8.1.eng: “A monk who has another five qualities shouldn’t give the full ordination, give formal support, or have a novice monk attend on him.

pli-tv-kd1:36.8.2.pli: Adhisīle sīlavipanno hoti, ajjhācāre ācāravipanno hoti, atidiṭṭhiyā diṭṭhivipanno hoti, appassuto hoti, duppañño hoti—
pli-tv-kd1:36.8.2.eng: He has failed in the higher morality, in conduct, and in view; and he’s ignorant and foolish.

pli-tv-kd1:36.8.3.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā na upasampādetabbaṃ, na nissayo dātabbo, na sāmaṇero upaṭṭhāpetabbo.

pli-tv-kd1:36.9.1.pli: Pañcahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā upasampādetabbaṃ, nissayo dātabbo, sāmaṇero upaṭṭhāpetabbo.
pli-tv-kd1:36.9.1.eng: But a monk who has five qualities may give the full ordination, give formal support, and have a novice monk attend on him.

pli-tv-kd1:36.9.2.pli: Na adhisīle sīlavipanno hoti, na ajjhācāre ācāravipanno hoti, na atidiṭṭhiyā diṭṭhivipanno hoti, bahussuto hoti, paññavā hoti—
pli-tv-kd1:36.9.2.eng: He hasn’t failed in the higher morality, in conduct, or in view; he’s learned and wise.

pli-tv-kd1:36.9.3.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā upasampādetabbaṃ, nissayo dātabbo, sāmaṇero upaṭṭhāpetabbo.

pli-tv-kd1:36.10.1.pli: Aparehipi, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā na upasampādetabbaṃ, na nissayo dātabbo, na sāmaṇero upaṭṭhāpetabbo.
pli-tv-kd1:36.10.1.eng: “A monk who has another five qualities shouldn’t give the full ordination, give formal support, or have a novice monk attend on him.

pli-tv-kd1:36.10.2.pli: Na paṭibalo hoti antevāsiṃ vā saddhivihāriṃ vā gilānaṃ upaṭṭhātuṃ vā upaṭṭhāpetuṃ vā, anabhirataṃ vūpakāsetuṃ vā vūpakāsāpetuṃ vā, uppannaṃ kukkuccaṃ dhammato vinodetuṃ āpattiṃ na jānāti, āpattiyā vuṭṭhānaṃ na jānāti—
pli-tv-kd1:36.10.2.eng: He’s not capable of three things in regard to a student: to nurse him or have him nursed when he’s sick; to send him away or have him sent away when he’s discontent with the spiritual life; and to use the Teaching to dispel anxiety. And he doesn’t know the offenses; and he doesn’t know how offenses are cleared.

pli-tv-kd1:36.10.3.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā na upasampādetabbaṃ, na nissayo dātabbo, na sāmaṇero upaṭṭhāpetabbo.

pli-tv-kd1:36.11.1.pli: Pañcahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā upasampādetabbaṃ, nissayo dātabbo, sāmaṇero upaṭṭhāpetabbo.
pli-tv-kd1:36.11.1.eng: But a monk who has five qualities may give the full ordination, give formal support, and have a novice monk attend on him.

pli-tv-kd1:36.11.2.pli: Paṭibalo hoti antevāsiṃ vā saddhivihāriṃ vā gilānaṃ upaṭṭhātuṃ vā upaṭṭhāpetuṃ vā, anabhirataṃ vūpakāsetuṃ vā vūpakāsāpetuṃ vā, uppannaṃ kukkuccaṃ dhammato vinodetuṃ āpattiṃ jānāti, āpattiyā vuṭṭhānaṃ jānāti—
pli-tv-kd1:36.11.2.eng: He’s capable of three things in regard to a student: to nurse him or have him nursed when he’s sick; to send him away or have him sent away when he’s discontent with the spiritual life; and to use the Teaching to dispel anxiety. And he knows the offenses; and he knows how offenses are cleared.

pli-tv-kd1:36.11.3.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā upasampādetabbaṃ, nissayo dātabbo, sāmaṇero upaṭṭhāpetabbo.

pli-tv-kd1:36.12.1.pli: Aparehipi, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā na upasampādetabbaṃ, na nissayo dātabbo, na sāmaṇero upaṭṭhāpetabbo.
pli-tv-kd1:36.12.1.eng: “A monk who has another five qualities shouldn’t give the full ordination, give formal support, or have a novice monk attend on him.

pli-tv-kd1:36.12.2.pli: Na paṭibalo hoti antevāsiṃ vā saddhivihāriṃ vā abhisamācārikāya sikkhāya sikkhāpetuṃ, ādibrahmacariyakāya sikkhāya vinetuṃ, abhidhamme vinetuṃ, abhivinaye vinetuṃ, uppannaṃ diṭṭhigataṃ dhammato vivecetuṃ—
pli-tv-kd1:36.12.2.eng: He’s not capable of five things in regard to a student: to train him in good conduct; to train him in the basics of the spiritual life; to train him in the Teaching; to train him in the Monastic Law; to use the Teaching to make him give up wrong views.

pli-tv-kd1:36.12.3.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā na upasampādetabbaṃ, na nissayo dātabbo, na sāmaṇero upaṭṭhāpetabbo.

pli-tv-kd1:36.13.1.pli: Pañcahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā upasampādetabbaṃ, nissayo dātabbo, sāmaṇero upaṭṭhāpetabbo.
pli-tv-kd1:36.13.1.eng: But a monk who has five qualities may give the full ordination, give formal support, and have a novice monk attend on him.

pli-tv-kd1:36.13.2.pli: Paṭibalo hoti antevāsiṃ vā saddhivihāriṃ vā abhisamācārikāya sikkhāya sikkhāpetuṃ, ādibrahmacariyakāya sikkhāya vinetuṃ, abhidhamme vinetuṃ, abhivinaye vinetuṃ, uppannaṃ diṭṭhigataṃ dhammato vivecetuṃ—
pli-tv-kd1:36.13.2.eng: He’s capable of five things in regard to a student: to train him in good conduct; to train him in the basics of the spiritual life; to train him in the Teaching; to train him in the Monastic Law; to use the Teaching to make him give up wrong views.

pli-tv-kd1:36.13.3.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā upasampādetabbaṃ, nissayo dātabbo, sāmaṇero upaṭṭhāpetabbo.

pli-tv-kd1:36.14.1.pli: Aparehipi, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā na upasampādetabbaṃ, na nissayo dātabbo, na sāmaṇero upaṭṭhāpetabbo.
pli-tv-kd1:36.14.1.eng: “A monk who has another five qualities shouldn’t give the full ordination, give formal support, or have a novice monk attend on him.

pli-tv-kd1:36.14.2.pli: Āpattiṃ na jānāti, anāpattiṃ na jānāti, lahukaṃ āpattiṃ na jānāti, garukaṃ āpattiṃ na jānāti, ubhayāni kho panassa pātimokkhāni vitthārena na svāgatāni honti na suvibhattāni na suppavattīni na suvinicchitāni suttaso anubyañjanaso—
pli-tv-kd1:36.14.2.eng: He doesn’t know the offenses; he doesn’t know the non-offenses; he doesn’t know which offenses are light; he doesn’t know which offenses are heavy; neither Monastic Code has been properly learned by him in detail, and he hasn’t analyzed them well, thoroughly mastered them, or investigated them well, either in terms of the rules or their detailed exposition.

pli-tv-kd1:36.14.3.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā na upasampādetabbaṃ, na nissayo dātabbo, na sāmaṇero upaṭṭhāpetabbo.

pli-tv-kd1:36.15.1.pli: Pañcahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā upasampādetabbaṃ, nissayo dātabbo, sāmaṇero upaṭṭhāpetabbo.
pli-tv-kd1:36.15.1.eng: But a monk who has five qualities may give the full ordination, give formal support, and have a novice monk attend on him.

pli-tv-kd1:36.15.2.pli: Āpattiṃ jānāti, anāpattiṃ jānāti, lahukaṃ āpattiṃ jānāti, garukaṃ āpattiṃ jānāti, ubhayāni kho panassa pātimokkhāni vitthārena svāgatāni honti suvibhattāni suppavattīni suvinicchitāni suttaso anubyañjanaso—
pli-tv-kd1:36.15.2.eng: He knows the offenses; he knows the non-offenses; he knows which offenses are light; he knows which offenses are heavy; he has properly learned both Monastic Codes in detail, and he has analyzed them well, thoroughly mastered them, and investigated them well, both in terms of the rules and their detailed exposition.

pli-tv-kd1:36.15.3.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā upasampādetabbaṃ, nissayo dātabbo, sāmaṇero upaṭṭhāpetabbo.

pli-tv-kd1:36.16.1.pli: Aparehipi, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā na upasampādetabbaṃ, na nissayo dātabbo, na sāmaṇero upaṭṭhāpetabbo.
pli-tv-kd1:36.16.1.eng: “A monk who has another five qualities shouldn’t give the full ordination, give formal support, or have a novice monk attend on him.

pli-tv-kd1:36.16.2.pli: Āpattiṃ na jānāti, anāpattiṃ na jānāti, lahukaṃ āpattiṃ na jānāti, garukaṃ āpattiṃ na jānāti, ūnadasavasso hoti—
pli-tv-kd1:36.16.2.eng: He doesn’t know the offenses; he doesn’t know the non-offenses; he doesn’t know which offenses are light; he doesn’t know which offenses are heavy; he has less than ten years of seniority.

pli-tv-kd1:36.16.3.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā na upasampādetabbaṃ, na nissayo dātabbo, na sāmaṇero upaṭṭhāpetabbo.

pli-tv-kd1:36.17.1.pli: Pañcahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā upasampādetabbaṃ, nissayo dātabbo, sāmaṇero upaṭṭhāpetabbo.
pli-tv-kd1:36.17.1.eng: But a monk who has five qualities may give the full ordination, give formal support, and have a novice monk attend on him.

pli-tv-kd1:36.17.2.pli: Āpattiṃ jānāti, anāpattiṃ jānāti, lahukaṃ āpattiṃ jānāti, garukaṃ āpattiṃ jānāti, dasavasso vā hoti atirekadasavasso vā—
pli-tv-kd1:36.17.2.eng: He knows the offenses; he knows the non-offenses; he knows which offenses are light; he knows which offenses are heavy; he has ten or more years of seniority.”

pli-tv-kd1:36.17.3.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā upasampādetabbaṃ, nissayo dātabbo, sāmaṇero upaṭṭhāpetabbo”ti.

pli-tv-kd1:36.17.4.eng: The section consisting of sixteen groups of five requirements for giving the full ordination is finished.

pli-tv-kd1:37.1.0.eng: 24. The six requirements for giving the full ordination

pli-tv-kd1:37.1.1.pli: “Chahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā na upasampādetabbaṃ, na nissayo dātabbo, na sāmaṇero upaṭṭhāpetabbo.
pli-tv-kd1:37.1.1.eng: “A monk who has six qualities shouldn’t give the full ordination, give formal support, or have a novice monk attend on him.

pli-tv-kd1:37.1.2.pli: Na asekkhena sīlakkhandhena samannāgato hoti, na asekkhena samādhikkhandhena samannāgato hoti, na asekkhena paññākkhandhena samannāgato hoti, na asekkhena vimuttikkhandhena samannāgato hoti, na asekkhena vimuttiñāṇadassanakkhandhena samannāgato hoti, ūnadasavasso hoti—
pli-tv-kd1:37.1.2.eng: He doesn’t have the virtue, stillness, wisdom, freedom, or knowledge and vision of freedom of one who is fully trained, and he has less than ten years of seniority.

pli-tv-kd1:37.1.3.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, chahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā na upasampādetabbaṃ, na nissayo dātabbo, na sāmaṇero upaṭṭhāpetabbo.

pli-tv-kd1:37.2.1.pli: Chahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā upasampādetabbaṃ, nissayo dātabbo, sāmaṇero upaṭṭhāpetabbo.
pli-tv-kd1:37.2.1.eng: But a monk who has six qualities may give the full ordination, give formal support, and have a novice monk attend on him.

pli-tv-kd1:37.2.2.pli: Asekkhena sīlakkhandhena samannāgato hoti, asekkhena samādhikkhandhena samannāgato hoti, asekkhena paññākkhandhena samannāgato hoti, asekkhena vimuttikkhandhena samannāgato hoti, asekkhena vimuttiñāṇadassanakkhandhena samannāgato hoti, dasavasso vā hoti atirekadasavasso vā—
pli-tv-kd1:37.2.2.eng: He has the virtue, stillness, wisdom, freedom, and knowledge and vision of freedom of one who is fully trained, and he has ten or more years of seniority.

pli-tv-kd1:37.2.3.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, chahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā upasampādetabbaṃ, nissayo dātabbo, sāmaṇero upaṭṭhāpetabbo.

pli-tv-kd1:37.3.1.pli: Aparehipi, bhikkhave, chahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā na upasampādetabbaṃ, na nissayo dātabbo, na sāmaṇero upaṭṭhāpetabbo.
pli-tv-kd1:37.3.1.eng: “A monk who has another six qualities shouldn’t give the full ordination, give formal support, or have a novice monk attend on him.

pli-tv-kd1:37.3.2.pli: Attanā na asekkhena sīlakkhandhena samannāgato hoti, na paraṃ asekkhe sīlakkhandhe samādapetā;
pli-tv-kd1:37.3.2.eng: He neither has it himself nor encourages others in the virtue,

pli-tv-kd1:37.3.3.pli: attanā na asekkhena samādhikkhandhena samannāgato hoti, na paraṃ asekkhe samādhikkhandhe samādapetā;

pli-tv-kd1:37.3.4.pli: attanā na asekkhena paññākkhandhena samannāgato hoti, na paraṃ asekkhe paññākkhandhe samādapetā;

pli-tv-kd1:37.3.5.pli: attanā na asekkhena vimuttikkhandhena samannāgato hoti, na paraṃ asekkhe vimuttikkhandhe samādapetā;

pli-tv-kd1:37.3.6.pli: attanā na asekkhena vimuttiñāṇadassanakkhandhena samannāgato hoti, na paraṃ asekkhe vimuttiñāṇadassanakkhandhe samādapetā;
pli-tv-kd1:37.3.6.eng: or knowledge and vision of freedom of one who is fully trained,

pli-tv-kd1:37.3.7.eng: and he has less than ten years of seniority.

pli-tv-kd1:37.3.8.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, chahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā na upasampādetabbaṃ, na nissayo dātabbo, na sāmaṇero upaṭṭhāpetabbo.

pli-tv-kd1:37.4.1.pli: Chahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā upasampādetabbaṃ, nissayo dātabbo, sāmaṇero upaṭṭhāpetabbo.
pli-tv-kd1:37.4.1.eng: But a monk who has six qualities may give the full ordination, give formal support, and have a novice monk attend on him.

pli-tv-kd1:37.4.2.pli: Attanā asekkhena sīlakkhandhena samannāgato hoti, paraṃ asekkhe sīlakkhandhe samādapetā attanā asekkhena samādhikkhandhena samannāgato hoti, paraṃ asekkhe samādhikkhandhe samādapetā.
pli-tv-kd1:37.4.2.eng: He both has it himself and encourages others in the virtue, stillness,

pli-tv-kd1:37.4.3.pli: Attanā asekkhena paññākkhandhena samannāgato hoti, paraṃ asekkhe paññākkhandhe samādapetā.

pli-tv-kd1:37.4.4.pli: Attanā asekkhena vimuttikkhandhena samannāgato hoti, paraṃ asekkhe vimuttikkhandhe samādapetā.

pli-tv-kd1:37.4.5.pli: Attanā asekkhena vimuttiñāṇadassanakkhandhena samannāgato hoti, paraṃ asekkhe vimuttiñāṇadassanakkhandhe samādapetā;
pli-tv-kd1:37.4.5.eng: and knowledge and vision of freedom of one who is fully trained,

pli-tv-kd1:37.4.6.eng: and he has ten or more years of seniority.

pli-tv-kd1:37.4.7.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, chahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā upasampādetabbaṃ, nissayo dātabbo, sāmaṇero upaṭṭhāpetabbo.

pli-tv-kd1:37.5.1.pli: Aparehipi, bhikkhave, chahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā na upasampādetabbaṃ, na nissayo dātabbo, na sāmaṇero upaṭṭhāpetabbo.
pli-tv-kd1:37.5.1.eng: “A monk who has another six qualities shouldn’t give the full ordination, give formal support, or have a novice monk attend on him.

pli-tv-kd1:37.5.2.pli: Assaddho hoti, ahiriko hoti, anottappī hoti, kusīto hoti, muṭṭhassati hoti, ūnadasavasso hoti—
pli-tv-kd1:37.5.2.eng: He has no faith, conscience, or moral prudence; he is lazy and absentminded; and he has less than ten years of seniority.

pli-tv-kd1:37.5.3.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, chahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā na upasampādetabbaṃ, na nissayo dātabbo, na sāmaṇero upaṭṭhāpetabbo.

pli-tv-kd1:37.6.1.pli: Chahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā upasampādetabbaṃ, nissayo dātabbo, sāmaṇero upaṭṭhāpetabbo.
pli-tv-kd1:37.6.1.eng: But a monk who has six qualities may give the full ordination, give formal support, and have a novice monk attend on him.

pli-tv-kd1:37.6.2.pli: Saddho hoti, hirimā hoti, ottappī hoti, āraddhavīriyo hoti, upaṭṭhitassati hoti, dasavasso vā hoti atirekadasavasso vā—
pli-tv-kd1:37.6.2.eng: He has faith, conscience, moral prudence, energy, mindfulness, and ten or more years of seniority.

pli-tv-kd1:37.6.3.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, chahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā upasampādetabbaṃ, nissayo dātabbo, sāmaṇero upaṭṭhāpetabbo.

pli-tv-kd1:37.7.1.pli: Aparehipi, bhikkhave, chahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā na upasampādetabbaṃ, na nissayo dātabbo, na sāmaṇero upaṭṭhāpetabbo.
pli-tv-kd1:37.7.1.eng: “A monk who has another six qualities shouldn’t give the full ordination, give formal support, or have a novice monk attend on him.

pli-tv-kd1:37.7.2.pli: Adhisīle sīlavipanno hoti, ajjhācāre ācāravipanno hoti, atidiṭṭhiyā diṭṭhivipanno hoti, appassuto hoti, duppañño hoti, ūnadasavasso hoti—
pli-tv-kd1:37.7.2.eng: He has failed in the higher morality, in conduct, and in view; he’s ignorant and foolish; and he has less than ten years of seniority.

pli-tv-kd1:37.7.3.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, chahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā na upasampādetabbaṃ, na nissayo dātabbo, na sāmaṇero upaṭṭhāpetabbo.

pli-tv-kd1:37.8.1.pli: Chahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā upasampādetabbaṃ, nissayo dātabbo, sāmaṇero upaṭṭhāpetabbo.
pli-tv-kd1:37.8.1.eng: But a monk who has six qualities may give the full ordination, give formal support, and have a novice monk attend on him.

pli-tv-kd1:37.8.2.pli: Na adhisīle sīlavipanno hoti, na ajjhācāre ācāravipanno hoti, na atidiṭṭhiyā diṭṭhivipanno hoti, bahussuto hoti, paññavā hoti, dasavasso vā hoti atirekadasavasso vā—
pli-tv-kd1:37.8.2.eng: He hasn’t failed in the higher morality, in conduct, or in view; he’s learned and wise; and he has ten or more years of seniority.

pli-tv-kd1:37.8.3.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, chahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā upasampādetabbaṃ, nissayo dātabbo, sāmaṇero upaṭṭhāpetabbo.

pli-tv-kd1:37.9.1.pli: Aparehipi, bhikkhave, chahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā na upasampādetabbaṃ, na nissayo dātabbo, na sāmaṇero upaṭṭhāpetabbo.
pli-tv-kd1:37.9.1.eng: “A monk who has another six qualities shouldn’t give the full ordination, give formal support, or have a novice monk attend on him.

pli-tv-kd1:37.9.2.pli: Na paṭibalo hoti antevāsiṃ vā saddhivihāriṃ vā gilānaṃ upaṭṭhātuṃ vā upaṭṭhāpetuṃ vā, anabhirataṃ vūpakāsetuṃ vā vūpakāsāpetuṃ vā, uppannaṃ kukkuccaṃ dhammato vinodetuṃ, āpattiṃ na jānāti, āpattiyā vuṭṭhānaṃ na jānāti, ūnadasavasso hoti—
pli-tv-kd1:37.9.2.eng: He’s not capable of three things in regard to a student: to nurse him or have him nursed when he’s sick; to send him away or have him sent away when he’s discontent with the spiritual life; to use the Teaching to dispel anxiety. And he doesn’t know the offenses; he doesn’t know how offenses are cleared; and he has less than ten years of seniority.

pli-tv-kd1:37.9.3.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, chahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā na upasampādetabbaṃ, na nissayo dātabbo, na sāmaṇero upaṭṭhāpetabbo.

pli-tv-kd1:37.10.1.pli: Chahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā upasampādetabbaṃ, nissayo dātabbo, sāmaṇero upaṭṭhāpetabbo.
pli-tv-kd1:37.10.1.eng: But a monk who has six qualities may give the full ordination, give formal support, and have a novice monk attend on him.

pli-tv-kd1:37.10.2.pli: Paṭibalo hoti antevāsiṃ vā saddhivihāriṃ vā gilānaṃ upaṭṭhātuṃ vā upaṭṭhāpetuṃ vā, anabhirataṃ vūpakāsetuṃ vā vūpakāsāpetuṃ vā, uppannaṃ kukkuccaṃ dhammato vinodetuṃ, āpattiṃ jānāti, āpattiyā vuṭṭhānaṃ jānāti, dasavasso vā hoti atirekadasavasso vā—
pli-tv-kd1:37.10.2.eng: He’s capable of three things in regard to a student: to nurse him or have him nursed when he’s sick; to send him away or have him sent away when he’s discontent with the spiritual life; to use the Teaching to dispel anxiety. And he knows the offenses; he knows how offenses are cleared; and he has ten or more years of seniority.

pli-tv-kd1:37.10.3.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, chahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā upasampādetabbaṃ, nissayo dātabbo, sāmaṇero upaṭṭhāpetabbo.

pli-tv-kd1:37.11.1.pli: Aparehipi, bhikkhave, chahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā na upasampādetabbaṃ, na nissayo dātabbo, na sāmaṇero upaṭṭhāpetabbo.
pli-tv-kd1:37.11.1.eng: “A monk who has another six qualities shouldn’t give the full ordination, give formal support, or have a novice monk attend on him.

pli-tv-kd1:37.11.2.pli: Na paṭibalo hoti antevāsiṃ vā saddhivihāriṃ vā abhisamācārikāya sikkhāya sikkhāpetuṃ, ādibrahmacariyakāya sikkhāya vinetuṃ, abhidhamme vinetuṃ, abhivinaye vinetuṃ, uppannaṃ diṭṭhigataṃ dhammato vivecetuṃ, ūnadasavasso hoti—
pli-tv-kd1:37.11.2.eng: He’s not capable of five things in regard to a student: to train him in good conduct; to train him in the basics of the spiritual life; to train him in the Teaching; to train him in the Monastic Law; or to use the Teaching to make him give up wrong views. And he has less than ten years of seniority.

pli-tv-kd1:37.11.3.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, chahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā na upasampādetabbaṃ, na nissayo dātabbo, na sāmaṇero upaṭṭhāpetabbo.

pli-tv-kd1:37.12.1.pli: Chahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā upasampādetabbaṃ, nissayo dātabbo, sāmaṇero upaṭṭhāpetabbo.
pli-tv-kd1:37.12.1.eng: But a monk who has six qualities may give the full ordination, give formal support, and have a novice monk attend on him.

pli-tv-kd1:37.12.2.pli: Paṭibalo hoti antevāsiṃ vā saddhivihāriṃ vā abhisamācārikāya sikkhāya sikkhāpetuṃ ādibrahmacariyakāya sikkhāya vinetuṃ, abhidhamme vinetuṃ, abhivinaye vinetuṃ, uppannaṃ diṭṭhigataṃ dhammato vivecetuṃ, dasavasso vā hoti atirekadasavasso vā—
pli-tv-kd1:37.12.2.eng: He’s capable of five things in regard to a student: to train him in good conduct; to train him in the basics of the spiritual life; to train him in the Teaching; to train him in the Monastic Law; and to use the Teaching to make him give up wrong views. And he has ten or more years of seniority.

pli-tv-kd1:37.12.3.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, chahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā upasampādetabbaṃ, nissayo dātabbo, sāmaṇero upaṭṭhāpetabbo.

pli-tv-kd1:37.13.1.pli: Aparehipi, bhikkhave, chahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā na upasampādetabbaṃ, na nissayo dātabbo, na sāmaṇero upaṭṭhāpetabbo.
pli-tv-kd1:37.13.1.eng: “A monk who has another six qualities shouldn’t give the full ordination, give formal support, or have a novice monk attend on him.

pli-tv-kd1:37.13.2.pli: Āpattiṃ na jānāti, anāpattiṃ na jānāti, lahukaṃ āpattiṃ na jānāti, garukaṃ āpattiṃ na jānāti, ubhayāni kho panassa pātimokkhāni vitthārena na svāgatāni honti na suvibhattāni na suppavattīni na suvinicchitāni suttaso anubyañjanaso, ūnadasavasso hoti—
pli-tv-kd1:37.13.2.eng: He doesn’t know the offenses; he doesn’t know the non-offenses; he doesn’t know which offenses are light; he doesn’t know which offenses are heavy; neither Monastic Code has been properly learned by him in detail, and he hasn’t analyzed them well, thoroughly mastered them, or investigated them well, either in terms of the rules or their detailed exposition; he has less than ten years of seniority.

pli-tv-kd1:37.13.3.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, chahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā na upasampādetabbaṃ, na nissayo dātabbo, na sāmaṇero upaṭṭhāpetabbo.

pli-tv-kd1:37.14.1.pli: Chahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā upasampādetabbaṃ, nissayo dātabbo, sāmaṇero upaṭṭhāpetabbo.
pli-tv-kd1:37.14.1.eng: But a monk who has six qualities may give the full ordination, give formal support, and have a novice monk attend on him.

pli-tv-kd1:37.14.2.pli: Āpattiṃ jānāti, anāpattiṃ jānāti, lahukaṃ āpattiṃ jānāti, garukaṃ āpattiṃ jānāti, ubhayāni kho panassa pātimokkhāni vitthārena svāgatāni honti suvibhattāni suppavattīni suvinicchitāni suttaso anubyañjanaso, dasavasso vā hoti atirekadasavasso vā—
pli-tv-kd1:37.14.2.eng: He knows the offenses; he knows the non-offenses; he knows which offenses are light; he knows which offenses are heavy; he has properly learned both Monastic Codes in detail, and he has analyzed them well, thoroughly mastered them, and investigated them well, both in terms of the rules and their detailed exposition; he has ten or more years of seniority.”

pli-tv-kd1:37.14.3.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, chahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā upasampādetabbaṃ, nissayo dātabbo, sāmaṇero upaṭṭhāpetabbo”ti.

pli-tv-kd1:37.14.4.eng: The section consisting of fourteen groups of six requirements for giving the full ordination is finished.

pli-tv-kd1:38.1.0.eng: 25. Discussion on those who have been monastics of another religion

pli-tv-kd1:38.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena yo so aññatitthiyapubbo upajjhāyena sahadhammikaṃ vuccamāno upajjhāyassa vādaṃ āropetvā taṃyeva titthāyatanaṃ saṅkami.
pli-tv-kd1:38.1.1.eng: Soon afterwards that monk who had been a monastic of another religion, and who had returned to that religious community after refuting his preceptor,

pli-tv-kd1:38.1.2.pli: So puna paccāgantvā bhikkhū upasampadaṃ yāci.
pli-tv-kd1:38.1.2.eng: came back to the monks and asked for the full ordination.

pli-tv-kd1:38.1.4.pli: “Yo so, bhikkhave, aññatitthiyapubbo upajjhāyena sahadhammikaṃ vuccamāno upajjhāyassa vādaṃ āropetvā taṃyeva titthāyatanaṃ saṅkanto, so āgato na upasampādetabbo.
pli-tv-kd1:38.1.4.eng: “Monks, when someone who has been a monastic of another religion refutes his preceptor after being legitimately corrected by him and then returns to that religion, but then comes back from that religious community once more, he shouldn’t be given the full ordination.

pli-tv-kd1:38.1.5.pli: Yo so, bhikkhave, aññopi aññatitthiyapubbo imasmiṃ dhammavinaye ākaṅkhati pabbajjaṃ, ākaṅkhati upasampadaṃ, tassa cattāro māse parivāso dātabbo.
pli-tv-kd1:38.1.5.eng: Anyone else who has been a monastic of another religion, and who wants the going forth and the full ordination on this spiritual path, should be given four months of probation.

pli-tv-kd1:38.2.1.eng: And it should be given like this.

pli-tv-kd1:38.2.2.pli: paṭhamaṃ kesamassuṃ ohārāpetvā kāsāyāni vatthāni acchādāpetvā ekaṃsaṃ uttarāsaṅgaṃ kārāpetvā bhikkhūnaṃ pāde vandāpetvā ukkuṭikaṃ nisīdāpetvā añjaliṃ paggaṇhāpetvā ‘evaṃ vadehī’ti vattabbo—
pli-tv-kd1:38.2.2.eng: First he should shave off his hair and beard and put on the ocher robes. He should then arrange his upper robe over one shoulder, pay respect at the feet of the monks, squat on his heels, and raise his joined palms. He should then be told to say this:

pli-tv-kd1:38.2.3.eng: ‘I go for refuge to the Buddha,

pli-tv-kd1:38.2.4.eng: I go for refuge to the Teaching,

pli-tv-kd1:38.2.5.eng: I go for refuge to the Sangha.

pli-tv-kd1:38.2.6.eng: For the second time, I go for refuge to the Buddha,

pli-tv-kd1:38.2.7.eng: For the second time, I go for refuge to the Teaching,

pli-tv-kd1:38.2.8.eng: For the second time, I go for refuge to the Sangha.

pli-tv-kd1:38.2.9.eng: For the third time, I go for refuge to the Buddha,

pli-tv-kd1:38.2.10.eng: For the third time, I go for refuge to the Teaching,

pli-tv-kd1:38.2.11.eng: For the third time, I go for refuge to the Sangha.’

pli-tv-kd1:38.3.1.pli: Tena, bhikkhave, aññatitthiyapubbena saṅghaṃ upasaṅkamitvā ekaṃsaṃ uttarāsaṅgaṃ karitvā bhikkhūnaṃ pāde vanditvā ukkuṭikaṃ nisīditvā añjaliṃ paggahetvā evamassa vacanīyo—
pli-tv-kd1:38.3.1.eng: Then, after approaching the Sangha, he who had been a monastic of another religion should arrange his upper robe over one shoulder, pay respect at the feet of the monks, squat on his heels, and raise his joined palms. He should then say this:

pli-tv-kd1:38.3.2.pli: ‘ahaṃ, bhante, aññatitthiyapubbo imasmiṃ dhammavinaye ākaṅkhāmi upasampadaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:38.3.2.eng: ‘Venerables, I have been a monastic of another religion, and I wish for the full ordination on this spiritual path.

pli-tv-kd1:38.3.3.pli: Sohaṃ, bhante, saṅghaṃ cattāro māse parivāsaṃ yācāmī’ti.
pli-tv-kd1:38.3.3.eng: I ask the Sangha for four months of probation.’

pli-tv-kd1:38.3.4.eng: And he should ask a second

pli-tv-kd1:38.3.6.eng: A competent and capable monk should then inform the Sangha:

pli-tv-kd1:38.3.7.eng: ‘Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd1:38.3.8.pli: Ayaṃ itthannāmo aññatitthiyapubbo imasmiṃ dhammavinaye ākaṅkhati upasampadaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:38.3.8.eng: So-and-so, who has been a monastic of another religion, wants the full ordination on this spiritual path.

pli-tv-kd1:38.3.9.pli: So saṅghaṃ cattāro māse parivāsaṃ yācati.
pli-tv-kd1:38.3.9.eng: He is asking the Sangha for four months of probation.

pli-tv-kd1:38.3.10.pli: Yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṃ saṅgho itthannāmassa aññatitthiyapubbassa cattāro māse parivāsaṃ dadeyya.
pli-tv-kd1:38.3.10.eng: If the Sangha is ready, it should give four months of probation to so-and-so, who has been a monastic of another religion.

pli-tv-kd1:38.4.1.eng: Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd1:38.4.2.pli: Ayaṃ itthannāmo aññatitthiyapubbo imasmiṃ dhammavinaye ākaṅkhati upasampadaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:38.4.2.eng: So-and-so, who has been a monastic of another religion, wants the full ordination on this spiritual path.

pli-tv-kd1:38.4.3.pli: So saṅghaṃ cattāro māse parivāsaṃ yācati.
pli-tv-kd1:38.4.3.eng: He is asking the Sangha for four months of probation.

pli-tv-kd1:38.4.4.pli: Saṅgho itthannāmassa aññatitthiyapubbassa cattāro māse parivāsaṃ deti.
pli-tv-kd1:38.4.4.eng: The Sangha gives four months of probation to so-and-so, who has been a monastic of another religion.

pli-tv-kd1:38.4.5.pli: Yassāyasmato khamati itthannāmassa aññatitthiyapubbassa cattāro māse parivāsassa dānaṃ, so tuṇhassa;
pli-tv-kd1:38.4.5.eng: Any monk who approves of giving four months of probation to so-and-so, who has been a monastic of another religion, should remain silent.

pli-tv-kd1:38.4.6.eng: Any monk who doesn’t approve should speak up.

pli-tv-kd1:38.4.7.pli: Dinno saṅghena itthannāmassa aññatitthiyapubbassa cattāro māse parivāso.
pli-tv-kd1:38.4.7.eng: The Sangha has given so-and-so, who has been a monastic of another religion, four months of probation.

pli-tv-kd1:38.4.8.pli: Khamati saṅghassa, tasmā tuṇhī, evametaṃ dhārayāmī’ti.
pli-tv-kd1:38.4.8.eng: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent. I’ll remember it thus.’

pli-tv-kd1:38.5.1.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, aññatitthiyapubbo ārādhako hoti, evaṃ anārādhako.

pli-tv-kd1:38.5.2.eng: And this is how someone who has been a monastic of another religion fails his probation:

pli-tv-kd1:38.5.3.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, aññatitthiyapubbo atikālena gāmaṃ pavisati, atidivā paṭikkamati.
pli-tv-kd1:38.5.3.eng: He enters the village too early and returns too late in the day.

pli-tv-kd1:38.5.5.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, aññatitthiyapubbo vesiyāgocaro vā hoti, vidhavāgocaro vā hoti, thullakumārikāgocaro vā hoti, paṇḍakagocaro vā hoti, bhikkhunigocaro vā hoti.
pli-tv-kd1:38.5.5.eng: He regularly associates with sex workers, widows, single women, paṇḍakas, and nuns.
pli-tv-kd1:38.5.5.comm: Sp-ṭ 3.87: Vesiyā gocaro mittasanthavavasena upasaṅkamitabbaṭṭhānaṁ assāti vesiyāgocaro. Esa nayo sabbattha, “Vesiyāgocaro: association with sex workers; the place to be approached by him for intimacy or friendship. This method applies to all (five groups).”

pli-tv-kd1:38.6.1.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, aññatitthiyapubbo yāni tāni sabrahmacārīnaṃ uccāvacāni karaṇīyāni, tattha na dakkho hoti, na analaso, na tatrupāyāya vīmaṃsāya samannāgato, na alaṃ kātuṃ, na alaṃ saṃvidhātuṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:38.6.1.eng: He’s not skilled or diligent in the various duties of his fellow monastics, and he lacks the proper judgment to organize and perform them well.

pli-tv-kd1:38.6.3.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, aññatitthiyapubbo na tibbacchando hoti uddese, paripucchāya, adhisīle, adhicitte, adhipaññāya.
pli-tv-kd1:38.6.3.eng: He doesn’t have a keen desire for recitation, for questioning, for the higher morality, for the higher mind, or for the higher wisdom.

pli-tv-kd1:38.7.1.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, aññatitthiyapubbo yassa titthāyatanā saṅkanto hoti, tassa satthuno tassa diṭṭhiyā tassa khantiyā tassa ruciyā tassa ādāyassa avaṇṇe bhaññamāne kupito hoti anattamano anabhiraddho, buddhassa vā dhammassa vā saṅghassa vā avaṇṇe bhaññamāne attamano hoti udaggo abhiraddho.
pli-tv-kd1:38.7.1.eng: He’s displeased when anyone disparages the teacher, the views, the beliefs, the persuasion, or the opinions of the religious community he’s left; but he’s pleased when anyone disparages the Buddha, the Teaching, or the Sangha.

pli-tv-kd1:38.7.2.pli: Yassa vā pana titthāyatanā saṅkanto hoti, tassa satthuno tassa diṭṭhiyā tassa khantiyā tassa ruciyā tassa ādāyassa vaṇṇe bhaññamāne attamano hoti udaggo abhiraddho, buddhassa vā dhammassa vā saṅghassa vā vaṇṇe bhaññamāne kupito hoti anattamano anabhiraddho.
pli-tv-kd1:38.7.2.eng: He’s pleased when anyone praises the teacher, the views, the beliefs, the persuasion, or the opinions of the religious community he’s left; but he’s displeased when anyone praises the Buddha, the Teaching, or the Sangha.

pli-tv-kd1:38.7.3.eng: This last one is the critical factor for someone who has been a monastic of another religion to fail his probation.

pli-tv-kd1:38.7.4.pli: Evampi kho, bhikkhave, aññatitthiyapubbo anārādhako hoti.

pli-tv-kd1:38.7.5.pli: Evaṃ anārādhako kho, bhikkhave, aññatitthiyapubbo āgato na upasampādetabbo.
pli-tv-kd1:38.7.5.eng: When he fails in this way, he shouldn’t be given the full ordination.

pli-tv-kd1:38.8.1.eng: And this is how someone who has been a monastic of another religion passes his probation:

pli-tv-kd1:38.8.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, aññatitthiyapubbo nātikālena gāmaṃ pavisati nātidivā paṭikkamati.
pli-tv-kd1:38.8.2.eng: He doesn’t enter the village too early or return too late in the day.

pli-tv-kd1:38.8.4.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, aññatitthiyapubbo na vesiyāgocaro hoti, na vidhavāgocaro hoti, na thullakumārikāgocaro hoti, na paṇḍakagocaro hoti, na bhikkhunigocaro hoti.
pli-tv-kd1:38.8.4.eng: He doesn’t regularly associate with sex workers, widows, single women, paṇḍakas, or nuns.

pli-tv-kd1:38.9.1.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, aññatitthiyapubbo yāni tāni sabrahmacārīnaṃ uccāvacāni karaṇīyāni, tattha dakkho hoti, analaso, tatrupāyāya vīmaṃsāya samannāgato, alaṃ kātuṃ, alaṃ saṃvidhātuṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:38.9.1.eng: He’s skilled and diligent in the various duties of his fellow monastics, and he has the proper judgment to organize and perform them well.

pli-tv-kd1:38.9.3.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, aññatitthiyapubbo tibbacchando hoti uddese, paripucchāya, adhisīle, adhicitte, adhipaññāya.
pli-tv-kd1:38.9.3.eng: He has a keen desire for recitation, for questioning, for the higher morality, for the higher mind, and for the higher wisdom.

pli-tv-kd1:38.10.1.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, aññatitthiyapubbo yassa titthāyatanā saṅkanto hoti, tassa satthuno tassa diṭṭhiyā tassa khantiyā tassa ruciyā tassa ādāyassa avaṇṇe bhaññamāne attamano hoti udaggo abhiraddho, buddhassa vā dhammassa vā saṅghassa vā avaṇṇe bhaññamāne kupito hoti anattamano anabhiraddho.
pli-tv-kd1:38.10.1.eng: He’s pleased when anyone disparages the teacher, the views, the beliefs, the persuasion, or the opinions of the religious community he’s left; but he’s displeased when anyone disparages the Buddha, the Teaching, or the Sangha.

pli-tv-kd1:38.10.2.pli: Yassa vā pana titthāyatanā saṅkanto hoti, tassa satthuno tassa diṭṭhiyā tassa khantiyā tassa ruciyā tassa ādāyassa vaṇṇe bhaññamāne kupito hoti anattamano anabhiraddho, buddhassa vā dhammassa vā saṅghassa vā vaṇṇe bhaññamāne attamano hoti udaggo abhiraddho.
pli-tv-kd1:38.10.2.eng: He’s displeased when anyone praises the teacher, the views, the beliefs, the persuasion, or the opinions of the religious community he’s left; but he’s pleased when anyone praises the Buddha, the Teaching, or the Sangha.

pli-tv-kd1:38.10.3.eng: This last one is the critical factor for someone who has been a monastic of another religion to pass his probation.

pli-tv-kd1:38.10.4.pli: Evampi kho, bhikkhave, aññatitthiyapubbo ārādhako hoti.

pli-tv-kd1:38.10.5.pli: Evaṃ ārādhako kho, bhikkhave, aññatitthiyapubbo āgato upasampādetabbo.
pli-tv-kd1:38.10.5.eng: When he passes in this way, he should be given the full ordination.

pli-tv-kd1:38.11.1.pli: Sace, bhikkhave, aññatitthiyapubbo naggo āgacchati, upajjhāyamūlakaṃ cīvaraṃ pariyesitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:38.11.1.eng: If someone who has been a monastic of another religion arrives naked, a robe should be sought through his preceptor.

pli-tv-kd1:38.11.2.pli: Sace acchinnakeso āgacchati, saṅgho apaloketabbo bhaṇḍukammāya.
pli-tv-kd1:38.11.2.eng: If he arrives with hair, he should get permission from the Sangha to shave.

pli-tv-kd1:38.11.3.pli: Ye te, bhikkhave, aggikā jaṭilakā, te āgatā upasampādetabbā, na tesaṃ parivāso dātabbo.
pli-tv-kd1:38.11.3.eng: But any dreadlocked, fire-worshiping ascetic who comes to be ordained should be given the full ordination without probation.

pli-tv-kd1:38.11.5.eng: Because they believe that deeds and actions have results.

pli-tv-kd1:38.11.6.pli: Sace, bhikkhave, jātiyā sākiyo aññatitthiyapubbo āgacchati, so āgato upasampādetabbo, na tassa parivāso dātabbo.
pli-tv-kd1:38.11.6.eng: And if someone comes to be ordained who has been a monastic of another religion but is a Sakyan by birth, he should be given the full ordination without probation.

pli-tv-kd1:38.11.7.pli: Imāhaṃ, bhikkhave, ñātīnaṃ āveṇikaṃ parihāraṃ dammī”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:38.11.7.eng: I give this special privilege to my relatives.”

pli-tv-kd1:38.11.8.eng: The discussion on those who have been monastics of another religion is finished.

pli-tv-kd1:38.11.9.eng: The seventh section for recitation is finished.

pli-tv-kd1:39.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena magadhesu pañca ābādhā ussannā honti—
pli-tv-kd1:39.1.1.eng: At that time in Magadha, there were five common diseases:

pli-tv-kd1:39.1.2.eng: leprosy, abscesses, mild leprosy, tuberculosis, and epilepsy.
pli-tv-kd1:39.1.2.comm: For an explanation of the Pali terminology behind these illnesses, see Appendix of Medical Terminology.

pli-tv-kd1:39.1.3.pli: Manussā pañcahi ābādhehi phuṭṭhā jīvakaṃ komārabhaccaṃ upasaṅkamitvā evaṃ vadanti—
pli-tv-kd1:39.1.3.eng: When people were sick with any of these, they went to Jīvaka Komārabhacca and said,

pli-tv-kd1:39.1.6.pli: rājā ca me māgadho seniyo bimbisāro upaṭṭhātabbo itthāgārañca buddhappamukho ca bhikkhusaṅgho;
pli-tv-kd1:39.1.6.eng: I look after King Seniya Bimbisāra of Magadha and his harem. I also look after the Sangha of monks headed by the Buddha.

pli-tv-kd1:39.1.7.eng: I’m not able to treat you.”

pli-tv-kd1:39.1.9.eng: and we’ll be your slave, too.

pli-tv-kd1:39.2.1.pli: “Ahaṃ khvayyo, bahukicco bahukaraṇīyo rājā ca me māgadho seniyo bimbisāro upaṭṭhātabbo itthāgārañca buddhappamukho ca bhikkhusaṅgho;
pli-tv-kd1:39.2.1.eng: Jīvaka repeated what he had already said.

pli-tv-kd1:39.2.4.pli: “ime kho samaṇā sakyaputtiyā sukhasīlā sukhasamācārā, subhojanāni bhuñjitvā nivātesu sayanesu sayanti.
pli-tv-kd1:39.2.4.eng: “These Sakyan monastics have pleasant habits and a happy life. They eat nice food and sleep in beds sheltered from the wind.

pli-tv-kd1:39.2.5.eng: Why don’t we go forth with the Sakyan monastics?

pli-tv-kd1:39.2.6.pli: Tattha bhikkhū ceva upaṭṭhahissanti, jīvako ca komārabhacco tikicchissatī”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:39.2.6.eng: If we do, the monks will nurse us and Jīvaka Komārabhacca will treat us.”

pli-tv-kd1:39.2.7.pli: Atha kho te manussā bhikkhū upasaṅkamitvā pabbajjaṃ yāciṃsu.
pli-tv-kd1:39.2.7.eng: They then went to the monks and asked for the going forth.

pli-tv-kd1:39.2.8.eng: The monks gave them the going forth and the full ordination.

pli-tv-kd1:39.2.9.pli: Te bhikkhū ceva upaṭṭhahiṃsu jīvako ca komārabhacco tikicchi.
pli-tv-kd1:39.2.9.eng: And the monks nursed them, and Jīvaka treated them.

pli-tv-kd1:39.3.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhū bahū gilāne bhikkhū upaṭṭhahantā yācanabahulā viññattibahulā viharanti—
pli-tv-kd1:39.3.1.eng: At one time the monks were nursing many sick monks. As a result, they kept on asking,

pli-tv-kd1:39.3.2.eng: “Please give a meal for the sick and for those nursing the sick. Please give medicines for the sick.”

pli-tv-kd1:39.3.3.pli: Jīvakopi komārabhacco bahū gilāne bhikkhū tikicchanto aññataraṃ rājakiccaṃ parihāpesi.
pli-tv-kd1:39.3.3.eng: And because Jīvaka was treating many sick monks, he was unable to fulfill his duty to King Bimbisāra.

pli-tv-kd1:39.4.1.pli: Aññataropi puriso pañcahi ābādhehi phuṭṭho jīvakaṃ komārabhaccaṃ upasaṅkamitvā etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd1:39.4.1.eng: Then a certain man who was afflicted with one of the five diseases went to Jīvaka and said,

pli-tv-kd1:39.4.3.pli: “Ahaṃ khvayyo, bahukicco, bahukaraṇīyo, rājā ca me māgadho seniyo bimbisāro upaṭṭhātabbo itthāgārañca buddhappamukho ca bhikkhusaṅgho;
pli-tv-kd1:39.4.3.eng: He replied, “I’m very busy. I look after the king of Magadha and his harem. I also look after the Sangha of monks headed by the Buddha.

pli-tv-kd1:39.4.4.eng: I’m not able to treat you.”

pli-tv-kd1:39.4.5.pli: “Sabbaṃ sāpateyyañca te, ācariya, hotu, ahañca te dāso;
pli-tv-kd1:39.4.5.eng: “I will give you everything I own, and I’ll be your slave, too.

pli-tv-kd1:39.4.7.pli: “Ahaṃ khvayyo, bahukicco bahukaraṇīyo, rājā ca me māgadho seniyo bimbisāro upaṭṭhātabbo itthāgārañca buddhappamukho ca bhikkhusaṅgho, nāhaṃ sakkomi tikicchitun”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:39.4.7.eng: Jīvaka repeated what he had already said.

pli-tv-kd1:39.5.2.pli: “ime kho samaṇā sakyaputtiyā sukhasīlā sukhasamācārā, subhojanāni bhuñjitvā nivātesu sayanesu sayanti.
pli-tv-kd1:39.5.2.eng: “These Sakyan monastics have pleasant habits and a happy life. They eat nice food and sleep in beds sheltered from the wind.

pli-tv-kd1:39.5.3.eng: Why don’t I go forth with the Sakyan monastics?

pli-tv-kd1:39.5.4.pli: Tattha bhikkhū ceva upaṭṭhahissanti, jīvako ca komārabhacco tikicchissati.
pli-tv-kd1:39.5.4.eng: If I do, the monks will nurse me, and Jīvaka Komārabhacca will treat me.

pli-tv-kd1:39.5.5.eng: And when I’m healthy, I’ll disrobe.”

pli-tv-kd1:39.5.6.pli: Atha kho so puriso bhikkhu upasaṅkamitvā pabbajjaṃ yāci.
pli-tv-kd1:39.5.6.eng: He then went to the monks and asked for the going forth.

pli-tv-kd1:39.5.7.eng: The monks gave him the going forth and the full ordination,

pli-tv-kd1:39.5.8.pli: Taṃ bhikkhū ceva upaṭṭhahiṃsu, jīvako ca komārabhacco tikicchi.
pli-tv-kd1:39.5.8.eng: after which they nursed him and Jīvaka treated him.

pli-tv-kd1:39.5.9.eng: When he was healthy again, he disrobed.

pli-tv-kd1:39.5.10.pli: Addasā kho jīvako komārabhacco taṃ purisaṃ vibbhantaṃ, disvāna taṃ purisaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd1:39.5.10.eng: Jīvaka saw that man after he had disrobed, and he asked him,

pli-tv-kd1:39.5.11.eng: “Didn’t you go forth with the monks?”

pli-tv-kd1:39.5.14.pli: Atha kho so puriso jīvakassa komārabhaccassa etamatthaṃ ārocesi.
pli-tv-kd1:39.5.14.eng: When that man had told him what had happened,

pli-tv-kd1:39.6.1.eng: Jīvaka complained and criticized the monks,

pli-tv-kd1:39.6.2.pli: “kathañhi nāma bhadantā pañcahi ābādhehi phuṭṭhaṃ pabbājessantī”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:39.6.2.eng: “How could the venerables allow one with the five diseases to go forth?”

pli-tv-kd1:39.6.3.pli: Atha kho jīvako komārabhacco yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi.
pli-tv-kd1:39.6.3.eng: He went to the Buddha, bowed, sat down,

pli-tv-kd1:39.6.4.pli: Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho jīvako komārabhacco bhagavantaṃ etadavoca—

pli-tv-kd1:39.6.5.pli: “sādhu, bhante, ayyā pañcahi ābādhehi phuṭṭhaṃ na pabbājeyyun”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:39.6.5.eng: “Please, sir, may the venerables not allow those with the five diseases to go forth.”

pli-tv-kd1:39.7.1.pli: Atha kho bhagavā jīvakaṃ komārabhaccaṃ dhammiyā kathāya sandassesi samādapesi samuttejesi sampahaṃsesi.
pli-tv-kd1:39.7.1.eng: The Buddha instructed, inspired, and gladdened him with a teaching.

pli-tv-kd1:39.7.2.pli: Atha kho jīvako komārabhacco bhagavatā dhammiyā kathāya sandassito samādapito samuttejito sampahaṃsito uṭṭhāyāsanā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṃ katvā pakkāmi.
pli-tv-kd1:39.7.2.eng: Jīvaka then got up from his seat, bowed down, circumambulated the Buddha with his right side toward him, and left.

pli-tv-kd1:39.7.3.pli: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṃ nidāne etasmiṃ pakaraṇe dhammiṃ kathaṃ katvā bhikkhū āmantesi—
pli-tv-kd1:39.7.3.eng: Soon afterwards the Buddha gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-kd1:39.7.4.eng: “You shouldn’t give the going forth to anyone afflicted with any of the five diseases.

pli-tv-kd1:39.7.5.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-kd1:40.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena rañño māgadhassa seniyassa bimbisārassa paccanto kupito hoti.
pli-tv-kd1:40.1.1.eng: On one occasion unrest erupted in the outlying districts governed by King Bimbisāra.

pli-tv-kd1:40.1.2.pli: Atha kho rājā māgadho seniyo bimbisāro senānāyake mahāmatte āṇāpesi—

pli-tv-kd1:40.1.4.pli: “Evaṃ, devā”ti kho senānāyakā mahāmattā rañño māgadhassa seniyassa bimbisārassa paccassosuṃ.

pli-tv-kd1:40.2.1.pli: Atha kho abhiññātānaṃ abhiññātānaṃ yodhānaṃ etadahosi—
pli-tv-kd1:40.2.1.eng: But the most distinguished soldiers thought,

pli-tv-kd1:40.2.2.pli: “mayaṃ kho yuddhābhinandino gacchantā pāpañca karoma, bahuñca apuññaṃ pasavāma.
pli-tv-kd1:40.2.2.eng: “If we go and enjoy the battle, we’ll do what’s bad and make much demerit.

pli-tv-kd1:40.2.3.pli: Kena nu kho mayaṃ upāyena pāpā ca virameyyāma kalyāṇañca kareyyāmā”ti?
pli-tv-kd1:40.2.3.eng: How can we avoid what’s bad and do what’s good instead?”

pli-tv-kd1:40.2.5.pli: “ime kho samaṇā sakyaputtiyā dhammacārino samacārino brahmacārino saccavādino sīlavanto kalyāṇadhammā.
pli-tv-kd1:40.2.5.eng: “These Sakyan monastics have integrity. They’re celibate and their conduct is good, and they’re truthful, moral, and have a good character.

pli-tv-kd1:40.2.6.pli: Sace kho mayaṃ samaṇesu sakyaputtiyesu pabbajeyyāma, evaṃ mayaṃ pāpā ca virameyyāma kalyāṇañca kareyyāmā”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:40.2.6.eng: If we go forth with them, we’ll avoid what’s bad and do what’s good.”

pli-tv-kd1:40.2.7.pli: Atha kho te yodhā bhikkhū upasaṅkamitvā pabbajjaṃ yāciṃsu.
pli-tv-kd1:40.2.7.eng: Those soldiers then went to the monks and asked for the going forth.

pli-tv-kd1:40.2.8.eng: And the monks gave them the going forth and the full ordination.

pli-tv-kd1:40.3.1.eng: Soon afterwards the generals asked among the king’s employees,

pli-tv-kd1:40.3.2.pli: “kiṃ nu kho, bhaṇe, itthannāmo ca itthannāmo ca yodhā na dissantī”ti?
pli-tv-kd1:40.3.2.eng: “Where are the soldiers so-and-so and so-and-so?”

pli-tv-kd1:40.3.3.pli: “Itthannāmo ca itthannāmo ca, sāmi, yodhā bhikkhūsu pabbajitā”ti.

pli-tv-kd1:40.3.4.eng: The generals complained and criticized the monks,

pli-tv-kd1:40.3.5.eng: “How could the Sakyan monastics give the going forth to those who are employed by the king?”

pli-tv-kd1:40.3.6.pli: Senānāyakā mahāmattā rañño māgadhassa seniyassa bimbisārassa etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ.

pli-tv-kd1:40.3.7.pli: Atha kho rājā māgadho seniyo bimbisāro vohārike mahāmatte pucchi—
pli-tv-kd1:40.3.7.eng: The king then asked the judges,

pli-tv-kd1:40.3.8.pli: “yo, bhaṇe, rājabhaṭaṃ pabbājeti, kiṃ so pasavatī”ti?
pli-tv-kd1:40.3.8.eng: “What’s the penalty for one who gives the going forth to someone employed by the king?”

pli-tv-kd1:40.3.9.pli: “Upajjhāyassa, deva, sīsaṃ chetabbaṃ, anussāvakassa jivhā uddharitabbā, gaṇassa upaḍḍhaphāsukā bhañjitabbā”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:40.3.9.eng: “The preceptor should have his head cut off, the one who does the formal proclamation should have his tongue cut out, and the participating group should have half their ribs broken.”

pli-tv-kd1:40.4.1.pli: Atha kho rājā māgadho seniyo bimbisāro yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi.
pli-tv-kd1:40.4.1.eng: The king went to the Buddha, bowed, sat down,

pli-tv-kd1:40.4.2.pli: Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho rājā māgadho seniyo bimbisāro bhagavantaṃ etadavoca—

pli-tv-kd1:40.4.3.eng: “Sir, there are kings with little faith and confidence.

pli-tv-kd1:40.4.4.eng: They would give the monks a hard time even over small matters.

pli-tv-kd1:40.4.5.pli: Sādhu, bhante, ayyā rājabhaṭaṃ na pabbājeyyun”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:40.4.5.eng: Please, may the venerables not give the going forth to those employed by a king.”

pli-tv-kd1:40.4.6.pli: Atha kho bhagavā rājānaṃ māgadhaṃ seniyaṃ bimbisāraṃ dhammiyā kathāya sandassesi samādapesi samuttejesi sampahaṃsesi.
pli-tv-kd1:40.4.6.eng: The Buddha instructed, inspired, and gladdened him with a teaching.

pli-tv-kd1:40.4.7.pli: Atha kho rājā māgadho seniyo bimbisāro bhagavatā dhammiyā kathāya sandassito samādapito samuttejito sampahaṃsito uṭṭhāyāsanā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṃ katvā pakkāmi.
pli-tv-kd1:40.4.7.eng: The king then got up from his seat, bowed down, circumambulated the Buddha with his right side toward him, and left.

pli-tv-kd1:40.4.8.pli: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṃ nidāne etasmiṃ pakaraṇe dhammiṃ kathaṃ katvā bhikkhū āmantesi—
pli-tv-kd1:40.4.8.eng: Soon afterwards the Buddha gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-kd1:40.4.9.eng: “You shouldn’t give the going forth to anyone employed by a king.

pli-tv-kd1:40.4.10.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-kd1:41.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena coro aṅgulimālo bhikkhūsu pabbajito hoti.
pli-tv-kd1:41.1.1.eng: At that time the criminal Aṅgulimāla had gone forth with the monks.

pli-tv-kd1:41.1.2.pli: Manussā passitvā ubbijjantipi, uttasantipi, palāyantipi, aññenapi gacchanti, aññenapi mukhaṃ karonti, dvārampi thakenti.
pli-tv-kd1:41.1.2.eng: When people saw him, they became alarmed and fearful. They turned away, took a different path, ran off, and closed their doors.

pli-tv-kd1:41.1.3.eng: People complained and criticized the monks,

pli-tv-kd1:41.1.4.pli: “kathañhi nāma samaṇā sakyaputtiyā dhajabandhaṃ coraṃ pabbājessantī”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:41.1.4.eng: “How could the Sakyan monastics give the going forth to a notorious criminal?”

pli-tv-kd1:41.1.5.pli: Assosuṃ kho bhikkhū tesaṃ manussānaṃ ujjhāyantānaṃ khiyyantānaṃ vipācentānaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:41.1.5.eng: The monks heard the complaints of those people.

pli-tv-kd1:41.1.6.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ …pe…

pli-tv-kd1:41.1.7.eng: “You shouldn’t give the going forth to a notorious criminal.

pli-tv-kd1:41.1.8.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-kd1:42.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena raññā māgadhena seniyena bimbisārena anuññātaṃ hoti—
pli-tv-kd1:42.1.1.eng: At that time King Bimbisāra had made the following declaration:

pli-tv-kd1:42.1.2.pli: “ye samaṇesu sakyaputtiyesu pabbajanti, na te labbhā kiñci kātuṃ;
pli-tv-kd1:42.1.2.eng: “Nothing should be done to anyone who has gone forth with the Sakyan monastics.

pli-tv-kd1:42.1.3.pli: svākkhāto dhammo, carantu brahmacariyaṃ sammā dukkhassa antakiriyāyā”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:42.1.3.eng: The Teaching is well-proclaimed. Allow them to practice the spiritual life to make a complete end of suffering.”

pli-tv-kd1:42.1.4.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro puriso corikaṃ katvā kārāya baddho hoti.
pli-tv-kd1:42.1.4.eng: Soon afterwards a certain thief was put in prison.

pli-tv-kd1:42.1.5.pli: So kāraṃ bhinditvā palāyitvā bhikkhūsu pabbajito hoti.
pli-tv-kd1:42.1.5.eng: But he escaped, ran away, and went forth with the monks.

pli-tv-kd1:42.2.1.eng: When people saw him, they said,

pli-tv-kd1:42.2.2.eng: “There’s that criminal who escaped from prison.

pli-tv-kd1:42.2.7.pli: ‘ye samaṇesu sakyaputtiyesu pabbajanti, na te labbhā kiñci kātuṃ;
pli-tv-kd1:42.2.7.eng: that nothing should be done to anyone gone forth with the Sakyan monastics.”

pli-tv-kd1:42.2.8.pli: svākkhāto dhammo, carantu brahmacariyaṃ sammā dukkhassa antakiriyāyā’”ti.

pli-tv-kd1:42.2.9.eng: People complained and criticized the monks,

pli-tv-kd1:42.2.10.pli: “abhayūvarā ime samaṇā sakyaputtiyā, nayime labbhā kiñci kātuṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:42.2.10.eng: “These Sakyan monastics are untouchable; you can’t do anything to them.

pli-tv-kd1:42.2.11.pli: Kathañhi nāma samaṇā sakyaputtiyā kārabhedakaṃ coraṃ pabbājessantī”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:42.2.11.eng: So how could they give the going forth to an escaped criminal?”

pli-tv-kd1:42.2.13.eng: “You shouldn’t give the going forth to an escaped criminal.

pli-tv-kd1:42.2.14.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-kd1:43.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro puriso corikaṃ katvā palāyitvā bhikkhūsu pabbajito hoti.
pli-tv-kd1:43.1.1.eng: On one occasion a certain man stole something, ran away, and then went forth with the monks.

pli-tv-kd1:43.1.2.pli: So ca rañño antepure likhito hoti—
pli-tv-kd1:43.1.2.eng: Yet the king’s court had issued a statement:
