pli-tv-kd1:43.1.2.comm: “Court” renders antepura. See Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-kd1:43.1.3.eng: “He should be executed wherever he’s seen.”

pli-tv-kd1:43.1.4.eng: When people saw him, they said,

pli-tv-kd1:43.1.5.comm: Likhitaka, literally, “One who has been written about”. Sp 3.93: Atha kho yo koci corikaṁ vā aññaṁ vā garuṁ rājāparādhaṁ katvā palāto, rājā ca naṁ paṇṇe vā potthake vā “itthannāmo yattha dissati, tattha gahetvā māretabbo”ti vā “hatthapādānissa chinditabbānī”ti vā “ettakaṁ nāma daṇḍaṁ āharāpetabbo”ti vā likhāpeti, ayaṁ likhitako nāma, “When someone has run away after stealing or committing another heavy offense against the king, and the king causes the writing about him on a leaf or in a book that ‘wherever so-and-so is seen, he should be seized and executed’ or ‘his hands and feet are to be cut off’ or ‘this penalty is to be imposed’, this is called a wanted criminal.”

pli-tv-kd1:43.1.9.pli: Anuññātaṃ raññā māgadhena seniyena bimbisārena ‘ye samaṇesu sakyaputtiyesu pabbajanti, na te labbhā kiñci kātuṃ, svākkhāto dhammo, carantu brahmacariyaṃ sammā dukkhassa antakiriyāyā’”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:43.1.9.eng: King Bimbisāra has declared that nothing should be done to anyone gone forth with the Sakyan monastics.”

pli-tv-kd1:43.1.10.eng: People complained and criticized the monks,

pli-tv-kd1:43.1.11.pli: “abhayūvarā ime samaṇā sakyaputtiyā, nayime labbhā kiñci kātuṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:43.1.11.eng: “These Sakyan monastics are untouchable; you can’t do anything to them.

pli-tv-kd1:43.1.12.pli: Kathañhi nāma samaṇā sakyaputtiyā likhitakaṃ coraṃ pabbājessantī”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:43.1.12.eng: So how could they give the going forth to a wanted criminal?”

pli-tv-kd1:43.1.14.eng: “You shouldn’t give the going forth to a wanted criminal.

pli-tv-kd1:43.1.15.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-kd1:44.1.0.eng: 31. The one who had been whipped

pli-tv-kd1:44.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro puriso kasāhato katadaṇḍakammo bhikkhūsu pabbajito hoti.
pli-tv-kd1:44.1.1.eng: At one time a certain man who had been whipped as a penalty went forth with the monks.

pli-tv-kd1:44.1.2.eng: People complained and criticized the monks,

pli-tv-kd1:44.1.3.pli: “kathañhi nāma samaṇā sakyaputtiyā kasāhataṃ katadaṇḍakammaṃ pabbājessantī”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:44.1.3.eng: “How could the Sakyan monastics give the going forth to one who has been whipped as a penalty?”

pli-tv-kd1:44.1.5.eng: “You shouldn’t give the going forth to one who has been whipped as a penalty.

pli-tv-kd1:44.1.6.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-kd1:45.1.0.eng: 32. The one who had been branded

pli-tv-kd1:45.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro puriso lakkhaṇāhato katadaṇḍakammo bhikkhūsu pabbajito hoti.
pli-tv-kd1:45.1.1.eng: At one time a certain man who had been branded as a penalty went forth with the monks.

pli-tv-kd1:45.1.2.eng: People complained and criticized the monks,

pli-tv-kd1:45.1.3.pli: “kathañhi nāma samaṇā sakyaputtiyā lakkhaṇāhataṃ katadaṇḍakammaṃ pabbājessantī”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:45.1.3.eng: “How could the Sakyan monastics give the going forth to one who has been branded as a penalty?”

pli-tv-kd1:45.1.5.eng: “You shouldn’t give the going forth to one who has been branded as a penalty.

pli-tv-kd1:45.1.6.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-kd1:46.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro puriso iṇāyiko palāyitvā bhikkhūsu pabbajito hoti.
pli-tv-kd1:46.1.1.eng: On one occasion a certain indebted man ran away and went forth with the monks.

pli-tv-kd1:46.1.2.eng: Soon afterwards the creditors saw him and said,

pli-tv-kd1:46.1.7.eng: King Bimbisāra has declared that nothing should be done to anyone gone forth with the Sakyan monastics.”

pli-tv-kd1:46.1.8.pli: ‘ye samaṇesu sakyaputtiyesu pabbajanti, na te labbhā kiñci kātuṃ;

pli-tv-kd1:46.1.9.pli: svākkhāto dhammo, carantu brahmacariyaṃ sammā dukkhassa antakiriyāyā’”ti.

pli-tv-kd1:46.1.10.eng: People complained and criticized the monks,

pli-tv-kd1:46.1.12.eng: you can’t do anything to them.

pli-tv-kd1:46.1.13.pli: Kathañhi nāma samaṇā sakyaputtiyā iṇāyikaṃ pabbājessantī”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:46.1.13.eng: So how could they give the going forth to an indebted person?”

pli-tv-kd1:46.1.15.eng: “You shouldn’t give the going forth to one who is indebted.

pli-tv-kd1:46.1.16.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-kd1:47.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro dāso palāyitvā bhikkhūsu pabbajito hoti.
pli-tv-kd1:47.1.1.eng: On one occasion a certain slave ran away and went forth with the monks.

pli-tv-kd1:47.1.2.eng: Soon afterwards the owners saw him and said,

pli-tv-kd1:47.1.6.pli: “māyyo, evaṃ avacuttha, anuññātaṃ raññā māgadhena seniyena bimbisārena ‘ye samaṇesu sakyaputtiyesu pabbajanti, na te labbhā kiñci kātuṃ, svākkhāto dhammo, carantu brahmacariyaṃ sammā dukkhassa antakiriyāyā’”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:47.1.6.eng: “No, King Bimbisāra has declared that nothing should be done to anyone gone forth with the Sakyan monastics.”

pli-tv-kd1:47.1.7.eng: People complained and criticized the monks,

pli-tv-kd1:47.1.8.pli: “abhayūvarā ime samaṇā sakyaputtiyā, nayime labbhā kiñci kātuṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:47.1.8.eng: “These Sakyan monastics are untouchable; you can’t do anything to them.

pli-tv-kd1:47.1.9.pli: Kathañhi nāma samaṇā sakyaputtiyā dāsaṃ pabbājessantī”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:47.1.9.eng: So how could they give the going forth to a slave?”

pli-tv-kd1:47.1.11.eng: “You shouldn’t give the going forth to a slave.

pli-tv-kd1:47.1.12.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-kd1:48.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro kammārabhaṇḍu mātāpitūhi saddhiṃ bhaṇḍitvā ārāmaṃ gantvā bhikkhūsu pabbajito hoti.
pli-tv-kd1:48.1.1.eng: At that time a certain shaven-headed smith had quarreled with his parents. He then went to the monastery and went forth with the monks.

pli-tv-kd1:48.1.2.pli: Atha kho tassa kammārabhaṇḍussa mātāpitaro taṃ kammārabhaṇḍuṃ vicinantā ārāmaṃ gantvā bhikkhū pucchiṃsu—
pli-tv-kd1:48.1.2.eng: While looking for their son, the parents came to that monastery. They asked the monks,

pli-tv-kd1:48.1.3.eng: “Venerables, have you by any chance seen such-and-such a boy?”

pli-tv-kd1:48.2.1.pli: Atha kho tassa kammārabhaṇḍussa mātāpitaro taṃ kammārabhaṇḍuṃ vicinantā bhikkhūsu pabbajitaṃ disvā ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-kd1:48.2.1.eng: Soon afterwards those parents saw that their son had gone forth as a monk. They then complained and criticized the monks,

pli-tv-kd1:48.2.2.eng: “These Sakyan monastics are shameless and immoral liars.

pli-tv-kd1:48.2.3.pli: Jānaṃyeva āhaṃsu—‘na jānāmā’ti, passaṃyeva āhaṃsu—‘na passāmā’ti.
pli-tv-kd1:48.2.3.eng: They deny knowing what they know and having seen what they’ve seen.

pli-tv-kd1:48.2.4.eng: Our boy has gone forth as a monk.”

pli-tv-kd1:48.2.5.pli: Assosuṃ kho bhikkhū tassa kammārabhaṇḍussa mātāpitūnaṃ ujjhāyantānaṃ khiyyantānaṃ vipācentānaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:48.2.5.eng: The monks heard the complaints of those parents.

pli-tv-kd1:48.2.6.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ.

pli-tv-kd1:48.2.7.eng: “You should get permission from the Sangha to shave someone’s head.”

pli-tv-kd1:49.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena rājagahe sattarasavaggiyā dārakā sahāyakā honti.
pli-tv-kd1:49.1.1.eng: At that time in Rājagaha, there was a group of seventeen boys who were friends

pli-tv-kd1:49.1.2.eng: and had Upāli as their leader.

pli-tv-kd1:49.1.3.eng: On one occasion Upāli’s parents thought,

pli-tv-kd1:49.1.4.pli: “kena nu kho upāyena upāli amhākaṃ accayena sukhañca jīveyya, na ca kilameyyā”ti?
pli-tv-kd1:49.1.4.eng: “How can we make sure that Upāli is able to live happily without exhausting himself after we’ve passed away?

pli-tv-kd1:49.1.6.pli: “sace kho upāli lekhaṃ sikkheyya, evaṃ kho upāli amhākaṃ accayena sukhañca jīveyya, na ca kilameyyā”ti.

pli-tv-kd1:49.1.8.pli: “sace kho upāli lekhaṃ sikkhissati, aṅguliyo dukkhā bhavissanti.
pli-tv-kd1:49.1.8.eng: but then his fingers will hurt.

pli-tv-kd1:49.1.9.pli: Sace kho upāli gaṇanaṃ sikkheyya, evaṃ kho upāli amhākaṃ accayena sukhañca jīveyya, na ca kilameyyā”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:49.1.9.eng: Or he could become an accountant,

pli-tv-kd1:49.2.1.pli: “sace kho upāli gaṇanaṃ sikkhissati, urassa dukkho bhavissati.
pli-tv-kd1:49.2.1.eng: but then his chest will hurt.

pli-tv-kd1:49.2.2.pli: Sace kho upāli rūpaṃ sikkheyya, evaṃ kho upāli amhākaṃ accayena sukhañca jīveyya, na ca kilameyyā”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:49.2.2.eng: Or he could become a banker,

pli-tv-kd1:49.2.4.pli: “sace kho upāli rūpaṃ sikkhissati, akkhīni dukkhā bhavissanti.
pli-tv-kd1:49.2.4.eng: but then his eyes will hurt.

pli-tv-kd1:49.2.5.pli: Ime kho samaṇā sakyaputtiyā sukhasīlā sukhasamācārā, subhojanāni bhuñjitvā nivātesu sayanesu sayanti.
pli-tv-kd1:49.2.5.eng: These Sakyan monastics, however, have pleasant habits and a happy life. They eat nice food and sleep in beds sheltered from the wind.

pli-tv-kd1:49.2.6.pli: Sace kho upāli samaṇesu sakyaputtiyesu pabbajeyya, evaṃ kho upāli amhākaṃ accayena sukhañca jīveyya, na ca kilameyyā”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:49.2.6.eng: If Upāli goes forth with them, he’ll be able to live happily without exhausting himself after we’ve passed away.”

pli-tv-kd1:49.3.1.pli: Assosi kho upālidārako mātāpitūnaṃ imaṃ kathāsallāpaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:49.3.1.eng: Upāli overheard this conversation between his parents.

pli-tv-kd1:49.3.2.pli: Atha kho upālidārako yena te dārakā tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā te dārake etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd1:49.3.2.eng: He then went to the other boys and said,

pli-tv-kd1:49.3.3.eng: “Come, let’s go forth with the Sakyan monastics.”

pli-tv-kd1:49.3.4.pli: “Sace kho tvaṃ, ayya, pabbajissasi, evaṃ mayampi pabbajissāmā”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:49.3.4.eng: “If you go forth, so will we.”

pli-tv-kd1:49.3.5.pli: Atha kho te dārakā ekamekassa mātāpitaro upasaṅkamitvā etadavocuṃ—
pli-tv-kd1:49.3.5.eng: The boys went each to his own parents and said,

pli-tv-kd1:49.3.6.eng: “Please allow me to go forth into homelessness.”

pli-tv-kd1:49.3.8.eng: that all the boys had the same desire and good intentions,

pli-tv-kd1:49.3.10.eng: The boys then went to the monks and asked them for the going forth,

pli-tv-kd1:49.3.11.eng: and the monks gave them the going forth and the full ordination.

pli-tv-kd1:49.4.1.eng: Soon afterwards they got up early in the morning and cried,

pli-tv-kd1:49.4.2.eng: “Give us congee, give us a meal, give us fresh food!”
pli-tv-kd1:49.4.2.comm: “Fresh food” renders khādanīya. See Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-kd1:49.4.5.pli: Sace yāgu bhavissati pivissatha, sace bhattaṃ bhavissati bhuñjissatha, sace khādanīyaṃ bhavissati khādissatha;
pli-tv-kd1:49.4.5.eng: If any of that becomes available then, you can have it.

pli-tv-kd1:49.4.6.pli: no ce bhavissati yāgu vā bhattaṃ vā khādanīyaṃ vā, piṇḍāya caritvā bhuñjissathā”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:49.4.6.eng: If not, you’ll eat after walking for alms.”

pli-tv-kd1:49.4.7.pli: Evampi kho te bhikkhū bhikkhūhi vuccamānā rodantiyeva “yāguṃ detha, bhattaṃ detha, khādanīyaṃ dethā”ti;
pli-tv-kd1:49.4.7.eng: But they carried on as before.

pli-tv-kd1:49.4.8.eng: And they defecated and urinated on the furniture.
pli-tv-kd1:49.4.8.comm: “Furniture” renders senāsana. See Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-kd1:49.5.1.pli: Assosi kho bhagavā rattiyā paccūsasamayaṃ paccuṭṭhāya dārakasaddaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:49.5.1.eng: After rising early in the morning, the Buddha heard the sound of those boys.

pli-tv-kd1:49.5.4.pli: Atha kho āyasmā ānando bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesi …pe…
pli-tv-kd1:49.5.4.eng: who told him what was happening. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned the monks:

pli-tv-kd1:49.5.5.pli: “saccaṃ kira, bhikkhave, bhikkhū jānaṃ ūnavīsativassaṃ puggalaṃ upasampādentī”ti?
pli-tv-kd1:49.5.5.eng: “Is it true, monks, that the monks give the full ordination to people they know are less than twenty years old?”

pli-tv-kd1:49.5.8.pli: kathañhi nāma te, bhikkhave, moghapurisā jānaṃ ūnavīsativassaṃ puggalaṃ upasampādessanti.
pli-tv-kd1:49.5.8.eng: “How can those foolish men do this?

pli-tv-kd1:49.6.1.pli: Ūnavīsativasso, bhikkhave, puggalo akkhamo hoti sītassa uṇhassa jighacchāya pipāsāya ḍaṃsamakasavātātapasarīsapasamphassānaṃ duruttānaṃ durāgatānaṃ vacanapathānaṃ uppannānaṃ sārīrikānaṃ vedanānaṃ dukkhānaṃ tibbānaṃ kharānaṃ kaṭukānaṃ asātānaṃ amanāpānaṃ pāṇaharānaṃ anadhivāsakajātiko hoti.
pli-tv-kd1:49.6.1.eng: A person who’s less than twenty years old is unable to endure cold and heat; hunger and thirst; horseflies, mosquitoes, wind, and the burning sun; creeping animals and insects; and rude and unwelcome speech. And they’re unable to bear up with bodily feelings that are painful, severe, sharp, and destructive of life.
pli-tv-kd1:49.6.1.comm: Sp-ṭ 4.295: Sarīsapeti ye keci sarante gacchante dīghajātike, “Sarīsape: whatever long creatures are moving by flowing.”

pli-tv-kd1:49.6.2.pli: Vīsativassova kho, bhikkhave, puggalo khamo hoti sītassa uṇhassa jighacchāya pipāsāya ḍaṃsamakasavātātapasarīsapasamphassānaṃ duruttānaṃ durāgatānaṃ vacanapathānaṃ, uppannānaṃ sārīrikānaṃ vedanānaṃ dukkhānaṃ tibbānaṃ kharānaṃ kaṭukānaṃ asātānaṃ amanāpānaṃ pāṇaharānaṃ adhivāsakajātiko hoti.
pli-tv-kd1:49.6.2.eng: But a person who’s twenty is able to endure these things.

pli-tv-kd1:49.6.3.pli: Netaṃ, bhikkhave, appasannānaṃ vā pasādāya, pasannānaṃ vā bhiyyobhāvāya …pe…

pli-tv-kd1:49.6.5.eng: he gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-kd1:49.6.6.eng: “You shouldn’t give the full ordination to a person you know is less than twenty years old.

pli-tv-kd1:49.6.7.eng: If you do, you should be dealt with according to the rule.”

pli-tv-kd1:50.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataraṃ kulaṃ ahivātakarogena kālaṅkataṃ hoti.
pli-tv-kd1:50.1.1.eng: At one time most of the members of a particular family had died from a deadly and contagious disease.

pli-tv-kd1:50.1.2.eng: Only a father and son were left.

pli-tv-kd1:50.1.3.pli: Te bhikkhūsu pabbajitvā ekatova piṇḍāya caranti.
pli-tv-kd1:50.1.3.eng: After going forth as monks, they walked together for alms.

pli-tv-kd1:50.1.4.pli: Atha kho so dārako pituno bhikkhāya dinnāya upadhāvitvā etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd1:50.1.4.eng: Then, when the boy had handed over his almsfood to his father, he said,

pli-tv-kd1:50.1.7.eng: People complained and criticized the monks,

pli-tv-kd1:50.1.9.eng: This boy was born to a nun!”

pli-tv-kd1:50.1.10.pli: Assosuṃ kho bhikkhū tesaṃ manussānaṃ ujjhāyantānaṃ khiyyantānaṃ vipācentānaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:50.1.10.eng: The monks heard the complaints of those people

pli-tv-kd1:50.1.11.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ.

pli-tv-kd1:50.1.12.eng: “You shouldn’t give the going forth to a boy less than fifteen years old.

pli-tv-kd1:50.1.13.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-kd1:51.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena āyasmato ānandassa upaṭṭhākakulaṃ saddhaṃ pasannaṃ ahivātakarogena kālaṅkataṃ hoti, dve ca dārakā sesā honti.
pli-tv-kd1:51.1.1.eng: At that time there was a family with faith and confidence that was supporting Venerable Ānanda. Then most of its members died from a deadly and contagious disease, and only two boys were left behind.

pli-tv-kd1:51.1.2.pli: Te porāṇakena āciṇṇakappena bhikkhū passitvā upadhāvanti.
pli-tv-kd1:51.1.2.eng: When they saw the monks, they ran up to them, as they had done before.

pli-tv-kd1:51.1.6.eng: “The Buddha has laid down a rule

pli-tv-kd1:51.1.7.eng: that a boy less than fifteen years old shouldn’t be given the going forth,

pli-tv-kd1:51.1.9.pli: Kena nu kho upāyena ime dārakā na vinasseyyun”ti?
pli-tv-kd1:51.1.9.eng: How then can I make sure that these boys don’t perish?”

pli-tv-kd1:51.1.10.pli: Atha kho āyasmā ānando bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesi.

pli-tv-kd1:51.1.11.pli: “Ussahanti pana te, ānanda, dārakā kāke uḍḍāpetun”ti?
pli-tv-kd1:51.1.11.eng: “Are they able, Ānanda, to scare away crows?”

pli-tv-kd1:51.1.13.pli: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṃ nidāne etasmiṃ pakaraṇe dhammiṃ kathaṃ katvā bhikkhū āmantesi—
pli-tv-kd1:51.1.13.eng: The Buddha then gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-kd1:51.1.14.eng: “I allow you to give the going forth to a boy less than fifteen years old if he’s able to scare away crows.”

pli-tv-kd1:52.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena āyasmato upanandassa sakyaputtassa dve sāmaṇerā honti—
pli-tv-kd1:52.1.1.eng: At one time Venerable Upananda the Sakyan had two novice monks,

pli-tv-kd1:52.1.3.eng: They had sex with each other.

pli-tv-kd1:52.1.4.eng: The monks complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-kd1:52.1.5.eng: “How could novice monks misbehave like this?”

pli-tv-kd1:52.1.7.eng: “A single monk shouldn’t have two novice monks attend on him.

pli-tv-kd1:52.1.8.eng: If he does, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-kd1:53.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhagavā tattheva rājagahe vassaṃ vasi, tattha hemantaṃ, tattha gimhaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:53.1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying right there at Rājagaha during the rainy season, the winter, and the summer.

pli-tv-kd1:53.1.3.pli: “āhundarikā samaṇānaṃ sakyaputtiyānaṃ disā andhakārā, na imesaṃ disā pakkhāyantī”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:53.1.3.eng: “The districts are left in darkness and obscurity by the Sakyan monastics. They don’t brighten them up by their presence.”

pli-tv-kd1:53.1.4.pli: Assosuṃ kho bhikkhū tesaṃ manussānaṃ ujjhāyantānaṃ khiyyantānaṃ vipācentānaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:53.1.4.eng: The monks heard the complaints of those people

pli-tv-kd1:53.1.5.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ.

pli-tv-kd1:53.2.1.pli: Atha kho bhagavā āyasmantaṃ ānandaṃ āmantesi—

pli-tv-kd1:53.2.2.eng: “Take a key, Ānanda, and go around the yards, informing the monks that

pli-tv-kd1:53.2.3.eng: the Buddha wishes to go wandering in the Southern Hills.

pli-tv-kd1:53.2.4.eng: Anyone is welcome to join him.”

pli-tv-kd1:53.2.5.pli: “Evaṃ, bhante”ti kho āyasmā ānando bhagavato paṭissuṇitvā avāpuraṇaṃ ādāya anupariveṇiyaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ ārocesi—
pli-tv-kd1:53.2.5.eng: Saying, “Yes, sir,” he did just that.

pli-tv-kd1:53.3.2.pli: “bhagavatā, āvuso ānanda, paññattaṃ dasavassāni nissāya vatthuṃ, dasavassena nissayaṃ dātuṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:53.3.2.eng: “Ānanda, the Buddha has laid down a rule that one must live with formal support for ten years and that one who has ten years’ seniority can give such support.

pli-tv-kd1:53.3.3.pli: Tattha ca no gantabbaṃ bhavissati, nissayo ca gahetabbo bhavissati, ittaro ca vāso bhavissati, puna ca paccāgantabbaṃ bhavissati, puna ca nissayo gahetabbo bhavissati.
pli-tv-kd1:53.3.3.eng: If we were to go, we would have to obtain support for a short time, and when we returned, we would have to obtain support once again.

pli-tv-kd1:53.3.4.pli: Sace amhākaṃ ācariyupajjhāyā gamissanti, mayampi gamissāma;
pli-tv-kd1:53.3.4.eng: So, if our preceptors and teachers go, we’ll go too.

pli-tv-kd1:53.3.5.pli: no ce amhākaṃ ācariyupajjhāyā gamissanti, mayampi na gamissāma.
pli-tv-kd1:53.3.5.eng: If they don’t, neither will we.

pli-tv-kd1:53.4.1.pli: Atha kho bhagavā ogaṇena bhikkhusaṅghena dakkhiṇāgiriṃ cārikaṃ pakkāmi.
pli-tv-kd1:53.4.1.eng: As a result, the Buddha went wandering in the Southern Hills with a small group of monks.

pli-tv-kd1:53.4.2.0.eng: 40. Discussion of release from formal support

pli-tv-kd1:53.4.2.1.pli: Atha kho bhagavā dakkhiṇāgirismiṃ yathābhirantaṃ viharitvā punadeva rājagahaṃ paccāgacchi.
pli-tv-kd1:53.4.2.1.eng: After staying in the Southern Hills for as long as he liked, the Buddha returned to Rājagaha.

pli-tv-kd1:53.4.3.pli: Atha kho bhagavā āyasmantaṃ ānandaṃ āmantesi—

pli-tv-kd1:53.4.4.pli: “kiṃ nu kho, ānanda, tathāgato ogaṇena bhikkhusaṅghena dakkhiṇāgiriṃ cārikaṃ pakkanto”ti?
pli-tv-kd1:53.4.4.eng: “Why was it so small, Ānanda, the group of monks that came wandering with me in the Southern Hills?”

pli-tv-kd1:53.4.5.pli: Atha kho āyasmā ānando bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesi.
pli-tv-kd1:53.4.5.eng: Ānanda told him what had happened.

pli-tv-kd1:53.4.6.pli: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṃ nidāne etasmiṃ pakaraṇe dhammiṃ kathaṃ katvā bhikkhū āmantesi—
pli-tv-kd1:53.4.6.eng: Soon afterwards the Buddha gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-kd1:53.4.7.pli: “anujānāmi, bhikkhave, byattena bhikkhunā paṭibalena pañcavassāni nissāya vatthuṃ, abyattena yāvajīvaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:53.4.7.eng: “A competent and capable monk should live with formal support for five years, but one who is incompetent should live with formal support for life.

pli-tv-kd1:53.5.1.pli: Pañcahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā na anissitena vatthabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:53.5.1.eng: A monk who has five qualities should live with formal support:

pli-tv-kd1:53.5.2.pli: Na asekkhena sīlakkhandhena samannāgato hoti na asekkhena samādhikkhandhena, na asekkhena paññākkhandhena na asekkhena vimuttikkhandhena na asekkhena vimuttiñāṇadassanakkhandhena samannāgato hoti—
pli-tv-kd1:53.5.2.eng: he doesn’t have the virtue, stillness, wisdom, freedom, or knowledge and vision of freedom of one who is fully trained.

pli-tv-kd1:53.5.3.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā na anissitena vatthabbaṃ.

pli-tv-kd1:53.5.4.pli: Pañcahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā anissitena vatthabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:53.5.4.eng: But a monk who has five qualities may live without formal support:

pli-tv-kd1:53.5.5.pli: Asekkhena sīlakkhandhena samannāgato hoti asekkhena samādhikkhandhena.

pli-tv-kd1:53.5.8.eng: and knowledge and vision of freedom of one who is fully trained.

pli-tv-kd1:53.5.9.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā anissitena vatthabbaṃ.

pli-tv-kd1:53.6.1.pli: Aparehipi, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā na anissitena vatthabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:53.6.1.eng: “A monk who has another five qualities should live with formal support:

pli-tv-kd1:53.6.2.pli: Assaddho hoti, ahiriko hoti, anottappī hoti, kusīto hoti, muṭṭhassati hoti—
pli-tv-kd1:53.6.2.eng: he has no faith, conscience, or moral prudence, and is lazy and absentminded.

pli-tv-kd1:53.6.3.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā na anissitena vatthabbaṃ.

pli-tv-kd1:53.6.4.pli: Pañcahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā anissitena vatthabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:53.6.4.eng: But a monk who has five qualities may live without formal support:

pli-tv-kd1:53.6.5.pli: Saddho hoti, hirimā hoti, ottappī hoti, āraddhavīriyo hoti, upaṭṭhitassati hoti—
pli-tv-kd1:53.6.5.eng: he has faith, conscience, moral prudence, energy, and mindfulness.

pli-tv-kd1:53.6.6.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā anissitena vatthabbaṃ.

pli-tv-kd1:53.7.1.pli: Aparehipi, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā na anissitena vatthabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:53.7.1.eng: “A monk who has another five qualities should live with formal support:

pli-tv-kd1:53.7.2.pli: Adhisīle sīlavipanno hoti, ajjhācāre ācāravipanno hoti, atidiṭṭhiyā diṭṭhivipanno hoti, appassuto hoti, duppañño hoti—
pli-tv-kd1:53.7.2.eng: he has failed in the higher morality, in conduct, and in view; he’s ignorant and foolish.

pli-tv-kd1:53.7.3.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā na anissitena vatthabbaṃ.

pli-tv-kd1:53.7.4.pli: Pañcahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā anissitena vatthabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:53.7.4.eng: But a monk who has five qualities may live without formal support:

pli-tv-kd1:53.7.5.pli: Na adhisīle sīlavipanno hoti, na ajjhācāre ācāravipanno hoti, na atidiṭṭhiyā diṭṭhivipanno hoti, bahussuto hoti, paññavā hoti—
pli-tv-kd1:53.7.5.eng: he hasn’t failed in the higher morality, in conduct, or in view; he’s learned and wise.

pli-tv-kd1:53.7.6.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā anissitena vatthabbaṃ.

pli-tv-kd1:53.8.1.pli: Aparehipi, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā na anissitena vatthabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:53.8.1.eng: “A monk who has another five qualities should live with formal support:

pli-tv-kd1:53.8.2.pli: Āpattiṃ na jānāti, anāpattiṃ na jānāti, lahukaṃ āpattiṃ na jānāti, garukaṃ āpattiṃ na jānāti, ubhayāni kho panassa pātimokkhāni vitthārena na svāgatāni honti na suvibhattāni na suppavattīni na suvinicchitāni suttaso anubyañjanaso—
pli-tv-kd1:53.8.2.eng: he doesn’t know the offenses; he doesn’t know the non-offenses; he doesn’t know which offenses are light; he doesn’t know which offenses are heavy; neither Monastic Code has been properly learned by him in detail, and he hasn’t analyzed them well, thoroughly mastered them, or investigated them well, either in terms of the rules or their detailed exposition.

pli-tv-kd1:53.8.3.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā na anissitena vatthabbaṃ.

pli-tv-kd1:53.8.4.pli: Pañcahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā anissitena vatthabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:53.8.4.eng: But a monk who has five qualities may live without formal support:

pli-tv-kd1:53.8.5.pli: Āpattiṃ jānāti, anāpattiṃ jānāti, lahukaṃ āpattiṃ jānāti, garukaṃ āpattiṃ jānāti, ubhayāni kho panassa pātimokkhāni vitthārena svāgatāni honti suvibhattāni suppavattīni suvinicchitāni suttaso anubyañjanaso—
pli-tv-kd1:53.8.5.eng: he knows the offenses; he knows the non-offenses; he knows which offenses are light; he knows which offenses are heavy; he has properly learned both Monastic Codes in detail, and he has analyzed them well, thoroughly mastered them, and investigated them well, both in terms of the rules and their detailed exposition.

pli-tv-kd1:53.8.6.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā anissitena vatthabbaṃ.

pli-tv-kd1:53.9.1.pli: Aparehipi, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā na anissitena vatthabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:53.9.1.eng: “A monk who has another five qualities should live with formal support:

pli-tv-kd1:53.9.2.pli: Āpattiṃ na jānāti, anāpattiṃ na jānāti, lahukaṃ āpattiṃ na jānāti, garukaṃ āpattiṃ na jānāti, ūnapañcavasso hoti—
pli-tv-kd1:53.9.2.eng: he doesn’t know the offenses; he doesn’t know the non-offenses; he doesn’t know which offenses are light; he doesn’t know which offenses are heavy; he has less than five years of seniority.

pli-tv-kd1:53.9.3.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā na anissitena vatthabbaṃ.

pli-tv-kd1:53.9.4.pli: Pañcahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā anissitena vatthabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:53.9.4.eng: But a monk who has five qualities may live without formal support:

pli-tv-kd1:53.9.5.pli: Āpattiṃ jānāti, anāpattiṃ jānāti, lahukaṃ āpattiṃ jānāti, garukaṃ āpattiṃ jānāti, pañcavasso vā hoti atirekapañcavasso vā—
pli-tv-kd1:53.9.5.eng: he knows the offenses; he knows the non-offenses; he knows which offenses are light; he knows which offenses are heavy; he has five or more years of seniority.”

pli-tv-kd1:53.9.6.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā anissitena vatthabbaṃ.

pli-tv-kd1:53.9.7.eng: The section consisting of ten groups of five is finished.

pli-tv-kd1:53.10.1.pli: Chahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā na anissitena vatthabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:53.10.1.eng: “A monk who has six qualities should live with formal support:

pli-tv-kd1:53.10.2.pli: Na asekkhena sīlakkhandhena samannāgato hoti, na asekkhena samādhikkhandhena, na asekkhena paññākkhandhena, na asekkhena vimuttikkhandhena, na asekkhena vimuttiñāṇadassanakkhandhena samannāgato hoti, ūnapañcavasso hoti—
pli-tv-kd1:53.10.2.eng: he doesn’t have the virtue, stillness, wisdom, freedom, or knowledge and vision of freedom of one who is fully trained, and he has less than five years of seniority.

pli-tv-kd1:53.10.3.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, chahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā na anissitena vatthabbaṃ.

pli-tv-kd1:53.10.4.pli: Chahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā anissitena vatthabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:53.10.4.eng: But a monk who has six qualities may live without formal support:

pli-tv-kd1:53.10.5.pli: Asekkhena sīlakkhandhena samannāgato hoti, asekkhena samādhikkhandhena, asekkhena paññākkhandhena, asekkhena vimuttikkhandhena, asekkhena vimuttiñāṇadassanakkhandhena samannāgato hoti, pañcavasso vā hoti atirekapañcavasso vā—
pli-tv-kd1:53.10.5.eng: he has the virtue, stillness, wisdom, freedom, and knowledge and vision of freedom of one who is fully trained, and he has five or more years of seniority.

pli-tv-kd1:53.10.6.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, chahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā anissitena vatthabbaṃ.

pli-tv-kd1:53.11.1.pli: Aparehipi, bhikkhave, chahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā na anissitena vatthabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:53.11.1.eng: “A monk who has another six qualities should live with formal support:

pli-tv-kd1:53.11.2.pli: Assaddho hoti, ahiriko hoti, anottappī hoti, kusīto hoti, muṭṭhassati hoti, ūnapañcavasso hoti—
pli-tv-kd1:53.11.2.eng: he has no faith, conscience, or moral prudence; he is lazy and absentminded; and he has less than five years of seniority.

pli-tv-kd1:53.11.3.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, chahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā na anissitena vatthabbaṃ.

pli-tv-kd1:53.11.4.pli: Chahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā anissitena vatthabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:53.11.4.eng: But a monk who has six qualities may live without formal support:

pli-tv-kd1:53.11.5.pli: Saddho hoti, hirimā hoti, ottappī hoti, āraddhavīriyo hoti, upaṭṭhitassati hoti, pañcavasso vā hoti atirekapañcavasso vā—
pli-tv-kd1:53.11.5.eng: he has faith, conscience, moral prudence, energy, mindfulness, and five or more years of seniority.

pli-tv-kd1:53.11.6.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, chahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā anissitena vatthabbaṃ.

pli-tv-kd1:53.12.1.pli: Aparehipi, bhikkhave, chahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā na anissitena vatthabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:53.12.1.eng: “A monk who has another six qualities should live with formal support:

pli-tv-kd1:53.12.2.pli: Adhisīle sīlavipanno hoti, ajjhācāre ācāravipanno hoti, atidiṭṭhiyā diṭṭhivipanno hoti, appassuto hoti, duppañño hoti, ūnapañcavasso hoti—
pli-tv-kd1:53.12.2.eng: he has failed in the higher morality, in conduct, and in view; he’s ignorant and foolish; he has less than five years of seniority.

pli-tv-kd1:53.12.3.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, chahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā na anissitena vatthabbaṃ.

pli-tv-kd1:53.12.4.pli: Chahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā anissitena vatthabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:53.12.4.eng: But a monk who has six qualities may live without formal support:

pli-tv-kd1:53.12.5.pli: Na adhisīle sīlavipanno hoti, na ajjhācāre ācāravipanno hoti, na atidiṭṭhiyā diṭṭhivipanno hoti, bahussuto hoti, paññavā hoti, pañcavasso vā hoti atirekapañcavasso vā—
pli-tv-kd1:53.12.5.eng: he hasn’t failed in the higher morality, in conduct, or in view; he’s learned and wise; he has five or more years of seniority.

pli-tv-kd1:53.12.6.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, chahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā anissitena vatthabbaṃ.

pli-tv-kd1:53.13.1.pli: Aparehipi, bhikkhave, chahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā na anissitena vatthabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:53.13.1.eng: “A monk who has another six qualities should live with formal support:

pli-tv-kd1:53.13.2.pli: Āpattiṃ na jānāti, anāpattiṃ na jānāti, lahukaṃ āpattiṃ na jānāti, garukaṃ āpattiṃ na jānāti, ubhayāni kho panassa pātimokkhāni vitthārena na svāgatāni honti na suvibhattāni na suppavattīni na suvinicchitāni suttaso anubyañjanaso, ūnapañcavasso hoti—
pli-tv-kd1:53.13.2.eng: he doesn’t know the offenses; he doesn’t know the non-offenses; he doesn’t know which offenses are light; he doesn’t know which offenses are heavy; neither Monastic Code has been properly learned by him in detail, and he hasn’t analyzed them well, thoroughly mastered them, or investigated them well, either in terms of the rules or their detailed exposition; he has less than five years of seniority.

pli-tv-kd1:53.13.3.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, chahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā na anissitena vatthabbaṃ.

pli-tv-kd1:53.13.4.pli: Chahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā anissitena vatthabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:53.13.4.eng: But a monk who has six qualities may live without formal support:

pli-tv-kd1:53.13.5.pli: Āpattiṃ jānāti, anāpattiṃ jānāti, lahukaṃ āpattiṃ jānāti, garukaṃ āpattiṃ jānāti, ubhayāni kho panassa pātimokkhāni vitthārena svāgatāni honti suvibhattāni suppavattīni suvinicchitāni suttaso anubyañjanaso, pañcavasso vā hoti atirekapañcavasso vā—
pli-tv-kd1:53.13.5.eng: he knows the offenses; he knows the non-offenses; he knows which offenses are light; he knows which offenses are heavy; he has properly learned both Monastic Codes in detail, and he has analyzed them well, thoroughly mastered them, and investigated them well, both in terms of the rules and their detailed exposition; he has five or more years of seniority.”

pli-tv-kd1:53.13.6.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, chahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā anissitena vatthabban”ti.

pli-tv-kd1:53.13.7.eng: The eighth section for recitation on untouchable is finished.

pli-tv-kd1:54.1.1.pli: Atha kho bhagavā rājagahe yathābhirantaṃ viharitvā yena kapilavatthu tena cārikaṃ pakkāmi.
pli-tv-kd1:54.1.1.eng: After staying at Rājagaha for as long as he liked, the Buddha set out wandering toward Kapilavatthu in the Sakyan country.

pli-tv-kd1:54.1.2.pli: Anupubbena cārikaṃ caramāno yena kapilavatthu tadavasari.

pli-tv-kd1:54.1.3.pli: Tatra sudaṃ bhagavā sakkesu viharati kapilavatthusmiṃ nigrodhārāme.
pli-tv-kd1:54.1.3.eng: he stayed in the Banyan Tree Monastery.

pli-tv-kd1:54.1.4.pli: Atha kho bhagavā pubbaṇhasamayaṃ nivāsetvā pattacīvaramādāya yena suddhodanassa sakkassa nivesanaṃ tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā paññatte āsane nisīdi.
pli-tv-kd1:54.1.4.eng: In the morning the Buddha robed up, took his bowl and robe, and went to Suddhodana the Sakyan’s house where he sat down on the prepared seat.

pli-tv-kd1:54.1.5.pli: Atha kho rāhulamātā devī rāhulaṃ kumāraṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd1:54.1.5.eng: The queen, the mother of Rāhula, said to the boy,

pli-tv-kd1:54.1.7.eng: Go and ask for your inheritance.”

pli-tv-kd1:54.2.1.pli: Atha kho rāhulo kumāro yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavato purato, aṭṭhāsi—
pli-tv-kd1:54.2.1.eng: Rāhula went up to the Buddha, stood in front of him, and said,

pli-tv-kd1:54.2.3.eng: When the Buddha got up from his seat and left,

pli-tv-kd1:54.2.4.pli: Atha kho rāhulo kumāro bhagavantaṃ piṭṭhito piṭṭhito anubandhi—

pli-tv-kd1:54.2.7.pli: Atha kho bhagavā āyasmantaṃ sāriputtaṃ āmantesi—
pli-tv-kd1:54.2.7.eng: The Buddha said to Venerable Sāriputta,

pli-tv-kd1:54.2.8.pli: “tena hi tvaṃ, sāriputta, rāhulaṃ kumāraṃ pabbājehī”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:54.2.8.eng: “Well then, Sāriputta, give Rāhula the going forth.”

pli-tv-kd1:54.3.1.pli: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṃ nidāne etasmiṃ pakaraṇe dhammiṃ kathaṃ katvā bhikkhū āmantesi—
pli-tv-kd1:54.3.1.eng: The Buddha then gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-kd1:54.3.2.eng: “The going forth as a novice monk should be given through the taking of the three refuges.

pli-tv-kd1:54.3.3.eng: It should be done like this.

pli-tv-kd1:54.3.4.pli: paṭhamaṃ kesamassuṃ ohārāpetvā kāsāyāni vatthāni acchādāpetvā ekaṃsaṃ uttarāsaṅgaṃ kārāpetvā bhikkhūnaṃ pāde vandāpetvā ukkuṭikaṃ nisīdāpetvā añjaliṃ paggaṇhāpetvā ‘evaṃ vadehī’ti vattabbo—
pli-tv-kd1:54.3.4.eng: First the candidate should shave off his hair and beard and put on ocher robes. He should then arrange his upper robe over one shoulder, pay respect at the feet of the monks, squat on his heels, and raise his joined palms. He should then be told to say this:

pli-tv-kd1:54.3.5.eng: ‘I go for refuge to the Buddha,

pli-tv-kd1:54.3.6.eng: I go for refuge to the Teaching,

pli-tv-kd1:54.3.7.eng: I go for refuge to the Sangha.

pli-tv-kd1:54.3.8.eng: For the second time, I go for refuge to the Buddha,

pli-tv-kd1:54.3.9.eng: For the second time, I go for refuge to the Teaching,

pli-tv-kd1:54.3.10.eng: For the second time, I go for refuge to the Sangha.

pli-tv-kd1:54.3.11.eng: For the third time, I go for refuge to the Buddha,

pli-tv-kd1:54.3.12.eng: For the third time, I go for refuge to the Teaching,

pli-tv-kd1:54.3.13.eng: For the third time, I go for refuge to the Sangha.’”

pli-tv-kd1:54.3.14.pli: Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, imehi tīhi saraṇagamanehi sāmaṇerapabbajjan”ti.

pli-tv-kd1:54.4.1.pli: Atha kho āyasmā sāriputto rāhulaṃ kumāraṃ pabbājesi.
pli-tv-kd1:54.4.1.eng: And Sāriputta gave Rāhula the going forth.

pli-tv-kd1:54.4.2.pli: Atha kho suddhodano sakko yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi.
pli-tv-kd1:54.4.2.eng: Soon afterwards Suddhodana went to the Buddha, bowed, sat down,

pli-tv-kd1:54.4.3.pli: Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho suddhodano sakko bhagavantaṃ etadavoca—

pli-tv-kd1:54.4.4.eng: “Sir, I want to ask for a favor.”

pli-tv-kd1:54.5.1.pli: “Bhagavati me, bhante, pabbajite anappakaṃ dukkhaṃ ahosi, tathā nande, adhimattaṃ rāhule.
pli-tv-kd1:54.5.1.eng: “When the Buddha went forth, it was very painful for me, and the same when Nanda went forth. With Rāhula, it’s even worse.

pli-tv-kd1:54.5.2.pli: Puttapemaṃ, bhante, chaviṃ chindati, chaviṃ chetvā cammaṃ chindati, cammaṃ chetvā maṃsaṃ chindati, maṃsaṃ chetvā nhāruṃ chindati, nhāruṃ chetvā aṭṭhiṃ chindati, aṭṭhiṃ chetvā aṭṭhimiñjaṃ āhacca tiṭṭhati.
pli-tv-kd1:54.5.2.eng: Affection for a child cuts deep. It cuts through the outer and inner skin; it cuts through the flesh, the sinews, and the bones, and it reaches all the way to the bone-marrow.

pli-tv-kd1:54.5.3.pli: Sādhu, bhante, ayyā ananuññātaṃ mātāpitūhi puttaṃ na pabbājeyyun”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:54.5.3.eng: Please, may the venerables not give the going forth to a child without the parents’ permission.”

pli-tv-kd1:54.6.1.pli: Atha kho bhagavā suddhodanaṃ sakkaṃ dhammiyā kathāya sandassesi samādapesi samuttejesi sampahaṃsesi.
pli-tv-kd1:54.6.1.eng: The Buddha then instructed, inspired, and gladdened him with a teaching,

pli-tv-kd1:54.6.2.pli: Atha kho suddhodano sakko bhagavatā dhammiyā kathāya sandassito samādapito samuttejito sampahaṃsito uṭṭhāyāsanā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṃ katvā pakkāmi.
pli-tv-kd1:54.6.2.eng: after which Suddhodana got up from his seat, bowed down, circumambulated the Buddha with his right side toward him, and left.

pli-tv-kd1:54.6.3.pli: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṃ nidāne etasmiṃ pakaraṇe dhammiṃ kathaṃ katvā bhikkhū āmantesi—
pli-tv-kd1:54.6.3.eng: Soon afterwards the Buddha gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-kd1:54.6.4.eng: “You shouldn’t give the going forth to a child without the parents’ permission.

pli-tv-kd1:54.6.5.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-kd1:55.1.1.pli: Atha kho bhagavā kapilavatthusmiṃ yathābhirantaṃ viharitvā yena sāvatthi tena cārikaṃ pakkāmi.
pli-tv-kd1:55.1.1.eng: After staying at Kapilavatthu for as long as he liked, the Buddha set out wandering toward Sāvatthī.

pli-tv-kd1:55.1.2.pli: Anupubbena cārikaṃ caramāno yena sāvatthi tadavasari.

pli-tv-kd1:55.1.3.pli: Tatra sudaṃ bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-kd1:55.1.3.eng: he stayed in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-kd1:55.1.4.pli: Tena kho pana samayena āyasmato sāriputtassa upaṭṭhākakulaṃ āyasmato sāriputtassa santike dārakaṃ pāhesi—
pli-tv-kd1:55.1.4.eng: At this time a family that was supporting Sāriputta sent him a boy with this message:

pli-tv-kd1:55.1.5.eng: “Please give the going forth to this boy.”

pli-tv-kd1:55.1.7.eng: “The Buddha has laid down a rule

pli-tv-kd1:55.1.8.eng: that a monk shouldn’t have two novices attend on him.

pli-tv-kd1:55.1.9.eng: I already have the novice Rāhula.

pli-tv-kd1:55.1.10.eng: So what should I do now?”

pli-tv-kd1:55.1.12.pli: “Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, byattena bhikkhunā paṭibalena ekena dve sāmaṇere upaṭṭhāpetuṃ, yāvatake vā pana ussahati ovadituṃ anusāsituṃ tāvatake upaṭṭhāpetun”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:55.1.12.eng: “I allow a competent and capable monk to have two novice monks attend on him, or however many he’s able to teach and instruct.”

pli-tv-kd1:56.1.2.pli: “kati nu kho amhākaṃ sikkhāpadāni, kattha ca amhehi sikkhitabban”ti?
pli-tv-kd1:56.1.2.eng: “How many training rules do we have that we should train in?”

pli-tv-kd1:56.1.4.pli: “anujānāmi, bhikkhave, sāmaṇerānaṃ dasa sikkhāpadāni, tesu ca sāmaṇerehi sikkhituṃ—
pli-tv-kd1:56.1.4.eng: “There are ten training rules for the novice monks:

pli-tv-kd1:56.1.9.eng: Abstention from alcoholic drinks that cause heedlessness

pli-tv-kd1:56.1.10.eng: Abstention from eating at the wrong time

pli-tv-kd1:56.1.11.eng: Abstention from dancing, singing, music, and seeing shows

pli-tv-kd1:56.1.12.eng: Abstention from wearing garlands and using scents and cosmetics

pli-tv-kd1:56.1.13.eng: Abstention from high and luxurious resting places
pli-tv-kd1:56.1.13.comm: “Resting place” renders sayana, often translated as “bed”. As can be seen from Kd 16:8.1–8.11, the sayana was used for both sitting and lying down.

pli-tv-kd1:56.1.14.eng: Abstention from receiving gold, silver, and money.”
pli-tv-kd1:56.1.14.comm: “Gold, silver, and money” renders jātarūparajata. For a discussion of this compound, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-kd1:56.1.15.pli: Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, sāmaṇerānaṃ imāni dasa sikkhāpadāni, imesu ca sāmaṇerehi sikkhitun”ti.

pli-tv-kd1:57.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena sāmaṇerā bhikkhūsu agāravā appatissā asabhāgavuttikā viharanti.
pli-tv-kd1:57.1.1.eng: Soon the novice monks were being disrespectful, undeferential, and rude toward the monks.

pli-tv-kd1:57.1.2.eng: The monks complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-kd1:57.1.3.pli: “kathañhi nāma sāmaṇerā bhikkhūsu agāravā appatissā asabhāgavuttikā viharissantī”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:57.1.3.eng: “How can the novices behave like this?”

pli-tv-kd1:57.1.5.pli: “anujānāmi, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa sāmaṇerassa daṇḍakammaṃ kātuṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:57.1.5.eng: “I allow you to penalize a novice monk who has five qualities:

pli-tv-kd1:57.1.6.eng: He’s trying to stop monks from getting material support

pli-tv-kd1:57.1.8.eng: He’s trying to make monks lose their place of residence

pli-tv-kd1:57.1.11.pli: anujānāmi, bhikkhave, imehi pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa sāmaṇerassa daṇḍakammaṃ kātun”ti.

pli-tv-kd1:57.2.4.eng: “I allow you to place restrictions on the novice monks.”

pli-tv-kd1:57.2.5.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhū sāmaṇerānaṃ sabbaṃ saṅghārāmaṃ āvaraṇaṃ karonti.
pli-tv-kd1:57.2.5.eng: The monks restricted the novices from the whole monastery.

pli-tv-kd1:57.2.6.pli: Sāmaṇerā ārāmaṃ pavisituṃ alabhamānā pakkamantipi, vibbhamantipi, titthiyesupi saṅkamanti.
pli-tv-kd1:57.2.6.eng: Because they were unable to enter the monastery, the novices left, disrobed, and joined the monastics of other religions.

pli-tv-kd1:57.2.8.eng: “You shouldn’t restrict anyone from a whole monastery.

pli-tv-kd1:57.2.9.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-kd1:57.2.10.pli: Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, yattha vā vasati, yattha vā paṭikkamati, tattha āvaraṇaṃ kātun”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:57.2.10.eng: I allow you to make restrictions for the place you’re staying and its access areas.”
pli-tv-kd1:57.2.10.comm: Sp 3.107: Yattha vā vasati yattha vā paṭikkamatīti yattha vasati vā pavisati vā, “Yattha vā vasati yattha vā paṭikkamati: where one lives or enters.”

pli-tv-kd1:57.3.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhū sāmaṇerānaṃ mukhadvārikaṃ āhāraṃ āvaraṇaṃ karonti.
pli-tv-kd1:57.3.1.eng: The monks placed restrictions on the novices’ food.

pli-tv-kd1:57.3.2.pli: Manussā yāgupānampi saṅghabhattampi karontā sāmaṇere evaṃ vadenti—
pli-tv-kd1:57.3.2.eng: People making congee and meals for the Sangha said to the novices,

pli-tv-kd1:57.3.7.eng: The monks have placed a restriction on us.”

pli-tv-kd1:57.3.9.pli: “kathañhi nāma bhadantā sāmaṇerānaṃ mukhadvārikaṃ āhāraṃ āvaraṇaṃ karissantī”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:57.3.9.eng: “How can the venerables restrict the novices’ food?”

pli-tv-kd1:57.3.12.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-kd1:57.3.13.eng: The account of penalties is finished.

pli-tv-kd1:58.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū upajjhāye anāpucchā sāmaṇerānaṃ āvaraṇaṃ karonti.
pli-tv-kd1:58.1.1.eng: On one occasion the monks from the group of six placed restrictions on novices without asking their preceptors for permission.

pli-tv-kd1:58.1.3.pli: “kathaṃ nu kho amhākaṃ sāmaṇerā na dissantī”ti.

pli-tv-kd1:58.1.6.eng: the preceptors complained and criticized those monks,

pli-tv-kd1:58.1.7.pli: “kathañhi nāma chabbaggiyā bhikkhū amhe anāpucchā amhākaṃ sāmaṇerānaṃ āvaraṇaṃ karissantī”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:58.1.7.eng: “How could the monks from the group of six place restrictions on our novices without asking us for permission?”

pli-tv-kd1:58.1.9.eng: “You shouldn’t place a restriction without asking permission from the preceptor.

pli-tv-kd1:58.1.10.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-kd1:59.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū therānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ sāmaṇere apalāḷenti.
pli-tv-kd1:59.1.1.eng: At one time the monks from the group of six were luring away the novices of the senior monks.

pli-tv-kd1:59.1.2.pli: Therā sāmaṃ dantakaṭṭhampi mukhodakampi gaṇhantā kilamanti.
pli-tv-kd1:59.1.2.eng: The senior monks had to get their own tooth cleaners and water for rinsing the mouth. As a result, they became tired.

pli-tv-kd1:59.1.5.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-kd1:60.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena āyasmato upanandassa sakyaputtassa kaṇṭako nāma sāmaṇero kaṇṭakiṃ nāma bhikkhuniṃ dūsesi.
pli-tv-kd1:60.1.1.eng: At one time Venerable Upananda the Sakyan had a novice monk called Kaṇṭaka who raped a nun called Kaṇṭakī.
pli-tv-kd1:60.1.1.comm: “Raped” renders dūsesi. See Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-kd1:60.1.2.eng: The monks complained and criticized him,

pli-tv-kd1:60.1.3.eng: “How could a novice monk misbehave in this way?”

pli-tv-kd1:60.1.5.eng: “I allow you to expel a novice monk who has ten qualities:
pli-tv-kd1:60.1.5.comm: “To expel” renders nāsetuṁ. See Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-kd1:60.1.15.comm: Sp 3.115: Bhikkhunidūsako bhikkhaveti ettha yo pakatattaṁ bhikkhuniṁ tiṇṇaṁ maggānaṁ aññatarasmiṁ dūseti, ayaṁ bhikkhunidūsako nāma, “Bhikkhunidūsako bhikkhave: in this context it means whoever violates an ordinary nun through one of three orifices (vagina, anus, or mouth) is called a bhikkhunidūsaka.”

pli-tv-kd1:60.1.16.pli: anujānāmi, bhikkhave, imehi dasahaṅgehi samannāgataṃ sāmaṇeraṃ nāsetun”ti.

pli-tv-kd1:61.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro paṇḍako bhikkhūsu pabbajito hoti.
pli-tv-kd1:61.1.1.eng: At one time a certain paṇḍaka had gone forth as a monk.

pli-tv-kd1:61.1.2.pli: So dahare dahare bhikkhū upasaṅkamitvā evaṃ vadeti—
pli-tv-kd1:61.1.2.eng: He went to the young monks and said,

pli-tv-kd1:61.1.5.pli: “nassa, paṇḍaka, vinassa, paṇḍaka, ko tayā attho”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:61.1.5.eng: “Go away, paṇḍaka. We don’t want you.”

pli-tv-kd1:61.1.6.pli: So bhikkhūhi apasādito mahante mahante moḷigalle sāmaṇere upasaṅkamitvā evaṃ vadeti—
pli-tv-kd1:61.1.6.eng: He went to the big and fat novices,

pli-tv-kd1:61.1.9.pli: “nassa, paṇḍaka, vinassa, paṇḍaka, ko tayā attho”ti.

pli-tv-kd1:61.1.10.pli: So sāmaṇerehi apasādito hatthibhaṇḍe assabhaṇḍe upasaṅkamitvā evaṃ vadeti—
pli-tv-kd1:61.1.10.eng: He then went to the elephant keepers and the horse keepers

pli-tv-kd1:61.1.11.eng: and once again said the same thing.

pli-tv-kd1:61.1.12.eng: And they had sex with him.

pli-tv-kd1:61.1.15.pli: Yepi imesaṃ na paṇḍakā, tepi ime paṇḍake dūsenti.
pli-tv-kd1:61.1.15.eng: And those who are not have sex with them.

pli-tv-kd1:61.1.17.pli: Assosuṃ kho bhikkhū tesaṃ hatthibhaṇḍānaṃ assabhaṇḍānaṃ ujjhāyantānaṃ khiyyantānaṃ vipācentānaṃ.

pli-tv-kd1:61.1.18.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ.

pli-tv-kd1:61.1.19.pli: “Paṇḍako, bhikkhave, anupasampanno na upasampādetabbo, upasampanno nāsetabbo”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:61.1.19.eng: “A paṇḍaka shouldn’t be given the full ordination. If it has been given, he should be expelled.”
pli-tv-kd1:61.1.19.comm: For the meaning of paṇḍaka, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-kd1:62.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro purāṇakulaputto khīṇakolañño sukhumālo hoti.
pli-tv-kd1:62.1.1.eng: At one time there was a gentleman who had been brought up in comfort, but whose entire family had died.

pli-tv-kd1:62.1.2.pli: Atha kho tassa purāṇakulaputtassa khīṇakolaññassa etadahosi—

pli-tv-kd1:62.1.3.pli: “ahaṃ kho sukhumālo, na paṭibalo anadhigataṃ vā bhogaṃ adhigantuṃ, adhigataṃ vā bhogaṃ phātiṃ kātuṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:62.1.3.eng: “I’ve been brought up in comfort and I’m incapable of making money.

pli-tv-kd1:62.1.4.pli: Kena nu kho ahaṃ upāyena sukhañca jīveyyaṃ, na ca kilameyyan”ti?
pli-tv-kd1:62.1.4.eng: How can I live happily without exhausting myself?”

pli-tv-kd1:62.1.5.pli: Atha kho tassa purāṇakulaputtassa khīṇakolaññassa etadahosi—

pli-tv-kd1:62.1.6.pli: “ime kho samaṇā sakyaputtiyā sukhasīlā sukhasamācārā, subhojanāni bhuñjitvā nivātesu sayanesu sayanti.
pli-tv-kd1:62.1.6.eng: “These Sakyan monastics have pleasant habits and a happy life. They eat nice food and sleep in beds sheltered from the wind.

pli-tv-kd1:62.1.7.pli: Yannūnāhaṃ sāmaṃ pattacīvaraṃ paṭiyādetvā kesamassuṃ ohāretvā kāsāyāni vatthāni acchādetvā ārāmaṃ gantvā bhikkhūhi saddhiṃ saṃvaseyyan”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:62.1.7.eng: Why don’t I just get myself a bowl and robes, shave off my hair and beard, put on ocher robes, and then go to the monastery and live with the monks?” And he did just that.

pli-tv-kd1:62.2.1.pli: Atha kho so purāṇakulaputto khīṇakolañño sāmaṃ pattacīvaraṃ paṭiyādetvā kesamassuṃ ohāretvā kāsāyāni vatthāni acchādetvā ārāmaṃ gantvā bhikkhū abhivādeti.
pli-tv-kd1:62.2.1.eng: When he came to the monastery, he bowed down to the monks.

pli-tv-kd1:62.2.7.eng: The monks said to Venerable Upāli,

pli-tv-kd1:62.3.1.pli: Atha kho so purāṇakulaputto khīṇakolañño āyasmatā upālinā anuyuñjīyamāno etamatthaṃ ārocesi.
pli-tv-kd1:62.3.1.eng: He then told Upāli what had happened.

pli-tv-kd1:62.3.3.eng: who in turn told the Buddha.

pli-tv-kd1:62.3.4.pli: “Theyyasaṃvāsako, bhikkhave, anupasampanno na upasampādetabbo, upasampanno nāsetabboti.
pli-tv-kd1:62.3.4.eng: “A fake monk shouldn’t be given the full ordination. If it has been given, they should be expelled.

pli-tv-kd1:62.3.5.pli: Titthiyapakkantako, bhikkhave, anupasampanno na upasampādetabbo, upasampanno nāsetabbo”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:62.3.5.eng: Anyone who has previously left to join the monastics of another religion shouldn’t be given the full ordination. If it has been given, they should be expelled.”
pli-tv-kd1:62.3.5.comm: “Who has previously left to join the monastics of another religion” renders titthiyapakkantaka, literally, “one who has left for another religion”. Sp 3.110: Ettha pana titthiyesu pakkanto paviṭṭhoti titthiyapakkantako. … upasampanno bhikkhu titthiyo bhavissāmīti saliṅgeneva tesaṁ upassayaṁ gacchati, padavāre padavāre dukkaṭaṁ. Tesaṁ liṅge ādinnamatte titthiyapakkantako hoti, “Here titthiyapakkantaka means one who has left and entered among the monastics of another religion. … If a fully ordained monk thinks, ‘I will become a monastic of another religion’, and he goes to their dwelling place while looking like a Buddhist monk, then each step is an instance of wrong conduct. Then, merely by taking on their characteristics, he is a titthiyapakkantaka.”

pli-tv-kd1:63.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro nāgo nāgayoniyā aṭṭīyati harāyati jigucchati.
pli-tv-kd1:63.1.1.eng: At one time there was a dragon who was troubled, ashamed, and disgusted with his existence as a dragon.

pli-tv-kd1:63.1.3.pli: “kena nu kho ahaṃ upāyena nāgayoniyā ca parimucceyyaṃ khippañca manussattaṃ paṭilabheyyan”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:63.1.3.eng: “How can I get released from this existence and quickly become human?”

pli-tv-kd1:63.1.5.pli: “ime kho samaṇā sakyaputtiyā dhammacārino samacārino brahmacārino saccavādino sīlavanto kalyāṇadhammā.
pli-tv-kd1:63.1.5.eng: “These Sakyan monastics have integrity. They’re celibate and their conduct is good, and they’re truthful, moral, and have a good character.

pli-tv-kd1:63.1.6.pli: Sace kho ahaṃ samaṇesu sakyaputtiyesu pabbajeyyaṃ, evāhaṃ nāgayoniyā ca parimucceyyaṃ, khippañca manussattaṃ paṭilabheyyan”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:63.1.6.eng: If I were to go forth with them, I would be released from this existence as a dragon and quickly become human.”

pli-tv-kd1:63.2.1.pli: Atha kho so nāgo māṇavakavaṇṇena bhikkhū upasaṅkamitvā pabbajjaṃ yāci.
pli-tv-kd1:63.2.1.eng: Then, taking on the appearance of a young brahmin, that dragon went to the monks and asked for the going forth.

pli-tv-kd1:63.2.2.eng: The monks gave him the going forth and the full ordination.

pli-tv-kd1:63.2.3.pli: Tena kho pana samayena so nāgo aññatarena bhikkhunā saddhiṃ paccantime vihāre paṭivasati.
pli-tv-kd1:63.2.3.eng: Soon afterwards that dragon was sharing a remote dwelling with a certain monk.

pli-tv-kd1:63.2.4.pli: Atha kho so bhikkhu rattiyā paccūsasamayaṃ paccuṭṭhāya ajjhokāse caṅkamati.
pli-tv-kd1:63.2.4.eng: After getting up early one morning, that monk did walking meditation outside.

pli-tv-kd1:63.2.5.pli: Atha kho so nāgo tassa bhikkhuno nikkhante vissaṭṭho niddaṃ okkami.
pli-tv-kd1:63.2.5.eng: When the monk had left, the dragon relaxed and fell asleep.

pli-tv-kd1:63.2.6.pli: Sabbo vihāro ahinā puṇṇo, vātapānehi bhogā nikkhantā honti.
pli-tv-kd1:63.2.6.eng: As a result, the serpent filled the whole dwelling, its coils even protruding from the windows.

pli-tv-kd1:63.3.1.pli: Atha kho so bhikkhu vihāraṃ pavisissāmīti kavāṭaṃ paṇāmento addasa sabbaṃ vihāraṃ ahinā puṇṇaṃ, vātapānehi bhoge nikkhante, disvāna bhīto vissaramakāsi.
pli-tv-kd1:63.3.1.eng: Just then that monk decided to go back inside. When he opened the door, he saw the serpent filling the whole dwelling. Terrified, he screamed.

pli-tv-kd1:63.3.2.eng: Monks came running to and asked him why he was screaming.

pli-tv-kd1:63.3.4.pli: “Ayaṃ, āvuso, sabbo vihāro ahinā puṇṇo, vātapānehi bhogā nikkhantā”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:63.3.4.eng: And he told them what had seen.

pli-tv-kd1:63.3.5.pli: Atha kho so nāgo tena saddena paṭibujjhitvā sake āsane nisīdi.
pli-tv-kd1:63.3.5.eng: The dragon woke up from the noise and sat down on his seat.

pli-tv-kd1:63.3.10.pli: Atha kho so nāgo bhikkhūnaṃ etamatthaṃ ārocesi.
pli-tv-kd1:63.3.10.eng: The dragon told them what had happened,

pli-tv-kd1:63.4.1.pli: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṃ nidāne etasmiṃ pakaraṇe bhikkhusaṅghaṃ sannipātāpetvā taṃ nāgaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd1:63.4.1.eng: He then had the Sangha of monks gathered and said to the dragon,

pli-tv-kd1:63.4.2.eng: “Dragons are unable to make progress on this spiritual path.

pli-tv-kd1:63.4.3.pli: Gaccha tvaṃ, nāga, tattheva cātuddase pannarase aṭṭhamiyā ca pakkhassa uposathaṃ upavasa, evaṃ tvaṃ nāgayoniyā ca parimuccissasi, khippañca manussattaṃ paṭilabhissasī”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:63.4.3.eng: Go, dragon, and keep the observance days of the fourteenth, the fifteenth, and the eighth of the lunar half-month. In this way you’ll be released from existence as a dragon and quickly become human.”

pli-tv-kd1:63.4.4.pli: Atha kho so nāgo aviruḷhidhammo kirāhaṃ imasmiṃ dhammavinayeti dukkhī dummano assūni pavattayamāno vissaraṃ katvā pakkāmi.
pli-tv-kd1:63.4.4.eng: When he heard this, the dragon wept. Sad and miserable, he cried out in distress and left.

pli-tv-kd1:63.5.1.eng: And the Buddha addressed the monks:

pli-tv-kd1:63.5.2.eng: “There are two occasions when dragons appear in their own form:

pli-tv-kd1:63.5.3.pli: Yadā ca sajātiyā methunaṃ dhammaṃ paṭisevati, yadā ca vissaṭṭho niddaṃ okkamati—
pli-tv-kd1:63.5.3.eng: when they have sexual intercourse with each other, and when they relax and fall asleep.

pli-tv-kd1:63.5.4.pli: ime kho, bhikkhave, dve paccayā nāgassa sabhāvapātukammāya.

pli-tv-kd1:63.5.5.pli: Tiracchānagato, bhikkhave, anupasampanno na upasampādetabbo, upasampanno nāsetabbo”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:63.5.5.eng: Monks, an animal shouldn’t be given the full ordination. If it has been given, it should be expelled.”

pli-tv-kd1:64.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro māṇavako mātaraṃ jīvitā voropesi.
pli-tv-kd1:64.1.1.eng: At one time there was a young brahmin who had murdered his mother.

pli-tv-kd1:64.1.2.pli: So tena pāpakena kammena aṭṭīyati harāyati jigucchati.
pli-tv-kd1:64.1.2.eng: He was troubled, ashamed, and disgusted by what he had done,

pli-tv-kd1:64.1.4.pli: “kena nu kho ahaṃ upāyena imassa pāpakassa kammassa nikkhantiṃ kareyyan”ti?
pli-tv-kd1:64.1.4.eng: “How can I escape from this terrible action?”

pli-tv-kd1:64.1.6.pli: “ime kho samaṇā sakyaputtiyā dhammacārino samacārino brahmacārino saccavādino sīlavanto kalyāṇadhammā.
pli-tv-kd1:64.1.6.eng: “These Sakyan monastics have integrity. They’re celibate and their conduct is good, and they’re truthful, moral, and have a good character.

pli-tv-kd1:64.1.7.pli: Sace kho ahaṃ samaṇesu sakyaputtiyesu pabbajeyyaṃ, evāhaṃ imassa pāpakassa kammassa nikkhantiṃ kareyyan”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:64.1.7.eng: If I were to go forth with them, I might be released from this bad deed.”

pli-tv-kd1:64.2.1.pli: Atha kho so māṇavako bhikkhū upasaṅkamitvā pabbajjaṃ yāci.
pli-tv-kd1:64.2.1.eng: He then went to the monks and asked for the going forth.

pli-tv-kd1:64.2.3.pli: “pubbepi kho, āvuso upāli, nāgo māṇavakavaṇṇena bhikkhūsu pabbajito.
pli-tv-kd1:64.2.3.eng: “Previously a dragon appearing as a young brahmin asked for the going forth.

pli-tv-kd1:64.2.4.eng: So, please examine this young brahmin, Upāli.”

pli-tv-kd1:64.2.5.pli: Atha kho so māṇavako āyasmatā upālinā anuyuñjīyamāno etamatthaṃ ārocesi.
pli-tv-kd1:64.2.5.eng: The young brahmin told Upāli what had happened.

pli-tv-kd1:64.2.7.eng: who in turn told the Buddha.

pli-tv-kd1:64.2.8.pli: “mātughātako, bhikkhave, anupasampanno na upasampādetabbo, upasampanno nāsetabbo”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:64.2.8.eng: “A matricide shouldn’t be given the full ordination. If it has been given, he should be expelled.”

pli-tv-kd1:65.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro māṇavako pitaraṃ jīvitā voropesi.
pli-tv-kd1:65.1.1.eng: At one time there was a young brahmin who had murdered his father.

pli-tv-kd1:65.1.2.pli: So tena pāpakena kammena aṭṭīyati harāyati jigucchati.
pli-tv-kd1:65.1.2.eng: He was troubled, ashamed, and disgusted by what he had done,

pli-tv-kd1:65.1.4.pli: “kena nu kho ahaṃ upāyena imassa pāpakassa kammassa nikkhantiṃ kareyyan”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:65.1.4.eng: “How can I escape from this terrible action?”

pli-tv-kd1:65.1.6.pli: “ime kho samaṇā sakyaputtiyā dhammacārino samacārino brahmacārino saccavādino sīlavanto kalyāṇadhammā, sace kho ahaṃ samaṇesu sakyaputtiyesu pabbajeyyaṃ, evāhaṃ imassa pāpakassa kammassa nikkhantiṃ kareyyan”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:65.1.6.eng: “These Sakyan monastics have integrity. They’re celibate and their conduct is good, and they’re truthful, moral, and have a good character. If I were to go forth with them, I might be released from this bad action.”

pli-tv-kd1:65.1.7.pli: Atha kho so māṇavako bhikkhū upasaṅkamitvā pabbajjaṃ yāci.
pli-tv-kd1:65.1.7.eng: He then went to the monks and asked for the going forth.

pli-tv-kd1:65.1.9.pli: “pubbepi kho, āvuso upāli, nāgo māṇavakavaṇṇena bhikkhūsu pabbajito.
pli-tv-kd1:65.1.9.eng: “Previously a dragon appearing as a young brahmin asked for the going forth.

pli-tv-kd1:65.1.10.eng: So, please examine this young brahmin, Upāli.”

pli-tv-kd1:65.1.11.pli: Atha kho so māṇavako āyasmatā upālinā anuyuñjīyamāno etamatthaṃ ārocesi.
pli-tv-kd1:65.1.11.eng: The young brahmin told Upāli what had happened.

pli-tv-kd1:65.1.13.eng: who in turn told the Buddha.

pli-tv-kd1:65.1.14.pli: “Pitughātako, bhikkhave, anupasampanno na upasampādetabbo, upasampanno nāsetabbo”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:65.1.14.eng: “A patricide shouldn’t be given the full ordination. If it has been given, he should be expelled.”

pli-tv-kd1:66.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena sambahulā bhikkhū sāketā sāvatthiṃ addhānamaggappaṭipannā honti.
pli-tv-kd1:66.1.1.eng: On one occasion a number of monks were traveling from Sāketa to Sāvatthī.

pli-tv-kd1:66.1.2.pli: Antarāmagge corā nikkhamitvā ekacce bhikkhū acchindiṃsu, ekacce bhikkhū haniṃsu.
pli-tv-kd1:66.1.2.eng: While on their way, they were attacked by gangsters. Some of the monks were robbed and some were killed.

pli-tv-kd1:66.1.3.pli: Sāvatthiyā rājabhaṭā nikkhamitvā ekacce core aggahesuṃ, ekacce corā palāyiṃsu.
pli-tv-kd1:66.1.3.eng: The king’s men came out from Sāvatthī. They caught some of the criminals, while others escaped.

pli-tv-kd1:66.1.4.pli: Ye te palāyiṃsu te bhikkhūsu pabbajiṃsu, ye te gahitā te vadhāya oniyyanti.
pli-tv-kd1:66.1.4.eng: Those who escaped went forth with the monks, but those who were caught were taken away for execution.

pli-tv-kd1:66.2.1.pli: Addasaṃsu kho te palāyitvā pabbajitā te core vadhāya oniyyamāne, disvāna evamāhaṃsu—
pli-tv-kd1:66.2.1.eng: Those who had gone forth saw the others being taken away for execution. They said,

pli-tv-kd1:66.2.2.pli: “sādhu kho mayaṃ palāyimhā, sacā ca mayaṃ gayheyyāma, mayampi evameva haññeyyāmā”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:66.2.2.eng: “It’s good that we escaped. Had we been caught, we would’ve been executed, too.”

pli-tv-kd1:66.2.5.pli: Atha kho te pabbajitā bhikkhūnaṃ etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:66.2.5.eng: They told the monks what had happened,

pli-tv-kd1:66.2.6.eng: and the monks told the Buddha.

pli-tv-kd1:66.2.8.pli: Arahantaghātako, bhikkhave, anupasampanno na upasampādetabbo, upasampanno nāsetabbo”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:66.2.8.eng: A murderer of a perfected one shouldn’t be given the full ordination. If it has been given, he should be expelled.”

pli-tv-kd1:67.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena sambahulā bhikkhuniyo sāketā sāvatthiṃ addhānamaggappaṭipannā honti.
pli-tv-kd1:67.1.1.eng: On one occasion a number of nuns were traveling from Sāketa to Sāvatthī.

pli-tv-kd1:67.1.2.pli: Antarāmagge corā nikkhamitvā ekaccā bhikkhuniyo acchindiṃsu, ekaccā bhikkhuniyo dūsesuṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:67.1.2.eng: While on their way, they were attacked by gangsters. Some of the nuns were robbed and some were raped.

pli-tv-kd1:67.1.3.pli: Sāvatthiyā rājabhaṭā nikkhamitvā ekacce core aggahesuṃ, ekacce corā palāyiṃsu.
pli-tv-kd1:67.1.3.eng: The king’s men came out from Sāvatthī. They caught some of the criminals, while others escaped.

pli-tv-kd1:67.1.4.pli: Ye te palāyiṃsu, te bhikkhūsu pabbajiṃsu.
pli-tv-kd1:67.1.4.eng: Those who escaped went forth with the monks,

pli-tv-kd1:67.1.5.pli: Ye te gahitā, te vadhāya oniyyanti.
pli-tv-kd1:67.1.5.eng: but those who were caught were taken away for execution.

pli-tv-kd1:67.1.6.pli: Addasaṃsu kho te palāyitvā pabbajitā te core vadhāya oniyyamāne, disvāna evamāhaṃsu—
pli-tv-kd1:67.1.6.eng: Those who had gone forth saw the others being taken away for execution. They said,

pli-tv-kd1:67.1.7.pli: “sādhu kho mayaṃ palāyimhā, sacā ca mayaṃ gayheyyāma, mayampi evameva haññeyyāmā”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:67.1.7.eng: “It’s good that we escaped. Had we been caught, we would’ve been executed, too.”

pli-tv-kd1:67.1.10.pli: Atha kho te pabbajitā bhikkhūnaṃ etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:67.1.10.eng: They told the monks what had happened, and

pli-tv-kd1:67.1.12.pli: “Bhikkhunidūsako, bhikkhave, anupasampanno na upasampādetabbo, upasampanno nāsetabboti.
pli-tv-kd1:67.1.12.eng: “One who has raped a nun shouldn’t be given the full ordination. If it has been given, he should be expelled.

pli-tv-kd1:67.1.13.pli: Saṅghabhedako, bhikkhave, anupasampanno na upasampādetabbo, upasampanno nāsetabboti.
pli-tv-kd1:67.1.13.eng: One who has caused a schism in the Sangha shouldn’t be given the full ordination. If it has been given, he should be expelled.

pli-tv-kd1:67.1.14.pli: Lohituppādako, bhikkhave, anupasampanno na upasampādetabbo, upasampanno nāsetabbo”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:67.1.14.eng: One who has caused the Buddha to bleed shouldn’t be given the full ordination. If it has been given, he should be expelled.”

pli-tv-kd1:68.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro ubhatobyañjanako bhikkhūsu pabbajito hoti.
pli-tv-kd1:68.1.1.eng: At one time a hermaphrodite had gone forth as a monk.

pli-tv-kd1:68.1.2.eng: He had sex and made others have it.
pli-tv-kd1:68.1.2.comm: Sp 3.116: Karotīti purisanimittena itthīsu methunavītikkamaṁ karoti. Kārāpetīti paraṁ samādapetvā attano itthinimitte kārāpeti, “Karoti: with the male characteristic he acts to transgress through sexual intercourse with women. Kārāpeti: having encouraged another, he causes action in his own female characteristic.” The meaning of the causative kārāpeti, however, is usually to make someone else act, not specifically to cause someone to act towards oneself. If this is correct, then the meaning here would be that one has sex oneself and generally causes others to have sex, not that the same person takes on different roles. I translate accordingly.

pli-tv-kd1:68.1.4.pli: “Ubhatobyañjanako, bhikkhave, anupasampanno na upasampādetabbo, upasampanno nāsetabbo”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:68.1.4.eng: “A hermaphrodite shouldn’t be given the full ordination. If it has been given, he should be expelled.”
pli-tv-kd1:68.1.4.comm: For the meaning of ubhatobyañjanka, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-kd1:69.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhū anupajjhāyakaṃ upasampādenti.
pli-tv-kd1:69.1.1.eng: On one occasion the monks gave the full ordination to someone without a preceptor.

pli-tv-kd1:69.1.3.eng: “You shouldn’t give the full ordination to someone without a preceptor.

pli-tv-kd1:69.1.4.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-kd1:69.2.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhū saṅghena upajjhāyena upasampādenti.
pli-tv-kd1:69.2.1.eng: On one occasion the monks gave the full ordination to someone with the Sangha as preceptor.

pli-tv-kd1:69.2.3.eng: “You shouldn’t give the full ordination with the Sangha as preceptor.

pli-tv-kd1:69.2.4.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-kd1:69.3.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhū gaṇena upajjhāyena upasampādenti.
pli-tv-kd1:69.3.1.eng: On one occasion the monks gave the full ordination to someone with a group as preceptor.

pli-tv-kd1:69.3.3.eng: “You shouldn’t give the full ordination with a group as preceptor.

pli-tv-kd1:69.3.4.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-kd1:69.4.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhū paṇḍakupajjhāyena upasampādenti …pe…
pli-tv-kd1:69.4.1.eng: On one occasion the monks gave the full ordination with a paṇḍaka as preceptor …

pli-tv-kd1:69.4.2.eng: with a fake monk as preceptor …

pli-tv-kd1:69.4.3.eng: with one who has previously left to join the monastics of another religion as preceptor …

pli-tv-kd1:69.4.7.eng: with a murderer of a perfected one as preceptor …

pli-tv-kd1:69.4.8.eng: with one who had raped a nun as preceptor …

pli-tv-kd1:69.4.9.eng: with one who had caused a schism in the Sangha as preceptor …

pli-tv-kd1:69.4.10.eng: with one who had caused the Buddha to bleed as preceptor …

pli-tv-kd1:69.4.11.eng: with a hermaphrodite as preceptor. They told the Buddha.

pli-tv-kd1:69.4.12.eng: “You shouldn’t give the full ordination with a paṇḍaka as preceptor,

pli-tv-kd1:69.4.13.eng: with a fake monk as preceptor,

pli-tv-kd1:69.4.14.eng: with one who has previously left to join the monastics of another religion as preceptor,

pli-tv-kd1:69.4.18.eng: with a murderer of a perfected one as preceptor,

pli-tv-kd1:69.4.19.eng: with one who has raped a nun as preceptor,

pli-tv-kd1:69.4.20.eng: with one who has caused a schism in the Sangha as preceptor,

pli-tv-kd1:69.4.21.eng: with one who has caused the Buddha to bleed as preceptor,

pli-tv-kd1:69.4.22.eng: or with a hermaphrodite as preceptor.

pli-tv-kd1:69.4.23.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-kd1:70.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhū apattakaṃ upasampādenti.
pli-tv-kd1:70.1.1.eng: On one occasion the monks gave the full ordination to someone without an almsbowl.

pli-tv-kd1:70.1.2.eng: When walking for alms, he received it in his hands.

pli-tv-kd1:70.1.4.eng: “He’s just like the monastics of other religions.”

pli-tv-kd1:70.1.6.eng: “You shouldn’t give the full ordination to someone without an almsbowl.

pli-tv-kd1:70.1.7.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-kd1:70.2.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhū acīvarakaṃ upasampādenti.
pli-tv-kd1:70.2.1.eng: On one occasion the monks gave the full ordination to someone without robes.

pli-tv-kd1:70.2.4.eng: “He’s just like the monastics of other religions.”

pli-tv-kd1:70.2.6.eng: “You shouldn’t give the full ordination to someone without robes.

pli-tv-kd1:70.2.7.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-kd1:70.3.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhū apattacīvarakaṃ upasampādenti.
pli-tv-kd1:70.3.1.eng: On one occasion the monks gave the full ordination to someone with neither almsbowl nor robes.

pli-tv-kd1:70.3.2.eng: He walked naked for alms and received it in his hands.

pli-tv-kd1:70.3.4.eng: “He’s just like the monastics of other religions.”

pli-tv-kd1:70.3.6.eng: “You shouldn’t give the full ordination to someone with neither almsbowl nor robes.

pli-tv-kd1:70.3.7.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-kd1:70.4.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhū yācitakena pattena upasampādenti.
pli-tv-kd1:70.4.1.eng: On one occasion the monks gave the full ordination to someone with a borrowed almsbowl.

pli-tv-kd1:70.4.2.eng: When he had been ordained, they took back the bowl.

pli-tv-kd1:70.4.3.eng: Then, when walking for alms, he received it in his hands.

pli-tv-kd1:70.4.5.eng: “He’s just like the monastics of other religions.”

pli-tv-kd1:70.4.7.eng: “You shouldn’t give the full ordination to someone with a borrowed almsbowl.

pli-tv-kd1:70.4.8.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-kd1:70.5.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhū yācitakena cīvarena upasampādenti.
pli-tv-kd1:70.5.1.eng: On one occasion the monks gave the full ordination to someone with borrowed robes.

pli-tv-kd1:70.5.2.eng: When he had been ordained, they took back the robes.

pli-tv-kd1:70.5.3.eng: He then walked naked for alms.

pli-tv-kd1:70.5.5.eng: “He’s just like the monastics of other religions.”

pli-tv-kd1:70.5.7.eng: “You shouldn’t give the full ordination to someone with borrowed robes.

pli-tv-kd1:70.5.8.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-kd1:70.6.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhū yācitakena pattacīvarena upasampādenti.
pli-tv-kd1:70.6.1.eng: On one occasion the monks gave the full ordination to someone with a borrowed almsbowl and borrowed robes.

pli-tv-kd1:70.6.2.eng: When he had been ordained, they took back the bowl and the robes.

pli-tv-kd1:70.6.3.eng: He then walked naked for alms and received it in his hands.

pli-tv-kd1:70.6.5.eng: “He’s just like the monastics of other religions.”

pli-tv-kd1:70.6.7.eng: “You shouldn’t give the full ordination to someone with a borrowed almsbowl and borrowed robes.

pli-tv-kd1:70.6.8.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-kd1:70.6.9.eng: The section consisting of twenty-one cases when the full ordination is not to be given is finished.

pli-tv-kd1:71.1.0.eng: 57. The section consisting of thirty-two cases when the going forth is not to be given

pli-tv-kd1:71.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhū hatthacchinnaṃ pabbājenti …pe…
pli-tv-kd1:71.1.1.eng: On one occasion the monks gave the going forth to someone without a hand …

pli-tv-kd1:71.1.3.eng: to someone without a hand and foot …

pli-tv-kd1:71.1.6.eng: to someone without an ear and nose …

pli-tv-kd1:71.1.7.eng: to someone without a finger or toe …

pli-tv-kd1:71.1.9.eng: to someone with a cut tendon …

pli-tv-kd1:71.1.14.eng: to someone who had been branded …

pli-tv-kd1:71.1.15.eng: to someone who had been whipped …

pli-tv-kd1:71.1.18.eng: to someone with a serious sickness …

pli-tv-kd1:71.1.20.eng: to someone blind in one eye …

pli-tv-kd1:71.1.21.eng: to someone with a crooked limb …

pli-tv-kd1:71.1.23.eng: to someone paralyzed on one side …

pli-tv-kd1:71.1.25.eng: to someone weak from old age …

pli-tv-kd1:71.1.32.eng: to someone blind, mute, and deaf.

pli-tv-kd1:71.2.1.eng: “You shouldn’t give the going forth to someone without a hand,

pli-tv-kd1:71.2.3.eng: to someone without a hand and foot,

pli-tv-kd1:71.2.6.eng: to someone without an ear and nose,

pli-tv-kd1:71.2.7.eng: to someone without a finger or toe,
pli-tv-kd1:71.2.7.comm: This single phrase combines two Pali terms, aṅgulicchinna and aḷacchinna. The latter refers to a thumb or a big toe, whereas the former refers to any of the remaining eight digits.

pli-tv-kd1:71.2.9.eng: to someone with a cut tendon,

pli-tv-kd1:71.2.10.comm: Phaṇahatthaka, literally, “One who has hands like a snake’s hood”. Sp 3.119: Phaṇahatthakoti yassa vaggulipakkhakā viya aṅguliyo sambaddhā honti, “Phaṇahatthako: one whose fingers are connected like the wings of a bat.”

pli-tv-kd1:71.2.14.eng: to someone who has been branded,

pli-tv-kd1:71.2.15.eng: to someone who has been whipped,

pli-tv-kd1:71.2.18.eng: to someone with a serious sickness,

pli-tv-kd1:71.2.19.comm: Parisadūsaka, literally, “One who defiles an assembly”. Sp 3.119: Parisadūsakoti yo attano virūpatāya parisaṁ dūseti; atidīgho vā hoti aññesaṁ sīsappamāṇanābhippadeso, atirasso vā …, “Parisadūsaka: whoever defiles an assembly through his own bad appearance. He is too tall, a head taller than others, or he is too short …”

pli-tv-kd1:71.2.20.eng: to someone blind in one eye,

pli-tv-kd1:71.2.21.eng: to someone with a crooked limb,

pli-tv-kd1:71.2.23.eng: to someone paralyzed on one side,
pli-tv-kd1:71.2.23.comm: Sp 3.119: Pakkhahatoti yassa eko hattho vā pādo vā aḍḍhasarīraṁ vā sukhaṁ na vahati, “Pakkhahata: for whom one hand or one foot or half the body does not work properly.”

pli-tv-kd1:71.2.24.comm: Chinniriyāpatha, literally, “The ways of movement have been cut off”. Sp 3.119: Chinniriyāpathoti pīṭhasappi vuccati, “One who crawls is called chinniriyāpatha.” The exact meaning is not clear.

pli-tv-kd1:71.2.25.eng: to someone weak from old age,

pli-tv-kd1:71.2.32.eng: or to someone blind, mute, and deaf.

pli-tv-kd1:71.2.33.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-kd1:71.2.34.eng: The section consisting of thirty-two cases when the going forth is not to be given is finished.

pli-tv-kd1:71.2.35.eng: The ninth section for recitation on inheritance is finished.

pli-tv-kd1:72.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū alajjīnaṃ nissayaṃ denti.
pli-tv-kd1:72.1.1.eng: At that time the monks from the group of six gave formal support to shameless monks.

pli-tv-kd1:72.1.3.eng: “You shouldn’t give formal support to shameless monks.

pli-tv-kd1:72.1.4.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-kd1:72.1.5.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhū alajjīnaṃ nissāya vasanti.
pli-tv-kd1:72.1.5.eng: At that time monks lived with formal support from shameless monks.

pli-tv-kd1:72.1.6.eng: Soon they too became shameless and bad.

pli-tv-kd1:72.1.8.eng: “You shouldn’t live with formal support from shameless monks.

pli-tv-kd1:72.1.9.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-kd1:72.1.11.eng: “The Buddha has laid down a rule

pli-tv-kd1:72.1.12.pli: ‘na alajjīnaṃ nissayo dātabbo, na alajjīnaṃ nissāya vatthabban’ti.
pli-tv-kd1:72.1.12.eng: that one should neither give formal support to shameless monks nor live with formal support from them.

pli-tv-kd1:72.1.13.pli: Kathaṃ nu kho mayaṃ jāneyyāma lajjiṃ vā alajjiṃ vā”ti?
pli-tv-kd1:72.1.13.eng: But how do we know who is shameless and who is not?”

pli-tv-kd1:72.1.15.pli: “Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, catūhapañcāhaṃ āgametuṃ yāva bhikkhusabhāgataṃ jānāmī”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:72.1.15.eng: “I allow you to wait for four or five days to find out if he is keeping the same standard as the monks.”
pli-tv-kd1:72.1.15.comm: Sp 3.120: Yāva bhikkhusabhāgataṁ jānāmīti nissayadāyakassa bhikkhuno bhikkhūhi sabhāgataṁ lajjibhāvaṁ yāva jānāmīti attho. Tasmā navaṁ ṭhānaṁ gatena “ehi bhikkhu, nissayaṁ gaṇhāhī”ti vuccamānenāpi catūhapañcāhaṁ nissayadāyakassa lajjibhāvaṁ upaparikkhitvā nissayo gahetabbo, “The meaning of ‘to find out if the other person is compatible with the monks’ is: until I find out the compatibility with the monks in terms of conscientiousness of the monk giving support. Therefore, when a monk who has gone to a new place is being told to obtain support, he should observe the conscientiousness of the support giver for four or five days, and then obtain support.”

pli-tv-kd1:73.1.0.eng: 59. Formal support for those who are traveling, etc.

pli-tv-kd1:73.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro bhikkhu kosalesu janapade addhānamaggappaṭipanno hoti.
pli-tv-kd1:73.1.1.eng: On one occasion a certain monk was traveling through the Kosalan country.

pli-tv-kd1:73.1.3.eng: “The Buddha has laid down a rule

pli-tv-kd1:73.1.4.eng: that a monk like me shouldn’t live without formal support.

pli-tv-kd1:73.1.5.pli: Ahañcamhi nissayakaraṇīyo addhānamaggappaṭipanno, kathaṃ nu kho mayā paṭipajjitabban”ti?
pli-tv-kd1:73.1.5.eng: But I’m traveling. So what should I do?”

pli-tv-kd1:73.1.7.pli: “Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, addhānamaggappaṭipannena bhikkhunā nissayaṃ alabhamānena anissitena vatthun”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:73.1.7.eng: “If you are traveling and unable to obtain formal support, I allow you to live without.”

pli-tv-kd1:73.2.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena dve bhikkhū kosalesu janapade addhānamaggappaṭipannā honti.
pli-tv-kd1:73.2.1.eng: On one occasion two monks were traveling through the country of Kosala,

pli-tv-kd1:73.2.2.eng: when they arrived at a certain monastery.

pli-tv-kd1:73.2.3.eng: Just then one of them got sick.

pli-tv-kd1:73.2.4.pli: Atha kho tassa gilānassa bhikkhuno etadahosi—

pli-tv-kd1:73.2.5.eng: “The Buddha has laid down a rule

pli-tv-kd1:73.2.6.eng: that a monk like me shouldn’t live without formal support.

pli-tv-kd1:73.2.7.pli: Ahañcamhi nissayakaraṇīyo gilāno, kathaṃ nu kho mayā paṭipajjitabban”ti?
pli-tv-kd1:73.2.7.eng: But I’m sick. So what should I do?”

pli-tv-kd1:73.2.9.pli: “Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, gilānena bhikkhunā nissayaṃ alabhamānena anissitena vatthun”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:73.2.9.eng: “If you are sick and unable to obtain formal support, I allow you to live without.”

pli-tv-kd1:73.3.1.pli: Atha kho tassa gilānupaṭṭhākassa bhikkhuno etadahosi—
pli-tv-kd1:73.3.1.eng: Then the monk who was nursing him thought,

pli-tv-kd1:73.3.2.eng: “The Buddha has laid down a rule

pli-tv-kd1:73.3.3.eng: that a monk like me shouldn’t live without formal support.

pli-tv-kd1:73.3.4.pli: Ahañcamhi nissayakaraṇīyo, ayañca bhikkhu gilāno, kathaṃ nu kho mayā paṭipajjitabban”ti?
pli-tv-kd1:73.3.4.eng: But this monk is sick. So what should I do?”

pli-tv-kd1:73.3.6.pli: “Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, gilānupaṭṭhākena bhikkhunā nissayaṃ alabhamānena yāciyamānena anissitena vatthun”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:73.3.6.eng: “If you have been asked to nurse someone who is sick and you are unable to obtain formal support, I allow you to live without.”

pli-tv-kd1:73.4.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro bhikkhu araññe viharati.
pli-tv-kd1:73.4.1.eng: At one time there was a certain monk who was staying in the wilderness.

pli-tv-kd1:73.4.2.pli: Tassa ca tasmiṃ senāsane phāsu hoti.

pli-tv-kd1:73.4.4.eng: “The Buddha has laid down a rule

pli-tv-kd1:73.4.5.eng: that a monk like me shouldn’t live without formal support.

pli-tv-kd1:73.4.6.pli: Ahañcamhi nissayakaraṇīyo araññe viharāmi, mayhañca imasmiṃ senāsane phāsu hoti, kathaṃ nu kho mayā paṭipajjitabban”ti?
pli-tv-kd1:73.4.6.eng: Yet I’m enjoying my dwelling in the wilderness. So what should I do?”

pli-tv-kd1:73.4.8.pli: “Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, āraññikena bhikkhunā phāsuvihāraṃ sallakkhentena nissayaṃ alabhamānena anissitena vatthuṃ—
pli-tv-kd1:73.4.8.eng: “If you notice that you are enjoying your stay in the wilderness, but unable to obtain formal support, I allow you to live without.

pli-tv-kd1:73.4.9.pli: yadā patirūpo nissayadāyako āgacchissati, tadā tassa nissāya vasissāmī”ti.
