pli-tv-kd1:73.4.9.eng: When a suitable support-giver comes, you should live with formal support from him.”

pli-tv-kd1:74.1.0.eng: 60. The allowance to make proclamations using the family name

pli-tv-kd1:74.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena āyasmato mahākassapassa upasampadāpekkho hoti.
pli-tv-kd1:74.1.1.eng: At one time a certain person wanted the full ordination with Venerable Mahākassapa.

pli-tv-kd1:74.1.2.pli: Atha kho āyasmā mahākassapo āyasmato ānandassa santike dūtaṃ pāhesi—
pli-tv-kd1:74.1.2.eng: Mahākassapa sent a message to Venerable Ānanda:

pli-tv-kd1:74.1.3.eng: “Please come, Ānanda, and do the proclamation.”

pli-tv-kd1:74.1.5.pli: “nāhaṃ ussahāmi therassa nāmaṃ gahetuṃ, garu me thero”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:74.1.5.eng: “Because I respect the elder so much, I can’t say his name.”

pli-tv-kd1:74.1.7.eng: “I allow you to do the proclamation also using the family name.”

pli-tv-kd1:74.2.0.eng: 61. The two people seeking the full ordination, etc.

pli-tv-kd1:74.2.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena āyasmato mahākassapassa dve upasampadāpekkhā honti.
pli-tv-kd1:74.2.1.eng: At one time there were two people who wanted the full ordination with Venerable Mahākassapa.

pli-tv-kd1:74.2.3.eng: about who should be ordained first.

pli-tv-kd1:74.2.5.eng: “I allow you to give the full ordination to two people with a single proclamation.”

pli-tv-kd1:74.3.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena sambahulānaṃ therānaṃ upasampadāpekkhā honti.
pli-tv-kd1:74.3.1.eng: At one time there were a number of people who wanted the full ordination with several senior monks.
pli-tv-kd1:74.3.1.comm: “Several” renders sambahula. See Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-kd1:74.3.3.eng: about who should be ordained first.

pli-tv-kd1:74.3.5.eng: “Well then, let’s ordain all of them with a single proclamation.”

pli-tv-kd1:74.3.7.pli: “Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, dve tayo ekānussāvane kātuṃ, tañca kho ekena upajjhāyena, na tveva nānupajjhāyenā”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:74.3.7.eng: “I allow you to give the full ordination to two or three people with a single proclamation, but only with a single preceptor, not with many.”

pli-tv-kd1:75.1.0.eng: 62. The allowance to be fully ordained when one is twenty years old since appearing in the womb

pli-tv-kd1:75.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena āyasmā kumārakassapo gabbhavīso upasampanno ahosi.
pli-tv-kd1:75.1.1.eng: At that time Venerable Kumārakassapa had been given the full ordination twenty years after he appeared in the womb.

pli-tv-kd1:75.1.3.eng: “The Buddha has laid down a rule

pli-tv-kd1:75.1.4.eng: that a person less than twenty years old shouldn’t be given the full ordination.

pli-tv-kd1:75.1.5.eng: I was ordained twenty years after appearing in the womb.

pli-tv-kd1:75.1.6.pli: Upasampanno nu khomhi, nanu kho upasampanno”ti?
pli-tv-kd1:75.1.6.eng: I wonder, have I been ordained or not?”

pli-tv-kd1:75.1.8.pli: Yaṃ, bhikkhave, mātukucchismiṃ paṭhamaṃ cittaṃ uppannaṃ, paṭhamaṃ viññāṇaṃ pātubhūtaṃ, tadupādāya sāvassa jāti.
pli-tv-kd1:75.1.8.eng: “When the mind first appears in the mother’s womb, when the consciousness first manifests, that’s a person’s birth.

pli-tv-kd1:75.1.9.eng: I allow you to give the full ordination to someone who is twenty years old since appearing in the womb.”

pli-tv-kd1:76.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena upasampannā dissanti kuṭṭhikāpi gaṇḍikāpi kilāsikāpi sosikāpi apamārikāpi.
pli-tv-kd1:76.1.1.eng: At that time the full ordination had been given to people who had leprosy, abscesses, mild leprosy, tuberculosis, and epilepsy.
pli-tv-kd1:76.1.1.comm: For an explanation of the Pali terminology behind these illnesses, see Appendix of Medical Terminology.

pli-tv-kd1:76.1.3.pli: “Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, upasampādentena terasa antarāyike dhamme pucchituṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:76.1.3.eng: “The one who is giving the full ordination should ask about thirteen obstacles.

pli-tv-kd1:76.1.4.eng: It should be done like this:

pli-tv-kd1:76.1.5.eng: ‘Do you have any of these diseases:

pli-tv-kd1:76.1.6.eng: leprosy, abscesses, mild leprosy, tuberculosis, or epilepsy?

pli-tv-kd1:76.1.11.eng: Are you employed by the king?

pli-tv-kd1:76.1.12.eng: Do you have your parents’ permission?

pli-tv-kd1:76.1.14.eng: Do you have a full set of bowl and robes?

pli-tv-kd1:76.1.16.eng: What’s the name of your preceptor?’”

pli-tv-kd1:76.2.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhū ananusiṭṭhe upasampadāpekkhe antarāyike dhamme pucchanti.
pli-tv-kd1:76.2.1.eng: Soon afterwards they asked those seeking the full ordination about the obstacles without first instructing them.

pli-tv-kd1:76.2.2.pli: Upasampadāpekkhā vitthāyanti, maṅkū honti, na sakkonti vissajjetuṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:76.2.2.eng: They were embarrassed, humiliated, and unable to respond.

pli-tv-kd1:76.2.4.pli: “Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, paṭhamaṃ anusāsitvā pacchā antarāyike dhamme pucchitun”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:76.2.4.eng: “You should instruct first and then ask about the obstacles.

pli-tv-kd1:76.3.1.eng: They instructed them right there in the midst of the Sangha.

pli-tv-kd1:76.3.2.pli: Upasampadāpekkhā tatheva vitthāyanti, maṅkū honti, na sakkonti vissajjetuṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:76.3.2.eng: Once more those seeking the full ordination were embarrassed, humiliated, and unable to respond.

pli-tv-kd1:76.3.4.pli: “Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, ekamantaṃ anusāsitvā saṅghamajjhe antarāyike dhamme pucchituṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:76.3.4.eng: “You should instruct them at a distance and then ask about the obstacles in the midst of the Sangha.

pli-tv-kd1:76.3.5.eng: And it should be done like this.

pli-tv-kd1:76.3.6.eng: First they should be told to choose a preceptor.

pli-tv-kd1:76.3.7.eng: Their bowls and robes should then be pointed out to them:

pli-tv-kd1:76.3.8.pli: ‘ayaṃ te patto, ayaṃ saṅghāṭi, ayaṃ uttarāsaṅgo, ayaṃ antaravāsako.
pli-tv-kd1:76.3.8.eng: ‘This is your bowl, this your outer robe, this your upper robe, and this your sarong.

pli-tv-kd1:76.3.9.eng: Now please go and stand over there.’”

pli-tv-kd1:76.4.1.eng: Then they were instructed by monks who were ignorant and incompetent.

pli-tv-kd1:76.4.2.pli: Duranusiṭṭhā upasampadāpekkhā vitthāyanti, maṅkū honti, na sakkonti vissajjetuṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:76.4.2.eng: And because they were badly instructed, they were once again embarrassed, humiliated, and unable to respond.

pli-tv-kd1:76.4.4.eng: “A monk who is ignorant and incompetent shouldn’t instruct.

pli-tv-kd1:76.4.5.eng: If he does, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-kd1:76.4.6.pli: Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, byattena bhikkhunā paṭibalena anusāsitun”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:76.4.6.eng: A monk who is competent and capable should instruct.”

pli-tv-kd1:76.5.1.eng: They instructed without having been appointed.

pli-tv-kd1:76.5.3.eng: “A monk shouldn’t instruct if he hasn’t been appointed.

pli-tv-kd1:76.5.10.eng: ‘Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd1:76.6.1.eng: And how is one appointed through someone else?

pli-tv-kd1:76.7.3.pli: Yaṃ jātaṃ taṃ saṅghamajjhe pucchante santaṃ atthīti vattabbaṃ, asantaṃ natthīti vattabbaṃ.

pli-tv-kd1:76.10.3.pli: Ayaṃ itthannāmo itthannāmassa āyasmato upasampadāpekkho, parisuddho antarāyikehi dhammehi, paripuṇṇassa pattacīvaraṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:76.10.3.eng: So-and-so is seeking the full ordination with venerable so-and-so. He is free from obstacles and his bowl and robes are complete.
pli-tv-kd1:76.10.3.comm: The Pali reads: Ayaṁ itthannāmo itthannāmassa āyasmato upasampadāpekkho. Taking the genitive case here to be the agent genitive, which seems to be the most obvious reading, this would mean, “So-and-so who is seeking to be fully ordained by venerable so-and-so.” But it is the Sangha that ordains, not individuals, and so this translation does not seem quite right. Vmv 3.126: Ayaṁ buddharakkhito āyasmato dhammarakkhitassa saddhivihārikabhūto upasampadāpekkho, “This Buddharakkhita, who is seeking the full ordination, is the student of Venerable Dhammarakkhita.” I have followed this interpretation, and thus my translation “with venerable so-and-so”.

pli-tv-kd1:76.10.4.pli: Itthannāmo saṅghaṃ upasampadaṃ yācati itthannāmena upajjhāyena.
pli-tv-kd1:76.10.4.eng: So-and-so is asking the Sangha for the full ordination with so-and-so as his preceptor.

pli-tv-kd1:76.10.5.eng: If the Sangha is ready, it should give the full ordination to so-and-so with so-and-so as his preceptor.

pli-tv-kd1:77.1.1.pli: “Tāvadeva chāyā metabbā, utuppamāṇaṃ ācikkhitabbaṃ, divasabhāgo ācikkhitabbo, saṅgīti ācikkhitabbā, cattāro nissayā ācikkhitabbā—
pli-tv-kd1:77.1.1.eng: “Straightaway the time should be noted and the date should be pointed out. These should be declared jointly to everyone. And the four supports should be pointed out to him:
pli-tv-kd1:77.1.1.comm: Sp 3.128: Chāyā metabbāti ekaporisā vā dviporisā vāti chāyā metabbā. Utuppamāṇaṁ ācikkhitabbanti “vassāno hemanto gimho”ti evaṁ utuppamāṇaṁ ācikkhitabbaṁ. Ettha ca utuyeva utuppamāṇaṁ. Sace vassānādayo aparipuṇṇā honti, yattakehi divasehi yassa yo utu aparipuṇṇo, te divase sallakkhetvā so divasabhāgo ācikkhitabbo. Atha vā “ayaṁ nāma utu, so ca kho paripuṇṇo vā aparipuṇṇo vā”ti evaṁ utuppamāṇaṁ ācikkhitabbaṁ. “Pubbaṇho vā sāyanho vā”ti evaṁ divasabhāgo ācikkhitabbo, “Chāyā metabbā: ‘It is the height of one man or the height of two men’, the length of the shade is to be measured. ‘The measure of the season (utuppamāṇa) should be pointed out’: ‘It is the rainy season, the cold season, the hot season’, in this way the measure of the season should be pointed out. In this case the measure of the season is just the season. If the rainy season, etc., is not complete, one should calculate the days until the completion of the season; that share of days (divasabhāga) is to be pointed out. Alternatively, ‘This is the name of the season, and it is complete or incomplete (by so many days)’, in this way the date is to be pointed out. ‘It is morning or evening’, in this way the part of the day is to be pointed out.” I have followed the latter of these two ways of understanding these terms, see the CPD. Saṅgīti ācikkhitabbā, literally, “A joint recitation is to be declared”, which is rather cryptic. Sp 3.128: Saṅgītīti idameva sabbaṁ ekato katvā “tvaṁ kiṁ labhasi, kā te chāyā, kiṁ utuppamāṇaṁ, ko divasabhāgo”ti puṭṭho “idaṁ nāma labhāmi – vassaṁ vā hemantaṁ vā gimhaṁ vā, ayaṁ me chāyā, idaṁ utuppamāṇaṁ, ayaṁ divasabhāgoti vadeyyāsī”ti evaṁ ācikkhitabbaṁ, “Saṅgīti: here it means: having brought everyone together, it should pointed out: “When you are asked, ‘What did you have? What time did you have? What date did you have?’ you should reply, ‘I had this: it was the rainy season/the cold season/the hot season; I had this time; I had this date.’” The point seems to be that a newly ordained monk should remember the time and date of his ordination so that he may respond to questions about it in future. Vmv 3.128 clarifies: Chāyādikameva sabbaṁ saṅgahetvā gāyitabbato kathetabbato saṅgītīti āha “idamevā”tiādi. Tattha ekato katvā ācikkhitabbaṁ. Tvaṁ kiṁ labhasīti tvaṁ upasampādanakāle kataravassaṁ, katarautuñca labhasi, katarasmiṁ te upasampadā laddhāti attho, “‘Here’, etc., means: having collected all—that is the time, etc.—saṅgīti is said because it is to be chanted, because it is to be declared. In regard to this, having brought (everyone) together, it is to be pointed out. ‘What did you have’ means: at the time of the ordination, which year did you have, which season; your ordination was obtained in which one?”

pli-tv-kd1:77.1.2.eng: ‘One gone forth is supported by almsfood.

pli-tv-kd1:77.1.3.eng: You should persevere with this for life.

pli-tv-kd1:77.1.6.eng: One gone forth is supported by rag-robes.

pli-tv-kd1:77.1.7.eng: You should persevere with this for life.

pli-tv-kd1:77.1.9.pli: khomaṃ, kappāsikaṃ, koseyyaṃ, kambalaṃ, sāṇaṃ, bhaṅgaṃ.
pli-tv-kd1:77.1.9.eng: linen, cotton, silk, wool, sunn hemp, and hemp.

pli-tv-kd1:77.1.10.eng: One gone forth is supported by the foot of a tree as a resting place.

pli-tv-kd1:77.1.11.eng: You should persevere with this for life.

pli-tv-kd1:77.1.13.eng: a dwelling, a stilt house, and a cave.
pli-tv-kd1:77.1.13.comm: For an explanation of the renderings “stilt house” and “cave” respectively for pāsāda and guhā, see Appendix of Technical Terms. Apart from the vihāra, “a dwelling”, and the guhā, “a cave”, the Pali mentions three kinds of buildings, the aḍḍhayoga, the pāsāda, and the hammiya, all of which, according to the commentaries, are different kinds of pāsāda, “stilt houses”. Rather than try to differentiate between these buildings, which is unlikely to be useful from a practical perspective, I have instead grouped them together as “stilt house”. Here is what the commentaries have to say. Sp 4.294: Aḍḍhayogoti supaṇṇavaṅkagehaṁ, “An aḍḍhayoga is a house bent like a supaṇṇa.” Sp-ṭ 4.294 clarifies: Supaṇṇavaṅkagehanti garuḷapakkhasaṇṭhānena katagehaṁ, “Supaṇṇavaṅkageha: a house made in the shape of the wings of a garuḷa.” A garuḷa, better known in its Sanskrit form garuḍa, is a mythological bird. Sp 4.294 continues: Pāsādoti dīghapāsādo. Hammiyanti upariākāsatale patiṭṭhitakūṭāgāro pāsādoyeva, “A pāsāda is a long stilt house. A hammiya is just a pāsāda that has an upper room on top of its flat roof.” At Sp-ṭ 3.74, however, we find slightly different explanations. It seems clear, however, that all three are stilt houses and that they are distinguished according to their shape and the kind of roof they possess.

pli-tv-kd1:77.1.15.eng: You should persevere with this for life.

pli-tv-kd1:78.1.0.eng: 65. The four things not to be done

pli-tv-kd1:78.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhū aññataraṃ bhikkhuṃ upasampādetvā ekakaṃ ohāya pakkamiṃsu.
pli-tv-kd1:78.1.1.eng: On one occasion, the monks gave the full ordination to someone and then departed.

pli-tv-kd1:78.1.2.pli: So pacchā ekakova āgacchanto antarāmagge purāṇadutiyikāya samāgañchi.
pli-tv-kd1:78.1.2.eng: The newly ordained monk lagged behind, walking by himself. On the way he met his old wife.

pli-tv-kd1:78.1.6.eng: “It’s difficult for those gone forth to get sex.

pli-tv-kd1:78.1.8.pli: So tassā methunaṃ dhammaṃ paṭisevitvā cirena agamāsi.

pli-tv-kd1:78.1.10.eng: When he caught up with the monks, they asked him what had taken him so long.

pli-tv-kd1:78.2.1.pli: Atha kho so bhikkhu bhikkhūnaṃ etamatthaṃ ārocesi.
pli-tv-kd1:78.2.1.eng: He told them what had happened,

pli-tv-kd1:78.2.3.pli: “Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, upasampādetvā dutiyaṃ dātuṃ, cattāri ca akaraṇīyāni ācikkhituṃ—
pli-tv-kd1:78.2.3.eng: “When you have given the full ordination to someone, you should give him a companion and point out the four things not to be done:

pli-tv-kd1:78.2.4.pli: Upasampannena bhikkhunā methuno dhammo na paṭisevitabbo, antamaso tiracchānagatāyapi.
pli-tv-kd1:78.2.4.eng: A monk who’s fully ordained shouldn’t have sexual intercourse, not even with an animal.

pli-tv-kd1:78.2.5.pli: Yo bhikkhu methunaṃ dhammaṃ paṭisevati, assamaṇo hoti asakyaputtiyo.
pli-tv-kd1:78.2.5.eng: If he has sexual intercourse, he’s not an ascetic, not a Sakyan monastic.

pli-tv-kd1:78.2.6.pli: Seyyathāpi nāma puriso sīsacchinno abhabbo tena sarīrabandhanena jīvituṃ;
pli-tv-kd1:78.2.6.eng: Just as a man with his head cut off is unable to continue living by reconnecting it to the body,

pli-tv-kd1:78.2.7.pli: evameva bhikkhu methunaṃ dhammaṃ paṭisevitvā assamaṇo hoti asakyaputtiyo.
pli-tv-kd1:78.2.7.eng: so too is a monk who has had sexual intercourse not an ascetic, not a Sakyan monastic.

pli-tv-kd1:78.2.8.eng: You shouldn’t do this for as long as you live.

pli-tv-kd1:78.3.1.pli: Upasampannena bhikkhunā adinnaṃ theyyasaṅkhātaṃ na ādātabbaṃ, antamaso tiṇasalākaṃ upādāya.
pli-tv-kd1:78.3.1.eng: A monk who’s fully ordained shouldn’t steal, not even a straw.

pli-tv-kd1:78.3.2.pli: Yo bhikkhu pādaṃ vā pādārahaṃ vā atirekapādaṃ vā adinnaṃ theyyasaṅkhātaṃ ādiyati, assamaṇo hoti asakyaputtiyo.
pli-tv-kd1:78.3.2.eng: If he steals a pāda coin, the value of a pāda, or more than a pāda, he’s not an ascetic, not a Sakyan monastic.

pli-tv-kd1:78.3.3.pli: Seyyathāpi nāma paṇḍupalāso bandhanā pavutto abhabbo haritatthāya;
pli-tv-kd1:78.3.3.eng: Just as a fallen, withered leaf is incapable of becoming green again,

pli-tv-kd1:78.3.4.pli: evameva bhikkhu pādaṃ vā pādārahaṃ vā atirekapādaṃ vā adinnaṃ theyyasaṅkhātaṃ ādiyitvā assamaṇo hoti asakyaputtiyo.
pli-tv-kd1:78.3.4.eng: so too is a monk who, intending to steal, takes an ungiven pāda coin, the value of a pāda, or more than a pāda not an ascetic, not a Sakyan monastic.

pli-tv-kd1:78.3.5.eng: You shouldn’t do this for as long as you live.

pli-tv-kd1:78.4.1.pli: Upasampannena bhikkhunā sañcicca pāṇo jīvitā na voropetabbo, antamaso kunthakipillikaṃ upādāya.
pli-tv-kd1:78.4.1.eng: A monk who’s fully ordained shouldn’t intentionally kill a living being, not even a small insect.

pli-tv-kd1:78.4.2.pli: Yo bhikkhu sañcicca manussaviggahaṃ jīvitā voropeti, antamaso gabbhapātanaṃ upādāya, assamaṇo hoti asakyaputtiyo.
pli-tv-kd1:78.4.2.eng: If he intentionally kills a human being, even causing an abortion, he’s not an ascetic, not a Sakyan monastic.

pli-tv-kd1:78.4.3.pli: Seyyathāpi nāma puthusilā dvedhā bhinnā appaṭisandhikā hoti;
pli-tv-kd1:78.4.3.eng: Just as an ordinary stone that has broken in half cannot be put back together again,

pli-tv-kd1:78.4.4.pli: evameva bhikkhu sañcicca manussaviggahaṃ jīvitā voropetvā assamaṇo hoti asakyaputtiyo.
pli-tv-kd1:78.4.4.eng: so too is a monk who has intentionally killed a human being not an ascetic, not a Sakyan monastic.

pli-tv-kd1:78.4.5.eng: You shouldn’t do this for as long as you live.

pli-tv-kd1:78.5.1.pli: Upasampannena bhikkhunā uttarimanussadhammo na ullapitabbo, antamaso ‘suññāgāre abhiramāmī’ti.
pli-tv-kd1:78.5.1.eng: A monk who’s fully ordained shouldn’t claim a superhuman quality, not even just saying, ‘I delight in solitude.’

pli-tv-kd1:78.5.2.pli: Yo bhikkhu pāpiccho icchāpakato asantaṃ abhūtaṃ uttarimanussadhammaṃ ullapati jhānaṃ vā vimokkhaṃ vā samādhiṃ vā samāpattiṃ vā maggaṃ vā phalaṃ vā, assamaṇo hoti asakyaputtiyo.
pli-tv-kd1:78.5.2.eng: If, because he has bad desires and is overcome by desire, he claims to have a non-existent superhuman quality—whether absorption, release, stillness, attainment, path, or fruit—he’s not an ascetic, not a Sakyan monastic.

pli-tv-kd1:78.5.3.pli: Seyyathāpi nāma tālo matthakacchinno abhabbo puna viruḷhiyā;
pli-tv-kd1:78.5.3.eng: Just as a palm tree with its crown cut off is incapable of further growth,

pli-tv-kd1:78.5.4.pli: evameva bhikkhu pāpiccho icchāpakato asantaṃ abhūtaṃ uttarimanussadhammaṃ ullapitvā assamaṇo hoti asakyaputtiyo.
pli-tv-kd1:78.5.4.eng: so too is a monk with bad desires, overcome by desire, who claims to have non-existent superhuman quality not an ascetic, not a Sakyan monastic.

pli-tv-kd1:78.5.5.eng: You shouldn’t do this for as long as you live.”

pli-tv-kd1:78.5.6.eng: The four things not to be done are finished.

pli-tv-kd1:79.4.21.comm: Vmv 3.131: Vinayamhītiādigāthāsu niggahānanti niggahakaraṇesu. Pāpiccheti pāpapuggalānaṁ niggahakaraṇesu, lajjīnaṁ paggahesu ca pesalānaṁ sukhāvahe mahante vinayamhi yathā atthakārī atthānuguṇaṁ karontova yasmā yoniso paṭipajjati nāma hoti, tasmā uddānaṁ pavakkhāmīti sambandhayojanā daṭṭhabbā; “In regard to the verses beginning with vinayamhi: niggahānaṁ means concerning the production of restraint. Pāpicche means in regard to the production of restraint of bad people and in regard to helping those who have a sense of conscience and those who are good, in the great Monastic Law which brings happiness, concerning one making and helping what is beneficial, wherefore it is called one practicing wisely, therefore I speak this summary. It is to be seen as connected together.”
